fixed-fluid






<p>All of the Monsters, Mysteries, and Mayhem from the Carnival Campaign from $2 Creature Feature! Grab your popcorn and take your seat, it's about to get spooky.&nbsp;<br><br>The bundle includes 4 mysteries:&nbsp;<br></p>
<p><strong><em><u>Harvest Time in Geringer&nbsp;<br></u></em></strong>
</p>
<p>It's election season in the town of Geringer. A carnival is in town, and people are turning up missing. Is this just a common monster, or is there something bigger at play?<br></p>
<p><strong><em><u>Motel from Hell</u></em></strong>
</p>
<p>A grisly murder occurs overnight at the Motel Belle. Why is that vacuum salesman watching us?</p>
<p><strong><em><u>Into the Mirrorverse</u></em></strong>
</p>
<p>A young Witch gets in over her head and releases an unusual evil...<br></p>
<p><strong><em><u>Hopeless in Hope, WV</u></em></strong>
</p>
<p>A swirl of paranormal phenomena and supernatural signs point to something amiss in Hope, WV. With a string of disappearances and a creature seen stalking the residents of Hope, Hunters will meet their match with this monster.&nbsp;<br><strong><em></em></strong></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgxODcyNTUucG5n/original/X0QpZJ.png]]






<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM1MDUwODMucG5n/original/Fauhol.png" loading="lazy"></p>
<h3>Don't go in there!</h3>
<p>Low level characters are pretty fragile, and gray oozes punch above their weight class. But sometimes, a party sees the glint of gold at the back of the cave and wades in.<br></p>
<h2>Print &amp; play 5th edition micro-module with almost no prep at all!</h2>
<p><strong><em>Experienced DM</em></strong>? Great for a one-shot evening when some of your players couldn't make it, or to help make a smooth transition between your big set piece adventures!</p>
<p><strong><em>New DM</em></strong>? This micro-module gives you support in running a fight with some oozes without making you run off to the reference books, a little help making up NPC names, and some ideas for future encounters in the area, if that's useful to you. Hey, I'm just trying to help.</p>
<p><em><strong>Any DM!</strong></em> If you've got some 2nd level characters in the hills and need a place to go next, this download will take care of you! <em>1-6 Oozes in the Dark</em> is a <strong>full-featured micro-module</strong> for a threatening little cave - 8 zine-sized pages of setup, NPCs, story hooks, maps, loot, and an easy combat tracker.</p>
<h2>This&nbsp;little booklet brings the game to the table&nbsp;with everything a big module has, and more!</h2>
<ul><li>Setup&nbsp;<strong>hooks</strong>&nbsp;to bring the characters in.</li><li>Some local&nbsp;<strong>NPCs</strong>&nbsp;(and a list of names to choose from if you hate making up names on the spot)</li><li><strong>Gray Ooze</strong> stat block so you don't have to look up a thing!</li><li>a print-n-play&nbsp;<strong>battle map</strong>&nbsp;you can just have the fight right on.</li><li><strong>Initiative tracker</strong>&nbsp;and HP checkboxes for the oozes so you don't need separate scratch paper</li><li>Ooze<strong> tactics</strong> are not subtle, ambush and eat! (Rescue NPC included if your characters are too fragile for gray ooze.)</li><li>What happens after the encounter?&nbsp;<strong>Loot, experience, 1d6 random rewards</strong>!</li><li>An <strong>area map </strong>and open-ended <strong>regional lore</strong>!</li></ul>
<h2>Designed for Print</h2>
<p>The PDF makes an 8-page mini-zine. Two sheets of paper - print both sides, fold, optional staple, and you are in the game!&nbsp;<em>Keep this in your toolbox and bring it out any time you need a fight in a cave!</em></p>
<h3>Art Asset Shoutout</h3>
<p><em>Map tiles for the full color micro-module designed by <a href="http://www.stevencolling.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Steven Colling</a> and available <a href="https://stevencolling.itch.io/isle-of-lore-2-hex-tiles-regular" target="_blank">here on Itch.io</a>.</em></p>
<h3>Fifth Edition Compatible</h3>
<p>This game supplement is published under the terms of the Wizards of the Coast Open Game License version 1.0a.</p>
<h3>Supported on Patreon</h3>
<p>If you'd like to have adventures like this on the regular, check out my Patreon page (<a href="https://patreon.com/deusexminima" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Patreon.com/DeusExMinima</a>) and thank you for your support!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjUyODg5LzM1MDUyNjkucG5n/original/gZWTDT.png]]






<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzMyNzAxMDIucG5n/original/FARS%2F%2F.png" loading="lazy"></p>
<h3>So many questions!</h3>
<ul><li><strong>Why </strong>are there so many skeletons in this stable?</li><li><strong>What </strong>secret does the town chandler hide?</li><li><strong>Who </strong>is asking all these questions?</li></ul>
<p>I dunno, you're the Dungeon Master, you're gonna have to make some stuff up. But this micro-module gives you the setup you need to find the answers!<br></p>
<h2>Print &amp; play 5th edition micro-module with almost no prep at all!</h2>
<p><strong><em>Experienced DM</em></strong>? Great for a one-shot evening when some of your players couldn't make it, or to help make a smooth transition between your big set piece adventures!</p>
<p><strong><em>New DM</em></strong>? This micro-module gives you support in running a fight with some skeletons without making you run off to the reference books, a little help making up NPC names, and some ideas for future encounters in the area, if that's useful to you. Hey, I'm just trying to help.</p>
<p><em><strong>Any DM!</strong></em> If you've got some 1st level characters in a forest and need a place to go next, this download will take care of you! <em>1-6 Skeletons in a Stable</em> is a <strong>full-featured micro-module</strong> for out in the woods - 8 little zine pages of setup, NPCs, story hooks, maps, loot, and an easy combat tracker.</p>
<h2>This&nbsp;little booklet brings the game to the table&nbsp;with everything a big module has, and more!</h2>
<ul><li>Setup&nbsp;<strong>hooks</strong>&nbsp;to bring the characters in.</li><li>Some local&nbsp;<strong>NPCs</strong>&nbsp;(and a list of names to choose from if you hate making up names on the spot)</li><li>Two stat blocks - <strong>skeletons </strong>and <strong>skeleton warhorses </strong>- you don't have to look up a thing!</li><li>a print-n-play&nbsp;<strong>battle map</strong>&nbsp;you can just have the fight right on.</li><li><strong>Initiative tracker</strong>&nbsp;and HP checkboxes for the skeletons so you don't need separate scratch paper</li><li>Skeleton<strong> tactics</strong> are not subtle, let's give them some motivation!</li><li>What happens after the encounter?&nbsp;<strong>Loot, experience, 1d6 random rewards</strong>!</li><li>An <strong>area map </strong>and vaguely worded&nbsp;<strong>regional lore</strong>!</li></ul>
<h2>Designed for Print</h2>
<p>The PDF makes an 8-page mini-zine. Two sheets of paper - print both sides, fold, optional staple, and you are in the game!&nbsp;<em>Keep this in your toolbox and bring it out any time you need a fight in a stable!</em></p>
<h3>Art Asset Shoutout</h3>
<p><em>Map tiles for the full color micro-module designed by <a href="http://www.stevencolling.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Steven Colling</a> and available <a href="https://stevencolling.itch.io/isle-of-lore-2-hex-tiles-regular" target="_blank">here on Itch.io</a>.</em></p>
<h3>Fifth Edition Compatible</h3>
<p>This game supplement is published under the terms of the Wizards of the Coast Open Game License version 1.0a.</p>
<h3>Supported on Patreon</h3>
<p>If you'd like to have adventures like this on the regular, check out my Patreon page (<a href="https://patreon.com/deusexminima" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Patreon.com/DeusExMinima</a>) and thank you for your support!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTg0MTA2LzMyNzAwOTUucG5n/original/DNDLuq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTg0MTA2LzMyNzAxMDAucG5n/original/4HtXSP.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTg0MTA2LzMyNzAwOTkucG5n/original/aVEYtN.png]]






<p>Thirteen Crossroads is a game about social scenes and subcultures, specifically how they ground the many intersecting relationships that build around them. You draw cards and answer questions about them, building up stories about a whole parade of characters as you go (some great-grandchild of Avery Alder's The Quiet Year). It's inspired by punk gigs and gay clubs, protest marches and zoom meetings.<br></p><p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIwMDA3MC83MDAwNjI0LnBuZw==/original/N6BelB.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIwMDA3MC83MTI4MDA1LnBuZw==/original/CGozmi.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIwMDA3MC83MTI4MDAyLnBuZw==/original/Km7QCW.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIwMDA3MC83MDAwNjExLnBuZw==/original/ViuL76.png]]






<p>The Baddies are back and babysitting again.&nbsp; The baby's powers? updated. The game mechanics? updated. The Halls? Decked. Never since the Grinch has there been such a heist in the works.&nbsp;<br><br>The sequel to 3 Baddies and a Baby gets a holiday themed sequel. It's still rules lite, but this game comes with a few suggestions for heists, and a completely new list of powers for the baby (with tons of Easter eggs. What are those doing here? That's the wrong holiday!)<br><br>So what are you waiting for? Grabs some friends, some dice, and let's start this heist.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc2MzAzMzAucG5n/original/QWJjaA.png]]






<p>Rent is due and your villainous crew is out of cash. A caper is needed or you lose the cool lair! But first, someone's sibling dropped off a snot nosed brat and you all have to keep an eye on the kid. But wait! The kid has... powers?&nbsp;<br><br>Jump into the wacky fun chaos of 3 Baddies and a Baby. Be villains, babysit, do crime.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU2MjExNTgucG5n/original/yd%2BDY1.png]]






<p><strong>Three Kids in a Trench Coat</strong><br></p>
<p>A simple and cute RPG for a collection of players to work together, roll some dice, and escape detention completely undetected in the most clever way possible. Face quirky teaches, unpredictable classmates, and dreaded hall monitors on your way to collect your school stuff and get the heck out of dodge!</p>
<p>Pay as you wish! But, the more I make the better this project will look over time! Help me add art and a layout one donation at a time!</p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzUwMzEwOTYucG5n/original/18Opiz.png]]






<p>3ternity, your digitally enhanced forever after.</p>
<p></p>
<p><span class=""></span>
</p>
<p><span class="">"Live" out your cybernetic afterlife in bliss, with our company you can enjoy endless comfort within the handcrafted existence experience of our deluxe eternity.</span></p>
<p></p>
<p>Take solace in knowing your relatives are in safe hands with our multinational corporation, our motto as always is the customer is of the highest importance. True to our statement, we have allocated a whopping 4GB of Ram per individual! Twice the amount of any other company in the market and the optimal quantity for a fruitful, joyous and excitement filled infinity.<br></p>
<p></p>
<p><span class=""></span>
</p>
<p><span class="">Phone our call centre for your free demo disc today!</span></p>
<p></p>
<p><span class=""></span>
</p>
<p>"We‚Äôre" dying to meet you.<br></p>
<p>========================</p>
<p>==============</p>
<p>==========</p>
<p><span class=""></span>
</p>
<p><span class="">Warning: This game may trigger epilepsy</span></p>
<p>==========<br></p>
<p>==============<br></p>
<p>========================</p>
<p>The relaxing ambient noise of 3ternity has been lovingly crafted by our resident composer&nbsp;'Shurk', specialising in soundscapes of the&nbsp;afterlife for more than 30 years.</p>
<p>--------&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;--------&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;--------&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;--------</p>
<p>The vibrant landscapes of our afterlife have been sculpted by hand and digitally rendered with the very best technology money can provide. Crafted with the highest precision over the course of 15 years by a team of 91 artists and engineers headed by our creative director 'Joseph Dunkerley'.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDUyMzQ3LzIyOTMxNDQuZ2lm/original/hYuVp1.gif]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDUyMzQ3LzIyOTMxMzIuZ2lm/original/Qomz7o.gif]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDUyMzQ3LzIyOTMxNDkuZ2lm/original/S9L5yv.gif]]






<p><em>You are participating in a new study by L&amp;G Inc. Though the compensation isn‚Äôt very good, they could be the key to your dream of having superpowers. After weeks of pokes and prods, and far more mental and physical tests than should be legal, you are one of the few whose power awakens! The catch?&nbsp;</em></p>
<p><em>You're stuck in this facility with a few powered individuals until you learn how to work together as a team of superheroes. Oh yeah, and everyone's power- including yours- is limited by 5 seconds in some way.
</em></p>
<p><em>So why go through all this?
</em></p>
<p><em>Because someone mentioned there would be a portal at the end of this training that could take your group anywhere, anytime. And did you catch the part about being a superhero?</em>
</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>5 Second Rule is a superhero game that&nbsp;uses the 3d6D system. It includes a Power Pool to encourage a balance between&nbsp;how often superhuman powers are used vs potential consequences. Will you and your teammates be able to learn the boundaries of your powers and how to work together well enough to get through the training facility? What awaits you once you do? </p>
<p>Originally created for <a href="https://itch.io/jam/one-page-rpg-jam-2021">One Page RPG Jam 2021</a>, it has been expanded to make it more printer friendly and&nbsp;easier to read.</p>
<p>Steph C. of TTRPGkids recently wrote this <a href="https://www.ttrpgkids.com/2022/03/01/tiny-tome-tiny-ttrpg-review-5-second-rule/#overall" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">incredible review</a><strong></strong> for 5 Second Rule in Tiny Tome. <em>"5 Second Rule was a lot of fun, easy to track, and encouraged a lot of teamwork and creative problem solving!&nbsp; It‚Äôs a great game for adults or kids to pick up quickly, and I hope you can check it out!"</em></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2NjcxNy84MzcwODY2LnBuZw==/original/KPZhFe.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2NjcxNy83NjY1ODI4LnBuZw==/original/haoJi3.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2NjcxNy83NjY1ODI5LnBuZw==/original/Syn3Si.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2NjcxNy83NjY1ODMzLnBuZw==/original/XSmgfH.png]]






<p><em>You find yourself seated at a table among a group of people you have never met before, in a place that feels‚Ä¶familiar. You have never been here, and yet the atmosphere is comforting, disarming. It feels a bit like home.</em></p>
<p><span class=""><strong>A Diner at the End</strong> </span><span class="">is a&nbsp;collaborative, improvisational storytelling game that invites at least two</span> players to share the experiences, dreams, and regrets of characters whose time has been spent. Players take on the personas of people across space and time, using a standard deck of playing cards as a means&nbsp;to guide their characters' conversations and reflections.</p>
<p>This game celebrates the lives we lead‚Äîin all of their joys and sorrows‚Äîand challenges players to find contentment in the limited time afforded to us all.<br></p>
<p>The <strong>A Diner at the End </strong>PDF features...<br></p>
<ul><li>Concise rules for playing the game 
</li><li>Easy-to-use tables to inspire character stories</li></ul>
<p>Paying <strong>$3 or more</strong> unlocks the <strong>Menu Print edition</strong>, a 12"x18" spread which adds...</p><ul><li>Tables to help inspire your character's origin</li><li>Rules for solo play </li></ul><p>Written and designed for <a href="https://kallenhale.itch.io/indie-index" target="_blank">Indie Index v1</a>.<br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc5Mjc2NTcuanBn/original/RoxV8i.jpg" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>Talk TTRPGs and more on <a href="https://twitter.com/bammaxgaming" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Twitter</a>!
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1ODczNC84MDU5OTEzLnBuZw==/original/wECBcu.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1ODczNC83OTA5OTI2LnBuZw==/original/Lv0PDV.png]]






<p><strong>Explore the rain-slicked streets of Film Noir.</strong></p>
<p>Cynical P.I.?&nbsp; Mesmerizing femme fatale?&nbsp; Dead-hearted hit man or pure-hearted reformer raging against the dark?&nbsp; <em>A Dirty World </em>has them all.&nbsp; It also features...</p>
<ul><li>An entirely reworked One Roll Engine, relentlessly forcussed on character.</li><li>A unified conflict mechanic where courtroom drama, gunfights, and the duel of seduction work the same way -- and transition seamlessly from one to another.</li><li>Instant character improvement in response to his circumstances and your decisions.</li><li>A system for sparking convoluted noir plots with a single die roll.</li></ul>
<p>In <em>A Dirty World</em>, the rules don't just support drama.&nbsp; They <em>are</em> drama.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI2NTI3MDEuanBlZw==/original/V8rEtp.jpeg]]






<p><em>A Fistful of Darkness</em> is a <strong>Weird West Fantasy</strong> <strong>hack </strong>of <strong>Blades in the Dark</strong> with heavy emphasis on the fantasy part. It‚Äôs not intended to be an accurate history lesson or a simulation of past times. It is designed to be a cinematic game which lets you play all those Weird West tropes towards the end of the world. <br></p>
<p><em>A Fistful of Darkness </em>is not a complete game. It‚Äôs a hack for Blades in the Dark by John Harper. You will need that game to play and if you don‚Äôt already own it, get it NOW! It‚Äôs more than worth your money.</p>
<h2>The Setting</h2>
<p>Imaging a world with the magic and mystery of the frontier: wide open<br>plains of the Old Wild West in all its beauty and madness, where violence<br>and sacrifice dominate every single day. Now add the Hellstone rush, under-<br>ground mayhem in mines and brand new sciences &amp; machines. Don‚Äôt forget<br>immigration, injustice, vigilante justice, outlaws, gunslingers, slick talkers<br>and setting suns. This all in the face of an impending doom: Demons and the<br>four riders bringing the end of the world as you know it. How do you make<br>it to the top of this powder keg, which side will you take in the impending<br>war and how much will your soul suffer? Let‚Äôs play to find out!</p>
<h2>The Rules</h2>
<ul><li>12 new playbooks<ul><li>The Fist - Like a cobra, ready to strike</li><li>The Shot - A deadly gunslinger &amp; showman</li><li>The Law - A lawmen &amp; enforcer</li><li>The Gamble - A subtle manipulator &amp; sly trickster</li><li>The Scout - A stealthy tracker &amp; hunter</li><li>The Outlaw - A maverick &amp; desperado beyond rules</li><li>The Thunderheart - A totem fighter born from the land</li><li>The Speaker - A spiritual guide &amp; protector</li><li>The Plan - A well-connected mastermind</li><li>The Gentle Touch - An empathic light in a dark world</li><li>The Wrench &amp; Saw - Mad scientist, Hellstone otaku</li><li>And special: The Revenant - A vengeful spirit in a dead body</li></ul></li><li>4 new Posse Playbooks<ul><li>Hellstone Scavengers, Outlaws, Bounty Hunters, Tribe</li></ul></li><li>New mechanics for your characters, crew and world (for example: Hellstone, Grit, Ablass, Stigmatas, Doom, Riders of the Apocalypse/End Game, Underworld Runs, Mutations)</li><li>Modified rules for Payout, Downtime and Entanglements/Rider Events, which tie into the Doom and Riders systems</li><li>A toolbox to create your own Weird West setting via world building</li><li>24 new factions for Mudwater and beyond</li><li>~180 pages of unique content including art</li></ul>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzMxMjMxNzQucG5n/original/ZOZw6w.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p><em>‚ÄúGet ready, Mateo. Doom is coming to dinner.‚Äù</em> ‚Äî MARSHAL McCAIN</p>
<h3>DOOM IS COMING TO MUDWATER</h3>
<p>It was a dark time,&nbsp; and it just got much darker: As if living in a cruel and heartless frontier world was not enough, as if living in a Hell on earth was not enough... in a too deep mine near that sleepy hollow called <em>Mudwater</em> they found Bloodstone. Thereafter known as <em>Hellstone</em>.</p>
<p>The old ones say that some things are better left uncovered and Hellstone is definitely such a thing. Like the original box of Pandora it was found deep in the earth, and now there is no way undoing it. You think the gold rush turned men into greedy monsters? Think again, because now we have all that and the real thing: monsters and demons, spirits and ghosts, mutants and undead soulless killers. Hordes of them hunting in the night, ravaging the countryside and swarms of living nightmares attacking from the skies. Beware traveler, no road is save anymore. They are coming from the mines, they are coming from underground maws, spawned into the dark where Hellstone is found.<br></p>
<p>Hellstone turned out to be way more valuable than any other resource known to man, even more precious than your beloved gold. Since they found a way to gain energy&nbsp; from Hellstone there's a new generation of marvellous machines and weapons for your greedy way to the top. Science and ancient magic rituals are equally powered with what Hellstone brings. Some say there's a just and appropriate way to use&nbsp; Hellstone, most of them just don't care if that's true. They are too busy exploiting it. It's a new world and everybody wants a big piece of it or die trying.</p>
<p>The elders and wise ones are sure the final days are upon us, that Hellstone is the first omen of a grim doom: The four horsemen will come. The white, the red, the black and the pale horse along with their riders will end existence and bring judgement and redemption. It's obvious that Hellstone plays a crucial part in this but the greedy ones are too blind to see. Does your posse recognize those signs or are you're too busy climbing to the top at the expense of their fellow people?</p>
<p>Thought you knew the face of greed? Come to Mudwater and learn anew. Some fools say it‚Äôs better to reign in Hell than serve in Heaven. Oh, yes! Who needs Heaven anyway when you have a Hellstone colt in your hand, still warm from killing a horde of demons? Just pray that you never run out of ammo... and pray for the day of your creator's judgement.</p>
<ul><li><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzMxMjMxNzYucG5n/original/%2Flywtt.png" loading="lazy"><br><br>Find additional free/PWYW content for the game (clocks, NPC card templates, ...) here: <a href="https://monkeyecho.itch.io/a-fistful-of-darkness-extended-content">https://monkeyecho.itch.io/a-fistful-of-darkness-extended-content<br></a><br>Looking for a printed book? <a href="https://www.lulu.com/en/en/shop/stefan-struck/a-fistful-of-darkness-hardcover/hardcover/product-1mm5v4kz.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><br></a></li><li><a href="https://www.lulu.com/en/en/shop/stefan-struck/a-fistful-of-darkness-hardcover/hardcover/product-1mm5v4kz.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"></a><a href="https://www.lulu.com/en/en/shop/stefan-struck/a-fistful-of-darkness-hardcover/hardcover/product-1mm5v4kz.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Check out the hardcover via lulu</a></li><li><a href="https://www.lulu.com/en/en/shop/stefan-struck/a-fistful-of-darkness-softcover/paperback/product-zrjq59.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Check out the softcover/paperback via lulu</a></li></ul>
<figure></figure>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI5OTEzMTIucG5n/original/3RWJnl.png]]






<p>You are the jester in King Lyrics‚Äô court. Through mere observation you discovered a conspiracy threatening their rule. You now have the fruitless task of warning their majesty.&nbsp;<br><br>A Fool's Errand is a single page, Solo-Journaling game about the futile effort of trying to warn a king about their inevitable destruction. <br><br>This game was made for Long Tail Games' Tiny Tome game jam<br>
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc3NTY5NDIuanBn/original/TZO24i.jpg]]






<p>Made for <a href="http://wuderpg.itch.io" target="_blank">WuDeRPG</a>'s&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/jam/quixotic-jam" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit">Quixotic Jam</a>.</p>
<p>A Handful Of Adventure is a journaling game that focuses on creating a story using a single theme determined by the roll of a d20. After writing a specific&nbsp;of amount of words, you roll a bunch of six-sided dice to determine where your story goes. What stories will&nbsp;<em>you&nbsp;</em>create?&nbsp;
</p>
<p>Special thanks to <a href="http://orpheuspress.itch.io" target="_blank">Orpheus Press</a> for the help in making the epub!&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc4OTkzNzQucG5n/original/d9G5JP.png]]






<p>A game of academic squabbles for two or more players. Fight for your hypothesis in a series of responses published by one of the journals in your field. Defend your academic integrity at all costs. Everyone needs to know your rival is wrong.</p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgzMTI0MDcucG5n/original/rqcBd8.png]]






<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYzMTc3OTcucG5n/original/bPq30O.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>Welcome to <strong>Tharaal's Hollow</strong>&nbsp; ‚Äî&nbsp; Your group of Marble-Seekers is here to get into a vault that's said to hold 2,000 Marble. As if that wouldn't be difficult enough on its own, the group is on a clicking clock as a Titan is incoming heading straight for the Tharaal's Hollow.<br></p>
<p>With all the inhabitants of Tharaal's Hollow unaware of their impending doom, Marble-Seekers can choose multiple ways to complete the adventure.</p>
<p>Do they save the people, or steal the money and save themselves?&nbsp;</p>
<p>This pamphlet adventure was designed with replayability in mind. A few ways you will find variety are:
</p>
<ul><li>Dice-rolled <strong>Titan Timer </strong>that will dictate how much time a group has before the settlement is crushed under a Titan's foot.
</li><li>Multiple&nbsp;<strong>Entry Points</strong>&nbsp;to support a variety of approach strategies</li><li><strong>Tables</strong>&nbsp;that try to support either stealthy or combat-based runs.</li></ul>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYzMTgzOTMucG5n/original/hRavu%2F.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p><a href="https://torthevic.itch.io/carapace" target="_blank">Carapace</a>&nbsp;was created by <a href="https://torthevic.itch.io/" target="_blank">TorTheVic</a><span></span></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NDE4My82MzE5MDE4LnBuZw==/original/rNw3Fr.png]]






<p>This Pathfinder Second Edition mini-adventure is meant to be run for a party of 2 to 4 level 7 characters. <br>Help Eldora by rescuing her wife from the depths of a mine where rare mushrooms grow, featuring a creature-hazard combo that can turn even a simple dungeon into a labyrinth.&nbsp;<br><br>Author:&nbsp; Shawn Pommier</p><p>Check out more on our main page!&nbsp;<a href="https://eldritchdream.itch.io/">https://eldritchdream.itch.io/</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5NDgxMC83NTMyOTc1LmpwZw==/original/SSQtiF.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5NDgxMC83NTMyOTc2LmpwZw==/original/NgcjyY.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5NDgxMC83NTMyOTc3LmpwZw==/original/hV8P%2F0.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5NDgxMC83NTMyOTc4LmpwZw==/original/z%2FdKux.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5NDgxMC83NTMyOTc5LmpwZw==/original/9GKdL8.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5NDgxMC83NTMyOTgwLmpwZw==/original/EG%2FfuB.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5NDgxMC83NTMyOTgxLmpwZw==/original/kSK84P.jpg]]






<h2>San Sibilia</h2>
<p><span></span><em>This city never changes, this city never stays the same. Close to the coast in a river delta, San Sibilia‚Äôs sprawling districts are connected by rambling trams and ramshackle ferries.&nbsp;</em><em>You may have read about <em>San Sibilia</em> once in a 20-part encyclopedia in a dusty shop around the corner, but haven‚Äôt been able to find the bookstore since.</em></p>
<h2>A Visit to San Sibilia</h2>
<p><span></span><em>A visit to San Sibilia</em> is a solo journaling game in which you roleplay a character chronicling their visit to the city of San Sibilia. It is a city not found on any maps‚ÄîSan Sibilia is both part of and distinct from our world. The city manifests itself differently to every visitor.</p>
<h2>Buy the print zine</h2>
<p>The game is also available in print. Buy it at&nbsp;<a href="https://floatingchair.club/products/a-visit-to-san-sibilia" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">FloatingChair.Club</a>.</p><h2>Newsletter</h2><p>Want to keep track of what I'm doing? Subscribe to my&nbsp;<a href="https://tinyletter.com/monstermind" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">newsletter</a>&nbsp;and be the first to know about my games in development.<span></span><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA3NjA4MS82MTcwNTE5LnBuZw==/original/V7bryy.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA3NjA4MS82MTcwNTIwLnBuZw==/original/GDGDl3.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA3NjA4MS82MTcwNTIxLnBuZw==/original/gOIKAA.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA3NjA4MS82MTcwNTIyLnBuZw==/original/6p0MrU.png]]






<p><strong><em>You are a Scientist.</em></strong><br></p>
<p>They tried to tell you to stop playing God.&nbsp;</p>
<p>You replied, ‚ÄúWho‚Äôs playing?‚Äù and spliced in another gene.&nbsp;
</p>
<p><strong><em>What is an Abomination?</em></strong>
</p>
<p>A living amalgamation of various forms of flesh, machinery, and whatever you can stick it together with. Some slimy, some hairy, some are covered in eyes. Others are a knot of tongues and fingers. An Abomination is whatever you can imagine it to be, tossed in a blender and put back together.
</p>
<p><strong><br></strong></p>
<p><strong>What is ABOMINATIONS?</strong>
</p>
<p>ABOMINATIONS is a tactile, GM-less TTRPG by Elliot Davis for 2-6 players. Using a set of letter tiles and some 10-sided dice, players will create and battle one-of-a-kind monsters of their own design.</p>
<p><strong>ABOMINATIONS Features:</strong></p>
<ul><li>An original 3-phase combat system that takes minutes to teach or learn.
</li><li>26 wild, wacky, and weird Genes to be combined into your unique Abomination - no two are alike!</li><li>6 Doctor personas, each with a unique Ultimate Gene Ability that can turn the tides in your favor
</li><li>Near-endless replayability through unique combinations of Doctor and Abomination</li><li>A satisfyingly crunchy yet simple d10 system that uses letter tiles to modify your rolls for defense and offense
</li><li>Original art by Elliot Davis
</li><li>A thematic, minimal character sheet, perfectly sized for placing and moving your letter tiles as you play
</li></ul>
<p><br></p>
<p><strong>What you get:</strong></p>
<ul><li>The full 20-page rules needed to play</li><li>Printable handouts<ul><li>Character Sheets with Quick Reference</li><li>Gene Ability Reference</li></ul></li><li>Print-and-play Gene Tiles (in case you don't own any letter tile games)</li><li>Fillable PDF Character Sheet</li></ul>
<p><strong>ZiMo 2022 Print-Run</strong></p>
<p>Thanks for a great ZiMo! More print copies will be available after preorders have been sent!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1NDk1OS84MDI2MTI3LmpwZw==/original/NjWODi.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1NDk1OS84MDgwMzQ5LnBuZw==/original/c77V3%2B.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1NDk1OS84MDI1OTI3LnBuZw==/original/kI7cKV.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1NDk1OS84MDI2MTE3LmpwZw==/original/XykMda.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1NDk1OS84MDI2MTUzLnBuZw==/original/RnUSPH.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1NDk1OS84MDM4OTU0LnBuZw==/original/YojKky.png]]






<p><strong></strong>Since the beginning of time, the forces of evil have sought to cause fear and destruction and each time it attempts to do so, a hero rises to stop them.
  &nbsp;
  </p>
<p>You are not one of those heroes.
  &nbsp;
  </p>
<p>Accomplice is a single-player roleplaying game where you are the assistant to one of these heroes, helping them do research and preparing a trap for one of these evil beings. By doing research from your personal library, looking for clues around town, and interviewing those that have insight into the world of the supernatural, only you can devise a plan that will allow you and your partner to stop evil from consuming the world.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Accomplice is a hack of&nbsp;<a href="https://noroadhome.itch.io/alone-among-the-stars" target="_blank">Alone Among the Stars</a> by Takuma Okada and is inspired by the Gabriel Knight computer game series by Jane Jensen.</p>
<p>For 1 Player. Players will need a deck of cards, a six-sided die, paper, and some pens or pencils.</p>
<p>If you'd like to play a multiplayer version of this games, consider checking out the hack <a href="https://aeta.itch.io/accomplices" target="_blank">Accomplices</a><br></p>
<p>If you like this game, you may also enjoy:<br><a href="https://mr-matthew.itch.io/alone-in-between" target="_blank">Alone in Between</a></p>
<p><a href="https://noroadhome.itch.io/alone-on-a-journey" target="_blank">Alone on a Journey</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ2Njk3NTgucG5n/original/PQMihH.png]]






<p>In <em>Adrift </em>you will find yourself cast into uncertainty, but encouraged to be kind to yourself in order to survive, maybe even thrive. This is accomplished through prompted reflections and journal entries.<br></p>
<p><em>Adrift </em>can be experienced alone or with friends near and far. It is designed to be engaged with for just a few minutes a day over several days, but is easily adapted to other experiences.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQyNTg0NjMuanBn/original/ymY%2BSq.jpg]]






<p><strong>Suit up. Get paid. Try not to die.<br></strong></p>
<p><strong><br></strong>Climb into an exo-suit designed by an empire that actively hates you. Survive a world that's probably trying to kill you. Kill tyrants.&nbsp;Save people. Change things up.<br></p>
<p><br>AEGIS is a love-letter tabletop RPG to LUMEN and looter-shooters like Anthem. <br></p><p><br></p><p>Art created by: <span class=""><span class="">@JNButlerArt</span></span><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTAyNi82MzEwNDQ2LnBuZw==/original/Fe%2Fbuo.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTAyNi82MzEwNDQ3LnBuZw==/original/WMwmox.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTAyNi82MzEwNDQ4LnBuZw==/original/wCnDIy.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTAyNi82MzEwNDQ5LnBuZw==/original/Z6teok.png]]






<p>Smash your brain into a Cyberhellscape in √Üthernet, a rules-light Occultech Horror Science-Fantasy game based off of <a href="https://gayhalforc.itch.io/sledgehammer">Sledgehammer</a> by <a href="https://gayhalforc.itch.io/">gayhalforc</a>.</p>
<h2>THE WORLD HAS CHANGED</h2>
<p><br>The Internet as we know it ceased to exist after The Incursion, and in its place the sprawling Virtual Hyperreality of the √Üthernet stretches horrible and festering in every direction. Plumb its depths in search of riches, miracles and ruins that the keepers of the mundane world will pay heartily for, just beware of the Daemons and UNGODS waiting for you in its depths, hoping to bend and shape your flesh to their own ends.</p>
<p>Make a character in seconds, ruin them for hours. The Player Book contains the minimum essential rules and setting information, and the Ref's Handbook fills in the other rules and tables you need to run the game. <br></p>
<h2>OK, WHAT DO I GET?</h2>
<ul><li>The Player Booklet (Print and Phone versions)</li><li>The Ref Handbook (Print and Phone versions) </li><li>The Sourcebook (Print and Phone versions) ‚Ä†</li><li>A Raw Text file so you can read it and not my godawful handwriting *</li></ul>
<p>‚Ä† This piece is in development</p>
<p>* This piece is useable as-is, but will be extended later<br></p>
<h2>WHERE DID THIS COME FROM?</h2>
<p>This game was made as a part of the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/sledgejammer-a-sledgehammer-jam">#Sledgejammer</a> game jam! <br></p>
<p>Based on Sledgehammer by Gayhalforc. √Üthernet is an independent work compatible with Sledgehammer but not affiliated with Gayhalforc.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzUxMTU4NjUuanBn/original/Ndg%2B6n.jpg]]






<h2>PLAYTEST MATERIAL</h2>
<p>This is the playtest version of the Against the&nbsp;Fall of Night TTRPG.&nbsp; More about the playtest status&nbsp;can be found below.&nbsp; What this means, in short, is that you can expect limited or no art, formatting, and incomplete rules all over the place.&nbsp; Your one-time purchase will entitle you to all playtest updates made, right up until the final playtest version.&nbsp;&nbsp;The final playtest version will be the complete text of the game, but will be missing elements like art and layout.&nbsp; The release version will be available separately when it is completed.</p>
<h1>Against the Fall of Night</h1>
<p>Against the Fall of Night (AFN) is a TTRPG about fighting against the coming darkness.&nbsp; The Night will fall.&nbsp; You can't stop it.&nbsp; That the fight is impossible makes it no less important.&nbsp; You can't stop the Night, but by bringing together and protecting as much as you can, you can keep the world together long enough to see the Dawn.</p>
<p>In the world of AFN, Night does not refer merely to what happens when the sun goes down.&nbsp;&nbsp;Night is an existential force, the terror that lies beyond, the darkness from without, a force and a place that is not of our world, but that wants very badly to make our world like it.&nbsp; Every day when the world shelters your view from the sun, that's not Night.&nbsp; That's just an ordinary night.&nbsp; Night is a longer cycle, when darkness creeps out from the places between shadows.&nbsp; When silence rings out, clear as a bell.&nbsp; When every mistake you have made, every fear you have, every dream you have been denied, rushes into your thoughts with crystal clarity.&nbsp; These things are the first stirrings of a true Night.&nbsp; Night is a slow corruption of the normal, a destruction of safety, a denial of predictability.&nbsp; When you hear a strange noise at 3 am, it could be anything.&nbsp; In the clear light of day, that was obviously just the house settling.&nbsp; At 3 am, it could have been an intruder or a monster or an extradimensional rift.&nbsp; These impressions are the leakage of true Night into any ordinary night.&nbsp; In an ordinary night, it is a passing fear, pushed away and laughed at nervously later.&nbsp; In true Night; who can say what fear might reveal, or what might pass through the darkness?</p>
<p>Night has fallen before, and it will fall again.&nbsp; Every time, the Dawn has come, its clear light banishing the Night.&nbsp; By default, an AFN campaign is set at&nbsp;Nightfall, when the Night is just beginning.&nbsp; Will your heroes be able to defend the world against the encroaching Night, and protect it long enough for Dawn to end this cursed Night?&nbsp; Will Night find a way to banish the light of hope, and prevent the Dawn from ever arriving?</p>
<p>Night falls, but heroes rise.&nbsp; In AFN, you play those heroes.&nbsp; With unique yet intuitive mechanical innovations, AFN keeps combat fresh and interesting without bogging itself down in the details.&nbsp; Powered by the Nightfall Engine, AFN aims to make sure that every choice offered to a player is an interesting choice; we don't believe that you need to waste your time making obvious choices or false choices.&nbsp; Resolution is quick and easy, using a system of Tests and Checks; Tests are rolled on a d20 and always have a fixed target number (10), while Checks are rolled on 2d6 and have varied TN by difficulty.&nbsp; In combat, characters spend Attack Points, Defense Points, and Magic Points to use combat techniques and cast spells, allowing all characters to make interesting choices with every action they take; but make sure you don't leave yourself open, as an attack that catches you off guard can cause serious harm to even an experienced hero.</p>
<p>In addition to the playtest document, a short introductory adventure is included, Heroes Rise.&nbsp;&nbsp;The heroes have found a village that has become a Nightmare.&nbsp; They must find the Anchor and defeat it to cleanse the Nightmare.</p>
<h2>PLAYTEST MATERIAL</h2>
<p>This is a playtest document.&nbsp; The current version is Playtest 0.1.&nbsp; Playtest 0.1 contains a full and complete core game system, along with multiple classes fully playable from level 1-6.&nbsp; (The level cap in AFN is 6.)</p>
<p>A selection of feats, spells, rituals, combat techniques, monsters, and magic items are included.&nbsp; Further expansion of these elements are planned.</p>
<p>Hints at what a setting region might be like are included.&nbsp; Expansion of the setting is planned.</p>
<p>One complete random generation table for Nightmare elements is included.&nbsp; Further expansions of these tables is planned.</p>
<p>There is no art included, and no editing, layout, or sensitivity reading has been performed on the playtest document.&nbsp; It is basically just text.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTExMzM2My82NDM1MTg1LnBuZw==/original/2B988m.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTExMzM2My82NDM1MTg3LnBuZw==/original/vQnYhh.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTExMzM2My82NDM1MTg2LnBuZw==/original/Zn1cNh.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTExMzM2My82NDM1MTg0LnBuZw==/original/%2BNRZDE.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTExMzM2My82NDM1MTgzLnBuZw==/original/pV%2FE0n.png]]






<h4><em>A fast-paced tabletop roleplaying game of heroic action in the world of ancient myths.</em></h4>
<p></p>
<h3>Heroes of Legend</h3>
<p>In the mists of ancient time, a poet sings of great deeds wrought by mighty<br>heroes‚Äîof monsters slain and justice restored, of wise counsel and devious<br>strategies, of courage, valor, and daring‚Äîdefiant of the gods themselves. In<br>AGON, you create these heroes, crafting their epic tale into an immortal legend.<br>On their way back home from war, a band of heroes become lost among<br>strange islands populated by mythical creatures, dangerous villains, legendary<br>kingdoms, and desperate people‚Äîeach entangled in strife, at the mercy of<br>the capricious gods.</p>
<p>It falls to you as the epic heroes of your age to seize this opportunity for<br>greatness‚Äîto set things right in these lost lands, overcome the trials of gods,<br>monsters, and mortals, prove the glory of your name, and win your way back home. In this game, you‚Äôll find:</p>
<ul><li>A brand-new game system for <strong>fast-paced heroic adventure</strong>, featuring simple characters and mechanics, quick location-based adventures, and one-roll conflict resolution. Play it as a <strong>zero-prep&nbsp; one-shot</strong>&nbsp;‚Äî or enjoy the complete experience as an ongoing series of island adventures.</li><li>Rules for creating your epic heroes, earning Glory for their Names, and<br>forging their eternal legends.</li><li>Divine Favor, Bonds, and Pathos to call upon for great deeds.</li><li>12 pre-made island adventures full of gods, monsters, and people to challenge your heroes.</li><li>Contests of Arts &amp; Oration, Blood &amp; Valor, Craft &amp; Reason, and Resolve<br>&amp; Spirit ‚Äîtesting both the prowess and passions of the heroes.</li><li>Guidance for the Strife Player, who presents the challenges of the islands.</li><li>The Vault of Heaven to record your progress towards returning home<br>and the grace (or ire) of the gods.</li></ul>
<h3>The Trials of Glory Await!</h3>
<p>Number of players: 3-6<br>Age of players: 13+<br>Length: 2-4 hours per game session<br>Page Count: 160<br>Release Date: March 2020 (2nd Edition)<br>Game Designers:&nbsp;John Harper and Sean Nittner</p><p><a href="https://community.bladesinthedark.com/t/paragon-system-for-agon-supplements-and-playsets/1810" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ4NDYzMjIucG5n/original/N5A3vb.png" align="left" style="padding-right: 10px" alt="paragon_logo" title="paragon_logo" loading="lazy"></a><br><br><br>AGON is the core book for the PARAGON game system. The system supports alternate settings and situations, contained in a variety of playsets. Check out a few below!<br><br></p><figure><a href="https://johnharper.itch.io/chamber" target="_blank"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ4NDYzNDUucG5n/original/ppHriU.png" width="175" alt="chamber" title="chamber" loading="lazy"></a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="https://johnharper.itch.io/storm-furies" target="_blank"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ4NDYzNDcucG5n/original/KDiSkO.png" width="175" alt="storm furies" title="storm furies" loading="lazy"></a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="https://seannittner.itch.io/surge-protectors" target="_blank"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ4NDYzNDkucG5n/original/P8dwFr.png" width="175" alt="surge protectors" title="surge protectors" loading="lazy"></a><br></figure>
<p><strong>AGON COMMUNITY FORUM</strong> (at the Blades in the Dark forums)</p>
<p><a href="https://community.bladesinthedark.com/c/off-topic-lounge/agon" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://community.bladesinthedark.com/c/off-topic-lounge/agon</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjE4ODQ4LzQ4NDYzMDAucG5n/original/aex%2BOi.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjE4ODQ4LzMyOTA4MzYucG5n/original/DkWAqL.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjE4ODQ4LzMyOTA1MDMucG5n/original/CrPpTR.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjE4ODQ4LzMyOTA1MjkucG5n/original/FTVXx3.png]]






<hr>






<h2 class="text-center"></h2>
<p></p>
<h2 class="text-center">Alien Armory is a collection of&nbsp;bio-punk weapons, armors and equipment compatible with the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror RPG.</h2>
<p class="text-right"></p>
<p><br></p>
<p class="text-justify"><em><strong>The Second Earth Xenobiology Committee has analyzed and catalogued a series of&nbsp;dangerous items of alien origins. Equip&nbsp;your Mothership characters with these horrendous tools&nbsp;or use them as plot hooks for deep space adventures.</strong></em></p>
<h4 class="text-right"></h4>
<p>This book contains:</p>
<ul><li>22 Bio-punk items</li><li>Void Septopus: Living vehicle</li><li>4 Xenodealer NPCs</li><li>Bio-punk items generator</li></ul>
<p class="text-right"><br>Alien Armory is written by <a href="https://linktr.ee/nyhur" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Nyhur</a> and drawn by <a href="https://www.instagram.com/jfpierra/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">J.F. Pierra</a><br>Many thanks to all our Kickstarter backers that made this project possible!<br><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2MjUwMS83NjAyODMzLnBuZw==/original/uY2xaO.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2MjUwMS83NjAyODM0LnBuZw==/original/3wvAl%2F.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2MjUwMS83NjAyODM1LnBuZw==/original/u5%2BSYN.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2MjUwMS83NjAyODM2LnBuZw==/original/QqPQld.png]]






<<list-links "[has:field[url]sort[title]]">>






<<list-links "[has:field[url]!sort[rating]]">>






<h1>Welcome to a Wild World of Fantastic Basketball</h1>
<p>Slam-Dunks! Triple Doubles! Kooky Advertisements! Smooching! Welcome to the premier lighthearted, setting-and-genre-neutral basketball tournament one-shot&nbsp; for two to four players! <br></p>
<h3>What?</h3>
<p>Let me back up. Alley-Oop! is a game that simulates a basketball tournament, but it's not about being a basketball expert, or leading your team to victory. In Alley-Oop!, you take a more laid back approach, instead letting the dice fall where they may, narrating and interpreting their results! How does that work? Well, every basketball player on your team is <em>represented by a specific die</em>. That big pink d12? That might be Josie Wreden, the 3 time All-Star and leading scorer in the league! And that green d4? That might be Sam "Bonanza" Bonnigan, a rookie here to show that they can hang in the big leagues. <br><br>And of course, they have to compete with the fact that they are mere humans in a league populated by ghosts, psychics, aliens, movie monsters and various knights from throughout history.<br></p>
<h3>Okay, You Lost me Again</h3>
<p>Oh, right! Alley-Oop! is completely flexible in its setting! So if you want to play as a bunch of Aliens getting together for an intergalactic tournament? Great! If you want to play as a group of kids playing a tournament in the last days and weeks of their summer camp? Amazing!<br></p>
<p>The only restrictions are that the characters have to play together, and that all the participants are living in the same general space for the duration of the tournament. That's because in between games of basketball, we get to see what the players lives are like in short little scenes. What's it like when they eat together? What does it look like when they train? Is that romance that was brewing on the court going to blossom into love? We answer those questions and more between the games!!</p>
<h3>Oh god just show me a bulleted list I beg of you</h3>
<p>Fine. We got:</p>
<ul><li>A Flexible Setting</li><li>Basketball Players are Specific Dice</li><li>A big Lexicon of Basketball Terms for Nerds!</li><li>A big list of Fun Settings for Jocks!</li><li>Lovely Art and Beautiful Layout</li><li>An easy to follow, play as you read format</li><li>30+ pages for $15</li></ul>
<h1>Free Playsheets Available In Demo Section</h1>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTUzODkxLzY1NTY3OTIuanBn/original/h%2FjAnV.jpg]]






<p></p>
<p><span></span></p>
<p><strong>You are a famous space cartographer</strong> that has been tasked with creating a comprehensive map of your section of the galaxy. To do this you have divided the galaxy into 36 quadrants and will label the most important Cosmic Bodies, both natural and constructed.&nbsp;
</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>---------
</p>
<p><em>Alone on a Galactic Map</em>&nbsp;solo tabletop role playing game about discovering Cosmic Bodies and creating a map.</p>
<p>This game&nbsp;uses a standard deck of playing cards, 2 six-sided dice, writing implements, a grid, and an optional coin.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</p>
<p>A grid is only provided at the end of the BW PDF document, but there are&nbsp;separate PNG files that are available for download.
</p>
<p>There is both a Circular Grid and a Square Grid available&nbsp;</p>
<p>This game is a hack of&nbsp;<a href="https://noroadhome.itch.io/alone-among-the-stars">Alone Among the Stars</a>&nbsp;by&nbsp;<a href="https://noroadhome.itch.io/">Takuma Okada</a>&nbsp;and is a space-themed version of my game&nbsp;<a href="https://k-ramstack.itch.io/alone-on-a-map">Alone on a Map</a></p>
<p>Image Credit:</p>
<p>Detail from&nbsp;Celestial Zoo by Pablo Carlos Budassi under Attribution-ShareAlike 2.0 Generic (CC BY-SA 2.0)&nbsp;</p>
<p><a href="https://ko-fi.com/kramstack" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ2NTkzNzEucG5n/original/GnxSt9.png" loading="lazy"></a>
</p>
<p>If you have made a map and would like to show me please @ me on Twitter my handle is&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/KadenRamstack" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@KadenRamstack</a>&nbsp;and I would love to see it!&nbsp;
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE3OTc0NC82ODcyOTkyLnBuZw==/original/16ELBA.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE3OTc0NC82ODcyOTI0LnBuZw==/original/Fvq%2Fwm.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE3OTc0NC82ODcyOTI3LnBuZw==/original/W8EnDC.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE3OTc0NC82ODcyOTQxLnBuZw==/original/2CXYyV.png]]






<p><span></span></p>
<p><strong>You are a renown cartographer</strong> that has been tasked with creating a comprehensive map of the entire world. To do this you have divided the world into 36 quadrants and will label the most important Landmarks.</p>
<p>---------</p>
<p><em>Alone on a Map</em>&nbsp;solo tabletop role playing game about discovering landmarks and creating a map.</p>
<p>This game&nbsp;uses a standard deck of playing cards, 2 six-sided dice, writing implements, a grid, and an optional coin.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p>A grid is provided at the end of each PDF document, but there is also separate grid PNG available for download.</p>
<p>This game is a hack of&nbsp;<a href="https://noroadhome.itch.io/alone-among-the-stars">Alone Among the Stars</a> by <a href="https://noroadhome.itch.io">Takuma Okada</a> and is heavily inspired by <a href="https://dr-d-king.itch.io/tiny-islands">Tiny Islands</a> by <a href="https://dr-d-king.itch.io">David King</a></p>
<p>For a Sci-Fi / Space version of the game check out <a href="https://k-ramstack.itch.io/alone-on-a-galactic-map">Alone on a Galactic Map</a></p>
<p>8/29/21 Update: Added a plain text and ePub version <br></p><p>3/9/22 Update: Added Transparent PNG <br></p>
<p><a href="https://ko-fi.com/kramstack" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ2NTkzNzEucG5n/original/GnxSt9.png" loading="lazy"></a></p>
<p>If you have made a map and would like to show me please @ me on Twitter my handle is <a href="https://twitter.com/KadenRamstack" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@KadenRamstack</a> and I would love to see it!&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODMxNDMzLzQ2NTkzODYucG5n/original/DB35al.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODMxNDMzLzQ2NTkzODQucG5n/original/hByZ6m.png]]






<p>There used to be humans here, but they all left. That‚Äôs what your mama told you, and what her mama told her.&nbsp;The Earth Mother has begun to retake the land and bring magic back to it. Green grass and vines cover the cities the humans left behind.</p>
<p><strong><em>You are a crow</em></strong>.</p>
<p>Take flight from your nest and explore.</p>
<p><em>"Alone on the Wind"&nbsp;is based on "<a href="https://noroadhome.itch.io/alone-among-the-stars" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit">Alone Among the&nbsp;Stars</a>" by <a href="https://noroadhome.itch.io/" style="font-size: inherit">Takuma Okada</a></em><span></span></p>
<p>Check out "<em><a href="https://harper-jay.itch.io/as-the-crow-flies" target="_blank">As the&nbsp;Crow Flies</a></em>", an expanded version of this game using the Carta system!</p><p><iframe frameborder="0" src="https://itch.io/embed/1367917?linkback=true&amp;bg_color=070b39&amp;fg_color=ffffff&amp;link_color=fb98f8&amp;border_color=000000" width="552" height="167">&lt;a href=&quot;<a href="https://harper-jay.itch.io/as-the-crow-flies">As&quot; class=&quot;redactor-linkify-object&quot;&gt;https://harper-jay.itch.io/as-the-crow-flies&quot;&gt;As</a> the Crow Flies by Chubby Crow Games&lt;/a&gt;</iframe><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM2MzA2Ny84MzAzMzk3LnBuZw==/original/RcLTd6.png]]






<p><strong>This edition of An Altogether Different River was funded on <a href="https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ehronlime/an-altogether-different-river-zine-edition" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Kickstarter as a part of Zine Quest 3</a>.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<p><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>&nbsp;<em>It has been some time since you‚Äôve left home, but now it‚Äôs finally time to return. To what, though? </em>
  </p>
<p><em>The home you held in your mind, and the home you will encounter will not be the same. You are not the same. </em>
  </p>
<p><em>You can‚Äôt step into the same river twice. You can‚Äôt go home again.<br></em></p>
<p><em></em><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>This is a GM-less roleplaying game meant for 2 to 4 players and&nbsp;a single session of about 3-4 hours. It&nbsp;is&nbsp;inspired&nbsp;in&nbsp;parts&nbsp;by&nbsp;<a href="http://lessthanthreegames.com/downfall.html" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Downfall, by Caroline Hobbs</a> and <a href="http://www.lamemage.com/microscope/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Microscope, by Ben Robbins</a>. Cover and interior art is by <a href="https://linktr.ee/venessatgg" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Venessa Tang</a>. You will need pencils and paper and maybe a deck of cards to pick randomly from lists.<br></p>
<p>It is about a Town, the people who have left it and returned, and the people who stayed behind. <br></p>
<p>It is about returning home and grappling with what has and hasn't changed.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NjI5NzUuanBn/original/HBClO8.jpg" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>At the start of the game, you will collaboratively build a Town out of several elements. You will draw two maps for the Town: one for the Town Then, and one for the Town Now.<br></p>
<p>You then create your characters and choose whether they left the Town and returned, or stayed throughout the period. You also highlight certain questions you want to explore through your characters and relationships. You will track this through a relationship map which you draw between the Towns.<br></p>
<p>Then you introduce and explore different aspects of the Town and play through different scenes to flesh out the Town and the characters, seeking to answer the different questions you have.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NjI5NzgucG5n/original/m5ez%2FY.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>You can look to Town card prompts to add different aspects of the town, then highlight how the Town has changed by picking an aspect and showing its form in both the Town maps. Based on what you know of the Town and its history, you can pick questions to form the basis of scenes between various characters to explore the Town in more detail.</p>
<p>Once you've answered a few questions, you'll move to end the game, even if you have questions left unanswered, as time passes on for the inhabitants of the Town.<br></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDY2NTI5LzU4NjE5NjcucG5n/original/E9bxo3.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDY2NTI5LzU4NjE5NjgucG5n/original/leMdod.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDY2NTI5LzU4NjE5NzAucG5n/original/sRsnLv.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDY2NTI5LzU4NjE5NjkucG5n/original/h1vvFl.png]]






<p></p>
<p>PHYSICAL COPIES AVAILABLE IN APRIL!</p>
<h2>What is&nbsp;Anamnesis?</h2>
<p>Anamnesis&nbsp;is a 24-page&nbsp;solo journaling RPG about self-discovery, reflection, and identity.</p>
<p>You play as an individual who has woken up with<strong> memory loss</strong>. You do not remember who you are, where you are, or what you care about.&nbsp;As you draw <strong>tarot cards</strong>, you fill the blank spaces of your <strong>past</strong> and learn more about your <strong>present</strong>.<br></p>
<p>All that is needed to play is a&nbsp;<strong>deck of tarot cards</strong>&nbsp;and a way to record your thoughts.</p>
<p>Included is:</p>
<ul><li>A PDF copy of Anamnesis (spreads &amp; pages)</li><li>A Designer's Commentary version of Anamnesis</li><li>An audiobook of Anamnesis, narrated by the author</li></ul>
<p><a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/1f0l9l3wyBpTWnwnSpEy2a?si=riOPD8ycSAmovJ6oohRhSw" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Click here for a Spotify playlist of background music for&nbsp;Anamnesis.</a><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<h2>Praise for Anamnesis</h2>
<p>"Anamnesis sent me down an eye-opening rabbit hole as far as what a TTRPG could be. Tender, personal, thought-provoking, moving, terrifying, raw."</p>
<p><em>-&nbsp;<strong>Shawn Drake, designer of HEDGE and Court of Blades</strong></em></p>
<p><em></em></p>
<p><em>"As an author, I love the potential of Anamnesis to help me generate random fictional scenarios. As I played, it became obvious that the game could also be used for self-reflection. Samantha has created a unique, powerful experience - I absolutely recommend Anamnesis for everyone who loves stories."</em></p>
<p><strong><em>- Tanya Schofield, author of the Melody's Song trilogy</em></strong></p>
<p><strong></strong></p>
<p><em><em>"Anamnesis invites you to sway and stumble through a journey of Proustian discoveries. Dwelling in the quiet connections between loss, discovery, and renewal, the game guides you through the creation of a world that can bloom and welcome, overwhelm and frighten, asking with a quiet persistence: Who are you?"</em></em></p>
<p><em><strong>- Sean Patrick Cain, designer of Long Haul 1983</strong></em></p>
<p><br></p>

<h4></h4>
<p>Anamnesis&nbsp;was successfully Itchfunded, which allowed the game to have an artist, editor, and layout artist. Thank you to everyone who helped make this game possible!</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Anamnesis was also <a href="https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/samanthaleigh/anamnesis-a-tarot-game" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">successfully Kickstarted</a> for a print run. Print copies coming in 2022! Thank you to everyone who backed this project.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p><strong>Purchasing Anamnesis for $10 will also fund a community copy.</strong></p>
<p></p>
<p><a href="https://www.redbubble.com/people/viaphonized/explore?asc=u&amp;page=1&amp;sortOrder=recent" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">If you like the art from Anamnesis, merch is available&nbsp;at Victor Winter's store</a></p>
