</p>
<h2>If you haven't yet picked up the ashcan, you can purchase the full pdf below, and get a head start into the dumpster.</h2>
<p><a href="mailto:disastertourismgames@gmail.com" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"></a>
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM3MDQ4NC84MDczMjE3LnBuZw==/original/NbPCG3.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM3MDQ4NC84MTEwMzkxLnBuZw==/original/j9FADO.png]]






<p>This collection features five NPCs designed for <a href="https://losing-games.itch.io/mausritter" target="_blank">Mausritter</a>, the table-top game of swords and whiskers.
  </p>
<p>This collection will add an extra dose of flavour, intrigue and  possibilities to your Mausritter adventure sites and hex crawl. Each NPC  card includes stats, personal information and tables for potential  side-quests and backstories. <br></p>
<p>Here's the cast of characters included in this collection:</p>
<p><strong>El Gecko</strong> the wall-climbing muralist. A lizard who wants to put their art in the most daring of places.</p>
<p><strong>Quillermo</strong> the ornery porcupine duellist. A quill wielding fighter who is desperate to find a worthy opponent.</p>
<p><strong>The Seer at Helen's Pond</strong>, a turtle who can see the future. A slow-talking (and moving) turtle who can reveal crucial information... for the right gift.</p>
<p><strong>One-Eyed Sligo</strong> the mage-hunter. A newt who wants to rid the world of all magic.</p>
<p><strong>Lupin Rainbow</strong> the ghost-squeaker. A mouse who sees and can talk to ghosts. <br></p>
<p><br></p>
<figure><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc5NTkzMzAucG5n/original/uJrrK1.png" alt="Mausritte compatibility logo" title="Mausritte compatibility logo" loading="lazy"></figure>
<p>These NPCs are independent productions by tim zee and are not   affiliated with Losing Games. It is published under the Mausritter Third   Party Licence.          </p>
<p>Mausritter is copyright Losing Games.      </p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgwMDM1MTUuanBn/original/UdAD%2Fp.jpg]]






<p><a href="https://jwalberg.itch.io/curse-of-the-alta-silva#rewards">Looking for community copies?</a></p>
<p>Welcome to the Alta Silva Resort, your relaxing retreat from the hectic pace of modern life. Ignore the rumors. It's perfectly safe here.</p>
<p>&nbsp;The brochure sounded so promising. You were just there for a party. A vacation. A company retreat. It was supposed to be relaxing. Fun. Maybe educational. A chance to recharge.</p>
<p>&nbsp;But now? Evil is on the loose. People are dead. People you cared about. More people are going to die.</p>
<p>&nbsp;Why? Who, or what, is killing you all? Can you stop it? Can you survive the night? Are you next?</p>
<p>Curse of the Alta Silva is a narrative storytelling roleplaying game in the tradition of classic slasher movies and &nbsp;surviving a night far from help.&nbsp; Evil Dead, Friday the 13th, Halloween, Child's Play, and Nightmare on Elm Street all rank high in the list of inspirations.&nbsp; There is no GM. You are in charge of your own doomed and bloody fate. To play, you will need several d6s, a d8, and copies of the included character sheet.</p>
<p>Characters are built on four Traits, four Skills, two Relationships, and one Group, using the <a href="https://liverealproductions.com/ven6-system-reference-document/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">VEN6 Storytelling System</a>.
</p>
<p><a href="https://liverealproductions.com/altasilvacharactersheet" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">A Google Doc character sheet is available here.</a>
</p>
<p><a href="https://liverealproductions.com/altasilvacharactersheetsheets" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">A Google Sheets character sheet is available here.</a>
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIzNTg4My83MjA1NDMwLnBuZw==/original/mSQQFn.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIzNTg4My83MjA1NDMyLnBuZw==/original/tY2t5m.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIzNTg4My83MjA1NDM0LnBuZw==/original/80fC5X.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIzNTg4My83MjA1NDQ1LnBuZw==/original/7j9ktR.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIzNTg4My83MjMxNTQ2LmpwZw==/original/QkShrH.jpg]]






<p>A microcosm TTRPG of insects and intrigue. Explore the&nbsp;mysterious bug city of the <strong>Cuticorium</strong>, orchestrate plots for supremacy, and uncover the secrets of the outside world.<br></p>
<p>Playing as a tiny bug is a daunting task without help.&nbsp;Using the unique&nbsp;<strong>Web system</strong>, you can build and burn connections with the land, other bugs, or yourself. Web tokens&nbsp;are used to power friendships or preserve the natural order. Mix and match from 21&nbsp;<strong>Features</strong>&nbsp;to define what type of bug you are, opening up new ways to spend Webs and lay out your schemes.&nbsp;<strong>Cuticorium</strong> uses a GM/Storyteller, 2-5 other players, and d4 dice.&nbsp;</p>
<p>What you get:</p>
<ul><li>A&nbsp;beautiful&nbsp;130-pg rulebook with colorful bug illustrations&nbsp;between every page.</li><li>Two gorgeous hi-res maps of the Cuticorim for tabletop printing or Roll20, with 23 distinct locations to explore.&nbsp;</li><li>An ambient nine track <a href="https://danielelsberry.bandcamp.com/album/cuticorium-original-soundtrack" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">original musical score</a> to set the mood.</li><li>Twelve detailed&nbsp;Ommatidia tables for randomly generating bug characters or playing Cuticorium as a solo journaling experience.</li><li>Printable one-page character sheets designed for simplicity.</li><li>One short starting adventure module with access to all future modules.&nbsp;</li><li>A plaintext version for accessibility with a guide to all the bugs shown in the rulebook for the unfortunate insectophobe.</li></ul>
<p><a href="https://www.indiepressrevolution.com/xcart/usducktape/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">A limited print run of Cuticorium is also&nbsp;available&nbsp;for&nbsp;purchase in small soft cover print with a&nbsp;map poster on the IPR online&nbsp;store</a></p>
<p>Credits: Illustrations by&nbsp;<strong><a href="https://www.instagram.com/melspontaneus/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Melisa Echavarria</a>,&nbsp;</strong><strong><a href="https://esabelleryngin.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Escher Cattle</a>,&nbsp;</strong><a href="https://www.stevennosov.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><strong>Steven ‚ÄòSki‚Äô Nosov</strong></a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/dreamcider" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><strong>Leo&nbsp;‚ÄòCrab Boy‚Äô Dreamcider</strong></a><a href="https://twitter.com/dreamcider" style="" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"></a><strong>,</strong> and <a href="https://twitter.com/dustbinrat" style="" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Hibi</a><strong>.&nbsp;</strong>Editing and formatting by&nbsp;<strong><a href="https://twitter.com/hktk1059" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">hktk1059</a>.&nbsp;</strong>Soundtrack by&nbsp;<strong><a href="https://soundcloud.com/yophey" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Daniel Elsberry</a>.&nbsp;</strong>Consulting by&nbsp;<strong><a href="https://www.9thlevel.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Heather O‚ÄôNeil and 9th Level Games</a>.&nbsp;Thank you to all the <a href="https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/40215414/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Kickstarter</a> backers who made this game possible.</strong></p><p><em>If you purchase a physical copy from a relator, message on twitter or by email with&nbsp;a picture of your book and I will get you a download code to the digital content.</em></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODQxMzg5LzU4MDQxMTEucG5n/original/TCBtSE.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODQxMzg5LzU4MDQxMTIucG5n/original/7OJqcJ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODQxMzg5LzU4MDQxMTMucG5n/original/%2Fim0X6.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODQxMzg5LzU4MDQxMTAucG5n/original/JAN501.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODQxMzg5LzU4MDQxMTQucG5n/original/6QWPPn.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODQxMzg5LzU4MDQxNTMucG5n/original/Xh7qGF.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODQxMzg5LzU3Njg5MzMucG5n/original/dGUcdt.png]]






<p>Cheaply crafted plastic friends to buy<br>Cyber companions were born to die<br>For many there are sorrowful tears to cry<br>Salt lakes drawn from countless tear ducts dry<br>To say their souls don't linger would be a lie<br>For they remain tethered until their chips do fry<br>Immortal cemetery dwellers, from sight they shy<br>Their ominous deathless presence one can't deny</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>'Cyber Companion Cemetery'</p>
<p>This 22 page book&nbsp;created by Joseph Dunkerley&nbsp;is a homage to all the beloved digital pets lost throughout the years.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMzk3ODQ4LzE5NzExODMucG5n/original/HOTL8t.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMzk3ODQ4LzE5NzExODEucG5n/original/yfWDcn.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMzk3ODQ4LzE5NzExODIucG5n/original/LHb6bQ.png]]






<h3>Enter cyber-reality and hack your way to victory!</h3>
<p><strong>Cyber//Core; HACK</strong> is a rules-light TTRPG for running quick one-shots or episodic cyberspace hacking missions.&nbsp;In this game, you will play as an elite hacker, taking on only the most difficult and dangerous missions. If it were simple, they wouldn't be hiring <strong>you</strong>. This also means that you are by no means guaranteed to succeed, and you'll need to use your resources wisely to see each mission through.</p>
<p>As an elite cyber hacker, you will use your custom suite of core hacking software to impose your will on the very reality of cyberspace, controlling your target's reality and finding a way through to your mission's goal. Make use of your personal mainframe's powerful computing capabilities to overclock and boost your software, or to make use of your elite specialty ability. Take care you don't get caught unless you're confident in your defense though. Once you've been detected, you may find it a quick path to Burn Out and a failed mission.<br></p>
<p>A mission can take as long as the GM and players want it to, but a recommended time frame is 30-60 minutes. Act fast, hack your way through system nodes, and get to the goal before your time runs out. <br></p>
<p>Now put on your favorite cyberpunk music, and get hacking!<br></p>
<h4>One-on-One Play</h4>
<p> Cyber//Core; HACK is designed with everything from one-on-one play all the way up to a full group in mind. If you've ever wanted to try running a solo game, this is a perfect system to do it in: give that one player your undivided attention and tell a story about a solo hacker taking on the world.</p>
<h4>GM-Less Option</h4>
<p>Cyber//Core; HACK can be played without a central GM if desired. In this case, each player should come up with a piece of the mission and a reason their hacker won't be part of it before getting started. Each piece can be presented in a random order to prevent anyone from knowing their segment is coming up next. While in their segment, the player who created it runs it for the other hackers, with their hacker tied up doing something else.</p>
<h4>Testimonials</h4>
<p>"This was a fun one-shot cyberpunk game that someone new to RPGs could enjoy and quickly get the hang of. Lots of potential for different outcomes every time you play. Don't be afraid to throw yourself headfirst into your hacking roleplay and have fun! The worst thing that can happen is being obliterated from cyberspace." -2mad_dog2 (Playtester)<br><br>"10/10, would hack again" - Arathius (Playtester)<br></p>
<h4>Light and Dark</h4>
<p>The difference between Dark Mode and Light Mode is purely aesthetic. But we all know Dark Mode is better :P<br></p>
<h4>Comments? Suggestions?</h4>
<p>Let me know if you liked the game, or have found ways to improve it!<br>You can comment here, or send me an <a href="mailto:contact@lonecolossusgames.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">email</a> :)</p>
<p>If you liked the game, please consider leaving a review!<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM0NjUxNS83OTA4MjM5LmpwZw==/original/2zvUQL.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM0NjUxNS83OTA4MjM0LmpwZw==/original/jz9jrQ.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM0NjUxNS83OTA4MjM2LmpwZw==/original/Vbxc3Z.jpg]]






<h2>Fight the Man. Save your store. Keep the music playing.</h2>
<p>In&nbsp;<em>Damn the Man</em>, you‚Äôll juggle the responsibilities of a day that will determine the future of your record store, all while trying to accomplish a big personal goal. Can you confess your love to your crush and find the money that went missing from the cash box? Can you pay off your debt to your parents while promoting tonight‚Äôs big show? The clock is ticking and you‚Äôve got until midnight to try.</p>
<p><em>Damn the Man</em>&nbsp;is inspired by movies like&nbsp;<em>Empire Records</em>,&nbsp;<em>Dazed and Confused</em>, and a love for the ‚Äô90s. It‚Äôs silly and tender and no familiarity with the source material is necessary to enjoy the game.</p>
<ul><li><strong>Players:</strong>&nbsp;3-4 players, 1 facilitator</li><li><strong>Time:</strong>&nbsp;About 3 hours</li></ul>
<p>The 103-page, full-color book features illustrations by artist&nbsp;<a href="https://www.instagram.com/adrawnnovel/?hl=en" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Evan Rowland</a>&nbsp;and all the step-by-step guidance you need to play the game! Banner art by&nbsp;<a href="https://www.instagram.com/bugwithapen" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Bug Robbins</a>.</p>
<h2>Nice words about the game:</h2>
<blockquote>‚ÄúShaffer not only nails the tone of 90‚Äôs slacker comedies with the character archetypes but also provides a book full of excellent advice for anyone running their first game.‚Äù&nbsp;<a href="https://geekandsundry.com/these-5-incredible-indie-rpgs-are-groundbreaking-and-award-winning/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">-Geek &amp; Sundry</a></blockquote>
<h2>Awards:</h2>
<p><a href="https://www.igdnonline.com/previous-award-winners" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">2018 IGDN award-winner for Best Rules</a>.</p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMjA4ODk1LzM2MTYzNTYuanBn/original/ASbd0m.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMjA4ODk1LzM2MTYzODEucG5n/original/msJG%2Fe.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMjA4ODk1LzM2MTY0MjUuanBn/original/znKT99.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMjA4ODk1Lzk3OTM4NS5wbmc=/original/veBpk%2F.png]]






<p>Deadly Revelation is a Murder Mystery Tabletop RPG where&nbsp;players are brought&nbsp;together to bond with allies, deceive future enemies, and ultimately, seek the truth.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Brought together&nbsp;through means unknown, a group of people are trapped in an unknown place with only one&nbsp;means of escape: murdering another and getting away with it.</p>
<p>Between telling truth from lie, and solving murders as they come, will those dwindling&nbsp;few who remain be able to escape by means other than killing? Or will they succumb to&nbsp;desperation and despair as the game at hand intends? Only those who know how to trust‚Äîand know when not to‚Äîwill reach the end alive.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwNzAzNi83NjAzNjgzLnBuZw==/original/t5dlB0.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwNzAzNi83NjAzNjYyLnBuZw==/original/Frswq6.png]]






<p><em>"We are immortals. Mercenaries. Warriors. We can't die. We live in the shadows, doing our part to help make this world a better place.  When we suffer a mortal injury, we just... get back up. Our consciousness returns, our wounds heal, and we're back in the fight, just like that."</em></p>
<p><em>"Everything that lives never lives forever. Even us. One day, your wounds just stop healing. We don't know when. We don't know why. Every death could be the one..."</em></p>
<p>As immortal warriors in an increasingly modernizing world, embark on dangerous missions to right the world's wrongs and participate in what many would call modern fairy tales.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>DELUXE EDITION<br></strong>Included in the Deluxe edition that was not present in the base game:</p>
<ul><li>4 new classes, including the drone-wielding Techno and the team-bolstering Synergist</li><li>A premade adventure</li><li>Optional rulesets to further enhance your DEATHLESS experience</li><li>Minor rule revisions for balancing</li></ul>
<p>In this game, you will:</p>
<ul><li>Go on daring clandestine missions to protect the world from injustice</li><li>Play as immortal warriors from all eras of history in the modern world</li><li>Experience tight, cinematic combat with the LUMEN system</li><li>Choose between 10 different classes: Ancient, Daredevil, Duelist, Leader, Marksman, Newbie, Paladin, Pragmatist, Synergist, and Techno&nbsp;</li></ul>
<p>Inspired by Greg Rucka's The Old Guard, this RPG is meant to capture the spirit of both the comics and their film adaptation. Create your own immortals and fight for a better world!</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc2OTgzMTIucG5n/original/d1i0%2FF.png" loading="lazy"><em></em></p>
<p>This game is Illuminated, and is made using the LUMEN system created by Spencer Campbell of Gila RPGs. This game is not affiliated with Gila RPGs.<br></p>
<p>This game also has an official Spotify playlist!&nbsp;You can use it during play to set the mood or to get the general vibes of the system. Check it out <a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/05IuFzjwSEreTlILku1wXt?si=cb84370b2a3d45f5&amp;nd=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here!</a></p><p>Actual Play Stream, courtesy of <a href="https://twitch.tv/stellaluna" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">StellaLuna</a>:<br></p><div class=""><div class=""><iframe width="500" height="281" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KWjNl50R1vY" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div><br></div><p></p>
<p><span></span></p>
<p><span></span></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KWjNl50R1vY" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyMzgzMy83NzA1NTIxLnBuZw==/original/7TBb0b.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyMzgzMy83NzA1NTIyLnBuZw==/original/%2FKnkqq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyMzgzMy83NzY4OTI0LnBuZw==/original/EnbU9U.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyMzgzMy83NzY4OTI1LnBuZw==/original/Fo6ogP.png]]






<p></p>
<p><em>‚ÄúBe he boar or be he man, he has a single knife. And if you come upon his mind, he‚Äôll end your too short life.‚Äù</em>
</p>
<p>There was a time that your ancestors knew the forest was to be feared. It was deep and dark. No sun touched the heart of these woods and those that went in were often not seen again. The beasts that ranged there were strange and if any religion was practiced within, it was old, odd, and evil. At least, that‚Äôs what the peasants would say, banded together in their small towns for safety or the illusion there of.
</p>
<p>This is a tiny hex crawl. There are seven locations you can add into any game you‚Äôre running with a narrative that runs throughout. Throw them into the center of the forest in your game world, run it as a simple one shot. or use it for inspiration. Marginally, it is designed for 5E, but the mechanics are light. It‚Äôd be easy to tear out the warm bleeding heart of it and use whatever fantasy game system you love most.
</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Also available in physical print on our website-&nbsp;<a href="https://crumblingkeep.com/product/deep-dark-wood-a-tiny-hex-crawl-print/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://crumblingkeep.com/product/deep-dark-wood-a-tiny-hex-crawl-print/</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEwNzQxMC82MzkyMDE0LnBuZw==/original/VzA6XP.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEwNzQxMC82MzkyMDEzLnBuZw==/original/v4DcI5.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEwNzQxMC82MzkyMDEyLnBuZw==/original/aj9NfZ.png]]






<h1>Deep Nightly Fathoms</h1>
<p class="text-justify">Inside this zine you will find a game that will take you and your fellow players through the Kingdom of Night, a liminal space between life, dream and death, inspired‚Äîand illustrated‚Äîby the beautiful art of Gustave Dor√©.</p>
<h3>Dive in to discover:</h3>
<ul><li class="text-justify">One-on-one or two-on-one play with expansions for larger groups.</li><li class="text-justify">Player characters who take a transformative journey over a land of sorrow.</li><li class="text-justify">Rules for exploring the Kingdom of Night and confront the dangers that lurk inside.</li><li class="text-justify">Tools to run a point-crawl exploration game, with an assortment of random tables to roll an adventure on the spot.</li></ul>
<p><em>Let us traverse these Deep Nightly Fathoms.</em></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjY5NDAwLzY1NjY1MTAuanBn/original/HAT9RB.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjY5NDAwLzY1NjY1MDkuanBn/original/P0HjIX.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjY5NDAwLzY1NjY1MDguanBn/original/8z6aqS.jpg]]






!sort[rating]






<$button>
<$action-deletetiddler $filter="[has:field[url]]"/>
Delete tiddlers tagged "[has:field[url]]"
</$button>






<h2 class="text-center"><em>A Fast-Paced Game of Blood &amp; Skulls for 2-6 Slayers</em></h2>
<p class="text-center"><em>Our world is rotting. The countryside is littered with festering corpses and unholy abominations. Our moon glows a crimson red. Our church has all but abandoned us.</em>
  </p>
<p class="text-center"><em>While the Angels bring forth the Final Woe in their immaculate choir,&nbsp; there are still those who stand in the face of the apocalypse. Brave warriors from kingdoms across the land. Slayers, who through their bravery or foolishness, stand against the endless spawn of Hell itself.</em>
</p>
<h2 class="text-center">Demon Crawl - A Tabletop Action-RPG</h2>
<p>Inspired by games of visceral combat and kinetic action like Diablo and Doom, Alessandro (<a href="https://twitter.com/sandromaycry" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@sandromaycry</a>) and Duffy (<a href="https://twitter.com/orxalot" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@orxalot</a>) set out to design an Action-RPG for the Tabletop space. <em>Demon Crawl - Gothic </em>(Penned by Alessandro) is its first fantasy-oriented&nbsp;incarnation (with a star-hopping sci-fi setting in development by Duffy). Both games pull from the same core Demon Crawl system and philosophy:</p>
<ul><li><strong>D6 Only System:</strong> In Demon Crawl the Slayers are playing a 2D6 Hack n' Slash while the GM is playing an all-out wargame with a mountain of 12mm D6s.&nbsp;</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>Blood:&nbsp;</strong>Slayers taking DMG and tearing through enemies, will generate Blood for themselves. This Blood is spent to unleash crazy abilities, act on enemy turns, empower attacks and even heal the Slayer at the last second.</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>No Roll To Hit: </strong>Every Slayer and Enemy Solo hit connects. Every turn brings all parties closer to death and ramps up the game's tension.</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>Hordes of Enemies:</strong> Enemies in Demon Crawl spawn in swarms of countless units that all occupy a single space, but each only have 1 HP. This system distills crowd combat into a satisfying Rip-and-Tear-fest that's easy for GMs to manage and Slayers to wrap their heads around.</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>It Is Always the Slayers' Turn:</strong> No matter what is happening, the Slayer always has options to act using Blood or Items. This recontextualizes the GM's turn as kinetic frenzy of healing, dashing and even attacking.</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>Combat That Prioritizes Speed:</strong> Action RPGs are all about speed and style, so combat in Demon Crawl is fluid, crunchy and above all fast to run.</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>Roleplaying That Prioritizes Stakes:</strong> When rolling Failure<strong> always </strong>has consequence but success has the possibility to roll into even greater rewards. Slayers are encouraged to leverage their heroic strengths and creativity while Overlords are encouraged to pull at their mortal&nbsp;weaknesses and recklessness.</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>Fast to Learn, Fast to Play, Fast to Hack:</strong> Speed was the biggest priority in Demon Crawl's design, and the system aims to provide GMs and Slayers with a combat experience unlike anything else. I've also aimed to make the game easy to learn with Slayers having all the relevant combat info on their Slayer Sheet. This all culminates in a modular system that's incredibly fast to hack and build your own content for.</li></ul>
<h2 class="text-center">Gothic - A Grim and Fantastical Setting</h2>
<p><em>Demon Crawl - Gothic</em> is the first pre-built setting for this system, with its own unique systems and horrors. The setting pulls from the Romantic Gothic Horror movement as much as it does from Pulp Horror and modern Dark Fantasy. It is a setting that lives in the shadow of an eccentric church&nbsp;and on the bones of horrors that best left forgotten. Fans of settings like those found in <em>Diablo</em>, <em>Bloodborne, Castlevania</em>&nbsp;and <em>Nier</em> will feel right at home in this macabre land of deceit and cosmic magicks.</p>
<h2 class="text-center">What's Included?</h2>
<ul><li>Basic Rules for the Demon Crawl - Gothic System</li><li>6 Unique Slayer Classes to choose from, each with their own distinct flavor and playstyle (<em>The Ragged Warrior, Seasoned Rogue, Wayward Sorcerer, Vermin Shepherd, Grim Archivist and War Machine</em>)&nbsp;as well as one <strong>bonus class</strong> for early adopters (<em>The Regal Attendant</em>)</li><li>3 Encounters&nbsp;featuring 3 intense bosses<em> (</em>From&nbsp;<em>The Fugue of the Heretic King</em> Dungeon<em>)</em></li><li>Print-and-Hack materials for rapid&nbsp;dungeon&nbsp;building&nbsp;</li></ul>
<h2 class="text-center">What's Needed?</h2>
<ul><li>2-6 Participants (Plays best with one Overlord and 2-4 Slayers)</li><li>Ample paper, pencils and unique tokens</li><li>A mountain of D6s (Preferably 12mm)</li><li>An 8x8 Grid Board (Chess Board works great!)</li><li>A love for the macabre and a yearning for fast-paced combat</li></ul>
<h2 class="text-center">What's Next for Demon Crawl?</h2>
<p>Right now <em>Demon Crawl - Gothic Quickstart Edition </em>serves as a first taste of both the Demon Crawl system and Gothic's macabre world. The next thing you might see from Demon Crawl is <a href="https://twitter.com/orxalot" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"></a><a href="https://twitter.com/orxalot" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Duffy</a>'s sci-fi setting (Currently codenamed <em>Demon Crawl - 6666</em>). Eventually Demon Crawl - Gothic will get its own fully fleshed out hex-crawl, featuring a variety of unlockable Slayers, diverse locales, fishing mechanics, expanded progression rules and more! However currently I'm hard at work hammering out the Quickstart rules for my similarly fast, but certainly more complex Mecha Tactics game <a href="https://www.steelhearts.info/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><em>Mobile Engagement Chassis: Steel Hearts</em></a><em></em>&nbsp;(It features a system that was a&nbsp;spiritual precursor to Blood and served as an inspiration for a lot of other narrative systems in <em>Demon Crawl)&nbsp;</em>so be sure to keep an eye on this page for whenever in the nebulous future the grim world of Woleria is expanded!</p>
<h3 class="text-center">!!&nbsp; &nbsp;Content Warning&nbsp; &nbsp;!!</h3>
<p class="text-center"><em>Be aware that Demon Crawl - Gothic includes copious references to Blood, Viscera, Bones and Body-horror. It is a game where life is fleeting and death abounds at every corner.</em></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA2ODM1Ny82MTIzNDAyLnBuZw==/original/EILYt%2B.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA2ODM1Ny82MTE5OTI3LmpwZw==/original/ChljNl.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA2ODM1Ny82MTIwMDY0LnBuZw==/original/IIhSk%2B.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA2ODM1Ny82MTI1NDc5LnBuZw==/original/V93ErJ.png]]






<p><span></span></p>
<p><strong>When th're is something strange in thy fantasy city, who is't shall thee summon? DEMONBREAKERS!</strong></p>
<p>If you're thinking Ghostbusters, but in the setting of Monty Python and the Holy Grail, you're in the right headspace for DEMONBREAKERS... Lets go!&nbsp;</p>
<p>You are Demonological Lorists, recently unemployed after the College Arcane terminated your grant due to your allegedly sloppy methods and questionable conclusions. In desperation you‚Äôve started an exorcism business, just as Hell‚Äôs Gates have opened in your fantasy city, unleashing a torrent of demonological activity.&nbsp;
 					
 				
 			
 		
</p>
<p>This is a GM-full game, and all players will cooperate to create scenes, introduce consequences, and resolve conflicts.&nbsp;The rules are one page. The game uses mechanics found in&nbsp;no dice, no masters games. And there are&nbsp;card-driven prompts to help players embody npcs and opposition.</p>
<p>This is a hack of the fantastic little one page game "Sabotage" by James Hanna (<a href="https://bullfrogjam.itch.io/sabotage">https://bullfrogjam.itch.io/sabotage</a>).</p>
<p>Demonbreakers was a submission to the 2021 One Page RPG Hackathon jam (<a href="https://itch.io/jam/one-page-hack-a-thon-2021">https://itch.io/jam/one-page-hack-a-thon-2021</a>), and the&nbsp;Finish your Damn RPG jam (<a href="https://itch.io/jam/finish-your-damn-rpg-jam">https://itch.io/jam/finish-your-damn-rpg-jam</a>).<br></p>
<p>This is a pre-playtest version of the game. Your support is appreciated but not&nbsp;expected. If you'd like to kick the tires coughing up money, feel free to grab a community copy, they are for you!</p>
<p>Released under the CC 4.0 license<br></p>
<p><strong>SHAMELESS PLUG: If you are a fan of these kinds of games, you'll love what I&nbsp;have in store for season 2 of Instadeath Survivors Support Group. Subscribe now so you don't miss the awesome!&nbsp;Listen to the&nbsp;<a href="https://anchor.fm/instadeath" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Podcast</a>. Watch on&nbsp;<a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwTrrTuIv-EcWMhvuEJSPzQ" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Youtube</a>.</strong></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-R5OYmSa-5c" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMxMzUzMC83NjM3ODQ4LnBuZw==/original/48ehKK.png]]






<p>&nbsp;As a lover of all things queer, you, dear reader, have a calling in literature. Like so many writers before, your great novel‚Äîthe one that aches in your soul‚Äîisn't ready. But this game is.<br><br>Take time to create an author, the trashy romance novel they wrote, and the two lesbian leads of that trashy novel. Then play it all out.<br><br>Follow them through the three classic acts of any lesbian love story: Denial, Yearning, and Crisis. And then enact that happily ever after ; )<br><br>Denial &amp; Yearning is:<br></p>
<ul><li>&nbsp;A story-heavy two player&nbsp;GMless roleplaying&nbsp;&nbsp;game</li><li>Playable in an evening (though it may take longer if you make the novel cover a true work of art)</li></ul>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTQyMTMxLzUzMzkwNjUucG5n/original/7CsLU0.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTQyMTMxLzUzMzkwNzAucG5n/original/gRInrn.png]]






<p>Detail is a worldbuilding game for 1-5 people. This game facilitates collaboratively&nbsp;building a setting through the use of small Details given significance. Play it as a stand-alone game, or create a setting for other roleplaying games or stories.&nbsp;</p><p>Now featuring Detail:&nbsp;Regrowth, an expansion with 60 new details centered on the natural world.</p>
<p>Detail is a game by Declan Lowthian.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ5MDAxNTcucG5n/original/7reezD.png]]






<p></p><p><br></p><p><br></p>
<p>Here‚Äôs how it is: Gods are dicks. They always have been. They ask too much of humans, don‚Äôt they? The best livestock, a chunk of your money, and in some cases, a first born child. What do humans get in exchange? A promise that obliteration would not come as long as the offering was paid. As long as the praise was given.&nbsp;</p>
<p>But this doesn't sit right with everyone. Especially when there's grave injustices being carried out in these gods' name. Small or more obscure divine try to gain their own footholds to rewrite the rules themselves.&nbsp;</p>
<p>This is you.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Make your own god, rewrite the rules of the world, remake things in your own image. Build a following and dethrone the divine!</p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ1NzEzNTAuanBn/original/v%2FD5da.jpg]]






<p><em>One of the grave robbers is caught. The crowd wheels him about with furious, amateurish blows to his head and defensively raised arms.&nbsp;</em><em>"Where is the body?" they shout. "Where did they take it?"&nbsp;</em></p>
<p><em>The body thief wails. "We were to take the body to Dr. Galfani! To the Flayed House!" he says, begging mercy.</em></p>
<p>DIE, GRAVE ROBBER, DIE! is a gothic horror one-shot RPG incursion for Trophy Dark, designed for 3-5 players. A rain-drenched world of horror and open graves awaits! Can you reach the Flayed House in time to rescue a stolen body before it‚Äôs too late?</p>
<p>Never played Trophy Dark before?&nbsp;&nbsp;No problem! All the rules you need are contained within.&nbsp;</p>
<p>This collaborative play-to-lose RPG scenario follows a group of desperate people charged with reclaiming a stolen body that's been spirited out of its grave.&nbsp; It is very likely that all of them will die or‚Äîat best‚Äîbe permanently scarred and haunted by the experiences waiting for them in the Flayed House!</p>
<p><br></p><p><b>Need an online character keeper?&nbsp;</b>&nbsp;Die, Grave Robber, Die!&nbsp;is supported by this&nbsp;<a href="http://arktosaur.us/keepers/trophydark" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Trophy&nbsp;Dark Character Keeper</a> courtesy of&nbsp;Ben Bond (Arktosaur).&nbsp;Note:&nbsp;requires a Google account to access.<br></p><p><br></p>
<p><strong>Spotify Playlist</strong><strong><br></strong><iframe src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/playlist/5fn5ZqCQIsVBjFTKE3Msr5?utm_source=generator" width="100%" height="380" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="" style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit"></iframe></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/c7P_Hf-xATM" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1ODA3NS83OTA2MDEyLnBuZw==/original/r8jHfP.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1ODA3NS84MDA3MzI4LnBuZw==/original/efIE7h.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1ODA3NS84MDA3MzMwLnBuZw==/original/Ww8Gh4.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1ODA3NS84MDA3MzI5LnBuZw==/original/itZHr%2B.png]]






<p><strong>Dinos for Quest Volume I</strong> is a mini booklet of dinosaur NPCs designed for the <strong>Quest</strong> TTRPG system.</p>
<p>This booklet includes four NPCs:</p>
<p><strong>Neovenator </strong>- A solitary ambush predator and sometimes scavenger. <br></p>
<p><strong>Diplodocus </strong>- A massive herbivore that can cause tremendous damage (without meaning to).</p>
<p><strong>Centrosaurus </strong>- An ornery plant-eater known to charge down anyone who gets too close.</p>
<p><strong>Microraptor </strong>- A small flying pack hunter with beautiful plumage. <br></p>
<p>Each NPC includes a large full colour illustration and a size comparison chart. <br></p>
<p>Each of these NPCs come with a full compliment of stats so they are usable in your games of Quest. Each of them also includes details and colour to better enable storytelling involving these fantastic creatures.</p>
<p>Additionally, this booklet includes an adventure scenario that can be used to highlight each of these new PCs.</p>
<p>Dinos for Quest is an ongoing project that seeks to add dozens of prehistoric creatures to the catalogue of NPCs available for use in Quest.</p>
<p>These NPCs were designed using the resources created by J.N. Butler in their excellent <strong>Monster Manifest</strong>. That product is available here:</p>
<p><u><a href="http://jnbutlerart.itch.io/monster-manifest" target="_blank">jnbutlerart.itch.io/monster-manifest</a></u></p>
<p>This work uses material from the Quest Creators Resource. The Quest Creators Resource by The Adventure Guild, LLC is licensed under <u>CC BY 4.0</u>. For more information about Quest, please visit <a href="http://www.adventure.game/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">www.adventure.game</a>. 
  </p>
<p><br></p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTg2Ny82MzE4MzMxLmpwZw==/original/r8fNzN.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTg2Ny82MzE4MzM0LmpwZw==/original/OnMQOM.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTg2Ny82MzE4MzM3LmpwZw==/original/Ua8Bt%2F.jpg]]






<p><strong>Dinos for Quest Volume I</strong>I is a mini booklet of dinosaur NPCs designed for the <strong>Quest</strong> TTRPG system. This booklet is a companion to Volume I, which is available here:</p>
<p><a href="https://timzee.itch.io/dinos-for-quest-vol-i">https://timzee.itch.io/dinos-for-quest-vol-i</a><br></p>
<p>This booklet includes four NPCs:
    </p>
<p><strong>Austroraptor </strong>- A wily pack hunter equally adapt at fishing and chasing down large prey.<br></p>
<p><strong>Carnotaurus</strong> - A ferocious apex predator that can hunts dinosaurs five times its size.<br></p>
<p><strong>Irritator</strong>- A crocodile-snouted predator with a crushing bite.<br></p>
<p><strong>Jobaria </strong>- An elephant-sized long-neck dinosaur that is gentle, but prone to stampeding. <br></p>
<p>Each NPC includes a large full colour illustration and a size comparison chart. 
    </p>
<p>Each of these NPCs come with a full compliment of stats so they are  usable in your games of Quest. Each of them also includes details and  colour to better enable storytelling involving these fantastic  creatures.
    </p>
<p>Additionally, this booklet includes an adventure scenario that can be used to highlight each of these new PCs.
    </p>
<p>Dinos for Quest is an ongoing project that seeks to add dozens of  prehistoric creatures to the catalogue of NPCs available for use in  Quest.
    </p>
<p>These NPCs were designed using the resources created by J.N. Butler in their excellent <strong>Monster Manifest</strong>. That product is available here:
    </p>
<p><u><a href="http://jnbutlerart.itch.io/monster-manifest" target="_blank">jnbutlerart.itch.io/monster-manifest</a></u>
    </p>
<p>This work uses material from the Quest Creators Resource. The Quest  Creators Resource by The Adventure Guild, LLC is licensed under <u>CC BY 4.0</u>. For more information about Quest, please visit <a href="http://www.adventure.game/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">www.adventure.game</a>.        </p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE0MDEwMS82NjE5OTc1LmpwZw==/original/8t7lZD.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE0MDEwMS82NjE5OTc3LmpwZw==/original/Em6hKI.jpg]]






<p>Our world is but one among many. We exist in a single paper-sharp slice of reality, pressed between the past and future, adjacent to the imaginary and unimaginable, above death and beneath eternity. Each layer of reality exists in relation to all the rest, and the paths we chart between them are often tangled to the point of absurdity. These worlds, the relationships between them, and the paths that wind between, are collectively known as the Disparateum.</p>
<p>As we speak, someone in the Disparateum is wandering the halls of a fractal museum-dungeon. Someone is planning a heist to steal a story from a mechanical dragon. Someone is running through a mirrored world while their reflection silently hunts them. Someone is flying through the streets of a collective dream to catch a bauble that'll grant them their heart's desire. Someone is opening a locked and dusty door in their soul to find something they tried to forget.<br></p>
<p>It could be you. The Disparateum waits for you to take the stage.</p>
<p>- - -<br></p>
<p>This game is in development! It currently contains Act I of <strong>Disparateum</strong>, as well as <strong>small business</strong>, the first of an eventual seven adventure modules included in the zine <strong>Seven Plays from the Disparateum</strong>. The current plan is for two more Acts, six more adventures, and a number of other supplementary materials, all contributed to by fantastic writers, game designers, and authors in the indie space. All the money this game makes will be going directly towards the goal of putting together that team of contributors and making really cool things with them, and while I've got a pretty good sense of what the other two Acts of the main book are gonna contain, the adventures and supplemental materials are gonna be free range and really, really weird. Can't wait for you to join us on this journey!<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE1MTIxNS82NzA3MDYzLnBuZw==/original/fe5LzX.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE1MTIxNS82NzA3MTMyLnBuZw==/original/m%2BQw0u.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE1MTIxNS82NzA3MDYyLnBuZw==/original/cH%2F6sa.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE1MTIxNS82NzA3MDgzLnBuZw==/original/Tcu18v.png]]






<p>A little game about artificial humanoids and their path to discovering their sense of self throughout a mentally and physically harrowing journey. One page of game mechanics and rules, and a bonus page&nbsp;of rollable tables for quick scenario&nbsp;generation and character sheets.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU5MjQyNzcucG5n/original/a6YdHo.png]]






<p>Dracula Owes You Money is a Hack of Grant H. Honey Heist.&nbsp;<br></p>
<p><strong>You and a group of other swindled victims have reached their last straw, and have come together to confront them at their hideaway to get your money back or die trying.<br></strong><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY5NDQyOTAucG5n/original/4322zk.png]]






<p>You get to be a dragon<br></p>
<p>You get to kiss dragons</p>
<p>Need I say more?&nbsp; This Tabletop RPG is about&nbsp;about the clash of over-sized personalities between&nbsp;shapeshifters who can assume human or dragon form, or anything in between. It's a GMless‚Äîmeaning everyone has equal narrative authority‚Äîand plays best over one or two 3-4 hour sessions, with 3-4 players.&nbsp;<br><br><strong>What about the Dragons, though?&nbsp;</strong><br><br>What is the fantasy of being a dragon?&nbsp;To me, dragons are interesting because they embody so many seemingly contradictory elements:&nbsp;they are powerful but vulnerable, unyielding but capricious, even tireless-but-sleepy. The one thing they aren't, in this game, is reserved:&nbsp;Dragons' emotions are all turned up to 11, and they aren't afraid to let everyone know exactly how they feel.<br><br><strong>What about the Hearts, though?</strong>&nbsp;<br><br>Notably though, while romance between characters is facilitated by the game and made as safe as possible by included support mechanics, it's also entirely opt-in: you declare on character creation whether your dragon is Open To Romance, and can change your mind at any time.&nbsp;<br><br><strong>And how does this game actually play?</strong><br><br><em>Dragonhearts</em> is made of several small scene types you play for different situations,&nbsp;like if you want to have&nbsp;big cool dragon duels <em>At Each Other's Throats</em>‚Äîwhich may at any moment become liaisons <em>In Each Other's Arms</em>‚Äîor change the entire world during <em>Endgame:&nbsp;The Eclipse</em>. Or, more importantly, you can have <em>A Dance</em>!&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>Players also collaborate on world-building elements to flesh out some Truths about the world, and can change them later during the endgame!&nbsp;<br><br><strong>How similar is it to Firebrands?</strong><br><br>This game follows the&nbsp;<em>Firebrands&nbsp;</em>Formula developed by&nbsp;Meguey and D. Vincent&nbsp;Baker, and while&nbsp;I was tempted to just "Find <em>Mobile Frame </em>Replace <em>Dragon" </em>I ended up doing... more than that. Most importantly, Dances are 50% longer! Also there are no coin flips or other mechanical randomizers. I've added several new games, and reworked the existing ones a bit to fit the setting.&nbsp;Also, wording and mechanics have been reworked to better facilitate interactions with more than two participants in certain games. <br><br></p>
<p>Generally speaking, one of the consentiest games ever is now even consentier, and more polyamory-friendly and trans-friendly.<br></p>
<p><br><strong>Character Keeper<br><br></strong>Originally written to be played in-person back when we could, uh, do that, I've made an updated Character Keeper to assist with playing this game online! (To find out how to make one for your own game, @GauntletRPG on Twitter has tutorials!)&nbsp;<br><br>You can open the Character Keeper at&nbsp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mWJ6PCc0CxLe0POCc-gUTZbI9KhfJlCZ4QrbiiVoB1o/edit?usp=sharing" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mWJ6PCc0CxLe0POCc-gUTZbI9KhfJlCZ4QrbiiVo...</a>&nbsp;and then go to File &gt; Make A Copy to get your own instance of it to share and edit!&nbsp;&lt;3<br><br></p>
<p>‚ÄîAlex<br></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yX-_fAnQqlc" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDY1MTU0LzI2NjE0OTAucG5n/original/nrwjt6.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDY1MTU0LzI2NjEzOTMucG5n/original/GomNVv.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDY1MTU0LzI2NjEzOTcucG5n/original/gSD5Eg.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDY1MTU0LzI2NjEzOTkucG5n/original/WkD6Y4.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDY1MTU0LzI2NjE0MDIucG5n/original/ZNVmGS.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDY1MTU0LzI2NjE0MDAucG5n/original/dh%2F%2Fr5.png]]






<p><em></em><em>A local recluse has put out the most curious of jobs on the message board - monster hunters wanted to either kill or capture an escaped specimen out near the previously abandoned wizards tower. What will your party discover in the tower and will the fact be of this escaped specimen?&nbsp;</em></p>
<p><strong>Dragons and Owls and Bears, Oh My</strong>! is a <em>Fifth Edition adventure</em> designed for four to six characters of 6th to 10th level and is optimized for <strong>four characters with an average party level (APL) of 9</strong>.&nbsp;</p>
<p>This adventure contains <strong>2 new creatures</strong>, <strong>4 custom battlemaps</strong>, <strong>3 new magic items</strong> and <strong>2 musical tracks </strong>to bring your session to life!<br></p>
<p>For our complete backlog of 5e adventures and thematic music tracks for each of our releases,&nbsp;<a href="https://www.patreon.com/thenightowls" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><strong>join us on Patreon!</strong></a><br></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WRVg_rNS2mo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxNTA5Ny84MjQyNzkwLmpwZw==/original/PJBWR3.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxNTA5Ny84MjQyNzg5LmpwZw==/original/FHHeuV.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxNTA5Ny84MjQyNzkxLmpwZw==/original/sTmQwq.jpg]]






<p><em>Update: I'm very pleased to note that the game has been awarded "Best Remix" in the Gaming Like It's 1926 game jam. It's my third year in a row being awarded a prize which makes me feel extremely fortunate--the judges' comments show that what I was going for really comes through for them. They said the game, "continues his tradition of creating exceptionally original games that explore the work of a specific visual artist." You can read all the comments here:&nbsp;<a href="https://www.techdirt.com/2022/03/09/announcing-the-winners-of-the-4th-annual-public-domain-game-jam/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://www.techdirt.com/2022/03/09/announcing-the-winners-of-the-4th-annual-pub...</a></em><br></p>
<p>In this game, two people explore a surrealistic dream connection to continue a partnership between avant-garde Czech artists Toyen and Jind≈ôich ≈†tyrsk√Ω beyond ≈†tyrsk√Ω's early death.<br></p>
<p>Two players will collectively create dream stories to connect Toyen and ≈†tyrsk√Ω. They will be prompted to develop those stories by drawing cards with the artists‚Äô paintings, placed along the path in ≈†tyrsk√Ω‚Äôs painting Jeskynƒõ (The Cave).</p>
<p><strong>About the artists</strong></p>
<p>Toyen, born Marie ƒåerm√≠nov√°, (1902-1980) was a genderqueer Czech painter, drafter, and illustrator. Toyen refused to use feminine endings for their name, which has been proposed as coming from the Czech expression ‚Äòto je on‚Äô (‚Äòit is he‚Äô). Their work heavily explored gender issues and sexual politics.</p>
<p>Jind≈ôich ≈†tyrsk√Ω (1899-1942) was a Czech Surrealist painter, poet, editor, photographer, and graphic artist.</p>
<p>As artistic partners, they worked and exhibited together, moving from earlier Cubist work to Surrealism in partnership. They were both members of Czech avant-garde group Devƒõtsil. In 1927, they founded their own art movement, Artificialism.</p>
<p><strong>About this game</strong><br></p>
<p>This game was designed for the Gaming Like It's 1926 game jam, which uses work that has entered the public domain in 2022.</p>
<p>It is the third in a series of games that engage with art by creating experiences through games.</p>
<p>The first two in the series were <a href="https://sciartica.itch.io/the-24th-kandinsky" target="_blank">The 24th Kandinsky</a> and <a href="https://sciartica.itch.io/fish-magic" target="_blank">Fish Magic</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Design notes</strong></p>
<p>Dreaming the Cave is one of a series of games that engages players with a deeper understanding of works of art by creating experiences with them. In this game, players will have a chance to experience a series of paintings by important but not particularly well-known artists.</p>
<p>With ≈†tyrsk√Ω‚Äôs painting entering the public domain, it was crying out to be the basis for a game, just because it looks like a boardgame already in some ways!</p>
<p>The game isn‚Äôt a lesson in art history as such but I hope it is an opportunity to consider these works in terms of aesthetic and thematic principles, based just on what can be observed. By creating your own dream-stories, you‚Äôll see the paintings in a different way.</p>
<p>Dreams don‚Äôt make sense. When further explored they tend to make less sense in some ways but more sense in others. The interaction between two players in telling a dream plays with this tension of knowability and describability.</p>
<p>Many tabletop games engage heavily with creative thinking processes and often are designed to help with that creativity. Yet, most creativity is directed (and academic definitions of creativity typically include some requirement of usefulness). <br></p>
<p>This game isn‚Äôt trying to be useful in the world, and it‚Äôs not trying to generate ideas that persist. It‚Äôs about creating an experience of allowing your mind to do what it doesn‚Äôt have a chance to do while awake very often.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM3ODU0Ni84MDI3ODIxLnBuZw==/original/0cHAKF.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM3ODU0Ni84MDI3OTM5LnBuZw==/original/DqTDT1.png]]






<p><strong>This item includes only the rulebook (and handouts) for Dreampunk, not the deck of cards.&nbsp;<a href="https://xavid.itch.io/dreampunk-deck">The digital Dreampunk deck is available separately.</a></strong><br></p>
<p>At night, you dream. Your dreams are not idle imaginings, but visits to a persistent world of wonders and dangers both personal and alien. Will you find power there? Will you find freedom? Or will you slowly slip into Entanglement, and be trapped there forever?</p>
<p>Play to find out!
</p>
<p>Dreampunk is a tabletop roleplaying game for 2‚Äì6 players comprised of two parts: a rulebook and a deck of surreal art cards. Rather than the numerical randomness of dice, it uses these cards as both creativity prompts and a resource to power your special abilities.&nbsp;<strong>This item includes the rulebook only.</strong></p>
<p>Your character is a Dreamer, someone from a waking world who is drawn to the Dream when they sleep. As a Dreamer, you have powerful abilities to shape the world around you. To do so, you must play a card and incorporate into your action an element of your choice from the card.
</p>
<p>Dreampunk can be played with or without a dedicated Guide. By default, the Guide player, rather than play a Dreamer, portrays the world of the Dream and its denizens. Alternately, you may instead distribute the Guide role among all the players, so everyone both plays a Dreamer and shares responsibility for the world. Either way, Dreampunk uses the cards to encourage an improvisational style for inspiring challenges and obstacles, avoiding the need for detailed planning or prewritten adventures.&nbsp;
</p>
<p>Dreamers can be any type of character you can imagine, and they're defined primarily not by their powers or skills but by the Needs that have entangled them with the Dream. Thirteen different Dreamer playbooks are available, reflecting different reasons for entering the Dream, as well as four deeper playbooks for characters with stranger origins. No matter your playbook, you are given wide room to creatively define your character, the world they come from, and their position in the Dream.
</p>
<p>The mechanics for Dreampunk are heavily inspired by the token economy of&nbsp;<a href="https://buriedwithoutceremony.com/dream-askew" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><em>Dream Askew</em>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<em>Dream Apart</em>&nbsp;by Avery Alder and Benjamin Rosenbaum</a>&nbsp;as well as the zaniness and powerful abilities of&nbsp;<a href="https://afarandasunlessland.wordpress.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Jenna Moran</a>'s works. The focus on art cards, however, creates a unique gameplay experience. By playing a card, you can use your Dreamer's lucid abilities to shape the Dream around you and overcome obstacles, defend yourself, or cause chaos. You draw cards when you falter against the Dream, when you use your tethers to the waking world, and when you awaken or find respite. The constantly-shifting array of cards prompts options that are never the same twice for both Dreamers and the Guide.
</p>
<p>
</p>
<p>Written by Xavid. Includes art from&nbsp;<a href="http://sarahmorrisonillustration.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Sarah Morrison</a>, <a href="https://www.jhennetyler.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Jhenne Tyler</a>, <a href="https://www.artstation.com/stylesosunde" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Kindred Styles</a>, <a href="https://www.instagram.com/wyrwicz_arts/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Chad Wyrwicz</a>, <a href="https://godofironstudios.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Obaseun ‚Äúgodofiron‚Äù Ogunkeye</a>, <a href="https://september-xyzx.tumblr.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">September-XYZX</a>, <a href="http://steffbradley.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">steff bradley</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/Faufix" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Idefix</a>, <a href="https://www.nathanielsantore.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Nathaniel Santore</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/candiedreptile" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Camille ‚ÄúKarma‚Äù O‚ÄôLeary</a>, <a href="http://twitter.com/amaranthsynth" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Finn J. Carey</a>, <a href="https://www.artstation.com/salzato" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Santiago Alzate</a>,&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="https://www.artstation.com/olivari" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Natalie Olivari</a>.</p>
<p>For full art credits and extras,&nbsp;<a href="https://dreampunk.xavid.us/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">visit the Dreampunk website</a>.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE1OTAyOS82NzQwMjg1LnBuZw==/original/36BPqF.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE1OTAyOS82NzQwMjg2LnBuZw==/original/4gO%2BNr.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE1OTAyOS82NzQwMjg3LnBuZw==/original/y9QIBy.png]]






<p><em><strong>LOVE FAST</strong></em>
 </p>
<p>Greg Stolze's procedurally generated game puts you in the corrupt,  dissolute city-state of Vindamere, but don't worry. You play the best  people there, spoiled children of privilege with nothing better to do  than pursue swordplay, flirt outrageously, and snack on delicious  vol-au-vents. A single game session covers the social year from Ye  Midwinter Balle through the prestigious Alle-Valley Fencinge  Championeshippe. Your louche elite blade-swanks fall in love, brawl,  sneer and engage in truly petty social rivalries.
 </p>
<p>Imagine a game that's "<em>Bridgerton</em>, only extremely violent" or "extra-horny <em>Cobra </em><em>Kai</em>, with swords."
 </p>
<p><em><strong>DIE PRETTY
</strong></em>
 </p>
<p>All the game's complexity is emergent. You can play it over and over  without having to prep it or continue a meandering story. The hard stuff  has already been built into the mechanics and the step-by-step  procedures for generating drama, intrigue, and coarse humor. All players  have to do is make the key decisions and roll on combinations of four  stats (Foppish, Serious, Duelist and Aristocrat) to subtly humiliate  rivals, engage in duels of wits (or more commonplace duels of swords),  make earnest plights of troth, and carry on with the restraint and  dignity you'd expect if Romeo was madly in love with Lady MacBeth.
 </p>
<p><em><strong>FIGHT LIKE A FOP!
</strong></em>
 </p>
<p>The game's about 44 pages, or 22,000 words, and it's funny. Rolling  up characters takes about five minutes, or seven if you giggle at the  list of suggested names. Every session of play starts with the primary  characters falling in love at a winter ball, progresses through a spring  cotillion, and culminates as their fencing schools vie for triumph at a  year-end tournament. But between those three fixed scenes, there are  random events encompassing everything from grog-house brawls, illegal  duels, erotic machinations and even a locked-room murder mystery. You  never get through all the possible scenes in one game, and every scene  has a variety of options, so it plays differently over and over. The  only thing it doesn't do is get dull.
        
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzcwMDU1NzYuanBn/original/LR5Ti2.jpg]]






<p>In this game you and your friends play as dwarves digging under a mountain in attempt to find treasure. All while trying to avoid run-ins with monsters and other dwarves. It is made for one Game Master and 2-4 other players.</p>
<p>*More downloadable supplements expected to be provided in the near future.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgyNDU4MDAucG5n/original/3CFmzk.png]]






<p>Pre-new version Available on Foundry VTT for Free thanks to Tikael, Please consider buying/tipping if you enjoy!&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/TikaelSol/PF2e-Expansion-Pack#felsine-and-bugbear-ancestries-by-shawn-pommier" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://github.com/TikaelSol/PF2e-Expansion-Pack#felsine-and-bugbear-ancestries-...</a><br></p>
<p>Escape the bonds of your past as a bugbear! These goblinoid peoples are swiftly becoming more and more understood and escaping from situations that have trapped them in darkness for far too long. Strong and boisterous, anyone who makes a friend of you is in for a life of adventure, strange entertainment, and a powerful ally.</p>
<p>This PDF includes</p>
<ul><li>1 ancestry</li><li>6 heritages</li><li>20feats</li><li>3 bugbear artworks by Lluis Abadias (one censored to be Safe For Work)</li></ul>
<p>Now includes screen reader compatible PDF for the visually impaired.</p>
<p>Author: Shawn Pommier&nbsp;(<a href="https://twitter.com/EldritchDream" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@EldritchDream</a>)<br></p>
<p>Artwork: "Lazer Lizard" Lluis Abadias (<a href="https://twitter.com/LluisAbadias" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@LluisAbadias</a>) Huge shoutout to Lluis for providing a bunch of artwork for free use among creators captured here on the cover and the last page!<br><br>Purchasing this version grants you 100% off the <a href="https://eldritchdream.itch.io/bugbear-nsfw">NSFW</a> version through this sale:&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/s/33797/bugbear-sfw-crossbuy">https://itch.io/s/33797/bugbear-sfw-crossbuy</a></p>
<p></p>
<p>Check out more on our main page!&nbsp;<a href="https://eldritchdream.itch.io/">https://eldritchdream.itch.io/</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA2OTY1LzgzMzM2MTcucG5n/original/roS0Zy.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA2OTY1LzgzMzM2MjEucG5n/original/FzHgRq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA2OTY1LzgzMzM2MTgucG5n/original/SEIUsg.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA2OTY1LzgzMzM2MTkucG5n/original/a67j3Z.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA2OTY1LzgzMzM2MjIucG5n/original/XkgEyf.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA2OTY1LzgzMzM2NTAucG5n/original/QtEmIy.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA2OTY1LzgzMzM2NTEucG5n/original/D2M3P8.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA2OTY1LzgzMzM2MjAucG5n/original/KabhSV.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA2OTY1LzgzMzM2MjMucG5n/original/h5IMOP.png]]






<p>Available on Foundry VTT for Free thanks to Tikael, Please consider buying/tipping if you enjoy!&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/TikaelSol/PF2e-Expansion-Pack#felsine-and-bugbear-ancestries-by-shawn-pommier" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://github.com/TikaelSol/PF2e-Expansion-Pack#felsine-and-bugbear-ancestries-...</a></p>
<p>This new Pathfinder Second Edition ancestry is for the cat lovers! Now with a brand new coat of paint and some refinement!</p>
<p>The Felsine are a small but adaptable people. They hold great respect for the providers in society and strive to offer what they can to ensure the safety and happiness of their clans!</p>
<p>This new Ancestry contains the following</p>
<ul><li>A full ancestry including lore and suggestions.</li><li>6 heritages</li><li>9 level 1 ancestry feats</li><li>4 level 5 ancestry feats</li><li>2 level 9 ancestry&nbsp;feats</li><li>2 level 13 ancestry&nbsp;feats</li><li>1 NEW level 17 feat</li><li>3 new weapons</li><li>Alternate PDF for visually impaired use</li></ul>
<p>Artists:</p>
<p>Shawn Pommier [Author] [<a href="https://twitter.com/EldritchDream" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/EldritchDream</a>]</p>
<p>moonstone [3D artist] [<strong><a href="https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/wizard-cat-50d08930b5c8459e8dcf7f53ac31fd8c" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/wizard-cat-50d08930b5c8459e8dcf7f53ac31fd8c</a></strong>]</p>
<p>Some images under public domain</p><p>Check out more on our main page!&nbsp;<a href="https://eldritchdream.itch.io/">https://eldritchdream.itch.io/</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjkwNjkyLzUwMTA1NzAuanBlZw==/original/KQ%2BZmN.jpeg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjkwNjkyLzUwMTA1NDcucG5n/original/ncz54F.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjkwNjkyLzUwMTA1NDgucG5n/original/uWCaPd.png]]






<p>*includes screen reader friendly version for visually impaired folx*<br></p>
<p>Since Grippli have officially been released by Paizo in the Mwangi Expanse book, I've decided to make our version of the Grippli free! I hope if you find our version fun you'll let us know on Twitter @EldritchDream&nbsp;</p>
<p>Grippli are a spiritual and family oriented folk, including the families they find. Spirits and insects answer their call. Will you play a poisonous Toskin, the transparent Glasslen, climb high as a Treewalker, scour watery depths as a Skelka, fight with the ferocity of the Needlspine, or wander the deserts as a Sandlands grippli?</p>
<p>Will you fly high with the new giant dragonfly animal companion? what about using the Great Darner as a familiar? This PDF has a lot going on for you funky frog lovers!</p>
<p>technical</p>
<ul><li>1 ancestry</li><li>6 heritages</li><li>19 feats (including a lvl 17 feat)</li><li>1 new weapon (with a new trait)</li><li>1 new creature ( a tiny animal at creature -1)</li><li>1 new animal companion with suggestions for flying mounts</li></ul>
<p>
Author:<br><strong>Shawn
Pommier (@EldritchDream on Twitter)</strong></p>
<p>
Artwork:<br><strong>Sheifoxy
[Grippli Mystic]
<a href="https://www.deviantart.com/sheifoxy/journal/Commissions-Info-3-837422631" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://www.deviantart.com/sheifoxy/journal/Commissions-Info-3-837422631</a></strong></p>

[Grippli Gunslinger] <a href="https://www.artstation.com/rookzer0" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://www.artstation.com/rookzer0</a></strong>

<p>The seas hold many wonders, one of them is YOU!</p>
<p>The merfolk ancestry Comes is our most filled out ancestry yet! With a variety of heritages, feats, weapons, alchemical items, and magical items to choose from!</p>
<p>Worried about travelling on land? No fear, there are feats and heritage options to make this more feasible, available from first level!</p>
<ul><li>6 unique heritages</li><li>12 level 1 ancestry feats</li><li>5 level 5 ancestry feats</li><li>3 level 9 ancestry feats</li><li>2 level 13 ancestry feats</li><li>3 new alchemical items</li><li>3 new weapons.</li><li>2 new kinds of ammunition</li><li>4 new weapon traits (5 if you include the merfolk trait)</li><li>3 new magic items including a new weapon property rune!</li></ul>
<p>Technical: 7 pages</p>
<ul><li>1 cover</li><li>5+ content</li><li>&lt;1 info key, credits, legal, and art block.</li><li>Includes visually impaired friendly alternate PDF</li></ul>
<p>Errata for Cable Trait:&nbsp;<a href="https://eldritchdream.itch.io/merfolk/devlog/226630/errata-cable-trait">https://eldritchdream.itch.io/merfolk/devlog/226630/errata-cable-trait</a>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Artists:</p>
<p>Shawn Pommier [Author, Cover art (background)] [<a href="https://twitter.com/EldritchDream" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/EldritchDream</a>]</p>
<p>Caffeinesystem [Art]<br><a href="https://pixabay.com/users/caffeinesystem-1979991/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://pixabay.com/users/caffeinesystem-1979991/</a>]<br>Now with art by:<br>Lluis Abadias<br>[<a href="https://twitter.com/LluisAbadias" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/LluisAbadias</a><span></span>]<span></span></p>
<p>Buy this version and get the NSFW version 100% off!&nbsp;<iframe frameborder="0" src="https://itch.io/embed/722581?bg_color=4f6781&amp;fg_color=afbfd2&amp;link_color=ffe762&amp;border_color=6e86a0" width="552" height="167">&lt;a href=&quot;<a href="https://eldritchdream.itch.io/merfolk-nsfw">Eldritch&quot; class=&quot;redactor-linkify-object&quot;&gt;https://eldritchdream.itch.io/merfolk-nsfw&quot;&gt;Eldritch</a> Ancestries: Merfolk [Pathfinder 2E] NSFW by An Eldritch Dream Games&lt;/a&gt;</iframe></p><p>Check out more on our main page!&nbsp;<a href="https://eldritchdream.itch.io/">https://eldritchdream.itch.io/</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjkwMTk1LzUwMTkxMjMuanBlZw==/original/QzvofN.jpeg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjkwMTk1LzUwMTkxMjQuanBlZw==/original/tpBD%2Fk.jpeg]]






<p>NEW AND IMPROVED</p>
<p>I AM MORSH!!!</p>
<p>Morshes are a people formed by the desperation of nature spirits in times of extreme danger. They protect the natural world and their little kin, the leshies. If you want to play a Medium plant folk with a myriad of abilities and options, or if you just wanted leshies but bigger, the morsh may be for you!</p>
<p>Technical:</p>
<p>1 ancestry</p>
<p>6 heritages</p>
<ul><li>Cacti Morsh</li><li>Mountain Morsh</li><li>Mycelial Morsh</li><li>Plains Morsh</li><li>Wetland Morsh</li><li>Woodland Morsh</li></ul>
<p>21 feats</p>
<ul><li>8 Level 1 ancestry feats</li><li>5 level 5 ancestry feats</li><li>3 level 9 ancestry feats</li><li>3 level 13 ancestry feats</li><li>2 level 17 ancestry feats</li></ul>
<p>10 pages (6 pages of content, 1 credit/index, 1 ad, 1 cover and 1 back) </p>
<p><em>Artists:</em></p>
<p>Shawn Pommier [Author, Layout] [<a href="https://twitter.com/EldritchDream" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/EldritchDream</a>]</p>
<p>Rookzer0 [Character Artist] [<a href="https://twitter.com/rookzer0" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/rookzer0</a>] </p>
<p><em>Check out more on our main page!&nbsp;<a href="https://eldritchdream.itch.io/">https://eldritchdream.itch.io/</a></em></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjkyNDM1LzUwMTA1ODEuanBlZw==/original/i4QMUe.jpeg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjkyNDM1LzQ3NDc3NTUucG5n/original/WarT%2FT.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjkyNDM1LzQ3NDc3NTYucG5n/original/imgpUS.png]]






<p>Check out more on our main page!&nbsp;<a href="https://eldritchdream.itch.io/" style="font-size: inherit">https://eldritchdream.itch.io/</a><br></p>
<p>Crossbows, Firearms, and more, OH MY!&nbsp;</p>
<p>
The
arbalesteur is a combat-oriented archetype that can either help
someone perform better with the weapons they already specialize in or
to mitigate the penalties and drawbacks of certain weapons.
Arbalesteurs are at their heart a ranged specialist that may have
some support or high damage actions in mind, trading safety for
damage, or damage for situational improvements.  At
the end of this section there are a few new weapons that the
arbalesteur is able to make good use of and diversifies the current
group of weapon choices in the game.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>FREE CONTENT PREVIEW: NEW WEAPONS</p>
<p>---------------</p>
<p>WEAPON TRAITS<br>The following weapon traits have been added, these originally<br>made their debut in Eldritch Ancestries: Merfolk!</p>
<p><br>Hydroeffective: Weapons with this quality do not suffer<br>attack or range penalties while underwater. If it is a slashing or<br>bludgeoning ranged attack it does not automatically miss.</p>
<p><br>Cable: Weapons or ammunition that have attached a length&nbsp;of cable or rope that is 50 feet long, if fired into a surface it acts&nbsp;as rope for the sake of trying to climb, assuming the weapon&nbsp;pierces the surface it hits. If fired into a creature the tether remains in them and can be grabbed to prevent them from&nbsp;running away with an Athletics check against the creature's&nbsp;Athletics DC. If the cable weapon strikes 50 feet or less away, the attacker may spend an action to grab onto the rope before it&nbsp;falls.</p>
<p>NEW WEAPONS</p>
<p><br>GREAT ARBALEST ITEM 0<br>Price 8 gp; Damage 1d10 P; Bulk 2<br>Hands 2; Range 120 ft.; Reload varies<br>Category Simple<br>Ammunition Bolts<br>Group Bow; Traits deadly d6, kickback<br>Great arbalests are the heaviest crossbow that can generally be carried, and offer dangerous power in trade. Due to their unweildy size, they are often set upon protective walls or upon wooden turrets to aid in their use for less capable warriors and guards. Sometimes two people will work together to load and fire a set great arbalest to keep pace with approaching threats. Normally the reload of a great arbalest is 3 actions due to the great effort that must be put into loading it. Those trained with martial weapons learn how to manipulate the weapon more efficiently reducing the reload to 2 actions.</p>
<p><br>HARPOON GUN (UNCOMMON) ITEM 0<br>Price 7 gp; Damage 1d8 P; Bulk 1<br>Hands 2; Range 60 ft.; Reload 1<br>Category Simple; Rarity Uncommon<br>Ammunition Harpoons<br>Group Firearm; Traits hydroeffective, deadly d8<br>This long stock firearm is specially designed to be used underwater with piercing ammunition. The explosive loads used to propel the ammunition are specially treated to work underwater and are attached to the ammunition to keep them safe, dry, and set properly.</p>
<p><br>AMMUNITION</p>
<p>Below are choices for ammunition for ranged weapons that use&nbsp;harpoons or bolts.</p>
<p>HARPOONS ITEM 0<br>Price 1 sp (for 10); Bulk Light<br>Category Ammunition<br>Ammunition Type Harpoon<br>Harpoons are metallic rods with barbed points, when loaded into a harpoon gun with a load of black powder they are propelled through water or air with equivalent ease.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Broadhead Harpoon; Level 0; Price 1 sp (for 10)<br>Loading a broadhead harpoon into a weapon that uses harpoons for ammunition gives it&nbsp;the Versatile S trait. These harpoons have wide slicing heads designed to glide through water.</p>
<p><br>Cable Harpoon; Level 0; Price 6 sp (for 1)<br>Cable harpoons have the cable weapon trait when fired.</p>
<p><br>CABLE BOLT ITEM 0<br>Price 6 sp (for 1); Bulk Light (for 10)<br>Category Ammunition<br>Ammunition Type Bolt<br>Cable bolts have the cable trait when fired.</p>
<p>-----------------</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Content:</p>
<p>1 new Archetype: the Arbalesteur&nbsp;<br></p>
<p>7 new feats</p>
<p>2 new weapons</p>
<p>4 new peices of ammunition</p>

<h1>The Medium Class for Pathfinder Second Edition&nbsp;</h1>
<p>Channeling spirits, partnering with otherworldly entities, or disrupting the cycle of souls to fit your needs‚Äî you are a medium. Regardless of your motivations, you have a talent for acting as a vessel for those without a body, sharing control with them in trade for power and knowledge. You are the bridge between the realm of spirits and the world of the material and mortal.</p>
<h3>Content</h3>
<p>21 pages - 1 cover, 1 back, 1 legal, 1 credit and&nbsp; index, 17 pages of content</p>
<p>The Medium Class (bounded caster)&nbsp;complete to level 20</p>
<p>7 Bonded Spirits (subclass)</p>
<p><strong>SPELLS:</strong>&nbsp;11 Focus spells</p>
<p><strong>FEATS:</strong> 47 class feats, plus 10 multiclass feats</p>
<h2>Credits</h2>
