The quiet suburb of Genomosville has long avoided the perview of any ner do wells, but that all changed when an adventuring party chose to make it their base of operations. They‚Äôve been called away on a grand quest, and left their children under the protection of the castle staff. Unfortunately, the staff all got drunk off their butts on cooking sherry during the annual holiday party. Ordinarily, this wouldn‚Äôt be a big deal, however your parents‚Äô oldest enemy, Gnome de Plume, has declared he intends to steal back the treasure they had taken from him. It‚Äôs up to you and the other children to save your parents‚Äô questionably attained riches.</p>
<p></p>








<p>A game about taking the time to give a part of yourself to someone you care for, and them doing the same.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY2Mzg4MzcucG5n/original/HAeSrB.png]]






<p></p>
<h1>Ever wanted to star in your own cheesy holiday romcom?</h1>
<p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;It‚Äôs the holiday season once again in your quaint small town. There are carols to be sung, decorations to be hung, and charming small businesses to be run. But with all of this holly-jolly hubbub, who has time for love? If only there was an equal-parts gorgeous and bland idiot to show you what this time of year is all about...</p>
<p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;As it turns out, there is! However, you are not the only one looking for love this December, and this town ain‚Äôt big enough for all of you (it‚Äôs a small town, remember). Flirt, blunder, and trope your way to romance and earn your single chaste kiss with the dazzling dullard of your dreams.</p>
<p> &nbsp; &nbsp; Hometown Holiday is a comedy/romance roleplaying game for 2-5 players and one GM. Players chose from one of six character classes inspired by tropes from Hallmark and Netflix holiday movies and compete to woo their shared love interest and complete secret objectives! Will you play as uptight businessman who needs to learn the meaning of Christmas? Maybe you run a quaint coffee shop on Main Street and find yourself smitten with a handsome prince! But wait, you forgot to make latkes for the PTA meeting! </p>
<p></p>
<h1>Beginner-Friendly, Rules-Lite, and All-Inclusive</h1>
<p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;This RPG was designed with newbies in mind, but can be enjoyed  by veterans of the genre, as well. Rules are written assuming you've  never played another RPG before. Character creation is streamlined, with  each player only needing to pick a class and one of two special  abilities per class. Games typically take 2-3 hours, and secret  objectives and goofy plot twists give plenty of replay value. The game  is perfect for holiday gatherings with family or friends, even if they  don't know the difference between a d6 and a d20.
 </p>
<p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Hometown Holiday is inclusive of all races, faiths,  disabilities, and sexual identities and orientations. The movies this  game parodies are typically Christmas themed and predominantly starring  straight able-bodied white people; by no means does your story have to  fit these parameters. The game and how you want to experience it is  effortlessly tailored as you see fit for the comfort and enjoyment of  you and your friends.
</p>
<p><br>PHYSICAL COPIES AVAILABLE FOR ORDER IN THE U.S.&nbsp;AT</p>
<p><a href="https://www.labyrinthdc.com/hometown-holiday.html" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://www.labyrinthdc.com/hometown-holiday.html</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI0NTYwNS83MzQ2MjIxLnBuZw==/original/54PcrI.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI0NTYwNS83MzQ2MjIwLnBuZw==/original/Xhcg0I.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI0NTYwNS83MzQ2MjIyLnBuZw==/original/PDcC81.png]]






<p><strong>How to Embrace a Swamp Creature</strong> gives you an austerity crushed commuter town, friendships debating their continued existence, toxic air, visions of the stench, zombies trekking out of the bog for a pub breakfast, pride and madness; asking ‚ÄúWhat do you do next?‚Äù<br></p>
<p><strong>How to Embrace a Swamp Creature</strong> is a role-playing game of <strong>Belonging outside Belonging</strong>. It is a game for 2-6 players as you all play a group of mentally ill post-teens living in <strong>Swamp Strange</strong>, a commuter town wrecked by over a decade of austerity. All players share responsibility for setting the mood and tone of the game, creating trouble and conflict, sharing the spotlight and spotlighting your setting, and looking after each other, however you can.
</p>
<p>Swamp Strange is connected by train to the nearest city. It sustains it, it is sustained by it, it is drained by it, it is an overflowing drain that struggles to remember it‚Äôs a town. An odd and old magic pervades Swamp Strange. Breathe in the Stench of the weird wetlands and feel knowledge crawling in the dark corners of your mind. You and the other swamp creatures shamble through your routines but you can‚Äôt help but feel the cracks in the mud.
</p>
<p>Your friend group used to see each other all the time: because you had to. Context forced you together and you became friends through that. But the context is gone. You‚Äôve moved on. But you‚Äôre still friends; for now. Confront aimlessness, confront intimacy, look at what you‚Äôve meant to each other and what you mean to each other. 
</p>
<h2>Want the game in print?</h2>
<p>You can order a copy <a href="https://www.lulu.com/en/gb/shop/the-dice/how-to-embrace-a-swamp-creature/paperback/product-q7e849.html?page=1&amp;pageSize=4" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here!</a></p>
<h2>A tabletop role-playing game by The Dice</h2>
<p>The Dice are a trans plural system of at least ten members. They are based in London and work as a teacher. Their hobbies (not all shared) include painting, making clay models and TTRPGs. They are a collection of artists, writers and game-designers.</p>
<h2>Inspired by the Mountain Goats song of the same name</h2>
<h2>Contained Within</h2>
<ul><li>A PDF landscape layout of the game, in both high quality and a smaller size</li><li>A playkit for printing (containing only the pages you'd need print outs of)</li><li>An ePub of the game (if you're looking for reader recommendations&nbsp;on laptop we recommend Freda or Calibre, on our phone we've found the standard PDF Reader also serve ePubs)</li><li>A version of the ePub that works with Kindle apps</li><li>A plain text version of the game</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI2MDU5MC83ODE0MTgzLnBuZw==/original/Lf5qE7.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI2MDU5MC83ODE0MTc5LmpwZw==/original/6wkqwL.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI2MDU5MC83ODE0MTc4LmpwZw==/original/8U4oka.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI2MDU5MC83ODE0MTgwLmpwZw==/original/izKFvP.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI2MDU5MC83ODE0MTc3LmpwZw==/original/TkeEW3.jpg]]






<h1>HOW TO MAKE YOUR RPG/STORY GAME MORE HEALING/ THERAPEUTIC</h1>
<p>Yo.</p>
<p>I know a lot of my friends already kinda subconsciously practice this but let's use some of that space holding experience and apply it dutifully to running games, as we are all in desperate need of release from suffering.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Please read and enjoy. You may consider this a LARP but also I'm joining the unironically publishes essays on itch gang.&nbsp;</p>
<p>get all me content in one go one patreon.com/mariamison&nbsp;</p>
<p>love,</p>
<p>maria<br></p>
<p>+ added adventure modules (aug 2021) for people who can expound more on what they've uncovered from this essay yes yes</p>
<p>HIGHLY ENCOURAGE TO TAKE A COMMUNITY COPY IF YOU HAVE ANY DESIRE TO READ</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzE3MTQ3LzY3NDM2MDIucG5n/original/DuzMaw.png]]






<<list-links "[tag[HTML5]sort[title]]">>






<p><a href="https://jwalberg.itch.io/human-hunter#rewards">Looking for community copies?</a></p>
<p>Since far back in the Long Ago, before the eldest elders can remember, legends have spoken of the mysterious human. Beings capable of forming rocks and trees into shelters towering far into the sky. Of flying, even without bearing wings. Of bending and molding their surroundings to meet their slightest whim.</p>
<p>Alas, only the young...the pups, the cubs, the children...believe in human tales. They are stories told to keep our babies safe, to prevent them from wandering out into the night.</p>
<p>Until now. This is Human Hunter. The show where you, a simple Cryptid, venture forth towards the Nevernever looking for irrefutable proof of the elusive beast, the hornless goatman...the Human.</p>
<p>Human Hunter is a narrative storytelling game about the hunt to prove the existence of humanity. For most of the game, you will be playing Cryptids, creatures that exist in legend and rumor, but are not generally accepted by human science. At times, you will be playing the part of the humans.&nbsp;Human Hunter is natively designed to be played with a GM, but a GM is not required.&nbsp;&nbsp;Characters are built on four Traits, four Skills, two Relationships, and one Group using the&nbsp;<a href="https://liverealproductions.com/ven6-system-reference-document/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">VEN6 Storytelling System</a>..</p>
<p><a href="https://liverealproductions.com/HumanHunterSheet" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">A Google Doc character sheet is available here.</a></p>
<p><a href="https://liverealproductions.com/HumanHunterSheetSheets" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">A Google Sheets character sheet is available here.</a></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIxNTMyOS83MTI4Njc5LnBuZw==/original/lYDzx2.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIxNTMyOS83MDkxNTg4LnBuZw==/original/VCNyHh.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIxNTMyOS83MDkxNTg5LnBuZw==/original/96bk8%2F.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIxNTMyOS83MDkxNjA5LnBuZw==/original/fmUAtK.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIxNTMyOS83MjMxNTQxLmpwZw==/original/hCWVD7.jpg]]






<p><em>You are not a human, but you like human things like small talk and parties. You and some of your other non-human friends decide to dress up as humans and attend a human party. However, your non-human quirks show up at the most inconvenient times. Try to make your way through the party without it getting too out of hand.</em></p>
<p>3-8 players gamify small talk in this larp, improvisation, awkward game of trying to not show your true self. Create basics of a non-human, flip over a card to see what the small talk conversation topic is, and then talk away!</p>
<p>Includes 8 character sheets in letter, 8 character sheets in A4, 1 blank character sheet to create your own.&nbsp;</p>
<p><em>There are multiple PDFs, two in Letter and two in A4. Additionally, there are one of each typed and one if each in the original handwriting.</em><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIwNzc0My83MDcwMDEwLmpwZw==/original/fiQ1IE.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIwNzc0My83MDcwMDA5LmpwZw==/original/Vy6vvi.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIwNzc0My83MDcwMDI1LnBuZw==/original/Z70EH%2B.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIwNzc0My83MDcwMDI0LnBuZw==/original/%2FUGEmI.png]]






<h5 class="text-right">Tooth and claw and saliva and sword&nbsp;</h5>
<h5 class="text-right">You've been starved for too long.</h5>
<h5 class="text-right">Run feral through the streets.</h5>
<h5 class="text-right">Share what you steal.</h5>
<h5 class="text-right">Eat the rich.</h5>
<p><strong><em><br></em></strong></p>
<p><strong><em>Hungry Gnolls Eat the Rich</em></strong> is a 12-page rules-lite roleplaying&nbsp;game based on John Harper's&nbsp;<em>Lasers and Feelings</em> and Ron Edward's <em>Trollbabes. </em>It's about&nbsp;forces of chaos and community&nbsp;fighting back against an established power that has disenfranchised those&nbsp;values.</p>
<p>In it, players take on the role of a band of hyena-folk who have committed&nbsp;themselves to action. They have forfeited what little comfort and safety&nbsp;they could access in order to fight an unjust system because they are&nbsp;singularly, uncompromisingly, hungry. They see hunger all around them‚Äìand there is no greater injustice than hunger to a gnoll.</p>
<p><em>Hungry Gnolls Eat the Rich&nbsp;</em>is complete and fully playable, with rules for character creation and play,&nbsp;a 1d100 table of random starting gear, and 25 example scenarios. In the future we may consider&nbsp;itchfunding to pay for more professional layout and original art.&nbsp;<br></p>
<p><br></p>
<h6>Media</h6>
<p><a href="https://open.spotify.com/episode/5ERfuZ8AkBMuBNFv1AdbGB?si=83c7cad4dc384bce" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">The Chimaera Cast</a>:&nbsp; Listen to the amazing folks at The Chimaera play a one-shot of the game, with all the blood and rebellion you could ask for.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2NTAzMi82Nzc5OTg3LnBuZw==/original/l9pdRH.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2NTAzMi82NzgwMDc2LnBuZw==/original/vRcHUV.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2NTAzMi82NzgwMDc3LnBuZw==/original/L57k1U.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2NTAzMi82NzgwMDc4LnBuZw==/original/tMXL7s.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2NTAzMi82NzgwMDc5LnBuZw==/original/DS%2BxqL.png]]






<p class="text-center"><strong>-The Fool-</strong></p>
<p>You enter a wild realm of limitless potential. A complete overhaul of the darling D&amp;D 5e. Mechanics, reality, your subconscious and the will of your friends all blend to make a cosmically delicious slushy that may forever alter the course of your life.</p>
<p class="text-center"><strong>-The Chariot-</strong></p>
<p>Unbound by petty Handbooks, your Players can unleash the full force of their creativity as they rip through your world at a dizzying pace. Their goal (unbeknownst to them) is to crash your game, thus ripping them back to their reality before they were hit by a Meteor.</p>
<p class="text-right">Did I mention the Meteor?</p>
<p class="text-center"><strong>-Judgement-</strong>
</p>
<p>The game's premise is that you and your compatriots are struck by a rogue Meteor. Cutting your life short and severing your ties to this mortal world. However a Devil offers you absolution, a chance to be the Hero of another world. You will probably accept because Hell, as it happens, is incredibly lame.</p>
<p class="text-center"><strong>-The World-</strong></p>
<p>Enter a system built from the ground-up as an engine for subverting your expectations and embracing the absurd. It's 26 Pages packed with an aesthetic as wild and varied as its rules! Meteor aims to burn a lasting impression in your mind and have you itching to run this as a one-shot the next time you forget to prep.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p><em>**This is a work of comedy, parody, remixing and exploratory roleplaying. It is in no way an official Wizards of the Coast or Dungeons &amp; Dragons 5th Edition Product.</em></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNjQ3MS82NjAzMzg5LmpwZw==/original/nKVpoR.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNjQ3MS82NjAzMzc2LnBuZw==/original/N4RPJS.png]]






<p>a mysterious bachelor has recently purchased the manor house overlooking the town. they're in the process of renovating- starting a new life. and rumour has it- they're looking for a partner.&nbsp;</p>
<p>compete against your fellow players for the chance at immortal love- a place by the Vampire's side.&nbsp;</p>
<p>or: The Bachelor if the bachelor was a Vampire.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Written for BIPOCVampJam 2021.&nbsp;</p>
<p>game design and layout by rue dickey</p>
<p>Content warnings: blood, biting, potential sexual and romantic content. Bonus class involves gaslighting and manipulation.</p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/z9qckVcZD-U" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY5MzMxODgucG5n/original/34DELj.png]]






<p><em>I&nbsp;Went to Bourbon, Indiana Once</em> is a hack of <em></em><a href="https://luckynewtgames.itch.io/i-went-to-seattle-once">I&nbsp;Went to Seattle Once by Lucky Newt Games</a> which is itself a hack of&nbsp;<em></em><a href="https://unknowndungeon.itch.io/i-went-to-japan-once">I&nbsp;Went to Japan Once by&nbsp;James Lennox-Gordon</a>. As per the original, you are friends, family, or perhaps random strangers bored in line at a gas station who all suddenly realize you've been to Bourbon, Indiana, a small little town without much to do. Did you visit either (or both!) of the town's dollar stores? Check out the town gazebo, a local hangout spot? Or perhaps you hit up the Redbox kiosk and relaxed for the night.</p>
<p>Players roll dice and share experiences blending the results of two separate tables, but once too many players tell the same stories over again (as we Midwesterners are wont to do), everyone goes their own way and the reminiscence concludes.</p>
<p>Find out what you did in a town I've spent over a third of my life in!&nbsp;üòÄ</p>
<p>Note: the demo versions are the same as the full version, they're merely missing the background art. If that's all you want, then enjoy! üòÄ The paid version includes the plain text version as well as a full color one, each of which comes in Legal or A5 page size and as an .svg or a .pdf. If you're willing and able, support via purchase is greatly appreciated and will encourage me to make even more games, but it's certainly not necessary üôÇ</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMxNTgzNC83NzYzOTQ0LnBuZw==/original/XD6Csb.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMxNTgzNC83NzYzMDUzLmpwZw==/original/1akb6V.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMxNTgzNC83NzYzMDU0LmpwZw==/original/m3DezG.jpg]]






<p><strong><em>Idle Hands Make the Devil's Work</em> is a semi-cooperative&nbsp;one-page tabletop rpg&nbsp;for three or more players.&nbsp;</strong><br></p>
<blockquote>You are a Bureaucratic Devil in service to the Lords of the Infinite Hells. You catalogue the paperwork of soul-stealing contracts, directing signees to their personal Hell. This is an incredibly efficient place and an incredibly boring one. After an eternity of this, you are fed up. Now you slack off on the job as much as you can without The Boss noticing. The Boss will NOT be happy if they catch you.</blockquote>
<p>Players alternate the role of Game Manager (GM) so everyone gets a chance to plot and scheme as a playable Devil! Choose from a simple set of skills to quickly make characters and jump right into the game!</p>
<p>The game is played in two phases:&nbsp;</p>
<ul><li>Before Lunch: Players must work together to avoid The Boss or risk the entire staff being tortured for eternity!</li><li>After Lunch:&nbsp;Players scheme and plot to be the last Devil standing, earning a promotion for their hard work (and being the last one standing)</li></ul>
<p>The game is available in several formats for easy reading on paper and various devices! A PNG version is also included so the game can be shared on screen and played over VTC software like Zoom and Discord!&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNTQwMS83NjYwMTE4LnBuZw==/original/5ZQkH%2F.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNTQwMS83NjYwMTI0LnBuZw==/original/uCyTJm.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNTQwMS83NjYwMDI3LnBuZw==/original/Ah3z7X.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNTQwMS83NjYwMTI1LnBuZw==/original/6Tfmsc.png]]






<p class="text-center"><em>The bar had been there for as long as anyone could remember. It had hardly changed since the day it opened, and every small scuff, stain, or dent in the furniture was a testament to the history that sat between the four walls.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p class="text-center"><em>And each weekend the same regulars would come into the bar. They would drink, exchange stories. And every weekend without fail, the bar would burst into song.</em></p>
<p class="text-center"><br></p>
<p><em>If It Wasn't For... </em>is a cooperative storytelling game about drunken singing and nostalgic tales.</p>
<p>Players take the role of&nbsp;bar patrons and each round they&nbsp;have to improvise a barroom song. This song will tell the story of someone who massively changed the character's life.</p>
<p>This game works well with other ttrpgs. It can be used as an icebreaker, and as a way to generate character backstories and relationships. It can also be used as a simple improv warmup exercise.&nbsp;<br><br>It is quick and simple to learn and you can start&nbsp;playing&nbsp;in under 5 minutes!</p>
<p><br></p>
<p><em>To play this game, you will need:</em></p>
<p>- One cup for each player.&nbsp;</p>
<p>-A table or solid object to stand or sit around.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ1ODg4OTkucG5n/original/5XFvk7.png]]






<p><em>There‚Äôs a faint, pleasant scent on the breeze and the word ‚Äúambrosia‚Äù on your tongue. You inhale sharply and the world seems cleaner, brighter. It‚Äôs early morning in Mirna, and the sun rising over the water carries with it a new luster and a deep calm. From your hilltop vantage, you can see the crowd approaching the shore as it recedes and divides as if cut with a butter knife, making way for the goddess of the waters to stride ashore and into the arms of her people.<br></em></p>
<p><em>Even from here, you can sense her radiance and power, and you feel its blessing wash over your heart. A dozen of the people from the shore levitate and soar over the ocean, over the town, over you. A dazzling array of colors shine atop the buildings through every soul. A loud, booming song erupts through the air, and the most joyful cheer you‚Äôve ever felt crosses the hills and rolls across the land. The Festival has begun.</em><br></p>
<p class="text-center"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzcxNTIxMzIucG5n/original/l37Iq9.png" loading="lazy"></p>
<p><strong>IMMORTAL FESTIVAL </strong>is an eight-page sidequest zine designed to be dropped into the tabletop roleplaying game of your choice. It contains 20 divine domains, 20 supernatural powers, and 20 mundane tasks that are maybe not totally 100% worth wasting your limited immortality on.&nbsp;</p>
<p>It is system neutral, but I was thinking a lot about <a href="https://yochaigal.itch.io/cairn" target="_blank">CAIRN</a> by Yochai Gal, <a href="https://www.patreon.com/posts/pilgrims-of-beta-54828261" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">PILGRIMS OF MISFORTUNE</a> by Nate Treme, and <a href="https://vanillagame.carrd.co/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">THE VANILLA GAME</a> by Jared Sinclair. The title was generated using Chris Bissette's <a href="https://loottheroom.uk/random-adventure-title-generator" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Random Adventure Title Generator</a> and the zine was written specifically for their <a href="https://itch.io/jam/random-adventure-jam">Random Adventure Jam</a>. All art is public domain and retrieved from <a href="https://www.oldbookillustrations.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Old Book Illustrations</a>.</p>
<p>Gain some powers! Do a favor for a deity! Maybe get rewarded? The world is yours (and, you know, everyone else's), so make the most of the next 24 hours while you celebrate... the <strong>IMMORTAL FESTIVAL</strong>!<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIyNjUwNS83MTUyMDUzLnBuZw==/original/fvXiOX.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIyNjUwNS83MTUyMTg3LnBuZw==/original/ywjHeP.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIyNjUwNS83MTUyMTg4LnBuZw==/original/tVTffC.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIyNjUwNS83MTUyMDU2LnBuZw==/original/hLKUIE.png]]






<p><strong>In an Instant</strong> is a game about photographing the end of the world. Explore the last moments of humanity. Mourn the Earth. Remind the world what you've lost.</p>
<p><em>At the end of everything, what's worth remembering?</em></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Inspired by Umurangi Generation and the hellhole of a world&nbsp;we&nbsp;all live in.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Now includes a Caltrop Core edition!<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1MjI5My83ODczMTQ4LnBuZw==/original/D7DWQT.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1MjI5My83ODczMTUxLnBuZw==/original/C5HgMi.png]]






<p>In Space, No One Can Hear You Feel<br><br>You‚Äôve both been on a ship for an untold amount of time and have just woken from cryo-sleep.<br>The ship is broken and beyond repair.<br>Lights don‚Äôt always work. Power is low.<br>The oxygen supply already feels thin. Supplies are almost non-existent.<br><br>Help is not coming.<br>Together you face the darkness.<br><br><br>These are your last moments.<br><br>This is a GMless game that uses 1d6 and a partner to play.<br>It was written by Malhidael (@malhidael) with layout done by Kienna Shaw (@kiennas).<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI2NTkwOTEucG5n/original/nfAdL5.png]]






<p><em>In the Light of a Setting Sun: Bonanza Edition</em>&nbsp;is a rules-light pen-and-paper adventure role-playing game set loosely in the Wild West (1850‚Äì1900) and based on iconic gunfighting genre movies set in that time period. Character sheet by Micah Anderson (<a href="https://twitter.com/micaholism" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@micaholism</a>).&nbsp;<em>Bonanza Edition&nbsp;</em>is an expansion of <a href="https://sivads-sanctum.itch.io/in-the-light-of-a-setting-sun-saddlebag-edition" target="_blank"><em>Saddlebag Edition</em></a>, released May 2020.</p>
<p><strong><em>WITHIN THE 44 - PAGE RULEBOOK, YOU'LL FIND:</em></strong></p>
<ul><li>Basics of the genre, and a warning against bigotry</li><li>A fast-paced&nbsp;d20 system with three stats</li><li>Randomized names, backgrounds, and loadouts for easy character creation</li><li>Oracles that provide layers of complexity to player characters or NPCs</li><li>A starting scenario and hexcrawl to set you on your path of mayhem!</li></ul>
<p><em><strong>WHAT $900 USD PAYS FOR:</strong></em><br></p>
<ul><li><del>A print run of the rulebook ($300 USD)</del></li><li>Paying myself ($600, about $0.10/word)</li></ul>
<p><em><strong>POTENTIAL STRETCH GOALS:</strong></em></p>
<ul><li>$1200: Paying myself more ($900 brings my pay to $0.15/word)</li><li>$1500: Judge's Bible (in development)<br><em></em></li></ul>
<p><em></em></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwNTIwMS83NTkyMzU4LnBuZw==/original/%2BY%2Fj6k.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwNTIwMS83NTkyMzkzLmpwZw==/original/Mscb2L.jpg]]






<p><strong>Welcome to Brittleholme</strong></p>
<p>The town of Brittleholme is overrun by strange and terrible creatures. A week ago a dentist arrived in the town and opened a clinic. After a few days of pulling teeth, cauterising rotten gums and lancing ulcers the nightmare began.&nbsp;<br></p>
<p>The adventurers will need to delve into the throbbing root of Brittleholme to find what they desire. Perhaps they will rid the town of its terrible curse in the process. 
</p>
<p>An atmospheric companion playlist for this adventure is available on Spotify, compiled by Irfon Brandon-Toki&nbsp;Rickard.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p><iframe src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/playlist/6QWahpuNPzy5zTTbfjkDln" width="100%" height="380" frameborder="0"></iframe><br></p>
<p>_____________________________________________________________________________________</p>
<p>In&nbsp;Thrall&nbsp;To Their Grasping Teeth&nbsp;has been designed for use with&nbsp;<a href="https://loottheroom.itch.io/a-dragon-game">‚ÄúA Dragon Game‚Äù by Chris Bissette</a>&nbsp;but can be adapted for other systems that might feature demonic dentists and possessed teeth.</p>
<p><span></span></p>
<p>The title of the adventure was created using the Random Adventure Title Generator by Loot the Room, available online at <a href="https://loottheroom.uk/random-adventure-title-generator" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://loottheroom.uk/random-adventure-title-generator</a>&nbsp;
</p>
<p>This adventure has been created as part of the Random Adventure Jam on itch.io, you can find more entries to this jam at <a href="https://itch.io/jam/random-adventure-jam">https://itch.io/jam/random-adventure-jam</a>&nbsp;
</p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE4NzE5OS82OTI2MzE3LmpwZw==/original/CK0pUz.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE4NzE5OS82OTIzNTM5LmpwZw==/original/bgJL9i.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE4NzE5OS82OTMxMTUzLmpwZw==/original/Xvvj1x.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE4NzE5OS82OTIzNTQ0LmpwZw==/original/LmGEiY.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE4NzE5OS82OTIzNTQ1LmpwZw==/original/ytu1so.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE4NzE5OS82OTIzNTQ2LmpwZw==/original/PoY1cG.jpg]]






{{HTML5}}






<p>A supplement for Pathfinder 1st edition, offering an assortment of bloodlines that are not as grand or legendary as those in the core rules. 4 new bloodrager bloodlines and 10 for sorcerers, plus three wildblooded options. In addition, 11 new spells dealing specifically with bloodlines, ranging from detecting bloodline-empowered creatures to concealing your own, denying a creature its ancestral gifts, or stealing a creature's bloodline for yourself! The book finishes off with 14 new feats and 6 traits that relate specifically to bloodlines.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Can't find any kings in your lineage?</strong> Devoid of draconic descent? Absent abyssal or aberrant affliction? Don't worry! One ancestor is as good as another, and your humble background may still have granted you sorcerous power, though perhaps nothing quite so impressive at parties. Discover the secrets of little-known lineages like the anonymous, carceral, furtive, ocular and torpid bloodlines. Obliterate adversaries with gelatinous might, or reveal to them the true power of having ancestors who were defeated so&nbsp;comprehensively that it <em>passed down through generations</em>.
</p>
<p>This is <strong>not</strong> a joke product, and the bloodlines and other content presented here should be balanced and suitable for play in a standard Pathfinder campaign.
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1MTc2Ny82MDE1ODQ0LnBuZw==/original/x7YEk5.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1MTc2Ny82MDE1ODQ1LnBuZw==/original/HPFizq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1MTc2Ny82MDE1ODQ2LnBuZw==/original/pcByLg.png]]






<p>A supplement for Pathfinder 1st edition, featuring 30 new spells. While not particularly serious, the spells are designed to be usable in play - this isn't a joke product.<br></p>
<p>Have&nbsp;<em>you</em>&nbsp;been mis-sold magical incantations, scrolls, spellbooks or eldritch initiations into blasphemous rites? Embarrass yourself with belated, public realisations that you learned the wrong spell? Avoid the pitfalls of overeagerness, scrawly handwriting and gullibility with this handy guide to spells that&nbsp;<strong>aren't</strong>&nbsp;the spell you're actually looking for. Thirty misleading spells, often silly, but some of them potentially useful nonetheless. When you need to temporarily hide a servant, lecture the undead or slightly alter your trousers, this is the place to look.
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1MTc1OS82MDE1Nzk4LnBuZw==/original/0W%2Bocw.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1MTc1OS82MDE1ODAwLnBuZw==/original/mQlCuW.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1MTc1OS82MDE1ODAxLnBuZw==/original/XZEfdI.png]]






<p>Ink Transference is a play by mail game where players get to be mildly psychic aliens learning about humans through lab reports.</p>
<p>Cover and character art by Bri DeDannan&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/BriDanann?s=20" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/BriDanann</a></p>
<p>Layout by Diwata <a href="https://diwatamnl.itch.io/">https://diwatamnl.itch.io/</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzMzNzE5NzEucG5n/original/lleHnY.png]]






<figure><em><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NTk3OTAucG5n/original/wPiyXa.png" loading="lazy"></em><em>Experiencing visions of a mythical land throughout childhood, you are guided to a kingdom ruled by the fae. Responsible for a pact made long ago by your ancestors, Arthur &amp; Guinevere Pendragon,&nbsp;you must now earn Belief and the respect of their gods to secure your ticket back home.</em></figure>
<p class="text-center"><br></p>
<p><strong>INSPIRISLES</strong>&nbsp;is a completely original <strong>all ages</strong> Tabletop RPG promoting&nbsp;<strong>storytelling</strong>,&nbsp;<strong>empathy</strong>&nbsp;and <strong>D</strong><strong>eaf awareness</strong>&nbsp;with an emphasis on <strong>cooperation</strong>.<br></p>
<ul><li>Play as teens gifted extraordinary powers.&nbsp;
</li><li>Meet famous characters and fearsome creatures from <strong>Celtic</strong> folklore.&nbsp;
</li><li>Work together to heal an ailing land and restore a fractured kingdom.&nbsp;
</li><li>Learn British and American <strong>sign language</strong> as you cast spells, solve puzzles and battle monsters.</li></ul>
<p>This project came about after running my teen&nbsp;<em>Dungeons &amp; Dragons</em>&nbsp;group&nbsp;<strong>Hatchlings</strong>&nbsp;for over a year. I wanted to create something for them, something they could have a hand in building, and something I could take beyond the group to use in schools and communities as a workshop tool. Inspirisles is the result of this: a game for <strong>all ages </strong>that reflects my interest in mythology and my ongoing work with the Deaf community.<br></p>
<p>With Inspirisles, we are especially encouraging parents, educators and tabletop beginners to invest in our game. Many of us have fond memories of 80s fantasy classics such as&nbsp;<em>The NeverEnding Story</em>&nbsp;&amp;&nbsp;<em>Labyrinth</em>. Inspirisles aims to capture some of that nostalgic magic and transport its older participants back to a more carefree and imaginative time.&nbsp;</p>
<figure><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NTk3MjIucG5n/original/B5BtwT.png" loading="lazy"><br></figure>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NTk3NTUucG5n/original/23ZYPg.png" loading="lazy">Inspirisles features a unique system we have called <strong>Shaping</strong>.&nbsp;It allows participants to engage with&nbsp;Deaf <strong>culture</strong>&nbsp;and learn sign language (<strong>ASL</strong> and <strong>BSL</strong> included). It also forms the&nbsp;dice mechanic at the heart of the game, where our Pendragons will wield the <strong>elements</strong> to fight <strong>Disbelief </strong>(our negative force) and heal the <strong>World Tree</strong>.<br></p>
<p>Inspirisles encourages&nbsp;<strong>teamwork</strong>&nbsp;at every turn. Only by Shaping can the party overcome the tests of our game. <strong>Belief Barriers</strong> are non-combative tests where our Pendragons must think up ways their elements can solve puzzles. <strong>Disbelief Battles</strong> are combative tests, where our Pendragons must pit their elements&nbsp;against&nbsp;a dangerous opponent.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NjAyMDEucG5n/original/0%2F79%2Fw.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>For the most fun, we recommend running the game with five players<strong>. </strong>One player volunteers to be the <strong>Grail Guide</strong> (GG), whilst the others form a party of<span class="">&nbsp;</span>Pendragons.&nbsp;It‚Äôs the Guide‚Äôs role to describe the Islands, plan the <strong>Questing Days </strong>(adventures)&nbsp;and give voice to the many characters and creatures the Pendragons will meet. We recommend the role to an adult or confident storyteller.</p>
<p>Sessions typically run 2-3 hours and can feature anything from a series of intense battles to a relaxing afternoon of downtime.</p>
<p>Beyond Shaping, Inspirisles offers everything enthusiasts&nbsp;have come to expect from a modern TTRPG. Alongside the natural benefits of roleplaying, we&nbsp;have wholesome&nbsp;character creation, a simple but&nbsp;engaging <strong>3d6</strong> rolling mechanic, an intuitive guide for planning and running&nbsp;sessions, exhaustive story prompts, robust <strong>safety tools</strong>&nbsp;and&nbsp;disability <strong>inclusion</strong> throughout.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NTg1NzYucG5n/original/3wS6ZY.png" loading="lazy"></p>
<figcaption><br><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NTk3MTcucG5n/original/tTQUf8.png" loading="lazy"><br></figcaption>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NjAwMzkuanBn/original/HpGtmY.jpg" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>The World Tree is in trouble. Disbelief has spread to its roots and before long it will wither and die. Long ago, your ancestor Guinevere Pendragon made a pact with the fae of these Islands. Her spirit will&nbsp;now guide her descendents through the <strong>All's Well </strong>portal and have them earn enough Belief to bring the Tree back to life.&nbsp;</p>
<p>As Pendragons, you are tasked with honouring Guinevere's pact, but how you fulfil this is entirely up&nbsp;to you.&nbsp;Travel to wondrous locations, from the glowing caverns of <strong>Miasma</strong> to the icy mountains of <strong>Rofang</strong>. Meet communities of <strong>Friends</strong>,&nbsp;from the inventive<strong> Piskies&nbsp;</strong>to the<strong>&nbsp;</strong>spiritual<strong> Giantheld</strong>. Become apprentices to the Inspired (gods) and learn their trades such as&nbsp;glassblowing at&nbsp;<strong>Kilna's</strong> forge. And face powerful foes such as the banished <strong>wyrms</strong>&nbsp;hoarding vast sums of Belief in their <strong>Underisles</strong> lairs.<br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NTk3MTQucG5n/original/RIy4P4.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<figcaption><em><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NTk2ODMucG5n/original/lyTEEZ.png" loading="lazy"><br></em><br><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NTgxMzguanBn/original/rwOgV3.jpg" style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit" loading="lazy"><em><br></em></figcaption>
<figcaption><br></figcaption>
<p>Find over 200 pages, including...<br></p>
<ul><li>A history of the Islands and their inhabitants.&nbsp;
</li><li>Pendragon&nbsp;character creation.</li><li>Sign language tutorials, including Deaf awareness tips and a strong introduction taking you from the <strong>fingerspelling</strong> alphabet to your first conversations.</li><li>A fun&nbsp;3d6&nbsp;dice rolling&nbsp;system.<br>
</li><li>How to run sessions as the Grail Guide and plan&nbsp;Questing Days&nbsp;using storytelling&nbsp;archetypes.</li><li>A host of <strong>worldbuilding</strong> inspirations, including vibrant&nbsp;locations,<strong>&nbsp;</strong>ways of earning Belief, festivals, famous Friends and foes and a menagerie of fae creatures.</li><li>A starter Questing Day: ‚ÄòFriends in High Places'.&nbsp;</li><li>Stunning full-colour illustrations from cover to cover, featuring dozens of diverse&nbsp;characters by<strong> </strong><a href="https://twitter.com/luseals" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><strong>Lucille Nual</strong></a> and a myriad of&nbsp;creatures,&nbsp;locations and&nbsp;intricate&nbsp;<strong>knot</strong> art by&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/mythiccomicsart" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><strong>Josh Somerville</strong></a>.</li><li>Dyslexia friendly fonts to prioritise <strong>accessibility</strong>.&nbsp;</li><li>Sensitivity reading and <strong>safety tools</strong>, including a consent questionnaire, reflection mechanic and X card.</li><li>Full colour or B&amp;W versions of the&nbsp;Pendragon&nbsp;sheet, and&nbsp;sign language&nbsp;material by&nbsp;<strong><a href="https://twitter.com/willowsquest" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Ashley Grace</a></strong> for both American and British players.</li></ul>
<p></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4ODEwNzQuanBn/original/gGJuOg.jpg" loading="lazy"></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NjMxNTgucG5n/original/GPyK5y.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>Inspirisles launches with <strong>video tutorials </strong>covering all sign language material for ASL and BSL. They have been lovingly&nbsp;produced and performed by my Deaf colleagues <strong>Rajnie Kaur </strong>and <strong>Katy White</strong>. Find the link to these on <strong>page 39</strong> of your PDF or hardcover.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY4NDQ5MTIucG5n/original/cMFvt1.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>As well as our video tutorials, all sign language and Deaf awareness elements have been consulted on by our Deaf colleagues at the charity and our interpreter contact in the US whose 1st language is ASL.</p><p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgxOTIwMDUucG5n/original/SDYpY5.png" loading="lazy"><br></p><p>In purchasing Inspirisles, you also get our first anthology of 9 Questing Days,&nbsp;<strong>Shapes of Adventure</strong>. This collection was&nbsp;written by members of our passionate&nbsp;<a href="https://discord.gg/JUAqGQS" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">discord</a>&nbsp;community and features&nbsp;new sign language material by <strong>Ashley Grace </strong>(she/her) and this new cover by <strong>Josh Somerville </strong>(he/him).</p><p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY3NjE1MzUuanBn/original/xWoBZd.jpg" style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit" loading="lazy"></p><p><br><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgxOTIwMDMucG5n/original/C%2Fk%2BTm.png" loading="lazy"><br><br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4NjcyMjAucG5n/original/wlx1ys.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>Lovely article here by the popular UK tabletop news and review site, <a href="http://dicebreaker.com/games/inspirisles/news/inspirisles-learn-sign-language-rpg" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><strong>Dicebreaker</strong></a>.</p>
<p>Youtube review by <strong><a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCbIl96w4kNeK_5HZrQWS9oA" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Dave Thaumavore</a></strong>.</p>
<div class=""><iframe width="500" height="281" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HkThAa3OYJg" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div>
<p>If you would like to <strong>review</strong>&nbsp;<strong></strong> or <strong>demonstrate</strong> our unique game for your article, podcast or stream, please send your interest to<strong> </strong><a href="mailto:hatchlingdm@gmail.com" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><strong></strong></a><a href="https://www.hatchlingsgames.co.uk/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">hatchlingsgames.co.uk</a><span></span><br></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HkThAa3OYJg" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNTMxOC81ODU4NjY5LnBuZw==/original/YxpJGQ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNTMxOC82Mjg2MzM3LmpwZw==/original/uG0fq2.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNTMxOC81ODU4NTY2LnBuZw==/original/stGstu.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNTMxOC82Mjg2MzM2LmpwZw==/original/m9xP23.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNTMxOC81ODU4NzI4LnBuZw==/original/q1EcpD.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNTMxOC82MzAwOTY0LmpwZWc=/original/9mruhE.jpeg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNTMxOC81ODU5NjA0LnBuZw==/original/guevfE.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNTMxOC82Mjg2MzM4LmpwZw==/original/aMWVrZ.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNTMxOC81ODU5ODQ1LnBuZw==/original/p50yO0.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNTMxOC81ODYzMzc0LmpwZw==/original/LD65Hp.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNTMxOC82MDA3NzY4LnBuZw==/original/1PMnHc.png]]






<p class="text-center"><em>You don‚Äôt ever remember signing a contract, but The Company owns you now, body and soul.&nbsp;You have a debt, and they‚Äôre coming to collect. Whatever you were before, this is your purpose now:<br>Finding a way to keep the creditors at bay.<br></em><em>Finding a way to get back...</em></p>
<h1 class="text-center">INTO THE BLACK</h1>
<p>INTO THE BLACK is a sci-fi adventure game using the PINKHACK system. Somewhat of a personal love letter to the Mass Effect franchise, Into the Black is a picaresque adventure game where the players must navigate and explore&nbsp;a strange and wonderous galaxy while deeply indebted to an interstellar corporation. Life among the stars, then, is about treading the razor's edge of struggling for survival and finding joy and love where one can.</p>
<p>This is currently an ASHCAN EDITION. I churned this out over the course of a weekend, tinkering with the PINKHACK system (a blend of Jared Sinclair's The Vanilla Game, Christian Mehrstam's Whitehack, and Chris McDowall's Into the Odd).</p>
<p>Inside this 97-page book you'll find:</p>
<ul><li>A series of tools for safe play, for Chroniclers and Travelers both</li><li>A&nbsp;lightweight 3-stat, 3-class&nbsp;OSR system requiring only a few d20s and d6s</li><li>A randomized character system that provides compelling starting points for your adventurer</li><li>50 creatures to encounter on your interstellar journey</li><li>A miscellanea section including ancient data-disks, clothes, drugs, corporations, space pirates, wandering star-nomads, space caravans, a technobabble generator, and strange sci-fi discovered items</li><li>A die-drop-based mapping system that allows for the collaborative creation of interesting adventure sites, settlements, planets, encounters, and cosmic anomalies</li><li>List of desirable goods to barter, buy and sell across the galaxy to pay your debt, as well as complications that might arise on the journey</li><li>Powerful telekinetic abilities and technological wonders</li><li>Rules for starship combat and a selection of vessels to battle, steal, avoid, and strive for</li><li>Art by the fabulous Evlyn Moreau, and&nbsp;Mike Winkelmann (aka Beeple)</li></ul><h3>Reviews:</h3><p><em>"The result is a homespun corner of space full of potential. An emergent story of local warlords or ancient tech can play out, or the group can soak in the emotional melange of finding a series of barren, if beautiful, landscapes while they watch the twin suns dance below several horizons."</em><br>-Chase Carter, <a href="https://www.dicebreaker.com/games/into-the-black/news/into-the-black-rpg-mass-effect" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Dicebreaker</a><span></span></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMDQyOS81NjkzODI0LmpwZw==/original/ZVIELs.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMDQyOS81NjkzODI1LmpwZw==/original/VKAQuw.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMDQyOS81NjkzODI2LmpwZw==/original/dSbgcV.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMDQyOS81NjkzODI3LmpwZw==/original/n5zWlC.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMDQyOS81NjkzODU5LmpwZw==/original/nmVTAh.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMDQyOS81NjkzODYwLmpwZw==/original/4k%2Bq2y.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMDQyOS81NjkzODU4LmpwZw==/original/JXyT3Y.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMDQyOS81NjkzODYxLmpwZw==/original/rEIRL%2F.jpg]]






<p>Beyond the reach of roads, past the scope of mortals there is a darkened place. A shadowed tree-line where no-one dares cross and whose boundaries go undisturbed.<br></p>
<p>This is not the woods of peaceful fey and beast, but the dark and twisted children‚Äôs tale that kept you full of terror. It is a world of fear, madness, and bloodshed; ruled over by the uncaring watch of ancient trees. There is no bargaining with the primal forces that rule the uncivilized world, as you have nothing they could ever want.</p>
<p><em>The woods do not care for you. Never forget that.</em></p>
<p>---</p>
<p>Into the Wyrd and Wild is a supplemental book for those seeking to incorporate a weird and terrifying wilderness into their role-playing game. Players and GMs who enjoy a level of horror and prefer the sweeping, darkened landscapes of forest and mires to the well-trodden cobblestone of dungeons need look no further when it comes to books. Presented within the book is a light overhaul of the adventuring system, modified to fit better with a campaign centered around forays into the frightening wilderness.<br></p>
<p>---</p>
<p>The book contains:</p>
<p><strong>Rules for wilderness travel and survival</strong></p>
<p><strong>Rules for Moon Cycles and strange phases.</strong></p>
<p><strong>Rules for hunting, tracking, and butchering monsters.</strong></p>
<p><strong>40+ dangerous and terrifying monsters.</strong></p>
<p><strong>40+ strange and savage items.</strong></p>
<p><strong>40+ spells and rules for channeling the Wyrd.</strong></p>
<p><strong>An essay and guideline on running and creating "wilderness dungeons."</strong></p>
<p><strong>A step-by-step guide for generating your own wilderness adventure.</strong></p>
<p><strong>100 random wilderness locations.</strong></p>
<p><strong>Tables upon tables of random diseases, wilderness dressings, traps, hazards, flora, encounters, and MORE.</strong></p>
<p><strong>All illustrated with over 150 pieces of original art.</strong></p>
<p><strong>Itch.io Exclusive: Includes the monster token set for free!</strong></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTE2NjM0LzI2ODMzMDUucG5n/original/lkReR5.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTE2NjM0LzI2ODMzMDYucG5n/original/aeEFmb.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTE2NjM0LzI2ODMzMDcucG5n/original/gjlFZK.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTE2NjM0LzI3OTc2MzcucG5n/original/PxZHD1.png]]






<p>Iot3K is a game focused on sci-fi horror tropes from the 1980s, as aliens have come to Plainville, IN in hopes of conquering the world. With your group of friends, work to discover their secret plot as they infiltrate all levels of the local government and seek to take control, or as they overrun and enslave your town. With six character types, six alien types, six plots, and the innovative Alien Influence and Plot Twist systems, this game can provide hours of over the top fun for any roleplayer--regardless of experience.</p>
<p><br>Praise for Invasion of the Third Kind:</p>
<p>"Fun, evocative distillation of PbtA-style games into a quick pickup adventure that concisely encapsulates its genre." @Tintenseher, mini ttrpg jam<br><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY1Mjk3MzcucG5n/original/AWiybw.png]]






<p class="text-right"><strong>Writing a new spell doesn‚Äôt need to be hard with this step by step guide!<br>Good for spellcasters who prefer the page and those who embrace tech!</strong></p>
<p><em>Inventing Incantations </em>is a solo, microRPG that helps you find the words for a spell. The instructions are available as&nbsp;a trifold brochure (10 pt font), a 4 page pdf (16 pt font) and a txt file.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>When printing the brochure: </strong>make sure to print on both sides of the paper, flipping on the short edge.<br></p>
<p>Inventing Incantations was&nbsp; inspired by <a href="https://temporalhiccup.itch.io/" target="_blank">Rae&nbsp;&nbsp;Nedjadi‚Äôs</a><a href="https://temporalhiccup.itch.io/" target="_blank"></a>&nbsp;ritual games.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDkzNTIxLzI1NjQ4ODAuanBn/original/DQRhj1.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDkzNTIxLzI1NjQ4ODEuanBn/original/gXMHD0.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDkzNTIxLzI1NjQ4ODcucG5n/original/3wbnWK.png]]






<p>They spoke with sweet words.&nbsp;</p>
<p>They said "work hard enough, and you can have it all!"&nbsp;
</p>
<p>They showed you images of the life you could lead. Wealth, family, comfort.&nbsp;
</p>
<p>They dazzled the world with ideas of "The Dream," all while doing everything in their power to assure that they would have while everyone else has not.
</p>
<p>The gods told stories, wove tales, captured hearts and minds. They built their power, their wealth, and they left everyone else in the dust. They still require the same sacrifices and devotion, but they ask time instead of blood. They ask attention rather than labor.&nbsp;
</p>
<p>They want for nothing and still they want more.
</p>
<p><strong>Now is the time for all of that to change</strong>. Your community, your people will assert themselves, will bring down the gods. Their strongholds will fall and all they have claimed for their own will be given to those from whom it was stolen.
</p>
<p>The Twilight of the Gods is upon the nine realms. Their fall will come at your hands.
</p>
<h3>A New Edda, Reforged&nbsp;</h3>
<p>The gods have built their corporations on the backs and bones of humans and giants alike. Across the City, each of the realms groans under the weight of their rule. They keep most people placated with trinkets, ads, and a steady diet of games and other consumable media.&nbsp;</p>
<p>You are not most people.&nbsp;</p>
<p>You and those in your neighborhood know the time of the gods is over. You are going to be the cold winds of a neon Fimbulwinter that ushers out the old world and brings in the new.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p>In this game, you can play anyone, be&nbsp;anyone who is part of the fight against the gods. Begin play with one set of characters, change focus to a different group, and tell the story of taking down the gods from any angle you choose.    This is a game about the whole of the people who will topple the gods.<br></p>
<h3>The System</h3>
<p>Iron Edda Reforged&nbsp;is powered by an all-new system designed by Tracy Barnett and playtested by Bee Zelda, Alex Flanigan, and Jeff Stormer. Characters are detailed, vibrant, and easy to make. The structure of play allows the players to change focus characters whenever they wish.&nbsp;
</p>
<p>By moving perspectives from one group of characters to another, any group can tell the same kinds of stories that we see in other forms of media. Changing characters and perspectives allows for the telling of the story as a whole, not just the experience of a small group of people.&nbsp;
</p>
<p><strong>Characters</strong>&nbsp;are made by choosing a&nbsp;<strong>warrior</strong>&nbsp;<strong>clan</strong>&nbsp;and assigning three details, which are short, descriptive, true phrases. Each detail has a rating,&nbsp;<strong>excellent</strong>,&nbsp;<strong>good</strong>, or&nbsp;<strong>fair</strong>. When a character takes a risky action, the number of d6s they roll depends on the detail they're using. If they roll poorly, they can spend a&nbsp;<strong>control</strong>&nbsp;<strong>point</strong>&nbsp;to re-roll their misses. To get more control points, players can choose for their character to fail a roll, narrating the outcome.
</p>
<p>Each warrior clan comes with a focus and a set of powers which can be used&nbsp;<strong>at-need</strong>,&nbsp;<strong>per scene</strong>, or&nbsp;<strong>per session</strong>. Jotunheim includes one set of powers for each of the ten warrior clans. Subsequent seasons will include different power sets that can be mixed and matched among seasons.
</p>
<p>When a character runs into trouble, they get&nbsp;<strong>glitch</strong>&nbsp;<strong>dice</strong>&nbsp;that they have to include in their die pool when they take their next action. &nbsp;When glitch dice hit, things go sideways for the character. Setbacks, advantages for the opposition, injury, or even death are all on the table if they're appropriate for the narrative.</p>
<p><strong>Want to hear how it developed? <a href="https://open.spotify.com/show/6ij3enGjfblHqLuvTzwiMk?si=2b6dff1e0b744aed" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Check out the Puppet Strings podcast on the One Shot Network!</a></strong><br></p>
<h3>Alpha Release</h3>
<p>This version of&nbsp;Iron Edda Reforged is an alpha release. Anyone who purchases will get the beta as well as any subsequent updates, including the final.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM0MDM4Ny83ODAxMDQ2LnBuZw==/original/sljGcG.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM0MDM4Ny83ODAxMDQ4LnBuZw==/original/4Fgu1E.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM0MDM4Ny83ODAxMDQ5LnBuZw==/original/wt6JeJ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM0MDM4Ny83ODAxMDUxLnBuZw==/original/wEMH%2F6.png]]






<p>You have become haunted by a vengeful spirit taking the form of Jonathan Frakes, beloved actor of stage and screen.&nbsp; He wants your attention ‚Äî a laugh, a glance, a respond to a myriad of strange, seemingly innocuous questions.</p>
<p>And yet, you know that even the slightest response will be all it takes for him to consume your soul and condemn you to hell for eternity.</p>
<p>Can you survive?</p>
<p><strong>Players:&nbsp;</strong>2<br></p>
<p><strong>Play Time:&nbsp;</strong>As long as it takes to complete a household chore<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzMxMzkxODQucG5n/original/8IZsFN.png]]






<p class="text-center">*****************************<br><br><strong>Curious about what Keepers of the Cards is like in play? </strong><br><br><a href="https://youtu.be/HfRdtTa0_y0" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Here we are playing Keepers of the Cards on Roll20's Indie Showcase!</a><br></p>
<p class="text-center"><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m2rdamL-GXk" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Here is an actual play video from Go Jess with an amazing cast</a>.<br></p>
<p class="text-center"><a href="https://youtu.be/aNSDFwz-_hI" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Here is a session of play with folks from the Gauntlet</a>.</p>
<p class="text-center">*****************************<br></p>
<h2></h2>
<h2>We Are The Keepers of the Cards</h2>
<p><em>The Magician has left behind a legacy of magic. As part of this legacy, a deck of cards &nbsp;was created. Each card contains a creature of pure magic.</em></p>
<p><em><br></em><br></p>
<p><em>At least, the cards used to.<br><br>You and your friends are the Keepers of the Cards! You are children of magic and hope, and you must find these creatures and rebuild this deck of magic and power.<br><br>But at the end of this tale, can you see it through?</em><br></p>
<h2><br>The Inspiration</h2>
<p><strong><em><br></em></strong></p>
<p><strong><em>KEEPERS OF THE CARDS </em></strong>is inspired by the anime series Cardcaptor Sakura and other shows from the magical girl genre. It's a game that focuses on young characters, friendships that change over time, magic that must be harnessed and claimed, magical hijinks that cause problems at school or home!<br></p>
<h2><br>The Game</h2>
<p><br>This story game is a Descended from the Queen game. The original game, <a href="https://www.evilhat.com/home/for-the-queen/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">For The Queen</a>, asks players to draw cards and answer prompts to intuitively and spontaneously create a story together. The story ends when the final question is drawn, and the players create an epilogue together.</p>
<p>In Keepers of the Cards, you can use the unique cards designed for this deck (you can upload them to Roll20 or a similar online app, or print and play!) You can also use any tarot deck (most are a Rider-Waite-Smith deck, which will line up perfectly with this game). Simply draw the cards and refer to the PDF to see what prompt you are asked to answer.<br></p>
<p><br></p>
<h2>This game includes:</h2>
<p><br></p>
<p>
</p>
<ul><li><strong>A PDF </strong>with instructions for play, optional rules, and all prompts</li></ul>
<p><br></p>
<ul><li><strong>Prompts, lots of prompts! </strong>When playing the game you will be asked to first establish who was the Magician who created the deck, and what creatures of magic you must track down. There are 22 prompts for the Magician (based on the 22 Major Arcana cards of the tarot) and 22 prompts for the creatures (once again based on the Major Arcana).<br><br>When playing the game, you can draw from 56 story prompts (based on the 56 Minor Arcana cards of the tarot). </li></ul>
<p><br></p>
<ul><li><strong>An X-Card</strong>, for discarding a prompt or changing an aspect of the story</li></ul>
<p><br></p>
<ul><li><strong>125 images for cards</strong>, including 4 unique card backs and 9 unique card designs</li></ul>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HfRdtTa0_y0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjQ4NTgxLzM0Nzc5MDQuanBn/original/gERIE7.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjQ4NTgxLzM0Nzc5MDUuanBn/original/hrMQIP.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjQ4NTgxLzM0NzcwOTYuanBn/original/UTg9ug.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjQ4NTgxLzM0NzcwOTMuanBn/original/HfuXd3.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjQ4NTgxLzM0NzcwOTQuanBn/original/N%2Bb%2BNM.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjQ4NTgxLzM0NzcwOTguanBn/original/IR%2FhmH.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjQ4NTgxLzM0NzcxMDEuanBn/original/Xk9EEE.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjQ4NTgxLzM0NzcxMDguanBn/original/IEx%2B1v.jpg]]






<h1>The Prophesy:</h1>
<p>The Sea, <strong>King Llyr</strong>, has died. His family gather in the great hall to hear his will be known, spoken by his spouse and steward, Penarddun. It is as many suspected, and as a few feared: All the lands of Prydein, its mountains and sheep, all its farmers and guardsmen, and all the powers of statehood are to be inherited solely by the King‚Äôs youngest born ‚Äî the teenaged princeling Branwen ‚Äî rather than being divided equally...</p>
<p>The reason for this sudden change in tradition? Branwen was prophesied to become the next King by his witch-child Manawydan, when they said:</p>
<blockquote>One born of flame and soot:<br>Who will befriend the Fair-Hound in the moonlit valley,<br>And will come of age upon the night of their Father‚Äôs natural passing,<br>And thus, before daybreak, will inherit all the world of Men?</blockquote>
<p>So now each Lordling must choose: <strong>Will you follow your father‚Äôs wishes and swear fealty to Branwen, or revolt and fight against the tide of destiny and take what you think is rightfully your, or perhaps you will find another way?</strong></p>
<h2><em>The game at a glance:<br></em></h2>
<ul><li><em>A print-n'-play roleplaying game about a family of giants, their feuds, and a prophesy that may spell doom.<br></em></li><li><em>Inspired by Welsh mythology! Play as characters from the Mabinogion.<br></em></li><li><em>Each player needs only a handful of six-sided dice&nbsp; (D6s), a pencil,  a good sense of wonderment, and a print-out of their character sheet.<br></em></li><li><em>Not </em>inherently<em> built as a 'player vs. player' type game, but ending everything in a duel or
starting a civil war are definitely some possible outcomes of the scenario.<br></em></li><li><em>It can be played
multiple times, and each time may be different. </em><em><br></em></li><li><em>The system uses pool-based success counting, and draws on factors from different sources to adjust difficulty. (See screenshots, right / below).<br></em></li><li><em> Licensed under <strong>CC BY-SA</strong>, if you want to hack it.</em></li></ul>
<h2>The&nbsp;Cast:</h2>
<ul><li><strong>Fran:</strong> Gallant but Austere. A great warrior and poet. Feels robbed by the unorthodox changes made by the
prophesy, and wants the will to be rescinded. Thinks
Manawydan is a fraud. Has never trusted Dormadd.</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>Manawydan</strong>: Apprehensive but Excited. Wants their fortune to come true peacefully. Doesn‚Äôt have total control over their
magic. Wants the best for the family, but has had some
conflicts with them over the years.</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>Nisyn</strong>: Calm and Inquisitive. Will follow the prophesy only if it‚Äôs true, but wonders about its legitimacy and the timing
of Manawydan‚Äôs claims. Wants answers. Offers advice to
Branwen, but only to serve their own interests.</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>Efnisyn:&nbsp;</strong>Brash and Ambitious. A bit of a trickster. Wants to be King instead of Branwen, and will try anything to prove
they are worthy. Thinks they may be able to twist
Manawydan‚Äôs words to their favour.</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>Branwen:&nbsp;</strong>Kindhearted, but a bit Na√Øve. Saddened by the death of the King, and a little unsure about taking on this
burden, but wants to make him proud. Doesn‚Äôt like all
the sudden attention, though. Keeps Dormadd close.</li></ul>
<ul><li><strong>Dormadd</strong>: Resembling of a handsome wolf at first, but perhaps a little rounder. <em>Truly, the best of dogs</em>. Believes they
were sent by the Silver Wheel to protect the prophesied
King with their life, should it come to that.</li></ul>
<h3>Explore Celtic Myths &amp; Folklore:</h3>
<p>The game is set in the glass hall of the&nbsp; Castle of the Winds, which floats in the cliffs&nbsp; above Dinas Olai, the city of light, the capital&nbsp; of Prydein, in the misty mountains of Eryri.
  </p>
<p>These names and places are all inspired by stories from the Mabinogi and the Triads, in a place&nbsp; and a time before these fair lands were&nbsp; touched by Roman hands. Familiarity with&nbsp; bronze-age history or Brythonic folklore is&nbsp;not required to play though. If you‚Äôre more&nbsp; familiar with Norse Mythology, then you‚Äôre&nbsp; part-way on the right track. The names are&nbsp; different, but the context is similar.<br></p>
<p>
</p>
<p>A full pronunciation guide and a family tree of the celtic gods are also provided!<br>
</p>
<h4>An Improvisational Roleplaying Game (For 3-7 Players):</h4>
<p><em>This is a<strong> 25 page</strong> demo scenario for a bigger game called AGORA (not yet released). It can be played in 3-4 hours, or continued over several sessions. Familiarity with the full rules is not required to play.</em><strong><br></strong></p>
<p>(<strong>Potential) Content Warnings:&nbsp;</strong>Family tragedy, Violence, and Conspiracy. Alcohol, Black-Magic, and Animal Abuse.</p>
<figure><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgzMDY5MjAucG5n/original/VL4PhD.png" loading="lazy"><br></figure>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxNzczNi84MzU3NDg2LmpwZw==/original/r7zcRS.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxNzczNi84MzU3NDg4LmpwZw==/original/aYsKxb.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxNzczNi84MzU3NDg5LmpwZw==/original/F7SYam.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxNzczNi84MzI2NDgxLmpwZw==/original/J3YDqX.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxNzczNi84MzI2NDY5LnBuZw==/original/CnDeMj.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxNzczNi84MzI2NDcwLnBuZw==/original/b71g5f.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxNzczNi84MzMzMTE4LnBuZw==/original/WJHdi6.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxNzczNi84Mjk4NjM0LmpwZw==/original/NxS54x.jpg]]






<p>This 2-player LARP&nbsp;is about kissing and being queer and resisting fascism. Love cannot always conquer all, but it is better to be with the people you love than to let them win. PUNCH NAZIS</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Use enthusiastic consent when playing this game, and make sure to look out for your own emotions and the emotions of other players.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzIwNjM5MjAucG5n/original/HE4lEY.png]]






<p>Kitchen Contest is a competitive cooking story game for 3-4 players.</p>
<p>Create a Chef and test your mettle to see who can be the Winner in a contest to cook the most delightful and delicious dishes!</p>
<p>Create a Judge who scores the competition to determine the Winner!</p>
<p>Contains variants for playing different kinds of contest, 1 person or 2 people with one Chef and one Judge.</p>
<p>This game uses 6 six-sided dice or a virtual dice roller and note paper or a text document to track progress.</p>
<p>Play with Safety Tools to ensure a comfortable competitive experience! <a href="https://bit.ly/ttrpgsafetytoolkit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://bit.ly/ttrpgsafetytoolkit</a> developed by <a href="https://twitter.com/KiennaS" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Kienna Shaw</a> and <a href="https://twitter.com/jl_nicegirl" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Lauren Bryant-Monk</a><span class=""></span><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTU4MTExLzI5MjY1MzEucG5n/original/1gTztf.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTU4MTExLzI5MjY1MzgucG5n/original/BJ8A2t.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTU4MTExLzI5MjY1MzcucG5n/original/X0GAWN.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTU4MTExLzI5MjY1MzYucG5n/original/k8Gmu%2B.png]]






<p>Kobolds &amp; Trench Coats is a two-page tabletop roleplaying game (TTRPG) about a group of Kobolds, their trusty trench coat, and the shenanigans they can get up to.&nbsp;</p>
<p>All these bigger magical creatures and pesky adventurers keep stealing your stuff and you've had it up to your horns with it. Don your magical trench coat and stack on each other's shoulders&nbsp;&nbsp;to become a perfectly normal,&nbsp;<em>totally human</em> adventurer and exact your whacky vengeance!&nbsp;Search out the finest shinies, the rarest magics, or just look for your stolen stuff with however many friends you can pile in here and still pass for human.&nbsp;Whatever happens, at least you have each other (and more than enough pockets). <span></span><br></p>
<p>Art for Kobolds &amp; Trenchcoats was done by Brighid de Danann. Find more of her amazing work at&nbsp;<a href="https://www.bridedanann.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">bridedanann.com</a>&nbsp;or <a href="https://twitter.com/BriDanann" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@BriDanann</a>.</p>
<p>Kobolds &amp; Trenchcoats is a hack of <a href="http://www.onesevendesign.com/laserfeelings/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Lasers and Feelings</a> by John Harper.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAzMTQ1MC81ODg1NTczLnBuZw==/original/Q%2BiRlh.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAzMTQ1MC81ODg1Nzg0LnBuZw==/original/6yN0yb.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAzMTQ1MC81ODg1Nzg1LnBuZw==/original/XlUPYl.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAzMTQ1MC81ODg1ODIxLnBuZw==/original/627n2s.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAzMTQ1MC81ODkyODk5LnBuZw==/original/BqKGMa.png]]






<p></p>
<h1>Last&nbsp;Year</h1>
<p>You are guests at an extremely fancy hotel. You are here this summer to rest, take a break from the outside world. You are strangers to each other, yet you both realize there is danger lurking the halls of this place. You have to remember what happened last year. Last year will hold the answers to your survival.</p>
<p>Last Year is a No Dice No Masters game. You will need some writing materials and something to represent tokens.</p>
<p>CW: This game deals with loss of memory, recalling past traumatic events, reconstructing memories and related themes.</p>
<p>Created for the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/one-page-rpg-jam-2021" target="_blank">One-Page Jam 2021</a><br><br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY3NTQyODEucG5n/original/wpGB4d.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<h2>similar games:</h2>
<ul><li><a href="https://metagame.itch.io/galactic" target="_blank">Galactic 2E</a></li><li><a href="https://eliseitz.itch.io/thursday" target="_blank">Thursday</a></li><li><a href="https://colesign.itch.io/the-space-war-is-over" target="_blank">Space War is Over</a></li></ul><h2>facing the menace</h2><p>Is a guided play supplement included in your purchase of last year. It adds acts and threats that help set scenes, gain (and lose tokens) during your game.<br></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzcxNzMwNzAucG5n/original/gvxI3G.png]]






<p class="text-center">...is a collaborative storytelling game intended for 4 players. 3 players play the Lesbian Werewolf Thruple, and 1 plays The Force of Nature, who creates all of the environments and natural occurrences.<br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p class="text-center"><strong>This trio of werewolves&nbsp;loves each other very much,</strong></p>
<p class="text-center"><strong>and they cannot talk about their feelings to save their lives</strong></p>
<p class="text-right"><em>(possibly literally???? up to you FoN!)</em></p>
<p class="text-center"><br></p>
<p class="text-center"><em>This game was created as a part of the Up All Night Jam with Off the Table and SuperQueero! I'm very sleepy!</em></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Inspirations/Tones include:</p>
<p><a href="https://twitter.com/ojomajaba" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">ojomajaba's work</a> -&nbsp;especially his trans werewolf pieces!</p>
<p><a href="https://crockpotcauldron.tumblr.com/post/116782369677/the-ideal-werewolf-novel" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">this tumblr post from 5 years ago</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.springhole.net/writing_roleplaying_randomators/wolf-werewolf-character.htm" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">a nice lil werewolf generator</a></p>
<p><a href="https://youtu.be/eSfh0EXQAGo" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">this specific clip of billy on the street</a></p>
<p><br></p>
<p><strong>Safety reference: <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SB0jsx34bWHZWbnNIVVuMjhDkrdFGo1_hSC2BWPlI3A/edit" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">The X Card</a></strong><br></p>
<p>Background photo by <a href="https://jaymantri.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">jay mantri</a></p>
<p>This is an untested experiment, and it was fun to write! Hope you enjoy it!&nbsp;If you want to spend money for some reason, please donate to your local bail fund.</p>
<p><em>Black Lives Matter, Trans Lives Matter, ACAB, and if you disagree with these statements, you may not play my game.</em></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzY4NzkxLzQzMDE2MTQucG5n/original/FzkPsC.png]]






<h1>Let Me Take a Selfie</h1><p>Let Me Take A Selfie&nbsp;is a collection of games using selfies to tell stories and explore emotions alone and with others. Selfies are a way we present ourselves to the world as we want to be seen. LMTAS explores relationships, crises, and fiction.</p>
<p>All games require phones with cameras and text messaging.<br></p>
<p><strong>Who Made Me Smile?</strong> is a four player game where players write stories and share selfies to connect and understand each others' emotions. <br></p>
<p><strong>The Story of My Face</strong> is a single player horror game where you tell your own story and create your own monsters while recording your adventure. <br></p>
<p><strong>Now You Don't</strong> is a multiplayer, GMless game where one player is the target of the experience and many others join them in a party that would be much less interesting if the one player wasn't invisible. <br></p>
<p><strong>Don't Look at Me</strong> is a two-player game where players are a couple separated by long distance, one who is ill and one who is in danger, who must weather the obstacles before them with limited time to communicate. <br></p>
<p><strong>Literally, I Can't</strong> is an exercise in competence where players must respond to small crises during a big crisis by demonstrating their competence in selfies and getting the job done.</p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMjMxMzg3LzEwOTY3NTguanBn/original/XZi7dq.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMjMxMzg3LzEwOTY3NDUuanBn/original/EhFm5E.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMjMxMzg3LzEwOTY3NDguanBn/original/QEMghx.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMjMxMzg3LzEwOTY3NDQuanBn/original/WJj30W.jpg]]






<h4></h4>
<blockquote>"Of course I knew you would be a great wizard Anthony, because of the strength of your magical lineage!"<br>"But professor, surely it was the power of friendship and hard work that let me succeed!"<br>Professor Rawlins smiled beatifically at Anthony. "No!" she said, humoring him, "The magic you were born with is all that really matters."</blockquote>
<p>--excerpt from <strong>Anthony Charterstone and Warlock's Curse</strong>, by RJ McElhenny</p>
<hr>
<h3>McElhenny Must Pay</h3>
<p>You're a wizard, and don't let anyone tell you any different. Especially not RJ McElhenny. She's just about the richest author on the planet, all thanks to her series of banal, lowest-common-denominator stories about wizards.&nbsp;Stories that make it pretty clear just what sorts of people she believes deserve to be called "wizards." If you weren't born magical, if you needed to learn how to wield the arcane or if your power stems from a patron or charm... well then you're an almost-wizard, as far as RJ McElhenny and her fans are concerned.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Well now, you've had quite enough of this, so you're going to get revenge the only way you can:&nbsp;stage an elaborate wizard heist through her well-appointed manor and steal her golden quill!</p>
<p><em>Let's Rob RJ McElhenny and Steal Her Golden Quill</em> is about taking&nbsp;on a fantasy novelist because you're tired of the shitty takes she keeps unloading on Twitter. It is, notably, a game with no subtext whatsoever and legally you can't prove otherwise.&nbsp;</p>
<hr>
<p>This here is a story game for three to five players. No prep, no GM, only about an hour to play unless you really take your time luxuriating in the petty vandalism you wreak on McElhenny Manor.&nbsp; Functionally, it's a simple narrative exercise in using the prompts to create obstacles in your way and telling stories of magic, skill, and teamwork to blow past those obstacles on your way to the heart of McElhenny Manor.&nbsp;</p>
<p>There's no losing the game. This is cathartic revenge fantasy, full of big action scenes powered by magic, where short-term failure just means throwing more spells out until the room finally explodes or whatever.&nbsp;</p>
<p>When you download this game you'll get two files:&nbsp;one which is made to be read off a screen like any ordinary PDF, and one which is made to be printed out (double-sided, flip on short edge) to be assembled into a sixteen-page, black-and-white&nbsp;zine. Keep it in your pocket in case you need to do wizard crimes at a moment's notice.&nbsp;</p><h4>Actual Review:</h4><p>"A fun little no-prep single-session game about a wizard heist. The best kind of heist!" - <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AZOleB3EYTU" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">zigmenthotep</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM5MDI0NTMucG5n/original/Tmaqgo.png]]






<<list-links "[tag[Linux]sort[title]]">>
