<p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;This is a collection of games I made for the&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/jam/bookmark-game-jam" target="_blank">Bookmark Game Jam</a><span></span>, hosted by&nbsp;<a href="http://diwatamnl.itch.io" target="_blank">Diwata ng Manila</a><span></span>. Why make one bookmark game when I could make four? They all easily fit on one double-sided sheet, right?</p>
<p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;One is spooky and ominous. One is silly and optimistic.&nbsp;One is quiet and blends in with the book as you read it.&nbsp;One is loud and&nbsp;actively destroys the book, and then itself. If there's not something there for you... gosh, I don't know what to tell ya. Better yet, they can all be replayed with different books or the same book. (Yes, even the destroyer one!)</p>
<p class="text-center"><em><strong>Content warning:</strong>&nbsp;Dead Between The Lines has running themes of supernatural un-death and being trapped.&nbsp;SHRED has strong vulgarity throughout and mentions death.</em></p>
<p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;The "demos" below contains the full game as text-only files; feel free to get a taste of the content before paying, or simply use them instead of the PDF if it suits your needs better. Free community copies are also available. üíö&nbsp;I'd love to hear your thoughts about this! Leave a comment below, and/or&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/lxnrhinners" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">tweet at me.</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzUyNTMwLzQyMDUxMzgucG5n/original/U3MRq5.png]]






<p><strong style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit">Locum Tendons</strong><span style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit">,&nbsp;</span><span class="" style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit">a butchering of the Latin phrase </span><em style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit">locum tenens</em><span class="" style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit">, meaning<br></span>"to substitute for," is a role-playing game about one or more doppelgangers infiltrating an adventuring party and systemically consuming them.&nbsp;You, the players, will take on the role of monsters while your GM takes the role of the party members you'll be massacring.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><em>Plant the seeds of deceit, harvest the flesh.&nbsp;</em><br></p>
<p>You'll need yourself and at least one other friend plus a few four sided dice! Please rate the game if you like it!&nbsp;</p>
<p>Built on THE Caltrop Core. Find it and it's creator here:<br><a href="https://titanomachyRPG.itch.io" style="font-size: inherit">https://titanomachyRPG.itch.io<br></a><a href="https://titanomachyRPG.itch.io" style="font-size: inherit">https://twitter.com/titanomachyRPG</a></p>
<p><span></span></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQwNjExMC84MjAxNjkzLnBuZw==/original/0yzfVN.png]]






<figure><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY3MTQyMzgucG5n/original/FghRpP.png" alt="A image of purple, pink and red roses on a green background" title="A image of purple, pink and red roses on a green background" loading="lazy"><br></figure>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzcwMDk0NTAucG5n/original/Vxtd1t.png" alt="What is this game?" title="What is this game?" loading="lazy"></p>
<p>LOGAN is an autobiographical tabletop game. In it you play through events I, Logan, have lived through, and come out with a version of my life in your hands.</p>
<p>LOGAN is deeply personal and vulnerable.</p>
<p>LOGAN is a reflection on life, on its high and lows, its ebbs and flows.</p>
<p>LOGAN is an invitation to look at your own life and reflect on all you have been through.</p>
<p>LOGAN is a reminder to commend yourself for still being here.</p>
<p>LOGAN is a work of queer joy, trans pride, resilience, growth and love.</p>
<p>LOGAN is a love letter that I invite you to write to yourself.</p>
<p><strong>Listen to Jeff Stormer and I play LOGAN on Party of One Podcast!</strong><br></p>
<p></p>
<div class=""><iframe width="500" height="281" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/7Vd63yzlqVA" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div>
<figure><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzcwMDk0NjQucG5n/original/DPIqtb.png" alt="What are people saying about LOGAN?" title="What are people saying about LOGAN?" style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit" loading="lazy"><br></figure>
<p>"While playing AutoBio I experienced intimacy, connection, and growth in a way beyond words. I feel like getting to know Logan better has helped me learn more about myself and my own formative experiences. <br>It's been a long while since I played and I still think about the experience fondly, and I know I've become a stronger and more vulnerable person because of this game." - Rae Nedjadi<br></p>
<p><a href="https://temporalhiccup.itch.io/" target="_blank"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY3NjA4MTIucG5n/original/ZPIhRp.png" alt="A portrait of Jamila R. Nedjadi" title="A portrait of Jamila R. Nedjadi" loading="lazy"></a><br></p>
<p>"It‚Äôs important to note the auto-biography and biography is tried and tested narrative genre on itself that really expands empathy and self-contemplation. Go hit up this really honest and engaging work to find your own story in Logan‚Äôs." - Maria Mison.</p>
<p><a href="https://mariabumby.itch.io/" target="_blank"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY3NjA4MjAucG5n/original/cwZewU.png" alt="A portrait of Maria Mison" title="A portrait of Maria Mison" loading="lazy"></a><br></p>
<p>"A tender, intimate game, I found myself wanting to learn more and more about little fictional Logan's life, and how the various highlights and moments of quiet resonated with my own experiences in some small way. LOGAN: An Autobiographical Tabletop Game is a phenomenal experience  from start to end, and is definitely a worthwhile journey to take in Logan's boots." - Valis.<br></p>
<p><a href="https://valistarri.itch.io/" target="_blank"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY3NjA4MjQucG5n/original/ws800N.png" alt="A picrew of Valis" title="A picrew of Valis" loading="lazy"></a><br></p>
<p>"At once gentle and childlike, at other times deeply musing and tragic, it was a wonderful mix of introspection and laughter. An autobio game that shows how the smallest choices and the little chances really make our stories come alive." - Marren</p><p>And if you enjoyed your experience with/as LOGAN, please&nbsp;rate and review. The buttons to do so are on this page.&nbsp;It really helps the game gain visibility, and is so so lovely for me to read. I really appreciate every single one &lt;3.</p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/7Vd63yzlqVA" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzMjg5Ni82NzE0MTE5LnBuZw==/original/NVqR2c.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzMjg5Ni82NzgzNjM5LnBuZw==/original/Tpak1T.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzMjg5Ni82NzYwMTM0LnBuZw==/original/zUnXuZ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzMjg5Ni82NzgzNjQzLnBuZw==/original/gsa52u.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzMjg5Ni82NzgzNjQ2LnBuZw==/original/i8uaP8.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzMjg5Ni82NzYwMTc1LnBuZw==/original/mXr9b9.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzMjg5Ni82NzYwOTI3LnBuZw==/original/SsS4N2.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzMjg5Ni82NzgzNjQ3LnBuZw==/original/E6ri0J.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzMjg5Ni82NzgzNjgyLnBuZw==/original/hZw6TG.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzMjg5Ni82NzgzNjQ1LnBuZw==/original/i%2F%2BZy6.png]]






<p>This is a game about a group of people sitting around a fire and working through their collective trauma and past hardships. &nbsp;Through doing this you collaboratively build a story of these people and their past.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Each player is a member of a group (adventuring party, sci-fi rebels, group of teenagers, whatever story you wish to tell) taking a break and dealing with trauma from some recent events. The game is ideally played around a fire with the group throwing their prompts into the flames (if a fire is not available, a bowl or basket is a perfect substitution). Players assign emotional weight to their portion of each tale, but must be careful to not be too blas√© or overly dramatic. The only way for the group to succeed is to be honest and confront their feelings while helping share the load of others.</p>
<p>Included is a fill-able PDF to create your own prompts and a prefilled version perfect for fantasy adventurers.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE0MzExMy82NjM3NjIzLmpwZw==/original/NH6K%2Fm.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE0MzExMy82NjM3NjIxLmpwZw==/original/y14Ioc.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE0MzExMy82NjM3NjIyLmpwZw==/original/z2bTNf.jpg]]






<p>Longing For Tranquility</p>
<blockquote>It has been <strong>quiet</strong> for a while, maybe <strong>too quiet</strong> - but I didn‚Äôt really care!&nbsp;It was the <strong>very last day before my retirement</strong> - and I was so <strong>ready for some peace and quiet!<br></strong>The name's <strong>Milvus!</strong> I was a <strong>Veteran Cleaner</strong> on my <strong>way out of the job - well almost!<br></strong><strong>Something came up ...&nbsp;</strong>and now I have to babysit <strong>Rookies!</strong></blockquote>
<p>Longing For Tranquility is a one-page adventure made for <a href="https://wuderpg.itch.io/clean-up-crew" target="_blank">Clean-Up Crew</a> - illuminated by LUMEN!</p>
<ul><li>Plug and Play!</li><li>Fast Paced Action</li><li>High Octane Gameplay</li><li>Kick-Ass fight!</li></ul>
<p>Even if you don't have any experience with LUMEN games, <strong>Longing For Tranquility</strong>&nbsp;is <strong>easy to&nbsp;pick up and just play</strong>.</p>
<h3></h3>
<h3>Reviewers say:</h3>
<blockquote>[Longing For Tranquility]&nbsp;sets a precedent for one-page Lumen games. 11/10<em></em><span></span></blockquote>
<blockquote class="text-right">Superb GM note: "Let the players KICK ASS"<br>My kind of game!</blockquote>
<blockquote>This looks so RAD!</blockquote>
<h3></h3>
<h3>Clean-Up Crew is Itchfunding</h3>
<p>We are currently Itchfunding Clean-Up Crew, because we are getting the most kick-ass artwork from a diverse team of 10 artists from all over the world and with representation from the LBGTQ+ community - and your contribution to Longing For Tranquility will feed directly into our funding goal!</p>
<h3>Backer Reward</h3>
<p>You can get Longing For Tranquility also as Backer Reward when you support Clean-Up Crew during our itchfunding campaign.</p>
<h3>Credit:</h3>
<p>Milvus artwork by MARCINs (@MARCINsRPGart)</p>
<p>Dice:&nbsp;<a href="https://speakthesky.itch.io/typeface-dicier" target="_blank">Dicier</a>&nbsp;by Speak the Sky<br></p>
<p>Longing For Tranquility&nbsp;is Illuminated by LUMEN, based on the LUMEN RPG system designed by Spencer Campbell, Gila RPGs. This game is in no way affiliated with Spencer Campbell or Gila RPGs.
<br><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc2MzI4NjQucG5n/original/%2BO2tB4.png" loading="lazy"></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMxMjY2NS83NjM3MjY5LnBuZw==/original/pMbNNe.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMxMjY2NS83NjM3MjcwLnBuZw==/original/WEpP9U.png]]






<p><strong>Loot the Plutes is the first full TTRPG published using the Four Points RPG System.</strong><br></p>
<p><strong>Overview</strong><br>In this game, you'll play as a gang of swashbuckling rogues in the hyper-capitalist plutocratic city of Gilderburg. The city&nbsp;is ruled over by the Circle, a group of six obscenely wealthy noble families.<br>Listen out for rumours, gather information, plan and attempt heists, evade the law&nbsp;and even use enchantments&nbsp;to literally steal from the rich and give to the poor.&nbsp;<br>Using Four Points, quickly make a character by choosing your Folk and area of roguish expertise, then you're ready to start looting!</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc1NzI0MjEucG5n/original/f5tlsY.png" loading="lazy"></p>
<figcaption>A small portion of the Circle's horded wealth.</figcaption>
<p></p>
<p><strong>The Folk of Gilderburg</strong><br>There are six playable Folk to choose from in Loot the Plutes. These are the Brell ( Catfolk), K'nach (Ratfolk), Leshvar (Lizardfolk), and the humanoid Hillfolk, Mountainfolk and Valleyfolk. Each Folk comes with a set of Traits and Abilities which have both narrative and mechanical applications.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc1NzI0MjIucG5n/original/C0DsJk.png" loading="lazy"></p>
<figcaption>Three nobles, each the head of one of the noble families of Gilderburg.</figcaption>
<p><strong>Game includes:<br></strong>- Setting lore and description<br>- Map of Gilderburg<br>- Six playable Folk<br>- Rules and Character creation mechanics<br>- Pre-Adventure discussion prompts and advice for safe play<br>- Guide (GM) section, including tips and roll tables<br>- Form-fillable character sheet<br></p>
<p><strong>Files Overview<br></strong>Loot the Plutes fully illustrated PDF. All illustrations are traditionally hand-drawn, in black and white.<br>The Loot the Plutes (Text Only) PDF,&nbsp;&nbsp;Rules Reference (Text Only) PDF, and Character Sheet (Word Document), are all formatted and tagged for screen-readers.</p>
<p><strong>The Four Points RPG System</strong><br>Four Points is an RPG System that focuses on Characters, Narrative, Player Agency and Customisation. This game includes all the necessary rules for playing it, and the unabridged Four Points SRD is now available on my itchio store!</p>
<p><strong>Community Copies</strong><br>I've made a number of Community Copies available.&nbsp;For every copy of Loot the Plutes that is purchased, another Community Copy will be added.</p>
<p><strong>Disclaimer<br></strong>Please note that the setting for Loot the Plutes is a capitalist hell-scape, but unlike our own real world version, it does not include any discrimination based on colour, appearance, disability, faith (or lack thereof), sex or gender. This game does not in any way encourage or attempt to legitimise bringing bigotry and hatred to the table.<br>The game includes a section covering safe play, with a link to a curated collection of various safety tools.&nbsp;<br>I have done my best to set everything up correctly, also with regards to accessibility. If there are any issues with the documents, please let me know in the comments.<br>Thanks and have fun!</p>
<p>I have made a playlist of music inspired by Loot the Plutes:&nbsp;<a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/3MUs6bGHtb1Od779RrVplc?si=fgzE5-PdS12O4edaa-R08A" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://open.spotify.com/playlist/3MUs6bGHtb1Od779RrVplc?si=fgzE5-PdS12O4edaa-R08A</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwMDQ5NS83NTY3MTI3LmpwZw==/original/AEpGe1.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwMDQ5NS83NTY2OTc3LmpwZw==/original/TJusNU.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwMDQ5NS83NTY2OTc0LmpwZw==/original/VShK04.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwMDQ5NS83NTY2OTczLmpwZw==/original/XdSlpm.jpg]]






<p><em>Time is running out. Following a blowout fight, you and a very close partner have decided to board starships leaving your home planet ‚Äî in opposite directions. The farther apart you travel, the greater the delay between your letters grows, and the shorter the windows of time you have to send them becomes. Can one of you build up the courage to break the wall between you and find closure before complete loss of signal?</em></p>
<p>An epistolary roleplaying game for two people. Created for #PlayByPostJam. Please feel free to comment with&nbsp;any questions you may have.</p>
<p class="text-right"><a href="http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img alt="Creative Commons License" style="border-width:0" src="https://i.creativecommons.org/l/by-sa/4.0/88x31.png" loading="lazy"></a><br><span>Loss of Signal</span> by <span>Noah Davis-Cheshire</span> is licensed under a <a href="http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License</a>.<br>Based on a work at <a href="https://flic.kr/s/aHsjXLQzZx" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://flic.kr/s/aHsjXLQzZx</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ5MTU1ODMucG5n/original/M0sz8S.png]]






<p>A 1-2 player journaling/storytelling game of&nbsp;war, loss, hope, and reflection from the cockpit of a deteriorating giant robot.</p><p class="text-center"><em>‚ÄúI definitely recommend this game. For $7, I absolutely think it is worth that. If you only play it one time, I definitely think it is worth the $7 price point. This is a game that is my first experience [with solo RPGS], it worked well. My nitpicks aside, I think it gives you everything that you need.‚Äù ‚Äì Michael, <a href="https://therpgacademy.com/the-reviews-lost-among-the-starlit-wreckage/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">The RPG Academy</a>, Rating: B+
  </em></p>
<p class="text-center"><em>‚ÄúI had such a good experience playing this game, and what makes it such a high rating for me is that this is a game that I would absolutely recommend somebody play for their first solo RPG.‚Äù ‚Äì Tom, The RPG Academy, Rating: A</em></p>
<p>You are a mecha pilot. You have piloted your humanoid machine across the surface of the earth, through the void of space, and among the shattered hulls of space colonies. You have fought a war that has seen cities consumed by fire, fleets of ships struck down by energy weapons, and mecha immolated by their own stricken reactors. You have survived all the way to today, the last battle of the war, waged in the void. Now, your survival is more uncertain than it has ever been.</p>
<p>The visual cacophony of both sides tearing into one another has faded, replaced by the silence of wrecked machines, an open grave of floating bodies, and the last gutters of fire as atmosphere and fuel are consumed from broken ships. Your mecha is laid low, its diagnostic screen awash in the black and red of dead and dying systems as you drift among the debris.&nbsp;</p>
<p>All you have is a dying mecha, an open communications channel, and your thoughts and memories - and the vague hope that someone will find you Lost Among The Starlit Wreckage before it‚Äôs too late.</p>
<p>You can get Print-on-Demand copies <a href="https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/378986/Lost-Among-The-Starlit-Wreckage" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a>, and find examples of play <a href="https://cannibalhalflinggaming.com/2021/05/25/lost-among-the-starlit-wreckage-warden-one/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a>&nbsp;and <a href="https://mancalledtrue.dreamwidth.org/317616.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a>.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTM4MDMwLzc1NjIxNTEucG5n/original/01KHqY.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTM4MDMwLzc0MjE4OTMucG5n/original/qKRXNj.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTM4MDMwLzU1NTg5NDkucG5n/original/HOPoOz.png]]






<p>Lost at Sea is&nbsp;a solo journaling game of finding land in an unforgiving ocean. In order to play you will need somewhere to document your journey, preferably a physical journal, two ten sided dice, and a tarot deck.&nbsp;</p>
<p>This game takes 30-60 minutes to complete.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxMjMwMC84MjI3NTY4LnBuZw==/original/Fjjn3w.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxMjMwMC84MjI3NTcyLnBuZw==/original/ZDVf2K.png]]






<p>The&nbsp;Lost City of Talghor was the seat of the empire ages past, now it's a cursed city that draw adventurers from all over the Empires seeking riches, power or freedom.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The set was designed for the Paper Mini Jam, and is to be used in tabletop rpgs and war games.</p>
<p>The Set contains:</p>
<p>4 factions with each characters each: The Knights, The Mages, The Cultists and The Rebels.</p>
<p>Paper miniature of all 16 characters in 2 sizes, 28mm that is used by most tabletop rpgs and a smaller size that is more of a personal taste.</p>
<p>All characters also in a png file for Vttrpgs apps.</p>
<p>A small e-book with some quick lore about the factions and the city.</p>
<p>Free version of the Paper Miniatures and Vttrpg tokens presenting one character of each factions, and for the print only the Front of the character is available in the free version.</p>
<p>(The tokens was tested only in the&nbsp;Roll20 app, so they can have issues in other apps, any feedback about this is very helpfu).</p>
<p>Any issues and feedback are appreciated, but be gentle. =)</p>
<p>Thank you so much!</p>
<p>Raul</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE1Mjk3NC82Njk3NDMzLnBuZw==/original/LUx5T3.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE1Mjk3NC82Njk3NDM1LnBuZw==/original/YKFoyJ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE1Mjk3NC82Njk3NDM2LnBuZw==/original/Gdb5eY.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE1Mjk3NC82Njk3NDM0LnBuZw==/original/FAdj%2Fv.png]]






<p><em>Since a few years strange lizard folk seem to have set up camp in the&nbsp;<strong>Darkspire mountains</strong>. The smolfolk of&nbsp;<strong>Gillingsburg</strong></em><em>&nbsp;don't like it much, like they dislike any change. Recently folk have started disappearing. At first only out-of-towners were missing, so the people of Gillingsburg didn't worry much, but now more people are gone, and it's starting to have an impact on the amount of fresh turnips at the weekly market, people are getting antsy.</em></p>
<h2>What is this?</h2>
<p>An old school hexcrawl adventure for <a href="https://ozbrowning.itch.io/ozr" target="_blank">OZR</a>, written for the&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/jam/ozrjam" target="_blank">#ozrjam</a> &amp; the&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/jam/random-adventure-jam" target="_blank">#AdventureJam</a>.</p>
<p>The pamphlet contains NPC &amp; monster stats for OZR, the accompanying bookmark (#statmark) adds stats for&nbsp;<a href="https://emielboven.itch.io/durf" target="_blank">DURF</a>.</p>
<p>Hex tiles by <a href="https://natetreme.itch.io/" target="_blank">Nate Treme</a> (<em>Highland Paranormal Society</em>).&nbsp;Character art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Bertdrawsstuff" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Bertdrawsstuff</a>.&nbsp;Lizard portraits by <a href="https://twitter.com/EvlynMoreau" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Evlyn Moreau</a>.&nbsp;</p>
<p>For use with <strong>OZR</strong> by Oz Browning or <strong>DURF</strong> by Emiel Boven, but easily converted to your analog adventure game of choice.</p><h3>Newsletter</h3>
<p>Want to keep track of what I'm doing? Subscribe to my&nbsp;<a href="https://tinyletter.com/monstermind" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">newsletter</a>&nbsp;and be the first to know about my games in development.</p><p><br></p>
<p><span></span></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNTgzMC83NzcyMDU4LnBuZw==/original/p22V8k.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNTgzMC83NzcyMDU3LnBuZw==/original/wBjsx1.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNTgzMC83NzcyMDYxLnBuZw==/original/pHxKa4.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNTgzMC83NzcyMDYwLnBuZw==/original/NiZc5d.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNTgzMC83NzcyMTIyLnBuZw==/original/26jiV2.png]]






<p>LZ13 is the unluckiest place on this god forsaken moon, totally screwed by the terraforming project. Only the Mining Operations keep this damn LZ staffed. And yet for whatever reason, you find yourself here. Escape the freezing cold, unnatural snowstorm and an alien hivemind.&nbsp;<br></p>
<p>Words and layout by <strong>MV</strong><br>Map by <strong>Dyson Logos</strong><br>Editing by <strong>Ava Islam</strong><br></p>
<h2>What's inside?</h2>
<p>LZ13 is a system agnostic scenario, recommended for sci-fi horror and investigative games. <br>In this A4 bifold you will find:<br></p>
<ul><li>Keyed map of the landing zone</li><li>Three hooks of varying challenge</li><li>Hivemind monster made of ice</li><li>Frozen undead personnel </li><li>Snowstorms way too intense for a small moon</li></ul>
<h2>Want more stuff like this?</h2>
<ul><li><a href="https://ian-yusem.itch.io/moonbase-blues" target="_blank">Moonbase Blues by Ian Yusem</a></li><li><a href="https://technoskald.itch.io/welcome-to-erf" target="_blank">Welcome to Erf by Technoskald</a></li><li><a href="https://tuesdayknightgames.itch.io/mothership-the-haunting-of-ypsilon-14" target="_blank">The Haunting of Ypsilon 14 by TKG<br></a></li></ul>
<p>Using <a href="https://vandelarden.itch.io/13-engraved-textures" target="_blank">Engraved Textures by Vendel Arden</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI0NDMwNi83MzEwNjc5LnBuZw==/original/tjnt3Z.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI0NDMwNi83MzEwNjcwLnBuZw==/original/139vCu.png]]






<<list-links "[tag[macOS]sort[title]]">>







<p><strong>"Magical Pets" is a cute little&nbsp;game&nbsp;</strong><strong>where you are the pets of students or teachers at a magic school. Since your humans are busy all the time, it falls to you to take care of various problems that befall the school...</strong></p>
<p>This is a two-page table-top role-playing game (TTRPG) for 2-6 players and&nbsp;a GM.<br></p>
<p>Become a gruff miniature unicorn who can read, an elegant sheep with an excellent nose, an eccentric cat who can levitate small items, a clumsy raven&nbsp;who specializes in fluffiness or any other talented, magical pet you want to be.</p>
<p>This rules-light&nbsp;game&nbsp;(a&nbsp;hack of&nbsp;<a href="https://johnharper.itch.io/lasers-feelings" target="_blank">Lasers &amp; Feelings</a>) is ideal&nbsp;for a no-prep/low-prep one-shot or few-shot. You can also use it as a starting point for a longer campaign and just keep playing to find out what happens next.<br>Further inspiration:&nbsp;<a href="https://shardsofblue.itch.io/library-cats" target="_blank">Library Cats</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://rjmakes.itch.io/magic-muggle-stuff">Magic &amp; Muggle Stuff</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://kpetker.itch.io/magic-mischief" target="_blank">Magic &amp; Mischief</a>.</p>
<p><span></span>The PDF (available in English and German)&nbsp;contains everything you need to play:<br></p>
<ul><li>instructions for character creation</li><li>random-roll tables for&nbsp;school details and threat scenarios</li><li>GM directions</li><li>questions for character development and group cohesion</li><li>several cute illustrations</li></ul>
<p>Just add 3 six-sided dice and perhaps some paper and a pen to take notes and you're good to go!</p>
<p>To make the game more accessible, there's also an HTML version&nbsp;of the entire game that you can download and open in a browser of your choice (instructions are included in the ZIP).<br></p>
<p><em>Please note that the spreads PDF is formatted in DIN A4. You may need to&nbsp;adjust&nbsp;your printer settings ("scale to fit")&nbsp;</em><em>if you use a different paper format.</em><span></span></p>
<p class="text-center">***</p>
<p><span></span></p>
<p><strong>"Magical Pets" ist ein niedliches, kleines Spiel, in dem ihr die Haustiere von Sch√ºler*innen oder Lehrer*innen einer Zauberschule seid. Weil eure Menschen dauernd besch√§ftigt sind, bleibt es euch √ºberlassen,&nbsp;euch um verschiedene Probleme zu k√ºmmern, die der Schule widerfahren...</strong></p>
<p>Dies ist ein zweiseitiges Pen&amp;Paper-Rollenspiel (PnP) f√ºr 2-6 Spielende und eine*n Spielleitung (SL).</p>
<p>Werde ein ruppiges Zwergeinhorn, das lesen kann; ein elegantes Schaf mit einer exzellenten Nase; eine exzentrische Katze, die kleine Gegenst√§nde schweben lassen kann, ein tollpatschiger Rabe, der sich auf Flauschigkeit spezialisiert hat oder irgendein anderes talentiertes, magisches Haustier, das du sein m√∂chtest.</p>
<p><span></span></p>
<p>Dieses regelleichte Spiel (ein Hack von&nbsp;<a href="https://johnharper.itch.io/lasers-feelings" target="_blank">Lasers &amp; Feelings</a>) ist ideal f√ºr Oneshots oder Fewshots mit wenig oder gar keiner Vorbereitung.&nbsp;Du kannst&nbsp;es auch als Ausgangspunkt f√ºr eine l√§ngere Kampagne benutzen und einfach weiter spielen, um herauszufinden, was als n√§chstes passiert.<br>Weitere Inspirationen:&nbsp;<a href="https://shardsofblue.itch.io/library-cats" target="_blank">Library Cats</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://rjmakes.itch.io/magic-muggle-stuff">Magic &amp; Muggle Stuff</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://kpetker.itch.io/magic-mischief" target="_blank">Magic &amp; Mischief</a>.</p>
<p>Das PDF (auf Deutsch und Englisch erh√§ltlich) enth√§lt alles, was ihr zum Spielen braucht:</p>
<ul><li>eine Anleitung zur Charaktererstellung</li><li>Zufallstabellen f√ºr Schulmerkmale und Bedrohungen</li><li>Hinweise f√ºr die Spielleitung</li><li>Fragen zur Charakterentwicklung und zum&nbsp;Gruppenzusammenhang</li><li>mehrere niedliche Illustrationen</li></ul>
<p>F√ºge einfach 3 sechsseitige W√ºrfel hinzu, sowie vielleicht etwas Papier und einen Stift zum Notizen&nbsp;machen und schon kann's losgehen!</p>
<p>Um das Spiel barrierefreier zu machen, gibt es weiterhin eine HTML-Version des gesamten Spiels, die du herunterladen und in einem Browser deiner Wahl √∂ffnen kannst (eine Anleitung daf√ºr ist im ZIP enthalten).</p>
<p><em>Beachte bitte, dass das Dokument auf DIN A4 formatiert ist. Eventuell musst du deine Druckereinstellungen anpassen (auf Seite anpassen), wenn du ein anderes Papierformat benutzt.</em><span></span><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTExMjk4LzY4MjAxMzIucG5n/original/4cJBIA.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTExMjk4LzY4MjAxMzMucG5n/original/7zisdo.png]]






<p><span></span></p>
<p>In the psychedelic shared hallucination of cyberspace‚ÄîMainframe‚ÄîAI programs roam freely. Self-replicating and self-editing, they've turned&nbsp;our shared online consciousness into&nbsp;a deep dream, observing us to simulate anything we might want to do in the digital playground we now inhabit.&nbsp;<br></p>
<p><em>Mainframe</em> is a&nbsp;cyberpunk&nbsp;hack of <a href="https://natetreme.itch.io/tunnelgoons" target="_blank">Tunnel Goons</a>&nbsp;in which you&nbsp;play as mercenaries who specialize in hunting down and capturing or deleting corporate&nbsp;AI programs. You have no body, your consciousness permanently wired into Mainframe. Each session is a mission to find and deal with one of these programs.<br></p>
<p>Explore the never-ending surreal servers of Mainframe as you fight to stop megacorporations from taking control of cyberspace entirely.</p>
<p>Inspired by the Witcher, Neuromancer, Counter/Weight by <a href="https://friendsatthetable.net/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Friends at the Table</a>, and <a href="https://punkpadour.itch.io/yokai-hunter" target="_blank">Yokai Hunter's Society</a>, this game is about exploring a strange version of cyberspace, digging into Megacorps' dirt, and scrounging for work in gritty neon world.&nbsp;</p>
<p>You'll need a few six-sided dice, a GM, 2-4 players, and 2-3 hours to play.</p><p>Print copies are available here:&nbsp;<a href="https://floatingchair.club/products/mainframe" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://floatingchair.club/products/mainframe</a></p>
<h3>Features:</h3>
<ul><li>15+ pieces of full-color, AI-enhanced art</li><li>A game based on Nate Treme's award-winning Tunnel Goons</li><li>Rules-light play</li><li>A table of mission ideas for little to no prep GMing</li></ul>
<h3>What's Included</h3>
<p>Your purchase of this game includes:</p>
<ul><li>A 60-page full color PDF, in singles and spreads</li><li>A character sheet for easy printing</li><li>Access to any updates for this game in the future</li></ul>
<p></p>
<p><br></p>
<p></p>
