[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTExNjcxMi82NDU0ODU1LnBuZw==/original/di%2BxrV.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTExNjcxMi82NDU0ODU0LnBuZw==/original/3Va6a7.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTExNjcxMi82NDU0ODUzLnBuZw==/original/N%2F107M.png]]






<figure><em style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit"><strong><a href="https://www.exaltedfuneral.com/products/operatives-and-civilians" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgzMTczMTQucG5n/original/QYqtwP.png" loading="lazy"></a><br></strong></em><br></figure>
<p><em>Your name is Schmichael Schwesten. You used to be a spy.</em></p>
<p>Welcome to <strong>Operatives &amp; Civilians</strong>, a 3-6 person, episodic, <em>Burn Notice-</em>inspired <strong><a href="https://johnharper.itch.io/lasers-feelings" target="_blank">Lasers &amp; Feelings</a> </strong>hack<span class=""> following a mish-mashed team of do-gooders with</span> legally questionable methods, equally questionable pasts, and more sense than cash.<br></p>
<p>Using L&amp;F's famously simple d6 roll-over/under system, you and your friends take on all kinds of odd and dangerous jobs, using your <strong>OPERATIVE </strong>and <strong>CIVILIAN </strong>skills to<span class=""> solve hard</span> problems for people <span class="">who are in</span> over their heads. If you're not familiar with <em>Burn Notice</em>, this means</p>
<ul><li>pretending to be people you're not,</li><li>improvising gear out of everyday household items,</li><li>driving fast and shooting faster,</li></ul>
<p>all without attracting too much attention from the police or feds.</p>
<p>Can you help your client, stay out of legal trouble, scrape up some cash, and make it back home in time for mojitos? Gather up two to five more friends and find out!</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc5OTQzMzkucG5n/original/l7%2Fx9U.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>The<strong> Operatives &amp; Civilians</strong> brochure features‚Ä¶
</p>
<ul><li>Concise rules for playing the game
</li><li>Easy-to-use tables to generate characters and jobs
</li><li>A simplified map of Miami to mark home base and follow the team‚Äôs action</li></ul>
<p>Written and designed for <a href="https://www.zinemonth.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Zine Month 2022</a>.<br></p>
<figure><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc5ODczOTMucG5n/original/sEX16O.png" loading="lazy"><br><br>Talk TTRPGs and more on <a href="https://twitter.com/bammaxgaming" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Twitter</a>!<br></figure>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM3MTMyMC83OTg2NTI3LnBuZw==/original/%2FrSTlL.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM3MTMyMC83OTg3NDgwLnBuZw==/original/bFbvdj.png]]






<p><strong>OrcFuck</strong> is a game about intimacy, love, sometimes pain, and fucking/getting fucked by/just fucking around with orcs. It is a 2-player game, with one player taking the role of the <strong>Orc</strong>, and one player taking the role of the <strong>Orcfucker.</strong><br></p>
<p>Orcs are hot. <em>Everybody knows this.</em> Their incredible <strong>musculature</strong>, their brutal and powerful <strong>attitudes</strong>, and those <strong>sexy, sexy tusks</strong>. Who could resist? Certainly not you. Somehow, someway, you were able to convince an Orc to fool around with you. Maybe they‚Äôre a longtime friend and dungeon party member who you‚Äôve been pining after. Maybe they‚Äôre a stranger who caught your eye in a local tavern, and you‚Äôve snuck away together. Maybe they‚Äôre your partner, and you‚Äôve decided to just have a nice night.
</p>
<p>Either way, you‚Äôre just two consenting adults ready to bone down. 
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYyMDI0NzMucG5n/original/bMrKDC.png]]






<$list filter="[is[current]has:field[url]]">
''Original Url'': {{!!url}}&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</$list>






<p><em>Orizuru </em>is a single-player tabletop story game about transforming into a beautiful bird.</p>
<p>You‚Äôll play a character who undertakes some kind of transformational quest to take themselves from who they are now, to becoming something new.</p>
<p>You‚Äôll take a square piece of paper, write on it, fold it and reflect on the result.</p>
<p><em>Orizuru</em> is the third in a series of shortform story games written by Marcus Shepherd of <strong>Blue Golem Games</strong>. It's complete, but feedback and reviews are invaluable for any future development.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p><em>Note: When downloading the game, please also download the folding instructions.</em><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p></p>
<p><em>Cover image: </em>Derivative of ‚Äú<a href="https://www.maxpixel.net/Origami-Paper-Crane-Crane-248335" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Origami Paper Crane Crane</a>‚Äù (retrieved from <a href="https://www.maxpixel.net/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Max Pixel</a>, no image credit provided), used under <a href="https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/deed.en" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">CC0 1.0 Universal</a>.&nbsp;</p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzIyNjc1MDIuanBn/original/O3E0hR.jpg]]






<h1><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI2ODQ5MjgucG5n/original/FQFrt%2F.png" loading="lazy"></h1>
<h1>What is Our Final Gathering?</h1>
<p>This is a game about telling the stories of a few individuals who have had their lives intertwine throughout all of history. From the very beginnings of when they thought they were all mortal, through the times where they had one another‚Äôs backs and the times when they wanted to put knives into those same backs. Our Final Gathering is a game about relationships and how they change throughout the years, when those years are actually centuries. It‚Äôs also a game about history, playing these characters during major events from this world‚Äôs past. Most of all, it is a game about finding yourself while you fight for your life against friends and foes alike.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI2ODQ5MDcucG5n/original/i7aHIi.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<h1>The Basics:</h1>
<p>This game combines the narrative, GM-less storytelling of Reflections combined with the tumbling tower building and tension of Dread as you play Highlander-esque immortals bent on killing the other player characters, because there can be only one!</p>
<p>The game takes place at the scene of an event called the Final Gathering, a showdown between the last remaining Immortals, and will be played in a series of flashback scenes. The scenes involve two or more players and detail a part of their lives together in the past from hundreds of years ago to the present. Scenes will take place in a single location at a single point in time and will involve everyone who is set up to be included in the flashback. Before a scene begins, each player will secretly pick a goal from a list of four goals that range from Easy, 1 pull, to Difficult, 4 pulls. If your goal is achieved in a scene, once the scene ends, you become the Attacker and start by pulling one brick as an Attack, holding onto this brick for use at a later time. The opponent who fulfilled your goal, referred to as the Defender, will need to pull a number of bricks equal to the difficulty level of the goal.</p>
<p>If the tower falls at this point, the scene will transition out of the flashback to the Final Gathering where you will describe the Attacker killing and beheading the Defender, which is the only way to kill an immortal. Do you do so with regret? Remorse? Anger? These could be friends from centuries past or they could be bitter enemies that have eluded you all these years. They could even be friends turned sour, or visa versa. The story will unravel the more you play. If the player whose character died had any reserve bricks, these pass to the player whose character killed them to represent the transfer of their immortal power. Also, their character sheet, along with any secrets built up along the way, pass to the other player to represent the transfer of their immortal knowledge.</p>
<p>If there is still more than one player left in the game, the remaining players rebuild the tower. You only rebuild the tower using the blocks that are not being reserved by other players at the table, however you may decide to put one or more reserved bricks onto the tower at this point in case you didn‚Äôt want to hold onto them any longer. Once the tower is rebuilt, pull 3 bricks for every player that has been eliminated plus 3. This is done one brick at a time with normal rules, and will start with the player whose goal was last achieved and proceed around the table until the correct number of bricks are pulled.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI2ODQ5MDgucG5n/original/Wa0IwN.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<h1>Materials Needed and Setup:</h1>
<p>To play the game, you will need a tumbling tower made of 54 wooden blocks. Each block is three times as long as it is wide, and one fifth as thick as its length, and should have some small, random variations to make things more difficult in pulling. You also will need the character sheets, scenarios and goal cards printed out to use throughout the game.</p>
<p>To start the game, stack the initial tower with eighteen levels of three blocks placed adjacent to one another along their long side and at right angles to the previous level. This should be done on a sturdy surface, such as a table, where players can easily gain access to pulling from any angle without jostling the table too much.</p>
<p>Once the tower is built, before the first scene is set, we will need to prime the tower. Start with the player to the left of the scene setter. Players pull and place one brick, continuing to the left after every pull, until 3 bricks are pulled. Then play begins.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTE2OTc3LzY1OTk0ODgucG5n/original/4xInFK.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTE2OTc3LzY1OTk0ODcucG5n/original/95qpuL.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTE2OTc3LzY1OTk0OTIucG5n/original/g7Xat2.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTE2OTc3LzY1OTk0OTQucG5n/original/52PrPi.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTE2OTc3LzY1OTk1MjkucG5n/original/NVgz5N.png]]






<p>Our god is dead is a comedy role-playing game about clerics hiding the fact that their god has died just before a celebration in their god's honor. Players will take on the role of devotees to their god and start scheming up increasingly impractical miracles in order to fool everyone else into thinking their god is still alive. How long can you keep the charade up?<br></p>
<p>The game doesn't need a game master and is played in a single session. There isn't any prep or character creation, so you can jump straight into playing, all you need are six-sided dice. Enjoy!</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU3NjEwODAucG5n/original/n7or6p.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU3NjA5ODUucG5n/original/TC8zYC.png]]






<p>Our Innermost Thoughts is a small collection of five RPGs played mostly solitaire. They are experiences about how to find your passion and your voice despite the flaws you have, about how to reconcile the fact that humankind's reign on earth has brought destruction to nature, about how communicating with others who do not look or talk like you is difficult, about observing others intentionally can begin the process of self-reflecting on our means of wrongful judgments of others, and about the beauty of finding joy in the lives and stories of others. These experiences ask a lot of questions, forcing you to reflect on who you are, your background, your status, and possibly even some aspects that have been hidden up to now.</p><p><u><strong><a href="https://www.presspot.games/store/p/our-innermost-thoughts" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Go here to purchase a physical copy</a>.</strong></u></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA0NDc0LzM4OTI4NTAuanBn/original/S7cQK4.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA0NDc0LzYxODM5MzMucG5n/original/PeKlkQ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzA0NDc0LzYxODM5MzIucG5n/original/%2F3mme3.png]]






<p></p>
<h1>Our Vale of Discontent is a community-based RPG setting featuring sentient oozes, solarpunk vistas, rioting union workers, and a story telling fungi with no name.&nbsp;</h1>
<p>Funded through Zinequest 2020!
</p>
<p>Designed to be droppable into almost any campaign, this is a setting that focuses on being evocative over exhaustive. This will be broadly usable with any old school system as well as 5e. The focus is not just on the fantastical world, but on what that means to the players and how it interacts with their beliefs.
</p>
<p>&nbsp;
</p>
<p>Our Vale of Discontent details a community on the brink of war with itself. Two tribes brought to conflict over their legacies. While the players may choose sides, the focus is not on war but on community.&nbsp;
</p>
<p>The Pingks, named for the tinkling sound of glass, have pushed the power of wind and glass to new frontiers in their mountain homes.&nbsp;Led by the resolute Condis Silico, they have kept dominion over those in the valley, the Drpock, and crushed their recent rebellion. Condis wants nothing more than to reclaim the peak her ancestors lost, regardless of how it tears apart everything around her. She doesn't understand what truly haunts the peak, or the manipulation that lurks around her.
</p>
<p>The Drpock, named for the sound of dripping water, are trying to rebuild and meet greater tribute demands from the Pingks. They have abandoned cultural rules around business and given ever greater power to industry. Even the oozes, a manifestation of their stories, have become commodities to be exported. They pull more heat from the ground and earth from their mines; how much longer can they sustain this pace?
</p>
<p>The Fwoom, named for the sound of their vacuums, are the workers who brave the caves and harvest the oozes.&nbsp;As hardships grow so do their demands for justice. The continual escalation and the refusal by the company to address their concerns means that it won't be long before they must take up arms.
</p>
<p>The KRRKT, named for the sound of a reloading rifle, are a mounting resistance dissatisfied by all sides. They strike at night and wield weapons of clay long forgotten. They want peace and they want it to be fair for all.
</p>
<p>Will the adventurers ally themselves with the Pingks and Silico‚Äôs vanity project, band together with the Drpock with their ooze-merchandising enterprise, or join forces with the discontent uprising from both tribes?
</p>
<p>Our Vale of Discontent is a 36-page self-contained adventure with no fixed settings. It is designed to be dropped into an existing campaign or run as a one-shot. Broadly compatible with most fantasy or modern settings, the zine contains:
</p>
<ul><li>XP systems centered around building community
</li><li>Descriptions of both tribes, the ooze harvester union, and the bubbling resistance
</li><li>A dynamic escalation system to make the events that unfold your own
</li><li>Oozes, given character and life
</li><li>A description of the valley and surrounding mountains
</li><li>A guide to unions and organizing within RPG worlds
</li><li>Methods of introducing solarpunk technology to your game
</li><li>Random tables for NPC relationship generation, flora, &nbsp;and more.
</li><li>Stats for NPCs and creatures compatible with OSR / 5e game
</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc0NDI5ODcucG5n/original/BSsXXU.png]]






<p>On the Western Front of the Great War, you and your fellow soldiers squat in the muddy trenches, ducking to avoid artillery shells and hoping that the trench fever gets the other side before it gets you. Soon the order will come, and you‚Äôll all go up, over the top, and into the waiting guns.&nbsp;<br></p>
<p>This GMless roleplaying game allows you to tell the stories of a squad of soldiers as they are forced to throw themselves against increasingly impossible odds.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM5MDMxMjYucG5n/original/wNYm2f.png]]






<h1>What is OZR?</h1>
<p>OZR is a lightweight framework for running OSR-ish adventure games, inspired by&nbsp;<a href="https://jasontocci.itch.io/2400" target="_blank">2400</a> by Jason Tocci, <a href="https://lampblack-and-brimstone.com/2019/02/freebooters-on-the-frontier-2e-playtest-update/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Freebooters on the Frontier</a> by Jason Lutes, <a href="https://chrismcdee.itch.io/electric-bastionland" target="_blank">Into the Odd</a> by Chris McDowell, <a href="https://mausritter.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Mausritter</a> by Isaac Williams,&nbsp;<a href="https://s-jared.itch.io/so-you-want-to-be-an-adventurer" target="_blank">So You Want To Be An Adventurer?</a> by Jared Sinclair, and a bunch of old editions of D&amp;D.</p>
<p>It includes a very lightweight system&nbsp;for&nbsp;creating characters, avoiding danger,&nbsp;tracking injury and exhaustion, travel, and improving your character through experience, as well as&nbsp;advice for refs&nbsp;on preparing for play, building encounters, and running the game.<span></span></p>
<p>It&nbsp;was written by <a href="https://ozbrowing.itch.io" target="_blank">Oz Browning</a>, with development and editing by <a href="https://quorumofsand.itch.io/" target="_blank">Matthew K</a>, and illustrations by&nbsp;<a href="https://bertdrawsstuff.myportfolio.com/" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Bert of Bertdrawsstuff</a>.</p>
<h1>Print version</h1>
<p>The physical version of OZR is available from&nbsp;<a href="https://www.rookspress.com/products/ozr" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Rook's Press</a>&nbsp;and <a href="https://rattiincantati.com/products/ozr" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">ratti incantati</a>&nbsp;(including a download code for the PDF version), printed by <a href="https://footprinters.co.uk" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Footprint Workers Co-op</a>.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTg5MjUyLzY5NjY1MzQucG5n/original/zGe%2F9b.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTg5MjUyLzY5NjY1MzUucG5n/original/WLx8Bm.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTg5MjUyLzY5NjY1MzYucG5n/original/c5zuqZ.png]]






<p><em>There are foul people all across this accursed place. Ones who do dark, terrible deeds and yet feel free to walk the earth. The world is dying, but justice is immortal. You hunt those who have escaped bondage and will return them to their rightful place: inside a cold, dark cell.<br></em></p>
<p><em></em><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc1MjgxMjcucG5n/original/ELdtrz.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>Discover your far away home, use a unique boon granted to you by your liege, and pursue those who would defile the laws of the land. </p>
<p>PALLID JAILOR is a new player class for Mork Borg written and designed by Christian Sorrell based on <a href="https://christiansorrell.itch.io/small-old-kingdom-of-somnaire">The Small Old Kingdom of Somnaire</a>. Art is public domain.<br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc1MjgyNTYucG5n/original/P%2BdR2%2B.png" loading="lazy"><br><br>PALLID JAILOR is an independent production by Christian Sorrell and is  not affiliated with Ockult √ñrtm√§stare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is  published under the M√ñRK BORG Third Party License.
 M√ñRK BORG is copyright Ockult √ñrtm√§stare Games and Stockholm Kartell. <br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5NDAyMS83NTI4MjkxLmpwZw==/original/7E3kyi.jpg]]






<p><strong>A Freeform High-Fantasy Grand Strategy Game</strong></p>
<p><strong>Pantheon&nbsp;Planning</strong> is a hack/reskin of <a href="https://mraston.itch.io/empyrean-dynasty">Empyrean&nbsp;Dynasty</a>&nbsp;by <a href="https://mraston.itch.io"><strong>Michael&nbsp;Raston</strong></a> and&nbsp;<a href="https://jamzilla.itch.io"><strong>James Millichamp</strong></a>. Support them and their game(s)!</p>
<p>Pantheon Planning is a game about the everlasting lifes of gods and their relationship with the world they theoretically govern and represent.</p>
<p>The game begins with the birth of the gods themselves and then records the mighty, strange and weird history of how these gods shall interact with the world.</p>
<p>Play eons of mythological history as the gods of a world to find out who becomes the supreme ruler of the pantheon, played in turns representing ever-shortening periods of time or played freely as some type of crazy theoretically everlasting campaign.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1ODU4NC83OTA5OTk3LmpwZw==/original/IUbg%2By.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1ODU4NC83OTEwMDAzLmpwZw==/original/F7RjEu.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1ODU4NC83OTEwMDEyLmpwZw==/original/XgqX12.jpg]]






<p><strong>A tiny, terrible ruler and his fungal warband for <a href="https://morkborg.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">M√ñRK BORG</a></strong><strong></strong><br></p>
<p><strong>Inspired by the wonderful art of <a href="https://www.patreon.com/evlynmoreau/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Evlyn Moreau</a> (available for use via Patreon)</strong><strong><br></strong></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc0Njc0OTkucG5n/original/HGYZ1H.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>PAPA MUSH is an independent production by Christian Sorrell and is not affiliated with Ockult √ñrtm√§stare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the M√ñRK BORG Third Party License.</p>
<p>M√ñRK BORG is copyright Ockult √ñrtm√§stare Games and Stockholm Kartell. <br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI4MzA4NS83NDY3MTgyLnBuZw==/original/k8Kfvq.png]]






<p>This guidebook is designed to supplement Paradigm Adventures: The Pocket Role Playing Game with advice on how to make your own worlds/modules for the game. it also has advice on how to game master for both novices and veterans.</p><p><br></p><p>It's advised to already have Paradigm Adventures: The Pocket Role Playing Game to supplement this booklet with.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgyNjczNTQucG5n/original/Ll%2FH7k.png]]






<p>Are you new to running or being a part of a table top role playing game? Do you want a quick-to-learn game that's easy to pick up and play with a small number of friends?&nbsp;Paradigm Adventures: The Pocket Roleplaying Game is designed for quick role playing games and for newcomers to get into the genre!&nbsp;</p>
<p>Instead of focusing on a theme, Paradigm Adventures: The Pocket Roleplaying Game focuses on using its malleable rule set to any theme the Game Master and players desire. That's right, these rules can be used for any settings that can be thought of! The game's only limit is the players' imaginations.</p>
<p>PDF rule book is only 14 pages long</p>
<p>This game can be played with 2-6 people</p>
<p>The playtime is 30+ minutes long (It really depends on how long you want to play it for. You can pick up the game again at a later date, too)</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgxOTkyMjIucG5n/original/Zq%2F27c.png]]






<p>Paranormal is a two-player competitive, yet collaborative, storytelling game. A hunter, and a spirit will create a story&nbsp;between the two using narrative storytelling, and competitive mechanics</p>
<p>Included in this PDF are 12 full color pages of&nbsp;rules to aid the two players&nbsp;in creating a haunting story.</p>
<p>Join our discord and ask for help with any confusion, or questions!&nbsp;</p>
<p><a href="https://discord.gg/5guPbwTX2A" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://discord.gg/5guPbwTX2A</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY5Njg5NjIucG5n/original/eZPWAs.png]]






<p>Paranormal Hunters Organization (PHO) is a hack for the game Lasers &amp; Feelings by John Harper. In PHO, you are a member of the Paranormal Hunters Organization (PHO), a small group of paranormal investigators with high hopes of connecting to the ‚Äúother side‚Äù. Your crew‚Äôs goal is to go to haunted places, investigate for clues, and gather evidence of paranormal activity.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc0ODM1NjQucG5n/original/KulBFm.png]]






<p>Fight giant bugs and gain strange abilities in a post-apocalyptic setting<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzU4Ny83Nzg1NjIwLnBuZw==/original/efo6TW.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzU4Ny83Nzg1NjYxLnBuZw==/original/y3yB71.png]]






<p><em>After years of war, you've been told to parley with your enemy in a neutral village. This gives you the chance to learn more about your enemy you might not have had the opportunity to observe outside of battle. Will what you learn encourage you to push for peace, or will it lead to more violence?</em></p>
<p>Parlay is solo journaling game that uses the SGS system. It&nbsp;asks the question, "Is it better or worse to know thy enemy?" Roll a d20 and expand your knowledge&nbsp;about your enemy, the local village, and yourself to find out.<br></p>
<p><em></em></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2ODk5Ni84MzQ1NTY0LnBuZw==/original/P2aTQN.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2ODk5Ni84MzI3NjM1LnBuZw==/original/Z5%2FKx2.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2ODk5Ni84MzI3NjM2LnBuZw==/original/uz9tn0.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2ODk5Ni84MzI3NjM4LnBuZw==/original/KEUcKG.png]]






<p>Do you like animals? Do you like partying? As in, going out in a party and risking your life? If so, PARTY ANIMALS is the game for you! Go out in adventures with your Band, get hurt, get sad, get better!&nbsp;<br><br>PARTY ANIMALS is a game built on the <a href="https://titanomachyrpg.itch.io/caltropcore">Caltrop Core</a> by <a href="https://titanomachyrpg.itch.io/">Titanomachy</a></p>
<p>You can find me on Twitter <a href="https://twitter.com/dani_belonia" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@dani_belonia</a></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI3NjUyNy83NDMxODcxLnBuZw==/original/250E3d.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI3NjUyNy83NDMxODcyLnBuZw==/original/178hIA.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI3NjUyNy83NDMxODcwLnBuZw==/original/ncL1dc.png]]






<p>"All the worlds ended together: heavens and hells, kingdoms and wastelands, and everything in between. As they broke apart, the Heartless Princess saved the bits she could, shoving them together and crowning the resultant Patchwork World with her Icy City to hold it all together."</p>
<p>Patchwork World is:</p>
<ul><li>a no-playbook, no-stat fantasy game; choose a couple moves and you're ready to start</li><li>powered by the apocalypse, meaning you'll need two 6-sided dice and not much else</li><li>70 moves that you can easily port to almost any other game</li></ul>
<p>Your purchase comes with:</p>
<ul><li>an 84-page PDF rulebook</li><li>a 31-page Play Materials document, including a form-fillable character sheet,&nbsp;70 unique moves (such as Magnificent Weapon, Stoned Investigator, Crystalline Garden, Become Cats, and more)</li><li>a plain-text version of the above</li></ul>
<p>Not sure if you want to commit? <a href="https://erinking.itch.io/patchwork-world-6e">Check out the preview of character creation here</a>.</p>
<p>"Patchwork World is the most fun PbtA game I've played... pass it on.&nbsp;Just unbridled joy." -&nbsp;<a href="https://gayhalforc.itch.io/">John Geary/@gayhalforc</a><br></p>
<p><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ckvK1id2Z7E" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Watch an actual-play of it here</a>.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4MTEzOTYuanBn/original/5OEo6g.jpg" loading="lazy"><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU4MTEzNzQuanBn/original/EwozaP.jpg]]






<p>Frightful magically created insects that can consume nearly anything and camouflage themselves in urban environments, what a pain! With juveniles, adults, a Queen, Alphas, and a set of energy eating variant abilities this monster set is so much more than a single bug. Countless quest lines and possibilities in a wide variety of locations are open to you! Check out the armipod mimics!</p>
<p>From the inconvenience of a pack eating the coffers of the local tavern to the Alpha-led heists of banks and treasuries to the swarming lair of the Queens, these intelligent insects might just surprise your players with their complexity.</p>
<p>Artists:</p>
<p>Shawn Pommier [Author] [<a href="https://twitter.com/EldritchDream" title="Https://twitter.com/eldritchdream" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/EldritchDream</a>]</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM4MTkzOTMuanBn/original/NR86qu.jpg]]






<p>Foggy woods and encroaching mist just became more terrifying. Curseveils sap memories from those that are encompassed by their fog or struck by their ghostly claws. Mad survivors from unfortunate villages speak of ghosts in the fog, people turning on one another, and mysteriously appearing wounds.</p>
<p>Curseveils can act both as a direct encounter, or an environmental challenge, causing your players to get lost, or worse.</p>
<p>Artists:</p>
<p>Shawn Pommier [Author, layout] [<a href="https://twitter.com/EldritchDream" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/EldritchDream</a>]</p>
<p><br></p>
<p><br></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/e8k8_YvLkCU" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjkyOTM0LzgzNDg5OTYucG5n/original/tj7kE3.png]]






<p>&nbsp;Created by unscrupulous mages to act as servitors, these little creatures are small creatures, eager to serve, and horribly brainwashed. They maintain, defend, and work amid dungeons, towers, lairs, and universities. With a snap of their fingers, they can activate traps, fling</p>
<p><br>Want a low level adventure for your players? Have them liberate some mugrim from servitude! Use intrigue, stealth, diplomacy, magic, or force to help the little creatures!</p>
<p><em>Artists:</em></p>
<p><em>Shawn Pommier [Author] [<a href="https://twitter.com/EldritchDream" title="Https://twitter.com/eldritchdream" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/EldritchDream</a>]</em></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM4MjM0NDguanBn/original/Pw0iLo.jpg]]






<p>Cyber land-sharks from Numeria! These cybernetically enhanced sharks are a precursor to an upcoming product including several variations and related Numerian-altered-creatures. Fill out your 2e Numerian adventure with this and more from An Eldritch Dream Games!!!<br></p>
<p>Artists:</p>
<p>Shawn Pommier [Author, Art] [<a href="https://twitter.com/EldritchDream" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/EldritchDream</a>]</p>
<p>Lluis Abadias [Inspiration] [<a href="https://twitter.com/LluisAbadias" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/LluisAbadias</a>]</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM4MjE4ODQuanBn/original/BIdjRc.jpg]]






Pawcific Rim is a two player role playing game/larp played between you and an animal sitting in your lap. The animal plays a mecha pilot, tasked with operating a giant robot on dangerous missions. You play that giant robot, and its AI guide, the H.U.M.A.N.
<p>It takes inspiration from media featuring giant robots, like Pacific Rim and Promare, as well as RPGs you play with your cat, like <a href="https://necromancy.itch.io/mews-cruise" target="_blank">Mews Cruise</a> and <a href="https://glittercats.itch.io/wouldnt-you-rather-do-that-with-maaaaaaagic" target="_blank">Wouldn't You Rather Do That With Maaaaaaagic?</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY0MzgxNjcucG5n/original/jfQwbO.png]]






<p class="text-right">you are the Witch, mightiest<br>of their kind.<br>you are DEATH, most feared<br>by all mortals.<br><br>you have danced and danced and<br>danced, but<br>the wick burns down for one of you,<br>and this macabre love affair cannot<br>last.</p>
<p class="text-center">~*~</p>
<p><em>penultimate: a game of wits between death and the witch who fell in love with them </em>is an intimate feverdream for two players.</p>
<p>the Witch and DEATH have had the mightiest of love affairs - but it all ends today. what will you say before the Witch succumbs to their mortality? how long can you extend your final moments together?&nbsp;<br></p>
<p class="text-center">~*~<br></p>
<p>the black, white, and purple pdf features original art by illustrator <a href="https://twitter.com/jehusethemoose" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">jessie weirich</a>. the plain text version (.txt) includes alt-text descriptions of said art.&nbsp; <br></p>
<p>pending funding, an audio version of this feverdream may also be available in the future.</p>
<p>for each copy of&nbsp;<em>penultimate:</em> purchased, another community copy will be added to the pool.<br></p>
<p class="text-center">~*~</p>
<p>this feverdream delves into dark places. please play using safety tools (see <a href="http://bit.ly/ttrpgsafetytoolkit" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">the ttrpg safety toolkit</a>) and with respect/trust in your fellow players. </p>
<p><em>the ttrpg safety toolkit is a resource co-curated by kienna shaw and lauren bryant-monk. the ttrpg safety toolkit is a compilation of safety tools that have been designed by members of the tabletop roleplaying games community for use by players and gms at the table. </em><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzU3NjExLzQyNDUxMTYucG5n/original/rI%2FMMM.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzU3NjExLzQyNDUxMTgucG5n/original/cMMxLu.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzU3NjExLzQyNDUxMTkucG5n/original/eBQW7m.png]]






<p><em><em>A planet poisoned by its people‚Äôs lifeline. The people‚Äôs need for just a few more drops of that poison. A remote, dangerous chance to discover a new reserve. As a member of a team of disposable drillers left alone on an asteroid to take that chance, the hope for your home colony that you lost long ago is now dwindling what little hope you reserved for yourself. If you can just find and secure this last energy source, it may let them live a few decades longer, but more importantly, you could earn enough money to leave this place far behind before you have to watch it destroy itself‚Ä¶</em></em></p>
<p><strong style=""></strong><em><strong>Penumbra</strong></em>&nbsp;is a contemplative one-shot adventure for Jesse Ross‚Äôs&nbsp;<em><a href="https://trophyrpg.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Trophy Dark</a></em>&nbsp;in which the players, a rag-tag group of burnt-out Sap drillers forced into the role of last-minute heroes, will struggle to cross a desolate asteroid and add a few final grains of sand to their colony planet's proverbial hourglass.<strong>&nbsp;A bleak and lonely exploration of whether to fight the end</strong><strong>,&nbsp;</strong><strong>this book contains all of the rules you need</strong><strong>&nbsp;to play</strong>, including all-new character creation options.</p>
<h3 class="text-center">Theme: Recurrence</h3>
<p>The book is 32 pages long. &nbsp;It includes:
</p>
<ul><li>4 new occupations and 6 new backgrounds, drives, and rituals for character creation
</li><li>15 moments
</li><li>10 conditions
</li></ul>
<p>You can also use the new character creation options from this adventure in the character keepers for&nbsp;<a href="https://www.arktosaur.us/keepers/trophydark" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><em>Trophy Dark</em></a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="https://www.arktosaur.us/keepers/trophygold" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><em>Trophy Gold</em></a>&nbsp;by&nbsp;Drew/Arktosaur for easier online play!</p>
<p>With purchase, you get the following fully bookmarked PDFs:
</p>
<ul><li>Single-page layout
</li><li>Facing-spread layout
</li><li>Printer-friendly, black-and-white, art-less version
</li><li>A separate file for character sheets
</li></ul>
<p>[A print-on-demand option is&nbsp;coming soon-ish!]<span></span>
</p>
<p>A limited number of free community copies are available below for those who are currently struggling.&nbsp;<strong>Every purchase of <em>Penumbra&nbsp;</em>will unlock one additional free community copy for another user.&nbsp;</strong>If you are feeling particularly generous, you can increase your purchase price, and for every $9.00 above the default price you pay, another free community copy will be unlocked!
</p>
<p>
</p>
<hr>
<p>If you want a darker, more horrifying one-shot adventure, check out my other&nbsp;<em>Trophy Dark</em> incursion <a href="https://atypicalfaux.itch.io/the-pried-eye"><em><strong>The Pried Eye</strong></em></a><strong><em></em></strong>!</p>
<p><iframe frameborder="0" src="https://itch.io/embed/990069?bg_color=000000&amp;fg_color=edc932&amp;link_color=8e79bb&amp;border_color=edc932" width="552" height="167"><a href="https://atypicalfaux.itch.io/the-pried-eye">The Pried Eye: A Trophy Dark Incursion by ATypicalFaux</a></iframe><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NDE3NC82MzA0OTIzLnBuZw==/original/FqpjPS.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NDE3NC82MzA0OTIxLnBuZw==/original/Tnr3La.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NDE3NC82MzA0OTIyLnBuZw==/original/Syh%2Bkd.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NDE3NC82MzA1OTM3LnBuZw==/original/6MXAX1.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NDE3NC82MzA0OTI1LnBuZw==/original/7hMZi%2B.png]]






<p></p>
<figure><img class="" src="https://ksr-ugc.imgix.net/assets/030/382/029/def0a64b9018d07c38bba5975abffd96_original.png?ixlib=rb-2.1.0&amp;w=680&amp;fit=max&amp;v=1598631970&amp;auto=format&amp;frame=1&amp;lossless=true&amp;s=ffd8b97b16e55b7a2533ac2508395f3e" style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; max-width: 100%" loading="lazy"></figure>
<p><strong>A game</strong>&nbsp;<strong>of compelling heroes and easy to understand rules.</strong></p>
<p>Perilous is a dungeon crawling RPG about braving the dark depths because the long forgotten magic of the ancients could mean the difference between life and death for the people you care about. It uses a simple 20 sided die, plain language, and tag based mechanics to make telling stories with your friends effortless.</p>
<figure><img class="" src="https://ksr-ugc.imgix.net/assets/031/023/798/de2632d8990a9a565d677ee04c5b5c9a_original.png?ixlib=rb-2.1.0&amp;w=680&amp;fit=max&amp;v=1602798504&amp;auto=format&amp;frame=1&amp;lossless=true&amp;s=fdf2429d2dc6eb07c31c976df06782d1" style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; max-width: 100%" loading="lazy"></figure>
<p><strong>Encounters feel more like puzzles than battles of attrition.</strong></p>
<p>Fighting enemies and facing dangers in Perilous is about finding clever solutions to unique problems rather than whittling away hit points. Each challenge you come up against is a collection of short descriptions that cover anything from the defenses an enemy has to the hazardous terrain you have to worry about. When you can't solve a problem right away, start building up advantages and creating openings until you can!</p>
<p><strong>Freeform character creation lets you create totally unique character ideas.</strong></p>
<p>Making a character in Perilous is both fast and incredibly fun, all you have to do is select the three aspects that define your character. Choose from categories such as your skills, signature equipment, spells, and personality to quickly create an interesting character ready to explore the world. The freeform character creation allows you to mix and match just the right talents and magical abilities for exactly the character you have in mind!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ2NjU4NzMucG5n/original/jBBldW.png]]






<p><strong>Earth Has Fallen:</strong></p>
<p><em>On the morning of June 14, 1968, a group of hippies fled to the mountains of Colorado to wait for doomsday, as the meteor, Icarus, neared Earth. Prophet Don, the leader of the doomsday cult, reported that after the meteor stuck the planet, California would slide into the ocean, the land would be plagued with horrible earthquakes, and society as we knew it would collapse. Don was correct.&nbsp;</em>
</p>
<p>You are a Survivor, one of a handful of children born from&nbsp;<strong>The Children of the Flowers</strong>, living in the mountainside town of Eldorado Springs, Colorado. Since Icarus's landing, the planet has seen wars, massive earthquakes, and the atmosphere poison itself. Not in Eldorado Springs though, it's safe here,<em>&nbsp;it's always been safe here</em>. Things are said to live out in The Periphery, the space around the town that none of these problems seem to cross over into, but it's fine here.<em>&nbsp;It's always fine here</em>. Rumor is the atmosphere is starting to clear up, but the people who leave into The Periphery don't always come back. What are you going to do about it?</p>
<p><strong>Phanta&nbsp;</strong>is a rules-lite and easy to work with RPG system, designed for fast decisive actions, and lasting relationships, both with the other Survivors you find yourself with, and the other folks in Eldorado Springs. All you need to play is 2-6 players, a copy of the rules, your Survivor's playbook, and a handful of d6s.</p>
<p>The Playbooks and Pop Culture Quick Reference guide are both marked as Demos just so players can more easily download them without needing to purchase the full game, but don't contain significant game text within them.</p>
<p>Phanta now officially supports Role,&nbsp;<a href="https://app.playrole.com/sheet-templates/3f2fbff0-phanta/save" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">and I have a basic character sheet up there if you'd like to use it</a>.</p>
<p>Phanta was made as part of the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/record-collection-2k21" target="_blank">Record Collection 2k21 Jam</a> and is based on the song Phanta by Le Tigre (off their incredible 1999 debut&nbsp;&nbsp;self titled album).</p>
<div class=""><iframe style="width: 500px; height: 281px" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/C89oHnkS0ts" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div>
<p>If you'd like a review copy of this game, shoot me a message on twitter (<a href="https://twitter.com/Keganexe" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@Keganexe</a>) or email me at Phanta@keganexe.com.</p>
<p>Print copies are here! You can reach me either of the above ways to get one, or purchase through itch (which is a little clunky but we will make it work!)</p>
<p>I made a new game, Star Heist, that uses a heavily modded version of the Phanta rulest to run! If you're interested you can get it <a href="https://keganexe.itch.io/star-heist">here</a>, you can play Phanta inside of an Adam Bell game, <a href="https://adamebell.itch.io/stat-heist">Stat Heist</a> here.</p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/C89oHnkS0ts" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODgzMjQ0LzQ5NzU0NjQucG5n/original/Gavs4F.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODgzMjQ0LzQ5NzU0NDgucG5n/original/R6UEQV.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODgzMjQ0LzQ5NzU0NTgucG5n/original/EfEUpO.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODgzMjQ0LzQ5NzU1OTkucG5n/original/HwJgVP.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODgzMjQ0LzQ5NzU2MDIucG5n/original/6B3Bq7.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODgzMjQ0LzUyMjEzOTEuanBn/original/2ZD0GY.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODgzMjQ0LzUyMjg2MzcuanBn/original/2naaY6.jpg]]






<p><strong>This is not a video game.</strong>&nbsp;It's a pdf of a tabletop roleplaying game.</p>
<hr>
<p>Step into the shoes of the faculty of Pigsmoke School of Sorcery, America's finest learning institution for the magically gifted.&nbsp;Teach classes, publish research, and try to navigate the cutthroat world of academia when the demons are real, the auditors are constructs of pure order, and imposter syndrome might just mean you're a doppelganger.<br></p>
<p>Students exist to make your life difficult. Your department head is an arch-conservative taskmaster who leans on you to make their department look good. The Dean's Office wants to ensure you're following all of their ridiculous rules. The bursar won't give you any money, your peers want their names ahead of yours on your latest paper, and your personal life is a garbage fire. Chase tenure, avoid burnout, and try to resist the urge to go adventuring: like all get-rich-quick schemes, it'll probably just end with a humiliating death.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTc0ODM4LzgxNTgxMi5wbmc=/original/kiZ7px.png]]






<p>This is a hexcrawl about trick or treating in a small town in South Louisiana. It is still "in beta" because it will eventually receive an update after some editing and play testing. But it's probably very close to its final form.</p>
<p>There are 16 keyed hexes on the map and a couple random encounter tables. In St. Ambrose you can encounter zombies, monsters, doom metal bands, a cult, zydeco ghosts, and a dentist.</p>
<p>This adventure is meant to be used with the&nbsp;<a href="https://natetreme.itch.io/prole">PROLE</a> analog adventure game
from Highland Paranormal Society but feel free to adapt it to the game of
your choice.</p>
<p><a href="https://natetreme.itch.io/cartographykit"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ0ODQwNzUucG5n/original/Om1byF.png" alt="Map" title="Map" loading="lazy"></a></p>
<figcaption>map made with hexkit</figcaption>
<blockquote>It is Halloween in the small town of St. Ambrose, a community deep in the wilderness of South Louisiana. The children of St. Ambrose have one goal tonight, to get as much candy as possible, even if it means facing the darkness that hides just under the surface of their sleepy little town.<br>In this adventure, players take on the roles of young trick-or-treaters. For the sake of the game, it‚Äôs assumed that these are children of the latchkey variety who take matters into their own hands. There are not any parents and only a few adults mentioned. It can be assumed that the parents are staying home to give out candy or are gone to a Halloween party and the children are on their own for the night. It‚Äôs not as if grown ups would believe the children if they told them supernatural things were happening anyways.</blockquote>
<p><strong>A WARNING: </strong>in this game the player characters are little kids, going trick or treating in a world where scary dangerous b-movie horror stuff is happening. So depending on how you run/play games, you could be playing a game where kids get hurt or killed by monsters. That could be very disturbing if handled recklessly. So be careful and give the game some thought before you run it! I don't think the subject matter is very intense but it is not made to be a kid friendly, there are some things that might need to be toned down for younger players or even ignored completely, like drugs, for instance.</p>
<p>This adventure and more is available for as little as $2 a month at the <a href="https://www.patreon.com/HPS" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Highland Paranormal Society Patreon.</a></p>
<div class=""><iframe style="width: 500px; height: 281px" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/E47GXFwYsGo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div>
<p></p>
<div class=""><iframe width="500" height="281" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/ahSOtw5EdJo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div>
<p></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/E47GXFwYsGo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODAwNzYzLzY5Njg2NzkucG5n/original/H%2B93Hm.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODAwNzYzLzQ0ODQwOTAucG5n/original/X1w9JA.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODAwNzYzLzQ0ODQwOTEucG5n/original/dEh%2BL%2B.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODAwNzYzLzY5Njg2ODAuanBn/original/gz4Oq%2B.jpg]]






<p><strong><em>Every person is their own little world.</em></strong></p>
<p>Getting to know someone new is a lot like exploring a new place. New rooms, locked doors, secret passageways, holy places. Learning what color the sun shines through their windows at every minute of the day. Savoring the melody their placehood creaks when they settle into sleep. The goal of <em>Placehood</em> is to discover as much as someone will let you, to immerse yourself in the emotional space of another person. Feel free to use this game to flesh out characters for any story you want to tell, be it a book or a TTRPG campaign.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYxNzk5MjQucG5n/original/XyTpfF.png]]






<p>The big black. The sea of souls. The astral realm.&nbsp;</p>
<p>There are many names for the space between the planes.&nbsp;</p>
<p>In the center of it all lies an island‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúThe friendliest Port in the Planes.‚Äù&nbsp;</p>
<p>Whether you are a spirit that has been recently separated from your body or an adventurer traveling between worlds, chances are you‚Äôre making a stop in‚Ä¶ Dreamhaven.</p>
<p>A brand new RPG zine to take you brand new places. <strong>Planar Compass</strong> is a supplement for <a href="https://necroticgnome.com/collections/old-school-essentials" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Old-School Essentials</a> and other classic RPG systems such as Swords and Wizardry, Labyrinth Lord, etc.
</p>
<ul><li>4 New Classes!</li>
<li>Rules for Psionics!</li>
<li>Over 40 Psionic Powers!</li>
<li>3 Small Adventures and a Dungeon!</li>
<li>A mini setting to act as home base in the astral sea or a fantastic one-off!</li>
<li>Contains a 60 page zine, 30 page player's booklet to avoid spoilers, and a players dungeon map!</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Note</strong>:Requires <a href="https://necroticgnome.com/collections/old-school-essentials" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Old-School Essentials</a>.
</p>
<div class=""><iframe style="width: 500px; height: 281px" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-PJe3-qAElU" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div>
<p><br></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-PJe3-qAElU" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzYwODczLzQyOTg0NDAucG5n/original/6qcNbi.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzYwODczLzQyNTQ3NjkuanBlZw==/original/83Oe0s.jpeg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzYwODczLzQyNTQ3NjguanBlZw==/original/NT27V%2F.jpeg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzYwODczLzQyNTQ3NzQuanBlZw==/original/LZZL5H.jpeg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzYwODczLzQyNTQ3NzguanBlZw==/original/PhOzRC.jpeg]]






<p>A late unofficial entry to <a href="https://itch.io/jam/safety-jam" target="_blank">#SafetyJam</a>.</p>
<p>A zine full of thoughts on transparency, trauma, safety, and integrity in games. Includes lists, essays, and a useful new LARP mechanic for freeform-type games.&nbsp;</p>
<p><br><strong>Content Note:</strong><br>This zine covers issues that arise in analog game spaces ‚Äî specifically tabletop roleplaying games (TTPRGs) and live action roleplaying games (LARPs). As such, it may contain references to sexism, racism, ableism, classism, queerphobia, transphobia, fatphobia, violence (both sexual and otherwise) torture, bullying, bigotry, white fragility, abuse, and other issues that arise within various analog gaming communities. Reader discretion is advised.</p>
<p>This zine is nowhere near the end-all-be-all of analog game safety. Please see the further reading section at the end for more resources.</p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI2NjQ3NjEucG5n/original/OvqQ3l.png]]






<p><em>‚ÄúI heard about it later, and when they called us blasphemers and demon-creators, I always thought of him. Robbie was a non-vocal robot. He couldn‚Äôt speak. He was made and sold in 1996. Those were the days before extreme specialization, so he was sold as a nursemaid‚Äî‚Äù&nbsp;</em><em>- I, Robot</em></p>
<p><strong></strong><strong>Positronic Potentials: The Nanny</strong></p>
<p>A solo journaling game inspired by Robbie from I, Robot by Isaac Asimov (1950)</p>
<p><strong>Content Warning: Body Image and Gender Reflection, Playing as a Non-Vocal Robot, Othering, Rejection, Loss of Agency, Child Endangerment&nbsp;</strong></p>
<p>Created as part of the&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/jam/fuckadobe" target="_blank">#FuckAdobeJa</a><a href="https://itch.io/jam/fuckadobe" target="_blank">m</a>&nbsp;using Paint 3D &amp; Affinity.</p>
<p>In Positronic Potentials: The Nanny, you play as a non-vocal robot whose role is that of a nursemaid for a child. You weren‚Äôt necessarily designed specifically for this role, though it holds a great importance to you, as does your relationship with the one under your care.   </p>
<p>You have a ‚Äúpositronic brain‚Äù and your mind is at least somewhat comparable to that of a human. You are able to consider yourself and the world around you. How closely your thoughts and feelings compare to humans, and how you relate to them, is up to you.   </p>
<p>While not designed to be able to speak, you are able to communicate through gestures and sign language.&nbsp; The child you care for is able to understand you for the most part.
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1MTQ0NS82MDEzOTY4LmpwZw==/original/Mg%2BnzI.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1MTQ0NS82MDEzOTc5LmpwZw==/original/tEmL8%2F.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1MTQ0NS82MDEzOTgyLmpwZw==/original/bibu2n.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1MTQ0NS82MDEzOTgzLmpwZw==/original/s8sFQV.jpg]]






<p><em>A figure stands in an ancient ruin, bare feet on crumbling stone. Her gown far too fine, her sword much too dark. She can not put down the sword until she finds where it came from. So she has come.</em></p>
<hr>
<p><strong>P<small>RINCESS WITH A </small>C<small>URSED </small>S<small>WORD</small></strong> is a journaling role-playing game for one player. It requires a tarot deck and can be played in half an hour or more. And it fits on one printed page.</p>
<p><strong>Explore the ruins.</strong> Turn over a tarot card and let the game prompts and the card image guide what you find there. Explore stone courts, torchlit dungeons, overgrown gardens and tattered libraries. Play with a different deck for a different adventure.<br></p>
<p><strong>Face challenges.</strong> Throw coins to find out if the princess staggers and stumbles or succeeds with supernatural prowess. Will the princess give her sword what it wants in exchange for its power?<br></p>
<p><strong>Find the sword's resting place.</strong>&nbsp;What is the princess willing to sacrifice to leave the sword behind? Or will the sword offer her something so tempting she cannot rid herself of it?<br></p>
<p><strong>Chronicle her journey.</strong> Write in third person as you play, as though transcribing a fairy tale. Where will the princess' quest lead her, and how will it be remembered?<br></p>
<p><em>The princess‚Äô own shadow mocked her, caricaturing her worst aspects. But she had faced far worse ridicule as a poor tailor. She extinguished her torch, and her shadow, and crept forward in the dark.</em><br></p>
<hr>
<p>Designed &amp; written by Anna Anthropy and&nbsp; illustrated by <a href="https://twitter.com/smallsmallwitch" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Rayne Klar</a>. Journal photograph by <a href="https://twitter.com/willnapforbooks" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@willnapforbooks</a>.<br></p>
<p><strong>BONUS MATERIAL:&nbsp;</strong>Pay $3 for the game to receive the notes I kept while designing and revising it, including a list of&nbsp;games that inspired Cursed Sword and a terrible variant to play it with.<br></p><p><strong>THE PRINCESS SWORD SERIES:</strong> Princess with a Cursed Sword is free, but you can also support it by purchasing my other games that are based on it:</p><ul><li><a href="https://w.itch.io/tavern-at-the-end">Tavern at the End of the World</a></li><li><a href="https://w.itch.io/the-empress-and-her-seer">The Empress and Her Seer</a></li></ul>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/b02A_mwpmjY" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTczNzIyLzMwMjA0MjMucG5n/original/6U0uev.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTczNzIyLzMwMjY0NjIucG5n/original/HxuFZq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTczNzIyLzMwMTgxMDQucG5n/original/tCgMT6.png]]






<h3>A world-building game about roadtrips and bathroom breaks</h3>
<h4></h4>
<p>by Ben R.</p>
<h4>What is it?</h4>
<p><em>Pull Over, I Need to Pee</em> is a game about the interstitial moments between&nbsp;chapters, the moments that are usually skipped, overlooked, or deemed not&nbsp;important enough. We will be playing through those moments, and only those&nbsp;moments. At its core, this game is a world-building tool to help imagine the&nbsp;small instances of beauty or brief connections you might have on the road.&nbsp;Behind you is your last grand adventure and ahead is the next one.&nbsp;</p>
<p>You can use&nbsp;this game to flesh out a journey between major acts of the story you‚Äôre telling,&nbsp;draw a few cards to make a shorter trip more vibrant, or imagine a world you&nbsp;haven‚Äôt explored yet. Along the way, you will make decisions about the world&nbsp;you‚Äôre travelling through and decide what makes it interesting, even if we‚Äôre&nbsp;only looking at the brief silences and soft exhalations between paragraphs.</p>
<h4>What do I need?</h4>
<ul><li>At least one person (probably the person reading this) and any number of&nbsp;people who want to tell this story</li><li>Paper and pencils for notes</li><li>A deck of cards (or a way to randomly generate a value between 1 and 52)</li></ul>
<p>You can play this game solo, but it works better with creative input from&nbsp;multiple people.</p>
<h4>Quick Facts</h4>
<ul><li>GMless</li><li>1-3 hours, 1-6 players</li><li>Collaborative world-building</li><li>Setting neutral</li></ul>
<p><br></p>
<h4>Reviews</h4>
<div>"Pull Over I Need to Pee is a delight. It provides a wonderful vehicle for collaborative world-building, and was a joy to play. We used it between seasons of a pre-established campaign, and it acted as a great bridge between seasons, as well as helping us flesh out our setting. "&nbsp;</div>
<p>- Jim McIntyre (Roll for Friendship)</p>
<div>"I liked how it felt fast paced but I also didn‚Äôt feel rushed on my turn. It flowed so nicely" -Tara</div>
<div><br></div>
<p>"I&nbsp;ran Pull Over, I Need to Pee with my friend group today, it was hilarious and amazing. my friends loved it!!!!" -Kae</p>
<p>"it was such a lovely game! I loved the pace of it, and that we don't give too many details cause it encourages others to add to it!" -Jessica</p>
<p><br></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgzMzExNjgucG5n/original/YmKAog.png]]






<p><strong><em>Tired of having your life besieged by problems out of your control? Move to Punch Town, where all your problems can be punched away! Got a broken laptop? Punch its glitches! Got a runny nose? Punch the disease! Down in the dumps? Punch your depression! Nobody knows how the hell it works (probably because somebody punched an unsavory history), but everyone here has fists that fix everything! So come on down to Punch Town: the town of punches!</em></strong></p>
<p>Punch Town is a GM-less roleplaying game where everyone plays as characters in a weird-ass town who take care of every problem the way everyone else around here does: with their fists! Each player sets up their own structure using blocks from that one wooden block tower game ‚Äî but instead of pulling blocks while keeping it intact, you're gonna slide, shoot, flick, and fling blocks across the tabletop to knock other's structures down! The more blocks you have, the more punches you can throw until you eventually get your way... but throw too many, and you'll risk causing more trouble than you fix!<br></p><p><br></p>
<p>I slapped this game together over a weekend to try and push myself to make more stuff. <a href="https://twitter.com/Rathayibacter" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Rath</a> (of&nbsp;<a href="https://rathayibacter.itch.io/">rathayibacter.itch.io</a>&nbsp;fame) gave me the name and encouragement&nbsp;to do this; the rest spilled out in a ludological frenzy. As such, I present this game as-is, weird wording and funky phrasing and all. I've also&nbsp;done NO testing on how this game plays! This is just a head's-up that this thing might be a bit wonky and perhaps need some tweaking at the table. But hey, I&nbsp;still think it's rad, and I hope you do too!</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>The "demo" below contains the full game as a text-only file; feel free to get a taste of the content before paying, or simply use it instead of the PDF if it suits your needs better. Free community copies are also available. üíö&nbsp;If you have any&nbsp;non-nasty&nbsp;comments about this work (what using it was like, constructive feedback, ideas for its future), I'd love to hear them! You can post them below,&nbsp;or&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/lxnrhinners" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">tweet at me.</a>&nbsp;Or both! So many options!<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNDk5OC82NTc4ODY4LnBuZw==/original/yuwJSJ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNDk5OC82NTc4NTM4LnBuZw==/original/kZ%2BWel.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNDk5OC82NTc4NTQxLnBuZw==/original/2NgbLy.png]]






<p><em>It's a beautiful day in the city, and you are a horrible pixie.&nbsp;</em><br><br><strong>Punk Pride Pixies</strong> is a game about community, anarchism, and Pride.<br></p>
<p>Work as a team to fight&nbsp;cats and capitalism. Start a riot. Throw bricks at oppressors.</p>
<p><strong>Punk Pride Pixies</strong> is a one-page horizontally laid out game. It comes with character creation, simple mechanics, and an adventure generator. You also get a second, vertically laid out version of the game in black and white.</p>
<p>If you're from a marginalized community or struggling for&nbsp;money--poke me on twitter and I'll send you a free community copy.</p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1ODA2Ny82MDU1NTM1LnBuZw==/original/JdVcOu.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1ODA2Ny82MDU1NTM2LnBuZw==/original/McIOrf.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1ODA2Ny82MDU1NTM3LnBuZw==/original/juSHfW.png]]






<p><strong>IT‚ÄôS 3 AM. THERE‚ÄôS SOMEONE IN YOUR HOUSE. THEY‚ÄôRE GOING TO KILL YOU.</strong></p>
<p>
</p>
<p><em>QUIETUS</em> is a one shot, prepless RPG of melancholy horror. It‚Äôs a game for a GM and one or two players, and emulates tragic horror movies like <em>Oculus</em>, <em>The Strangers</em>, <em>The Babadook</em>, <em>Inside</em> and the Netflix version of <em>The Haunting of Hill House</em>. If a piece of fiction can make you cry and scream, then it‚Äôs a great model for the sort of stories that you can tell with <em>QUIETUS</em>.</p>
<p>Powered by a stripped down version of the award-winning <em>Blades in the Dark</em> engine, you‚Äôll create characters with tragic backstories, and send them hurtling headlong into a nightmare where their past trauma might be the only thing that saves them.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI4MjAyMTYucG5n/original/V1A6tV.png]]






<p>You are an animal living in a human‚Äôs world. The humans have found you, and the military will pursue you with every weapon, vehicle, and trap they have at their disposal. You‚Äôve only got one option. RUN!</p>
<p>Rainbow Runaways was created for the Caltrop Core game jam,&nbsp; and runs on the&nbsp;<a href="https://titanomachyrpg.itch.io/caltropcore" target="_blank">Caltrop Core engine by Titanomachy</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzgyMy83Nzg1MTYyLnBuZw==/original/WYptEN.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzgyMy83Nzg1MTYzLnBuZw==/original/huYVwP.png]]






<p><strong>Rainbow World</strong>&nbsp;is a short collaborative world building game. With it, a few friends can generate a unique world, filled with wonder and conflict, in a half hour. It can handle original races and almost any setting or genre you can dream up!</p>
<p>It employs an economy of earning and eating <strong>Skittles</strong> candies as the history of your fictional world is unveiled. As the game progresses, the world shifts and changes, reflected by index cards piling up. The game ends when everyone agrees that a satisfying snapshot of an imaginary world has developed.</p>
<p>Rainbow World was first written for the <a href="https://200wordrpg.github.io/2016/supplement/2016/04/12/RainbowWorld.html" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">2016 200 Word RPG Challenge</a> and can still be found on the challenge's website. This new version is mechanically identical to the challenge entry but features expanded text, play examples, and art to better explain the game.</p>
<p>Included is <strong>Rainbow World: The Peanut Butter Planet,&nbsp;</strong>a one page supplement for Rainbow World.&nbsp;Peanut Butter Planet replaces the typical&nbsp; Skittles with&nbsp;<strong>Reese's Pieces</strong>&nbsp;or, with minor tweaking, cherry tomatoes or mini bell peppers.</p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzIyMzA1MDEucG5n/original/rMW6wh.png]]






<p>It's easy to forget to show the people you know and care about the kindness and love they deserve, and that's where #RToK (Random Tweets of Kindness)&nbsp;comes into play!</p>
<p>Follow the rules to&nbsp;fill out the sheet with people to perform acts of kindness for, as well as what acts of kindness you'll be doing, then do as many as you want!&nbsp;Save the sheet(s)&nbsp;as reminders of the good you've done or recycle em, whatever you want, they're your sheets after all üß°</p>
<p><strong>What you'll need:</strong> A d6 (or number generator), a Twitter account (everything is manual, you won't be linking or connecting anything no worries!), the third page of this document (or some paper), and something to write with.<br></p>
<p>Note:&nbsp;this game goes out to <a href="https://twitter.com/unbirthdayangel" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Angel, my fianc√©e</a>, for suggesting I make a game for Random Acts of Kindness day. It also goes out to <a href="https://twitter.com/weirdgiraffes" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Carla, my good friend</a>, for her remarkable game, <em><a href="https://weirdgiraffegames.itch.io/loving-accountability" target="_blank">Loving Accountability</a></em>, which was a massive inspiration for this game (so much so that, if you like mine at all, I&nbsp;wholeheartedly recommend that you&nbsp;go grab <em>Loving Accountability</em> as well! In fact, do it anyway lol)</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQwNDg4Ny84MTg2MDY4LnBuZw==/original/KkJSLG.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQwNDg4Ny84MTg2MDY5LnBuZw==/original/SgzP%2B%2F.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQwNDg4Ny84MTg2MDg5LmpwZw==/original/43uZPK.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQwNDg4Ny84MTg2MDcwLnBuZw==/original/I06Zju.png]]






<$list filter="[is[current]has:field[rating]]">
''Rating'': {{!!rating}}&nbsp;&nbsp;
</$list>






<p><em>A Recipe on Kmiydish Paper</em> is a one-player game about delicious food and the communities who prepare it.<br></p>
<p>We‚Äôve all been told that some recipes have been handed down through generations, or kept in restaurant safes for decades, or are only known and cooked by mysterious figures. These recipes, and the food they create, are well-loved historical relics, mirroring a region‚Äôs geography, politics, and people. <strong>What are the hidden histories behind our favorite butter pickles, beers, briskets, and breads?</strong> And what would it look like if history was seen through their (yeasty) eyes?
</p>
<p><em>A Recipe on Kmiydish Paper</em> is <strong>a solitary game built for <a href="https://itch.io/jam/lost-and-found" target="_blank">the Lost &amp; Found jam</a></strong> that answers those questions. Instead of playing as adventurers at a tavern, or even a chef behind the scenes, <strong>you will inhabit a food from its conception through history in the sister cities of Blue Kmiyd and Rose Kmiyd.</strong>
</p>
<p>These sister cities have seen wars, extinctions, and the questionable churn of industrialization transform the landscape and the treatment of citygoers: including the people who recorded your recipe on Kmiydish paper. As an insular cultural group, your creators may use you as an economic lifeline or a form of communal love throughout the centuries. You‚Äôll pass through 5 Chefs, each being changed by and changing you, from your ingredients to your street cred to their futures.
</p>
<p>You might be the first food given to a newborn by a doula, or a new food entirely whipped up by in a cooking competition, or the food rations thrown into trenches during an Kmiydish civil war. Using random tables, guiding questions, and a twisting three-act structure, you will never play through the same world twice or develop the same strange recipe - which you can cook at the end of your worldbuilding session! An actual play session of all this in action can be <a href="https://otter.ai/u/UD3hGVzFOfFhk4H5LMxX3SqC1-I" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">listened to or read here</a></p>
<p><em>Recipe on Kmiydish Paper</em> is based upon the experiences of pre-WWII Jewish Quarter residents in Eastern Europe and the power and legacy of their food. It‚Äôs a love letter to Chowder, Strega Nona, Top Chef, and Mandy Patinkin, to name a few inspirations. No dice are required for play, just something to write on, <a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/39a4RAWIDPF3Fv3bxs4jOS?si=0ce06ab58dda4e4c" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">the Kmiydish Rest playlist</a>, and a few hours to build out a food history. This is a perfect pre-game exercise to flesh out the urban or culinary history of a location you can slot into another TTRPG of your choice.
</p>
<p>Dive to play as:
</p>
<ul><li>The Beverage, from vodka to tea
</li><li>The Pastry, from matza to croissants
</li><li>The Meat, from tongue sandwiches to kofta
</li><li>The Preserve, from sauerkraut to raspberry jam
</li></ul>
<p>Be inherited and altered by 27 different chefs, from human to golem, forager to consumer, suppressionist to archivist.
</p>
<p>Features 6 stunning artworks by Aylin Erkan, a Turkish-Ashkenazi&nbsp;illustrator, harkening back to cookbook inlays and family memories.</p>
<p>Also includes:
</p>
<ul><li>A <a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/39a4RAWIDPF3Fv3bxs4jOS?si=0ce06ab58dda4e4c" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">60-song playlist</a>, to mark time passing and keep you company!
</li><li>A D20 list of religious rituals + a D20 list of food culture traditions.
</li><li>An excerpted dictionary of words and names in the local tongue.
</li><li>An assorted selection of Kmiydish holidays, rumors, and lore.
</li><li>An optional ‚Äúpantry mode‚Äù to localize the game to your kitchen.
</li></ul>
<p>Game format: 46-page full color PDF, A5 size and formatted to be read as a digital PDF (but feel free to print and play yourself).&nbsp;
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE5OTA1OS84Mjc5Mjg0LmpwZw==/original/z5%2Bsej.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE5OTA1OS84Mjc5MjgzLmpwZw==/original/eSv1YV.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE5OTA1OS84Mjc5Mjg1LmpwZw==/original/LeB%2F4n.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE5OTA1OS84Mjc5MjgyLmpwZw==/original/rZ2mdi.jpg]]






<p>One of you has watched the other from afar, absolutely head over heels in love. Their intense charisma and understated confidence gives away the sense that they are so wise, so worldly, that one would even believe they are far older and more experienced than they look.</p>
<p>The other of you has lived a thousand lifetimes, an immortal being of thirst and desire, whose time is running out as the world becomes harder for them to survive in, and those in their neighbourhood are beginning to suspect that they are not what they seem.</p>
<p>One of you has asked the other out on a date. Perhaps this will give one or both of you a chance to satisfy a deep, yearning hunger that loneliness has not afforded for some time.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Or perhaps it is instead the last night you both will ever see each other again.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2NDc5OS82Nzc3MjE2LmpwZw==/original/c7n%2FIC.jpg]]






<p><strong>This game is in development! Everyone who purchases it now will be buying at a discount until the final game is completed and released.</strong></p>
<p><strong>This game is an expansion for <a href="https://mxquinn.itch.io/for-the-honor">For The Honor</a> by&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/Mx_quinn?t=Zwn-KsfjtjA93cvY-z8IaA&amp;s=09" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@Mx_quinn</a> you will need the full game to utilize these minigames!</strong></p>
<p>Shows today talk about vulnerability and the ways we challenge ourselves to connect and rely on others while also taking time to be ourselves and enjoy who we are or who we can change into. <strong>Reliance and Recreation</strong> adds minigames to give these options in a game of <strong>For the Honor&nbsp;</strong>and provide a dialogue&nbsp;of vulnerability or even a way to resist it in character.</p>
<p>I highly recommend using safety tools with any roleplaying games, but these minigames can bring the urge to tackle heavy subjects that would benefit from open and honest communication. Please check out&nbsp;<a href="https://drive.google.com/drive/mobile/folders/114jRmhzBpdqkAlhmveis0nmW73qkAZCj?usp=sharing" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">The TTRPG Safety Toolkit</a>&nbsp;by <a href="https://twitter.com/KiennaS?t=ZkHFXeYmGCF0Yrf7tQFESA&amp;s=09" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@KiennaS</a>&nbsp;and <a href="https://twitter.com/jl_nicegirl?t=lelO9oO1-3nDxXv3vyKHzA&amp;s=09" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@jl_nicegirl</a>&nbsp;as a good primer to using safety tools in your games! I really do think they make this experience so much better.</p>
<p>I'd also like to give a special thanks to my playtesters/collaborators on this project and their encouragement that pushed me to put this out here. These games were literally born out of a one shot that became a wild campaign and the people who helped me get here are very important to me:<br></p>
<p><a href="https://twitter.com/AdvancedStick?t=xuAeUdhniBRCj6PHXFC23g&amp;s=09" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@AdvancedStick</a><br></p>
<p><a href="https://twitter.com/KyleWithAnN?t=JFPO6R0sjQ12_3pi_gdAdw&amp;s=09" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@KyleWithAnN</a><br></p>
<p><a href="https://twitter.com/Taylor_CS?t=dGm7og6wnamsGWbx2GWSjA&amp;s=09" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@Taylor_CS</a><br></p>
<p>Currently available at release are:</p>
<p>Trust and Connection- A game for two inspired by the trial of Orpheus and Eurydice. What choices will you make?</p>
<p>Trials and Tribulations- Sometimes our characters are off doing hard things by themselves! A game for the whole table to play peanut gallery to a character's challenge.</p>
<p>Get Along Sweater- The villain and hero are handcuffed together trope. As a game!</p>
<p>Regrets- Honestly one I'm most proud of, inspired by all those rough late night moments in so many shows where all the characters think about where they've been and where to go next.</p>
<p>New Season‚Äôs Fashion- Everyone loves outfit changes and overanalyzing what they mean in the show!</p>
<p>Coming soon:</p>
<p>Beach Episode minigame- What it says on the tin</p>
<p>Layout</p>
<p>Title page</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzcxMzI5MDYuanBn/original/NybA%2Bg.jpg]]






<p>RETRO is a synthwave Caltrop Core game made on a dare.</p>
<p>join the Night Riders, a group of miscreants who have a mission to keep the rain slick, neon lit, streets safe and free.</p>
<p>Use Nostalgia to push past defeat and to enhance your Tropes vibes.</p>
<p>Grab a handful of d4's, put on some <em><strong>A E S T H ET I C</strong></em> music, and save the night!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc1NDAwNjAucG5n/original/lCw2L%2F.png]]






<p>Reunification is a game for 3-5 players where each player takes on the role of one member of a family that has been split apart due to a civil war. Throughout the game, you will ask questions of the other family members in order to get to know them and build up familiarity, empathy, and compassion with each other. It is a game of questioning and writing‚Äîin hopes of gaining insight and perspective, understanding and trust.</p>
<p>Attached to the end is a printout reference of questions to ask. 32 pages successfully kickstarted for the RPG Zine campaign in February of 2019.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQ1Mzg2LzIyNDU2NjkucG5n/original/CztA%2Bm.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQ1Mzg2LzIyNDU2NzIucG5n/original/5m2Pb%2F.png]]






<p><strong><em>You have been poisoned!</em></strong> A Crime Boss had this done to you.&nbsp;</p>
<p>You have hours‚Ä¶maybe a couple days before you succumb to the effects of the deadly toxin and perish. So,&nbsp;you‚Äôve made a decision about how you want to spend the precious little time you have left: Find and kill the Crime Boss!</p>
<p>Pity the criminal, thug, or henchman that gets in your way!<br>
</p>
<p>To play you‚Äôll need:
</p>
<ul><li>A journal to record your hourly&nbsp;entries&nbsp;
</li><li>A deck of cards with no jokers&nbsp;
</li><li>A 6-sided die&nbsp;
</li><li>A tumbling block tower&nbsp;</li><li>10 tokens of some kind</li></ul>
<p>This game is based on&nbsp;<a href="https://loottheroom.itch.io/wretched" target="_blank">The Wretched</a>, a game&nbsp;originally created by&nbsp;<strong><em>Chirs Bissette</em>.&nbsp;</strong><strong>Revenge Is A Poison</strong>&nbsp;is about one person trying to get their revenge, against a powerful individual, before falling to the poison coursing through their body.&nbsp;Inspired by movies like Crank, D.O.A., Kate, &amp; a pinch of John Wick.</p>
