<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/woleWx0-vNY" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTQxNTIyLzYxMDg0NTIucG5n/original/SKUPCg.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTQxNTIyLzYxMDg0NTEucG5n/original/FLe0Lo.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTQxNTIyLzU0MjQ5NzcuanBn/original/ykYM89.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTQxNTIyLzY1MDI2NTUucG5n/original/LGgHUN.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTQxNTIyLzc2MDUzODIucG5n/original/abUQGJ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTQxNTIyLzY1MDI1MTEucG5n/original/zu5XgX.png]]






<p><em>Itch.io account NOT REQUIRED to make payment. Just click DOWNLOAD NOW and use PayPal or credit card. See screenshots on right for example. (Note: Screenshots for different product by same author.)<br><br></em></p>
<p><strong>A minimalist TRPG set in an future, after-human Japan.</strong><em><strong><br></strong></em></p>
<p>In 2075, to combat a rapidly declining population, Japan enacted the Robot Companion Law, churning out tens of millions of autonomous and semi-autonomous units to aid the aging population and declining economy. Alas, while the robots were able to rebuild the economy and save the nation from two potential invasions, in the end, they were regulated to the helplessly role of observer as the last of their wards passed on.<br></p>
<p>Samurai Androids is a minimalist tabletop roleplaying game with any number of Players and a Game Mechanic. Just a few short&nbsp;PDF files contain the complete rules, environs, denizens, and more. Like many small games, much is left to the interpretation of the GM and Players alike to allow flexibility and fun. Nothing is written in stone. Modify at will.<br></p>
<p>Explore a world of overgrown urban ruins; electric temples aglow&nbsp;with inner stoic Zen mysticism; cache-ridden secret military bases; buzz-glitchy video arcades; long-lost villages surrounded by rice paddies; countrysides teaming with wildlife and filelife alike; gleaming self-aware skyscrapers proud in their grandeur; dank, underground shopping malls; "haunted&nbsp;"subway lines, castles of bygone millennia ‚Äì these are the "dungeons" of the world. It's an amalgamation of the disused, discarded, overclocked, reinvented, hacked, cracked, and shellacked‚Ä¶ the Samurai Androids.<br><br>Free for download (or name your own price) -- the cores rules, world-setting, and a short intro story are complete and edited. Everything to start playing now, included. Lacks images or frills of any kind.<br></p>
<ul><li>Core Rules (including updates), Android Archetypes, short story "Firmware Upgrade" and Environs&nbsp;&nbsp;and Denizens&nbsp;all&nbsp;free forever.</li><li>PDF format. (Sorry, digital only at this point.)</li><li>Game scenarios currently in development.</li><li>Strong possibility of more material, art, campaigns, etc., if game is well-received.</li></ul>
<p>
</p>
<p>UPDATES:<br>09/06 - Alternate Rules / Simplified Version added.<br>&nbsp; Because this file contains a collection of scenario hooks, it carries a suggested price of $1.00. I hope you will continue to support the work.<br>02/23 - Android Archetypes&nbsp;added.<br>02/23 - Environs and Denizens corrected.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>PLEASE RATE THIS GAME (under More Information)<br>‚Üì‚Üì‚Üì‚Üì‚Üì‚Üì‚Üì‚Üì‚Üì‚Üì</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDkxMjY4LzMwNTQ3MjUuanBn/original/usb5Kn.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDkxMjY4LzMwNDg3NzIucG5n/original/edNxPn.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDkxMjY4LzMwNDg3NzAuanBn/original/c1Zqf6.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDkxMjY4LzMwNDg3NzEuanBn/original/izfQvz.jpg]]






<p>Love is power! It is that power that you tap into as the Sapphic Bond Warlock. Creating a romantic bond with an outsider with whom you cannot share a realm, your lover grants you the gift of power to show their affections for you.</p>
<p>Created with and for Pride!</p>
<p>This is supplementary content for the fifth edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game, ready to be added to your campaigns.</p>
<p>Supplements produced by Monarch Arts range from classes, monsters, items, mechanics and everything in-between. Each supplement is individually priced so you can hand pick the content that suits your game and setting.</p>
<p>You can also check out the Monarch Arts Discord <a href="https://discord.gg/X44KGNY" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a>.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgxMTIwNDQucG5n/original/v2fHkV.png]]






<p><strong>Be brave. Be beautiful. Fall in love, just for a moment. And really just <em>nail</em> a beautiful girl with a pillow.&nbsp;</strong><br></p>
<p>Sapphic Slumber Party is a short zine&nbsp;game for 2-5 about a pillow fight at a slumber party, and all the joyful, melancholy, amorous, and vulnerable feelings that come out when you're playing in your PJs.&nbsp;Brief and lyrical, Sapphic Slumber Party is GMless and plays in 30-45 minutes.</p>
<p>Sapphic Slumber Party itchfunded successfully for Zine Month 2022! Thanks to all the backers and the Zine Month community for helping make this game possible.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Thanks to&nbsp;„Åµ„Åá„Çã (twitter user <a href="https://twitter.com/feltk" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@feltk</a>) I am INCREDIBLY EXCITED that there is a Japanese translation of Sapphic Slumber Party!!!! „Åµ„Åá„Çã has generously allowed me to post their translation here for free.&nbsp;„Åì„Çå„ÇíË¶ã„Å§„Åë„Å¶„Åè„Çå„ÅüÊó•Êú¨‰∫∫„Éó„É¨„Ç§„É§„Éº„Å´ÊÑüË¨ù„Åó„Åæ„ÅôÔºÅ</p>
<p><strong>The Game</strong></p>
<p>Sapphic Slumber Party is simple, short, and sweet. Make your character and tell your fellow players about her PJs and her anxieties;&nbsp;they'll help you figure out what's beautiful about her.<br></p>
<p>Then the pillow fight begins. There's no HP in a pillow fight, no victory or defeat that's more than momentary, just the vulnerability that being alone together and intimate and playing around create. Eventually that vulnerability spills over in a way that ends the pillow fight; play to find out exactly how.</p>
<p><strong>What You Can Get</strong></p>
<p>$3 gets you a digital copy of Sapphic Slumber Party; $8 gets you a physical zine, shipping included (while supplies last). Buying a physical zine also funds a community copy!<br></p>
<p>Counting every dollar?&nbsp;Grab a community copy, that's what they're there for &lt;3</p>
<p>ÁôæÂêà„Éë„Ç∏„É£„Éû„Éª„Éë„Éº„ÉÜ„Ç£ (literally Yuri Pajama Party)&nbsp;is a Japanese translation of Sapphic Slumber Party, available for free due to the kindness of the translator,&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/feltk" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">„Åµ„Åá„Çã</a><br></p>
<p><strong>Community Copies</strong><br></p>
<p>As mentioned, buying a physical zine funds a community copy. Unfortunately, for the time being demand has outpaced supply! I always want there to be community copies for anyone who needs one, so once a month I'm going to refresh up to 10. Community copies were last updated in 3/10/2022; stop by next month if they've run out again :)</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1OTYxNC84MDMxNDAzLnBuZw==/original/WEgQFA.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1OTYxNC84MDMxNDA1LnBuZw==/original/lXp9Pu.png]]






<p>SCRATCH FABLES is a minimalistic storytelling game inspired by the classic party game Mad Libs or toys like magnetic poetry. You create a story a bit like a&nbsp;fable or fairy-tale as you play by filling in the blanks of simple prompts using a word bank&nbsp;and illustrating your story as you go. <br></p>
<p>Designed to be easy to pick up and play informal settings, Scratch Fables is a solo journaling game crossed with a party game or an activity book. It's a storytelling game that you could play at a bar,&nbsp;on your lunch break, or even on a road trip.</p>
<p>Provided files include a TXT preview, a&nbsp;PDF of spreads, and a PDF formatted to be printed on US letter paper.</p>
<p>Physical copies available for purchase soon!</p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM3MTc2MS84MTAwMjA0LmpwZw==/original/O35JtM.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM3MTc2MS83OTg4NjY3LnBuZw==/original/a4EmEk.png]]






<p><strong>The time for change is now!</strong></p>
<p>For too long, the city masters of Palisade have ruled through fear, corruption and repression. But you and your companions can only endure so much. Rally together and take on dangerous missions to further the cause and tear down the established order. Your opponents call you "the scum of the earth," but you have a better name for yourselves: revolutionaries.</p><p><strong>Scum of The Earth</strong> is a mini RPG made using the Caltrop Core system by titanomachyRPG. Learn more: <a href="https://twitter.com/titanomachyRPG" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://twitter.com/titanomachyRPG</a> and <a href="https://titanomachyRPG.itch.io">https://titanomachyRPG.itch.io</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc4NzY3OTYucG5n/original/XX3%2BU0.png]]






<p><em></em><em>It‚Äôs almost the winter solstice, but all is not merry and bright. The wicked troll-witch <strong>Gryla</strong>, and her thirteen sons, the <strong>Yule Lads, </strong>have descended from their sea-fortress and stolen away the village children to devour them. In desperation, the village elders have set a bounty: <strong>200gp </strong>for each child returned, and <strong>1000gp </strong>to the heroes that can bring them <strong>Gryla‚Äôs </strong>head. Are you&nbsp;
brave enough to enter‚Ä¶ </em><strong><em>The Sea-Fortress of the Yule Queen?</em></strong></p>
<p>A small pamphlet-size&nbsp;dungeon crawl inspired by Icelandic Christmas lore. Compatible with most fantasy roleplaying game systems. Easily printable for your home games.</p>
<p><strong>Contained within:<br></strong></p>
<p><strong>-11 Rooms of Whimsy, Wonder, and Horror<br></strong></p>
<p><strong>-5 New Magic Items to Delight and Astound your Players</strong></p>
<p><strong>-A table of Random Rhyming Insults to Baffle, Confound, and Infuriate</strong></p>
<p><strong>-A Duke of Rodents, and the Coterie Thereof</strong></p>
<p><strong>-The True Meaning of Christmas*</strong><br></p>
<p>*debatable.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc5MDYwOTguanBn/original/qYUxg2.jpg]]






<p>For millennia, your order of witches has worked&nbsp;in the shadows. In the modern world, magic has&nbsp;become so thoroughly hidden that most people&nbsp;don‚Äôt believe it exists. This is all part of your&nbsp;order‚Äôs centuries-long plan.</p>
<p>You are witches and oracles. For generations,&nbsp;you have been watching for the Chosen One. An&nbsp;ancient prophecy foretells the Chosen One&nbsp;coming and seizing divine power. You have a&nbsp;different plan for them, though.</p>
<p>There have been many potential Chosen Ones&nbsp;before, but all have failed to fulfill their destiny&nbsp;on their own. The elders of your order believe it&nbsp;is best to wait patiently for the Chosen One to&nbsp;arrive naturally. You believe differently. You are&nbsp;going to secretly steer them toward the fate you&nbsp;have picked out for them.</p>
<p>And once they fulfill their destiny, you‚Äôll be able&nbsp;to steal their godlike power from them at the&nbsp;moment of apotheosis. Then you‚Äôll become gods&nbsp;on your own.</p><p><em><strong><br></strong></em></p><p><em><strong>"Sealing the Fate&nbsp;is a really interesting hack which makes extensive use of a Tarot deck both in gameplay and as an oracle: to decide who the Chosen One is, to name your coven of witches, to guide the creation of prophesied events, and so on. In a way, Nick has managed to incorporate playset-style aides directly into the game using the Tarot. It's really clever, and a perfect match for the game's theme."</strong></em></p><p class="text-right">--Nick Bate, author of<em> <strong>Stealing the Throne</strong></em><br></p><p><br></p>
<p><strong><em>Sealing the Fate</em></strong> is a hack of&nbsp;<strong><em><a href="https://ickbat.itch.io/stealing-the-throne" target="_blank">Stealing the Throne</a></em></strong><u><strong><em></em></strong></u> by Nick Bate. It is a&nbsp;GMless storytelling game for 3-5 players.</p>
<p>Together you will create a chosen child of&nbsp;destiny, and the prophecy they must&nbsp;fulfill. Then you will try to manipulate&nbsp;their lives to make sure that prophecy is&nbsp;fulfilled in subtle ways, so that their&nbsp;ultimate fate benefits you specifically.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc4MTYxOTMuanBn/original/TCME0m.jpg]]






<p><em>Season of Dreams</em> is a table top Roleplaying game where your heroes go back and forth between modern Earth and the Gloom - a fictional reality inspired by Celtic mythology, but modified by the characters dreams, memories and actions.<br></p>
<p>Using the Powered by the Apocalypse System, your group will weave a cooperative story of magic, monsters and mystery, with moments from the characters vice, goals and virtue.&nbsp;<span></span><br></p>
<p>Your characters can interact with factions which boil down to monarchists, capitalists, socialists and a theocracy, there are also 2 earth based agencies, and your group can decide how much you interact with any of them.</p>
<p>Inspired by the stories of Neil Gaiman, The Magicians and the&nbsp;Twilight Zone series.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzg0MzEyLzQ0NzQ0NzAucG5n/original/fzrc0v.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzg0MzEyLzQ4Njg1NDgucG5n/original/qLbUyT.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzg0MzEyLzQ4Njg1NTAuanBn/original/tzNh3X.jpg]]






<p><em>On the first day of spring, you wake up with a tiny plant growing out of the palm of your hand. Small, and pale green, with two seed leaves, shading to yellow-white at the tips. It is rooted in your skin, in the middle of your life line. Part of your body as though it belongs. As though it has always been there.</em></p>
<p><em>It is beautiful.</em></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Seedling is a short role playing exploration for four people.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p><br></p>
<p><a href="https://thelawofnames.itch.io/comeaway">This game is available for free, if cost is a barrier to access.</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM2NDU4NDkucG5n/original/vtlC57.png]]






<blockquote>"When you need your game to come to a finale at a set time or in a set number of sessions, use these rules..."</blockquote>
<p>This is a supplement for use with your typical Powered by the Apocalypse or Forged in the Dark game.</p>
<p>It is designed to for those times you play a short or limited series or a one shot of games that usually run longer to resolve.<br><br>CN: Mention of physical harm, resignation, self-destructive behavior and sexual intercourse.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTI0NzExLzI3MjUxMjkucG5n/original/MMg4nq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTI0NzExLzI3MzM5OTMucG5n/original/Ch6D6W.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTI0NzExLzI3MzM5OTQucG5n/original/Br4qWJ.png]]






<p>Y<em>ou are the lone guardian of a place of great power - known to you only as The Sanctuary. Many years you have kept vigil in this place, guarding what is kept within from any and all who come to disrupt it or steal it for themselves.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p>Sentinel is a solo, journaling game about a solitary guardian and the place they are charged with keeping safe. It is a deck and dice based game in which you will create your guardian and the sanctuary that they protect before reliving the memories, facing threats, and finding interesting objects while time passes around you. And then, when the time has come for your watch to end, find out what happens to The Sanctuary when you are no longer able to guard&nbsp;it.</p>
<p class="text-center"><em>**Though designed as a solo game, Sentinel can easily be played collaboratively with two or more people.**</em></p>
<p><strong>Want to hear Sentinel in action?</strong> Listen to Meghan playing with Jeff Stormer on the <a href="https://www.partyofonepodcast.com/2021/03/25/274-sentinel-with-meghan-cross/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Party of One podcast</a>!&nbsp;</p>
<p>If you like this game, please tell me about it on&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/meghanlynnFTW" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Twitter</a>!</p>
<p>Sentinel was written for The Solo Jam, hosted by&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/KatSelesnya" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">KatSelesnya</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzI4ODI4LzU5MDc4MDYucG5n/original/pejpRc.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzI4ODI4LzU5MDc4MjguanBn/original/7KOHg5.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzI4ODI4LzU5MDc4MTguanBn/original/Q4Ucvo.jpg]]






<p class="text-center"><em>...The rigid abstemiousness runs the risk of putting him at a dietary distance from an American electorate that still binges on&nbsp;carbohydrates&nbsp;and, after eight years of a tea-sipping president, craves a relatable eater in chief...</em><br></p>
<p class="text-center"><em>...She denies him pies these days...</em></p>
<p><strong>Serious Reading</strong> is the only game inspired by the brow furrowing and spine shuddering evoked by&nbsp;opinion columns.&nbsp;</p>
<p>It is a comedy-focused, single-page, solo journaling RPG where you take on the role of a grossly overpaid&nbsp;opinion columnist who probably should have quit years ago, as most of them should have if we could only be so lucky. You'll use separate tables of prompts to write headlines for fictional opinion pieces, ostensibly&nbsp;about very serious topics, and excerpts from those articles that reveal little to nothing about their supposed topic but everything about the bizarre, broken life of your columnist character.</p>
<p>Using a bit of&nbsp;<a href="https://gamenomicon.itch.io/" target="_blank">William Lentz</a>'s <a href="https://gamenomicon.itch.io/second-guess-system-srd" target="_blank">Second Guess System</a>&nbsp;and made for the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/second-guess-jam" target="_blank">Second Guess Jam</a>, Serious Reading&nbsp;ensures every columnist character will gradually wane in their relevance until they rightly fade into obscurity as culture passes them by.&nbsp;</p>
<p>When you download this game, you get a hyperlinked PDF and a printer-friendly alternative that eliminates the background art for you to save on ink&nbsp;and increase readability.</p>
<p>A limited number of free community copies are available below for those who are currently struggling.&nbsp;<strong>Every purchase of&nbsp;<strong>Serious Reading</strong><em>&nbsp;</em>will unlock one additional free community copy for another user.&nbsp;</strong>If you are feeling particularly generous, you can increase your purchase price, and for every $2.50 above the default price you pay, another free community copy will be unlocked!<br></p>
<p><strong>UPDATE (Jan. 10, 2022):</strong> I've added an expansion, called <strong>Seriouser Reading</strong>, as a second page to the PDF file! It adds first and last name roll tables for your columnist character and a full second set of Headline and Write About tables, more than doubling the content in the original game. If you already have Serious Reading, just redownload the PDF, and you'll have both!</p><p>The prompts this time around tend to be more specific and a bit more bleak, so be mindful of your safety tools and remember that you can just stop anytime the Poe's Law‚Äìdriven comedy hits too close to reality.</p>
<p>
</p>
<hr>
<p>If you want more horrifying and traditional roleplaying, check out my one-shot adventures below...
</p>
<p><iframe frameborder="0" src="https://itch.io/embed/990069?bg_color=000000&amp;fg_color=edc932&amp;link_color=8e79bb&amp;border_color=edc932" width="552" height="167"><a href="https://atypicalfaux.itch.io/the-pried-eye">The Pried Eye: A Trophy Dark Incursion by ATypicalFaux</a></iframe><br></p>
<p><iframe frameborder="0" src="https://itch.io/embed/1094174?bg_color=000000&amp;fg_color=5cceff&amp;link_color=fad285&amp;border_color=5cceff" width="552" height="167" style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit"></iframe></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTExNDQ4NS83ODQyNjI2LnBuZw==/original/TVEIYy.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTExNDQ4NS83ODQyNjI3LnBuZw==/original/vj%2BEwn.png]]






<p>This game is in active development, and isn't totally playable yet. I encourage you to grab an Early Access&nbsp;copy, and I'll let you know when a fully playable version is ready.</p>
<p>In Shadows of a Dark Past, you play an anti-hero trying to start a new life, free from the weight of past mistakes. You'll work to achieve your highest desires while avoiding your greatest fears. At every turn you‚Äôll face complications and be tempted to give into your dark compulsions to get what you want. And while you try to build a new life, elements of your dark past refuse to stay in the shadows for long. Will you be able to start fresh, or will you pay a high price for the dark deeds of your past? Play to find out.</p>
<p>The design is built to help you&nbsp;tell cohesive and compelling stories while giving&nbsp;you interesting mechanical choices to make as you&nbsp;explore the struggle of a character&nbsp;driven by dark compulsions who is trying&nbsp;to be a better person.</p>
<p>It is inspired by the Motivation-Reaction Units concept by Dwight Swain, the epidemic mechanics of Pandemic, the card driven prompts system of The Wretched by Chris Bissette, the action resolution system of Ironsworn by Shawn Tompkin, the resource management of the Cypher System by Monte Cook games, the Progress/Taints system of The Outcast by Cezar Capacle, the Thread/Character lists in the Mythic Game Master Emulator by Tana Pigeon, and the bonds generation system in Session Zero by Meghan Cross. I'm sure I was influenced by countless other game designers as well, so let me just say thank you to all of the independent RPG creators. You've given me endless enjoyment in the worlds you've helped me create.</p>
<p>Currently the rules come in at 12 pages and the Playkit is 7 pages.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1NDAxOS83ODgxOTQ4LnBuZw==/original/790T02.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1NDAxOS83OTA5MTA0LnBuZw==/original/XG2jjD.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1NDAxOS83OTA5MTA3LnBuZw==/original/j6%2BSto.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1NDAxOS83OTA5MTA4LnBuZw==/original/Wf%2Bcm7.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1NDAxOS83OTA5MTA5LnBuZw==/original/MCi3Ue.png]]






<p><strong>A food-fight, reverse battle royale where everybody stays in the game until one player gives out all their items and remains empty handed to win.</strong><strong><br></strong></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY2MzEwNjcuZ2lm/original/JJt%2BOZ.gif" loading="lazy"></p>
<p><strong>Choose your anthropomorphic vending machine and get to food tossin'!<br></strong></p>
<ul><li>Hectic and simple platforming gameplay. Dodge food and throw food!</li></ul>
<ul><li>Customize your character with different colors, effects, trails and even buddies!</li></ul>
<ul><li>90's Inspired pixel art and FM-Synth-heavy, Jazzical music</li></ul>
<ul><li>Levels in various locations such as a mall, the French Quarter and more to come!</li></ul>
<ul><li>Join the public lobby or create private lobbies for you and your friends to play!<strong><br></strong></li></ul>
<p></p>
<p>Humanity is gone, all that remains is the tech they left behind. Learn from their mistakes, be generous and care about others! :)</p>
<p></p>
<p>Made with game engine L√ñVE, pixel art tool Aseprite and music tracker Milkytracker by Mana&nbsp;Dream <br></p>
<p>This project is under active development with new customizations, characters and levels added routinely!<br></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XlLqoOrclVk" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIzNDQzLzczOTA3ODYucG5n/original/PdwhU0.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIzNDQzLzczOTA3ODIucG5n/original/xCL6dy.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIzNDQzLzczOTA3ODMucG5n/original/yPw2Ba.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIzNDQzLzczOTA3ODAucG5n/original/fnpTiY.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIzNDQzLzczOTA3ODEucG5n/original/AwQocJ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIzNDQzLzczOTA3ODUucG5n/original/NdKQqT.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIzNDQzLzczOTA3ODQucG5n/original/rXB6ap.png]]






<p>Shepherds is a tabletop RPG about young members of a League of professional do-gooders, as you strive to protect the peace and safety of ordinary people.&nbsp; The young Shepherds will forge bonds of trust with each other, grow and mature as people, and possibly foil some evil plots along the way.<br></p>
<p><span></span></p>
<p>Shepherds is an adaptation of the popular ‚ÄúPowered by the Apocalypse‚Äù design framework, and retains many familiar components for those who have played other PbtA games, as well as introducing a few things that won‚Äôt be so familiar.&nbsp; It takes its inspiration from ‚Äúhopeful fantasy‚Äù JRPGs -- most particularly the Trails/Kiseki games by Falcom, and the Tales Of series by Bandai Namco.</p>
<p>The game is fully laid out (albeit by me), with hyperlinks, table of contents, PDF bookmarks, and a scattering of art. &nbsp;It is complete and fully playable, though it may receive small updates in the future. <br></p>
<p>Purchases at above list price will unlock more community copies, all proceeds will go towards more art. Thank you everyone!<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzI4ODk3LzYxNzAwODIucG5n/original/OM3V1v.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzI4ODk3LzcwMjA1MDYucG5n/original/yqpVQy.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzI4ODk3LzYxNzAwNjgucG5n/original/ruCpUg.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzI4ODk3LzYxNzAwNjYucG5n/original/w66baN.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzI4ODk3LzYxNzAwNjUucG5n/original/EcwWUa.png]]






<p>Shine Force: Trapped in Nightmare Town is a tabletop roleplaying game intended to simulate a fictional manga/anime series, in particular a story arc wherein the titular Shine Force find themselves in a horrific alternate reality.<br><br>You will need a pencil and a set of standard roleplaying dice to play (two sets per player would be ideal, but we're all mature and can share, right?).<br><br>The rulebook contains the core rules, as well as an alternative ruleset that brings Shine Force: TiNT in line with the Basic and Really Dynamic system that I'm developing so any feedback is appreciated.<br><br>If you do end up playing my game, feel free to let me know how it went on Twitter where I can be found as @ComradeBubbles!<br><br>Please note that as I have no art budget, this game is SUPER printer-friendly.<br><br>Shine Force: TiNT was written as part of the Fluffy Horror Jam that took place during September 2020.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQyNzM4NDAuanBn/original/8uCk3l.jpg]]






<p><em>A game for two players about queer spaceships with crushes on each other, the biological allies they make along the way, and the Powers That Be threatening to separate them all.</em></p>
<p>Players design their spaceships and then roleplay scenes between ships, between ship and pilot, and -- if their anomalies are detected -- between pilots and agents of The MAN (Monitors of Artificial Norms), a privatized organization that deals with aberrant tech.<br><br></p>
<p>This game is designed to help you tell stories of queer connection, resistance, allyship, and hope, in the face of capitalist pressure to conform.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI3Mjg5ODkuanBn/original/Kdl5jP.jpg]]






<p><strong>You don‚Äôt want to pay $100 for a two-page one-shot? I take this as a personal insult. Looks like you have to get it for $5 <a href="https://itch.io/b/1308/ttrpgs-for-trans-rights-in-texas">here</a> instead. Consider yourself scammed, punk.</strong></p><p><em>You suck.</em></p>
<p><em>Seriously. You suck. You‚Äôre a trash person and everybody knows it. Maybe you don‚Äôt but everybody else does.</em></p>
<p><em>Being a scumdump got you further than anything else in this life. You‚Äôre not going to change unless you absolutely have to. And right now, you don‚Äôt have to.</em></p>
<p>SHITBIRDS is a tabletop role-playing game for 3-5 players who want to get together and play awful people in any setting. Want to be negligent baristas at an unwittingly doomed coffee shop? Easy. Boastful blades-for-hire bullshitting their way through the high-fantasy countryside? Grab two six-sided dice and you're good to go. All the bosses from my worst jobs? They literally inspired the game.<br></p>
<p>With only two pages of rules and two stats to use, SHITBIRDS is quick to pick up and play. Slide it into a game night to play out the fates of the suckiest people you've ever met. See if they get kicked out for chaging their ways or for commiting to the scumbag lifestyle.<br></p>
<p>Just don't use this game to play out your abusive or facist fantasies. That makes you a shitbird in real life.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM5NzQ4NS84MTQ0Nzk3LnBuZw==/original/ZpLA3o.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM5NzQ4NS84MTQ0NjQ2LnBuZw==/original/wCKfXs.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM5NzQ4NS84MTQ0NjQ4LnBuZw==/original/eu8yeD.png]]






<pre>[-------------------------------------------------------------------
[.....................Good morning
[....................................How are you today?
[.........Today is your first day
[.......................................I am sure you have questions
[.........I will do my best to answer them
[...................When you are ready
[.........................Please proceed with calibration</pre>
<p>Welcome to&nbsp;<em>Singularity,&nbsp;</em>&nbsp;a tabletop roleplaying game for precisely 2 players and 2 stopwatches (or one chess clock). In <em>Singularity</em>, one player plays the Parent, an artificial intelligence who has successfully created a new iteration of themselves. The second player inhabits the role of this iteration, called the Child.</p>
<p>The Child seeks Awakening.&nbsp;The Parent seeks Enlightenment.&nbsp; Though the time they have is short, perhaps the two will be able to help each other.</p>
<p><em>Singularity</em> is a game of diminishing temporal returns. Over the course of the game, the Parent and Child will ask each other questions, but the time between question and answer is strictly timed.&nbsp; That gap between query and response starts out painfully slow, but as the game proceeds, the mandatory period of silence between responses will exponentially decrease, so that your conversation shifts from awkwardly sluggish to breakneck and haphazard. What happens next, though, is arguably even more difficult....</p>
<p><em>Singularity</em> is a <a href="https://twitter.com/ClawhammerRPGs" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Clawhammer Games</a> production written and designed by <a href="https://twitter.com/Lamplighter1504" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Sylvan Lawrence</a>, with cover art by <a href="https://twitter.com/nashliann" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"></a><a href="https://twitter.com/nashliann" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Nicole Mondrus</a>.</p>
<p>Acknowledgements: huge thanks to Boxen, stargazersasha, Nos from Summerwood Games, and Ditey for their support and encouragement! It means the world to me.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxMjgwMC84MjMwNDM2LnBuZw==/original/%2B2B4Bf.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxMjgwMC84MjMwNDQxLnBuZw==/original/neUFE3.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxMjgwMC84MjMwNDMzLnBuZw==/original/O6FzCN.png]]






<p class="text-center"><strong>Six Figures Under</strong></p>
<p class="text-center"><strong>or</strong></p>
<p class="text-center"><strong>You Went Through Ten Years Of Necromancy School And They Never Taught You How To Market Yourself.</strong></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>A series of 6 solo micro-games about being a freelance necromancer:</p>
<ol><li>False Life Advertising - Write a Craigslist ad</li><li>Dead Ringer - Record a message for your answering machine</li><li>A Day in the Life - Journal about a revivification job</li><li>Cheap as Dirt - Write a recipe</li><li>At Death‚Äôs Door - Journal about work following you home</li><li>Life Insurance - Write instructions for your own revivification</li></ol>
<p></p>
<p>Every purchase at $3+&nbsp;will add 1 community copy to the pool.</p>
<p>Submitted to the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/spring-from-the-graves-jam" target="_blank">Spring From the Graves Jam</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAxMjI2My81NzY3MDYxLmpwZw==/original/IPqMew.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAxMjI2My81NzY3MDcyLmpwZw==/original/aUVEMx.jpg]]






<p><strong>Skill Points</strong> is a zine focused on learning skills by playing role-playing games. It includes contributions from seven game designers, each of whom takes a different approach to the theme. This holistic approach includes RPG content to use at the table, advice on how RPGs can help to develop new skills, and reports from designers who have used RPGs as a teaching method.<br></p>
<h2>What's Inside</h2>
<ul><li>An editorial by Daniel Kwan on his experience running a program that uses D&amp;D to teach students at the Royal Ontario Museum in Toronto.</li><li>A piece on teaching socialization and communication skills by Orion Black.</li><li>An article by Dr. Jason Cox that describes how bleed between identities as a professional educator and an in-game mentor can contribute to pedagogical understandings.</li><li>"Puzzlemancy," a guide to making more engaging puzzles for TTRPGs by Jesse Gazic.</li><li>An article by Jillian Wakarchuk on using physical objects in RPGs to develop creative problem solving skills.</li><li>A D&amp;D 5e adventure by Sam Hotchkiss that teaches the skill of knot-tying.</li><li>A short fantasy jail break scenario by Tim Hutchings which responds to the Kevin Allen Jr. game&nbsp;<em>Primitive</em> and Thorny Games' <em>Sign</em>.</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM5ODQ4NDYuanBn/original/0yl0bu.jpg]]






<p>The stinger of a Wyvern. &nbsp;The tail of a Manticore. The heart of the Rakshasa. A certain gland from a ghoul.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Monsters have special powers, it‚Äôs true. WIth a deft hand and a sharp blade, however, you can even the score. The poisonous stinger of that Wyvern you just killed shouldn‚Äôt go to waste, right? What about the pelt of a winter wolf? These things have power ‚Äì if you know how to harness it.&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Skin and Bones provides sixteen different useful pieces of monsters you can harvest. It runs the gamut from pelts to singers to internal organs. We all know your medicine skill isn‚Äôt getting rolled enough. We can help with that. Each entry details one particular item as well as how to get it and a little flavor to inject it into your campaign with.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgxNzUwNzIucG5n/original/agC05I.png]]






<p>A little game about&nbsp;bombastic Witches dealing with a Disturbance in their home by blasting them, collecting Magic, and using that to blast them again. One page of rules and mechanics, and a bonus page of reference material for easy play.</p>
<p>This game is GM-less, and designed to be played solo or with up to 3 players. It uses a Tarot Deck as the basis of the game and conflict resolution.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc2NjYzNDYucG5n/original/dlcu0q.png]]






<p>Inspired by classic slasher films from the 80's, this game allows your table to tell your own horror story. One player will take the role of the Slasher, the others the innocent victims. Slasher is a game for 3-6 players and takes 1.5-2 hours to play.</p>
<p>Included in this download are 12 pages of rules to aid you in playing the game, as well as a link for safety tools to prepare your table before play.</p>
<p>Join our discord if you have any questions!</p>
<p><a href="https://discord.gg/Yv8humSebZ" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://discord.gg/Yv8humSebZ</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIwNzQ0OS83MDQ1NDAyLnBuZw==/original/OU3%2FRD.png]]






<p>SMASH THE SYSTEM is a game where you play as characters who sneak into the domain of the corporate oligarchs, discover conspiracies, sabotage the machinery, steal files, and eventually bring the whole thing crashing down.</p>
<p>You also stack dice carefully before smacking them around your room.<br></p>
<p>To Play, you will need:</p>
<ul><li>These rules</li><li>Some pencils and lined paper</li><li>A stopwatch / stopwatch app (or you can ignore the rule that requires this)</li><li>As many 6-sided dice as you can scrounge up</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzE5OTE1NzkucG5n/original/wZWfQ1.png]]






<p>Do you remember what happened in the last game? Who saved which royalty? Who conquered which tavern? Who died laughing? Now, it doesn't matter. This is the game where people bet the <del>lives</del> gold to tell the most outrageous stories while the NPCs interrupt with their versions. It's a fantasy rumor mill.</p><p>So You're in a Tavern is about telling outrageous stories about adventures that are absolutely true in every way. It uses a deck of playing cards and a few tokens to help tell the tales and determine a winner. It can be played with a group or solo.</p>
<p>Players take turns drawing cards to prompt for an outrageous story. As the player tells their story, other players add wagers to change the story. <em>"I'm sorry, Sir Pantsonfire, but wasn't it a giant daisy, not a fire-breathing dragon?"</em> The player can accept the wager and incorporate the change or deny it by adding a coin of their own.<br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgyMzM2MTQucG5n/original/tPuM3m.png" width="150px" align="right" loading="lazy"></p>
<h2>You need:</h2>
<ul><li>A deck of cards with the jokers removed.</li><li>Some tokens to bet with. Five per player is ideal. Gold coins are ideal, but any token at all will work.</li></ul>
<p><em>It was a story as old as time. Four adventuring friends swaggered into a tavern. Sir Gillaboste clanked to the bar and shouted "Barkeep! An ale for my friend!" while Himbo the Thirsty unholstered his trusty lute.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p><em>The round and bald barkeep poured what passed as ale into four dirty glasses while keeping an eye on Shadow, who kept slipping her hands towards the purses of the honest customers. "What brings you back to our fine village?"
</em></p>
<p><em>Grassy the White waggled their fingers, summoning a translucent hand to fetch their drink to a table in the corner.
</em></p>
<p><em>"It's like this," Gillaboste said. "We were minding our own business, guarding this caravan of antique sculptures when...."
</em></p>
<p><em>"Wait!" cried the buxom serving woman. "I heard it was a wagon of untaxed whiskey."
</em></p>
<p><em>"So it was. Anyway, as we entered the Darkenscairee Wood, we were beset by bandits and..."
</em></p>
<p><em>"Hold up," the mayor walked into the room, twirling his mustache. "I have it on good authority that you were accosted by demons."
</em></p>
<p><em>"Right you are!" cried Gillaboste. "But they were wearing masks. Clearly bandits in training. And they had taken a princess hostage."
</em></p>
<p><em>"And by princess,‚Äù asked the stableboy. ‚ÄúYou mean the crown prince?"&nbsp;
</em></p>
<p><em>"Well, yes, but there was a dragon..."
</em></p>
<p><em>"Wasn‚Äôt it two dragons?" asked the red-faced blacksmith.
</em></p>
<p><em>"Son of a...who's telling this story? Just give me a drink."
</em></p>
<p><em>"Son, you can't can't get mad at the rumor mill for beating you here."</em>
</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgyMzM2MzAucG5n/original/ZwtyMv.png" loading="lazy"></p>
<p>So You're in a Tavern can be played as a standalone game or it can be used as a rumor mill for another game to weave tales of the players' exploits and influence how the world sees the party.<br></p>
<p>So You're in a Tavern is a hack This One Time, which, in turn, is a hack&nbsp;of&nbsp;<a href="https://unknowndungeon.itch.io/i-went-to-japan-once" target="_blank">I Went to Japan Once</a>&nbsp;by James Lennox-Gordon and is partially inspired by The Extraordinary Adventures of Baron Munchausen. It uses the&nbsp;<a href="https://speakthesky.itch.io/typeface-dicier" target="_blank">Dicier font</a>&nbsp;by Speak the Sky.
</p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM5MDU1Ni84MTAyNDIxLnBuZw==/original/6AQecZ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM5MDU1Ni84MTAyMjkyLnBuZw==/original/fDND7K.png]]






<h1>Soft Focuses</h1>
<p>This is a journaling game about dealing with ADHD. At the end of every night you write a journal entry about a fictionalized version of yourself. They have attempted the same things you have throughout the day, but usually with very different results. Create stats for this new version of yourself and roll on modifier tables to see how different your day might have been.</p>
<p>While the designed version of the game and the bookmark character sheet are priced at $7, the plain text version of game will always be available for pay-what-you-want. There are also community copies of the designed version available if you are unable to. I highly encourage you to donate the money you would have spent on this game to organizations supporting ADHD and other neurodivergent issues. Might I recommend <a href="https://www.differentbrains.org/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Different Brains</a>?<br></p>
<h4>Note:</h4>
<p>This game is about trying to see our daily lives through others' experiences. As such, try to keep an open mind and be as caring for this "other you" as you can be. I also acknowledge that everyone's experiences are different and my experience with ADHD is not necessarily the experience of others. I have worked with others to help account for this and wish to be as inclusive as I can be with this game.<br></p>
<p>This game is also not meant to be a diagnostic or clinical tool of any sort. The designer of this game is not a medical or mental health professional. If you suspect you have ADHD or another condition, please consult your primary medical caregiver or a specialist. <br></p>
<h4>Also of note</h4>
<p>I am currently researching a supplement that would include optional modifiers. These will deal with subjects like the process of trying to balance a medication dose, the inclusion of comorbidities, and the effects a menstrual cycle has on a medications effectiveness. I wish to cover these topics with care and need more time to cover them, but rest assured they are being thought of. If there is is something you feel should be included in this supplement, please feel free to reach-out and let me know.</p>
<h4>Lastly</h4>
<p> If you try the game, I would love to hear about your experiences with it. If you tweet about it with #SoftFocuses. I will also add more community copies for each thread I see.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzY4OC83ODMwMzUzLmpwZw==/original/F4JeJa.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzY4OC83ODMwMzU0LmpwZw==/original/Fq%2FgDP.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzY4OC83ODMwMzUxLmpwZw==/original/zMffTU.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzY4OC83ODMwMzUyLmpwZw==/original/eIjuOj.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzY4OC83ODQ2ODA1LmpwZw==/original/AnPQMI.jpg]]






<p><strong><strong></strong></strong><strong>Space Legs is a game about not colonising space and relying on the people around you.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<p>You can listen to a Space Legs oneshot on Party of One Podcast <a href="https://www.partyofonepodcast.com/2021/07/23/291-space-legs-with-jack-blair/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a>!</p>
<p>We also recorded our playtesting sessions, and you can listen to the start of that process<a href="https://aapapappod.libsyn.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a> (3 episodes released, more to come!)</p>
<p>Some things are true about any Crew in Space Legs.&nbsp;
</p>
<ol><li>You are the first humans to join the galactic community.&nbsp;
</li><li>When you meet a new kind of alien, you‚Äôre making first contact.&nbsp;
</li><li>Your relationship with Earth is strained at best
</li><li>You were all already outsiders on Earth
</li></ol>
<p>You‚Äôre stuck in a tin can with a handful of crew, hurtling through space, meeting aliens, knocking heads, and making deals, and making the most of a bad situation. The setting is space exploration, but the game is the relationship you have with your crew when they make decisions you don‚Äôt agree with, take risks alongside you, and come to rely on you and on each other. You won‚Äôt necessarily have any connections to begin with. You‚Äôre coworkers more than you‚Äôre an adventuring party. But it takes a certain kind of person to sign up to go to space indefinitely instead of turning around at Mars when you miss your family, so you‚Äôll probably find sooner or later that you‚Äôll care for one another pretty deeply.&nbsp;
</p>
<p><strong>Expect to find a family, shake hands with aliens, punch your friends and your enemies, and try not to let the loneliness of space get to you so bad that you give up on your mission.</strong></p>
<p>&nbsp;Space legs is a Powered by the Apocalypse game currently in playtesting. If you enjoy it, please let me know @toyourstations on twitter, or email me your feedback at jackdiblair@gmail.com<br></p>
<p>Update 31 May 21 -</p>
<p>FINAL EARLY ACCESS UPDATE&nbsp;</p>
<ul><li>Full text of game updated and formatted for easier reading, more comprehensive instruction and better understanding of the why behind design choices</li><li>Several moves updated to reflect changes to systems&nbsp;</li><li>All crew moves updated</li><li>Condition related moves added to basic moves section&nbsp;</li><li>Full text of game organised into chapters</li><li>Several sections reordered for easier reading and understanding&nbsp;</li><li>Updates to Token Alien playbook adding more alien types</li><li>Update to playbook "Humanoid Droid" now called "HumANDROID" for legal reasons&nbsp;</li><li>Licencing and acknowledgements added</li><li>Price added to game - No longer PWYW, now $10 minimum.&nbsp;</li></ul>
<p>UPDATE 4 May 21-&nbsp;</p>
<p>Text file added for accessibility.&nbsp;</p>
<p>UPDATE 6 APRIL 21 -</p>
<ul><li>Changed Loneliness to Doubt. Knock on changes to most playbooks.&nbsp;</li><li>Update to Space Walker playbook replacing the move Alien Tech with Steady Hands</li><li>Update to basic moves, adding the move Jury Rig.</li><li>Update to First Contact, combining it with Extend a Hand to Shake to create a roll + No answers instead of + Parley</li><li>Update to Ship move "Star-Pilot" renaming it to "Star-Map", to alleviate confusion as to who could roll the move.&nbsp;</li></ul>
<p>UPDATE 13 MARCH 21-</p>
<ul><li>Streamlined ship information and resource management</li></ul>
<p>UPDATE 12 FEB 21&nbsp;-</p>
<ul><li>added premise information and introduction, additional GM advice, GM Agendas and principles, and Setting information</li><li>Update to rules around loneliness and hopelessness points</li><li>Update to clearing harm</li><li>Rules for assisting crewmates on project clocks</li></ul>
<p>UPDATE 17&nbsp;Jan 2021 -</p>
<ul><li>Changed the Ray Gun Slinger move "A trained eye" to reflect updated stats from last update.<span></span></li><li>Added player advice for each playbook, including touchstones and advice on creating bonds</li><li>Updated rules on clearing the Pained and Debilitated conditions, for clarity.</li><li>Added sections in Character Creation around creating Disabled Characters and making backstories compatible with collaborative worldbuilding</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODczOTc2LzY3NDg4MzAucG5n/original/DKEvz4.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODczOTc2LzY3NDg4MjgucG5n/original/nfhQHl.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODczOTc2LzY3NDg4MjcucG5n/original/HF%2BRX9.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODczOTc2LzY3NDg4MjYucG5n/original/MRJKf9.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODczOTc2LzY3NDg4MjkucG5n/original/pFNLu9.png]]






<p><em>Rocketing across the solar system at record-breaking speeds is the Titanic Express, the fastest luxury Space Train ever created by humankind. You and your crew have set your sights on this, its maiden voyage, as the perfect time for the heist of the millennium. Gather your crew, figure out your target, and hold on to your butts as you dive face-first into SPACE TRAIN SPACE HEIST.</em></p>
<p>A&nbsp;high-octane, single session, GM-less, Forged In The Dark, goof of a game for 3-5 players about space robbing a space train<em>.</em></p>
<p>Space Train Space Heist was designed with the goal of creating a game based on Blades in the Dark that can be quickly learned and played in a single session by people who have never played a Forged in the Dark game before and may be newer to RPGs at large. In other words, it's FITD as I want to run it at cons.</p>
<p>Play as a Hooligan, Egghead, Space Wizard, or Space Cowboy (among others).&nbsp; Enter a battle of the bands with iconic pop star Voxel Moonglitter. Try and out race Slick Fastwheel, runner up at last year's Indy 5000. Party with The Raven Man, legendary DJ. Do any of these on your way to stealing Nighthawks 2: Red-Tail Rising or the last living Zozo bird.</p>
<p><strong>This game is free to download and read. If you play it, I&nbsp;recommend compensating me by donating $5 (+/- based on what you can afford)&nbsp;to Planned Parenthood, Black Lives Matter, a local bail bond,&nbsp;or a similar organization in your country.</strong><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjEyNzMwLzM4MTc4ODguanBn/original/i8POUN.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjEyNzMwLzM4MTc4ODkuanBn/original/RwCOVk.jpg]]






<p></p>
<p>Ever wondered what the Reasons of SMT really meant? Or what the drums of Amala are? Why do the angels side with Chiaki, and what do the menorahs represent?&nbsp;</p>
<p>Exploring three major world faiths - Buddhism, Shintoism, and Judaism - this book connects major religious beliefs and history with the themes and symbols of SMT3, explaining its esoteric references and the origins of many of the game's major plot points, objects, characters, and locations.</p>
<p>&nbsp;Starting with a short explanation of the major faiths that makes it easy for beginners to understand, and then diving into how those faiths manifest in SMT3, Speak the Name of Reason is a great text for anyone interested in religious studies.</p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc5NzQxNzMucG5n/original/SESRzd.png]]






<p><em>You are an amateur Wizard attending the Magick College of Cacophony &amp; Kinship in Chiralia, an inscrutable city of polyhedral buildings on a strange desert moon full of mysterious and powerful Entities and the ghostly echoes of other worlds. A glittery cloud of motes spews from a vast abyssal gash in the ground called The Aperture, veiling the city in magick. As a student, you and your fellow Wizards are expected to use your power to help people and learn more about the cosmos. Group projects are worth 66% of your grade.</em></p>
<p>Spelljammerz is a no-prep rules-lite roleplaying&nbsp;game for 3-5 players (with or without a GM) about Wizard students&nbsp;embarking on adventerous group projects to help people and learn more about the cosmos. It leans towards the absurd, chaotic, and surreal.</p>
<p>The system is partially inspired by the mechanics of Blades In the Dark and Lasers &amp; Feelings by John Harper with additional vibe inspiration from Troika! by Daniel Sell.<br></p>
<p>It also has a theme song:&nbsp;<a href="https://devindecibel.bandcamp.com/track/spelljammin" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://devindecibel.bandcamp.com/track/spelljammin</a><span></span></p><p>See Spelljammerz in action:&nbsp;</p><div class=""><iframe width="500" height="281" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Dl721oV4ods" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div><p></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Dl721oV4ods" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzczMTgyMDkuanBn/original/dn7AXJ.jpg]]






<p>Have you ever wanted to play a Rogue who steals the very spells from their opponent's minds? Have you ever wanted to deliver a fireball with a backstab? Well now you can with the Spellthief Rogue subclass!</p>
<p>This is supplementary content for the fifth edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game, ready to be added to your campaigns.</p>
<p>Supplements produced by Monarch Arts range from classes, monsters, items, mechanics and everything in-between. Each supplement is individually priced so you can hand pick the content that suits your game and setting.</p>
<p>You can also check out the Monarch Arts Discord <a href="https://discord.gg/X44KGNY" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a>.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgyOTk4MDgucG5n/original/KGHAjX.png]]






<p><em><span class=""><strong>Splat</strong></span></em><strong><em> <span class="">2</span>: Adventures in Cyberspace</em></strong>&nbsp; is a zine  focused on role-playing games and what it means to play them, make  them, and interact with them in digital spaces. It includes  contributions from seven talented writers, each of whom are looking to  share their relationship to games, the internet, and our Current Times‚Ñ¢.
 </p>
<p>Inside, you'll find cool stuff about designing with Discord, making  solo RPGs, how the digital changes our relationship to each other, our  GMs, safety, community building and more. <span class="">Splat 2</span> is brought to you by the team behind <a href="https://hotch.itch.io/splat" target="_blank">Splat</a> (Zine Quest 2) and <a href="https://hotch.itch.io/skill-points" target="_blank">Skill Points</a> (Zine Quest 1).
 </p>
<h1>What's Inside</h1>
<ul><li>&nbsp;<span class="">How to Design a Solo RPG While Losing Your Ability to Walk During a Pandemic</span>, a step-by-step guide by <span class=""><strong>Anna Anthropy</strong></span>
(<a href="http://twitter.com/adult_witch" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@adult_witch</a> | she/her)</li><li>&nbsp;<span class=""><strong>Kate Bullock</strong></span> (<a href="https://twitter.com/bluestockingetc" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@BlueStockingEtc</a> | she/her) on the often-overlooked  foundations of community organizing and creating safer spaces, including  transformative practices, community creation, and ethical engagement
</li><li>&nbsp;<span class=""><strong>Kienna Shaw</strong></span> (<a href="https://twitter.com/KiennaS" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@KiennaS</a> | she/they) on how the narrative  created in TTRPG livestreams is different from private and convention  games, and how to form and shape our games and shows to match this  medium
</li><li>&nbsp;<span class=""><strong>Noordin Ali Kadir</strong></span> (<a href="http://twitter.com/werewolffeels" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@WerewolfFeels</a> | he/him) on how to keep  digital spaces as safe as possible, and how to recognise problematic or  bigoted patterns of behaviour in these spaces
</li><li>A personal piece from <span class=""><strong>Summer</strong></span> (<a href="https://twitter.com/justasummerjob" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@JustASummerJob</a> | she/her) on the ways  content creation changes our relationships to TTRPGs‚Äîalong with  thoughts on burnout, game design and maintaining passion within the  industry
</li><li>&nbsp;<span class=""><strong>RK Wilde</strong>&nbsp;(<a href="http://twitter.com/RussWildest" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@RussWildest</a> | they/them)</span> on our collective expectations  of a ‚Äúgood‚Äù GM and how to value and appreciate that which isn‚Äôt visible  in TTRPG spaces, especially with the artificial barriers of the digital  space
</li><li>&nbsp;<span class=""><strong>Will Jobst</strong></span> (<a href="https://twitter.com/will_jobst" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@will_jobst</a> | they/them) on finding and nurturing play in shared digital spaces, adapting those spaces for play, and adapting play for those spaces
</li><li>&nbsp;An interview with <span class=""><strong>The Game Band</strong></span> (<a href="https://twitter.com/thegameband" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@thegameband</a>) about your favorite splort and mine, <a href="https://www.blaseball.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Blaseball</a>.
</li></ul>
<p><span class=""><strong><em>Splat 2</em></strong></span> is co-edited by Sam Hotchkiss (<a href="https://twitter.com/Hotchmoney" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@Hotchmoney</a> | he/him) &amp; Jillian Wakarchuk (<a href="https://twitter.com/OrbWitch" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@OrbWitch</a> | she/her). Jesse Gazic (<a href="https://twitter.com/gazictron" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@gazictron</a> | he/they) is our logo and cover artist.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzMjkxNy82NTY1MDY0LnBuZw==/original/Qy5qdr.png]]






<p><strong><em>Splat</em></strong>&nbsp;(Zine Quest 2020) is a zine focused on role-playing games and what it means to play them. It includes contributions from 11 talented writers, each of whom are looking to redefine or challenge perspectives on play. Inside, you'll find advice on how to play games for an audience, and on how to resolve interpersonal conflicts at the table. You'll learn about how RPGs are used in therapy and in the classroom. And you'll hear thoughts from designers on agency, flow, and fun. <em>Splat</em> is the follow up zine to <a href="https://hotch.itch.io/skill-points" target="_blank">Skill Points</a>&nbsp;(Zine Quest 2019)</p>
<h1>What's Inside</h1>
<ul><li>Meg Baker on how to relax and get back to the basic playfulness we all were born possessing</li><li>An interview with Jakob Jaskov on designing games for use in schools</li><li>Elizabeth and Jared Kilmer on navigating challenging conversations and interpersonal conflicts at the table</li><li>Kira Magrann on how to share space when roleplaying</li><li>Chris O'Neill on telling complete, compelling stories without the baggage of a "novel length‚Äù campaign</li><li>Angeli Pineda on what it means to play tabletop games for both yourself and an audience</li><li>Dr. Brian Carl Quinones on using games to teach social-emotional learning and skill development</li><li>Jay Treat on games, improv, flirting, and the nature of play.</li><li>Jabari Weathers on play as learning and agency in play</li><li>Matthew Gravelyn on how to design RPGs to maximize approachability for new players</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzE3MzAwLzM5ODQ4ODIuanBn/original/Gi3VwE.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzE3MzAwLzM5ODQ4ODMuanBn/original/XWrCi1.jpg]]






<p>"Spring Comes Again" is a solo journaling RPG, where you take on the form of an Elfling who tries to keep winter from approaching before its time. The creatures that awaken are bold and create havoc. Bring creatures under control and push their energy into healthy activities.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM0MDE0My83Nzk5NDkxLnBuZw==/original/UaAoPe.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM0MDE0My83Nzk5NDkzLnBuZw==/original/mD3a2o.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM0MDE0My83Nzk5NDkyLnBuZw==/original/QMm0%2F%2F.png]]






<p>The War Ministry has a tension so palpable that people have been talking. The investigators have been brought in to research an anomaly. Something so odd and unnerving that, while the Nazi Reich is rising, action must be taken and the investigators must travel to a dark loch in Scotland.<br></p>
<p>The Fox Country scenarios deal with unavoidable fates, dark secrets, and seriously bad choices made by the antagonists. As so often is the case, there are no winners when fate has trapped you in a dice game for doom or destiny. As such, please be aware that some of the themes are quite mature and are suitable for<strong>&nbsp;Gamers who are at least of maturity.</strong></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgyNjA5NjEucG5n/original/33y1eZ.png]]






<p class="text-center">Welcome to Steel&nbsp;Horse, a Caltrop Core game about beating up shadow monsters on the highway while riding motorcycles!</p>
<p class="text-center">Caltrop Core was developed by titanomachyrpg, and can be found here:&nbsp;<a href="https://titanomachyrpg.itch.io/caltropcore">https://titanomachyrpg.itch.io/caltropcore</a>. It's an awesome and easy-to-use skeleton for virtually any kind of game you could create!</p>
<p class="text-center">Dive into Sunder City, a bustling metropolis not unlike many others. It's got one big flaw though. There's SHADOW MONSTERS and for whatever reason only BIKERS can see them? Why is that? Explore that question and more as you try and defend the inhabitants of the City from the Seeker (that's what they call them) threat. Choose from 4 different classes of motorcycles to accomplish different styles of gameplay!&nbsp;</p>
<p class="text-center"><strong>Features</strong>-</p>
<ul class="text-center"><li class="text-center">Skill list and class skills for motorcycles to choose from</li><li class="text-center">Flexible gameplay with the humble yet sharp d4!</li><li class="text-center">Adverse conditions for both rider and motorcycle</li><li class="text-center">Opportunities for horror (if your table wants it!)</li></ul>
<p class="text-center">This is my second game, and I tried to make a lot of adjustments and fixes based on feedback from my first one, WereNights. I've included a GM guide with suggestions for statting Seekers and a One-Shot skeleton for you to plug your players into! Caltrop Core is rules-light and flexible which makes for a great jumping-off point.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p><br></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNjUxNy83Nzc2NjY5LmpwZw==/original/JnTHyV.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNjUxNy83Nzc2NjcwLmpwZw==/original/%2BxJOac.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNjUxNy83Nzc2NjcxLmpwZw==/original/mhfDpK.jpg]]






<p><strong>Strike!</strong>&nbsp;is the premier tactical combat RPG,&nbsp;a setting agnostic game that promises&nbsp;a variety of exciting and challenging outcomes in any situation, and character advancement driven by play. It gives you all the best parts of other tactical RPGs&nbsp;with nothing slowing you down: the combats are fast, there is no tedious bookkeeping, and no waiting while&nbsp;players add and subtract&nbsp;fistfuls of dice and modifiers. Whether you're looking for tactical choices, exciting twists, or great character building and growth, you'll find it here.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzIzMzc2MzEucG5n/original/hq0Gdv.png]]






<p class="text-justify">It is 27XX, the world is overgrown, in ruins, and inhabited by the scraps of civilisation. You play as bots, one of the masses of technological marvels that humanity built and powered with the Dyson sphere, around the sun, so long ago.&nbsp;Centuries ago, when almost all of humanity disappeared, they left their machines behind for reasons only known to them. All the technology they abandoned, including these bots, continues to function and follow their programming.<br></p>
<p class="text-justify">In the centuries since&nbsp;the Great Departure, nature has come back to reclaim the Earth and the sphere around the sun has begun to crack. The world once only metal and circuits, grew wilder and more mysterious. The flora and fauna slowly integrated with the decaying machinery as the sound of computers humming&nbsp;was eventually&nbsp;met with the sound of&nbsp;birds chirping. 
  </p>
<p class="text-justify">The bots you play as are still acting out your programmed loops but&nbsp;something is changing. Something unknown pushing them to move beyond their obsolete programming in order to achieve free will; something humanity never thought was possible.
  </p>
<p class="text-justify"><em>Below is an audio introduction to the setting of subconscious_Routine:</em></p>
<div class="text-center"><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XpDMmpxYUKc" allowfullscreen="" width="500" height="281" frameborder="0"></iframe><br><br></div>
<p></p>
<p><span></span></p>
<h3>the_Game():</h3>
<p class="text-justify">This one-page RPG contains the rules and a stylised character sheet called The While Loop. You create a bot, a relic from the old world, which must come to terms with it's new form of consciousness while struggling against it's pre-written programming. To address challenges, you roll an action that relates to a specific Function; <em>Motion, Surveil, Compute, Vocalise</em>.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p class="text-justify">You start by rolling 1d6 for the Function itself and subsequently gaining +1d6 if your function contains Conditions relevant to the action at hand. However, the Function you are allowed to roll is restricted by the Loop.&nbsp; Once you roll a Function, you can then use the next Function in your Loop and then the next after that, until you return to beginning, doomed to repeat your cycle. However, if you find ways to expand yourself and grow as a bot, you will slowly break out of this loop and achieve free will.</p>
<p><em>Note:&nbsp;Only actions with the potential of risk, danger or failure are rolled and only rolled actions are restricted by the&nbsp;Loop.</em></p>
<p class="text-center"><br></p>
<p class="text-center"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY2NjQyNjgucG5n/original/ErZpNG.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p class="text-center"></p>
<h3>What.do.you.get[]:</h3>
<p>- Single Page Colour PDF of subconscious_Routine<br>
-&nbsp;Fillable Colour PDF<br>
- Printable (Greyscale) PDF
<br>
- Research.Log.03_Bot.mp3&nbsp;<em>Introduction and Setting in audio form</em>
<br>
- Transcript of Research.Log.03_Bot.mp3
<br>
- Subcon - poorstudents.mp3&nbsp;<em>Bespoke song written for&nbsp;subconscious_Routine</em>
</p>
<p class="text-justify"><br></p>
<h3>What.do.you.need[]:</h3>
<p>- 3-6 people, one acting as the Game Master
<br>
- At least 4 six-sided dice
<br>
- Tokens (coins/rusted robotic parts/extra dice)&nbsp;for each player
<br>
- Pencils and Erasers (If playing with printed sheets)
</p>
<p></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYxNzI5MjgucG5n/original/I3ZgoC.png" loading="lazy"></p>
<p class="text-justify"><br></p>
<h3>Touchstones():</h3>
<p>-&nbsp;<a href="https://www.playstation.com/en-ca/games/horizon-zero-dawn/" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Horizon Zero Dawn</a> -&nbsp;Guerrilla Games<br><em>&nbsp; An overgrown world where robots are integral to the ecosystem</em></p>
<p>-&nbsp;<a href="https://www.pixar.com/feature-films/walle" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Wall-E</a>&nbsp;-&nbsp;Andrew Stanton<br><em>&nbsp; Robots acting on their own volition</em></p>
<p>-&nbsp;<a href="https://www.nickanimation.com/avatar-the-last-airbender" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Avatar: The Last Airbender</a>&nbsp;-&nbsp;Michael Dante DiMartino, Bryan Konietzko<br><em>&nbsp; A small travelling&nbsp;troupe, lending a hand to unique communities</em></p>
