<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XpDMmpxYUKc" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY1ODgwMjEucG5n/original/aVoV3M.png]]






<p>Sudden Death allows you to resolve easy combat encounters with a single die roll and a conversation. This gives you more time and more impact for the encounters that really matter. It also helps to open up communication at your table by giving some narrative control to each player.&nbsp; Each class has been mechanically balanced for the resources available and has a separate table that can be consulted to determine how the combat&nbsp;unfolds.&nbsp;Sudden&nbsp;Death will make every campaign using the fifth edition of the&nbsp;world's most popular roleplaying game better.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTUxMzA5LzI4ODMzNzcuanBn/original/JRSfAS.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTUxMzA5LzM2NTgwOTkucG5n/original/GRDTra.png]]






<p>You're a superhero in training, waiting for the call to save the world. You're also a high school senior in detention on the Saturday before graduation, but you've got more important things to do. How will you escape? Where will you go? Will you make unlikely friendships with the other seniors in super detention? Will you be the ones to save the day?&nbsp;</p>
<p>This game is a one page RPG inspired by classic 80s teen movies, secret schools for superheroes, new wave music (which is old) and retrowave music (which is newer).</p>
<p><strong>The Soundtrack:</strong></p>
<p>No 80's game would be complete without it's own mixtape for your enjoyment.&nbsp;</p>
<p><a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/3X8OUdEYTX8QhfgBiQzOMW?si=d737f092a24747df" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Click here to go to the playlist</a> or start playing it here:</p>
<p><iframe src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/playlist/3X8OUdEYTX8QhfgBiQzOMW?utm_source=generator&amp;theme=0" width="100%" height="80" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe><br></p>
<p><strong>Where to find us:</strong>
</p>
<ul><li>Follow us on&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/OrpheusPress" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">twitter</a>&nbsp;for more games and news.
</li><li>Join our&nbsp;<a href="https://wixsite.us20.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=93b2ee08fe30598e29a03c3cd&amp;id=476cddafc6" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">mailing list</a>&nbsp;if you want to keep up with new releases!
</li></ul>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM2NDYzNS83OTQ0MjQ3LnBuZw==/original/Edc%2BNH.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM2NDYzNS83OTQ0MjQ0LnBuZw==/original/2917ik.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM2NDYzNS83OTQ0MjQ1LnBuZw==/original/5aDEXH.png]]






<p>I love superheroes. I love generators. But man, do I&nbsp;hate mile-long compendiums of every single thing in existence under a particular heading, and then having to flip back and forth between page 13 and 47, and still being shackled to the dictations of tables.</p>
<p>So instead of having an omniscient&nbsp;superpower encyclopedia, I thought it would be nice to make something that would be capable of producing a whopping 1,296 different outputs, while still giving plenty of opportunity for interpretation and&nbsp;customization ‚Äî all spawned from just 4 tables.</p>
<p><em><strong>Supertables</strong></em> is pretty much just that:&nbsp;a&nbsp;collection of tables, with some structures connecting them, which you can use to create powers and contexts for characters in a superhero setting. It's not a game... or maybe it is. Or maybe it's a part of a game. Call it what you will, and it will be that thing. (As long as it involves generating superpowers.)<br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Made for the&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/jam/beyond-the-super-jam" target="_blank">Beyond the Super Jam</a>, hosted by&nbsp;<a href="https://metagame.itch.io/" target="_blank">Riley Rethal</a>.</p>
<p>I'd love to hear your thoughts about this! Leave a comment below, and/or&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/lxnrhinners" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">tweet at me.</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM1MDMwNTEucG5n/original/QZQ0l2.png]]






<p class="text-center"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgyOTIwNzEucG5n/original/boEcHc.png" loading="lazy"><br></p><p>Created for the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/lightanddarknessjam" target="_blank">Light &amp; Dark GameJam</a><span></span><span></span>, this horror game uses a modified version of the Gambit system to bring 2 Players together in a place of darkness. Light is the only thing that might keep them safe from the Shades that occupy the land of the old mansion and grounds. Sadly, light is the rarest thing they possess.<br></p>
<p>Can two strangers, stolen from their normal lives and placed in this house with none of their belongings, survive long enough to escape, or until dawn keeps the Shades at bay? Can they unravel any of the mystery behind what happened in this house? Can they do any of this as a team, or will one prove to be willing to betray the other for a better chance of survival?</p>
<p>Replayable, with multiple potential difficulties, Surprise! is part board-game, part TTRPG, all guaranteed to bring you back to the table for another challenge.</p>
<p>The Gambit: Surprise! rules are also available as a standalone purchase <a href="http://leekhulme.itch.io/gambit-surprise" target="_blank">here</a>.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgxMDIwOTcucG5n/original/PCMwPR.png]]






<p>A game about being happy, being sad, and being everything in between.</p>
<p>sweet*peony is a two-player game about telling the story of a person or an object through the lenses of Joy or Sorrow using a regular deck of cards. Whether your story encompasses a day, a week, a year, or a lifetime, joy and sorrow are natural parts of life, and what that looks like is up to you.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>You can watch an Actual Play of this game here!</p><div class=""><iframe width="500" height="281" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/mEi65yM7Gek" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div><p></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/mEi65yM7Gek" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzUxMzU5NzkuanBn/original/7A5XAC.jpg]]






<p>Sword Quest - Addendum is a supplement for the minimalist yet very flexible and expandable RPG called Sword Quest!</p>
<p>It contains optional rules and guidance to expand the scope of your game and make the game play more dynamic! This small pockedmod supplement contains the following:&nbsp;</p>
<ul><li>Rules for Adversity Token to stimulate heroic narratives.</li><li>Rules for Pushing the Roll to make the game more dramatic.</li><li>Rules for Helping your allies.</li><li>Rules for Effort, allowing players to sacrifice their health to accomplish epic deeds.</li><li>Rules for Exploration to adjudicate dungeon and hexcrawl scenarios.</li><li>Guidance for spellcasting!&nbsp;</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE3NTkyNy82ODQ2OTc3LnBuZw==/original/Zd8kN7.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE3NTkyNy82ODQ2OTgwLnBuZw==/original/qJPrPT.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE3NTkyNy82ODQ2OTc5LnBuZw==/original/lm67x9.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE3NTkyNy82ODQ2OTc4LnBuZw==/original/2QKHzC.png]]






<p>Swordquest is a handmade&nbsp;micro tabletop RPG inspired by Classic Gamas and their modern counterparts!</p>
<p>All you need to play is your imagination, a few six-sided dice and some friends.</p>
<p>You can create a character in just a few minutes (or seconds) and star playing right away. The game doesn't use classes and allows for infinite customization.</p>
<p>You can run any fantasy adventure with this tight ruleset and we incite you to create your own material for it.</p>
<p>Swordquest is released under Creative Commons&nbsp;Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-SA 4.0).</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNTMzOS82NTg3NDE3LnBuZw==/original/U0K7bl.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNTMzOS82NTg3NDE4LnBuZw==/original/5eo6IN.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNTMzOS82NTg3NDIxLnBuZw==/original/WRAVh8.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNTMzOS82NTg3NDIwLnBuZw==/original/jr2q0u.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEzNTMzOS82NTg3NDE5LnBuZw==/original/muJYPl.png]]






<p>Syndicate Powers is a Tabletop Roleplaying Game about Supernatural Assassins&nbsp;built on Caltrops Core by TitanomachyRPG&nbsp;</p>
<p>In Syndicate Powers Players will fill the Roles of Assassins part of the Syndicate a group of Supernatural Assassins that take on Missions for Coin, to further their own Agenda or other reasons. The Players get sent on a mission to fulfill a certain Objective or several Objectives while using their Gears and Powers as well as Creativity to overcome obstacles in new ways, kill targets in a surprisingly satisfying fashion or flee in the most unexpected ways.</p><p>The Game is supposed to take between 2-4 hours for 2-5 Players (one of which will be the GM)</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc3NjEzNTEuanBn/original/6fm3wf.jpg]]






<p>In the modern era occultists use painted street art to channel magic into reality altering spells. But with after effects that could tear apart the streets around them. Tagger Magic is set using the WaRP OGL from Atlas Games but is simple enough that it could be transferred over to others systems with ease. So grab some spray cans and change the city around you.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODU5NzQ0LzQ4MjUzODEuanBn/original/kJ4U%2Bs.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODU5NzQ0LzQ4MjUzNzQuanBn/original/yHo31t.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODU5NzQ0LzQ4MjUzNzMuanBn/original/ZjFICg.jpg]]






<p><b>Who will you be in this city amongst the clouds?</b></p>
<p>&nbsp;
  </p>
<p>Tales from the Aerosphere is an original steampunk TTRPG that is powered by the Neon Nights system, a system that prioritizes seemingly limitless character creation freedom.
  </p>
<p>&nbsp;
  </p>
<p>In this game you will find‚Ä¶
  </p>
<p>&nbsp;
  </p>
<ul><li>-<b>HUNDREDS of interesting, unique, and fun Perks</b>
  </li><li>-<b>DOZENS of weapons, CogWare augmentations for your body, equipment upgrades, and items to add to your beginning character</b>
  </li><li>-<b>OVER 20 unique and dynamic NPC sheets that are simplistic and accessible to use at any table.</b>
  </li></ul>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>From medics, to assassins, to mechanics, to a literal barbarian, there are THOUSANDS of character combinations you can play &nbsp;in Tales from the Aerosphere.   </p>
<p>&nbsp;
  </p>
<p>The game also includes free updates whenever a new patch is released that adds content or fixes errors.&nbsp;
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNzM1Ny83NzE5MTAzLnBuZw==/original/6MDfy2.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNzM1Ny83NzE5MDk3LnBuZw==/original/%2BOkhJA.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNzM1Ny83NzE5MDk4LnBuZw==/original/pO8IOA.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNzM1Ny83NzE5MDk2LnBuZw==/original/0tSZbq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNzM1Ny83NzE5MTAwLnBuZw==/original/zudzM5.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNzM1Ny83NzE5MDk5LnBuZw==/original/Ge0hea.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNzM1Ny83NzE5MTAxLnBuZw==/original/quFLAt.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNzM1Ny83NzE5MTAyLnBuZw==/original/54pkhu.png]]






<div style="margin: 0 auto; max-width: 600px">
<p class="text-center"><strong>From the creator of <a href="https://boyproblems.itch.io/boy-problems" target="_blank">Boy Problems</a>, <a href="https://boyproblems.itch.io/black-heart" target="_blank">Black Heart</a> <br>&amp;&nbsp;<a href="https://boyproblems.itch.io/in-case-of-an-emergency" target="_blank">In Case of an Emergency</a>...</strong></p>
<p class="text-center"><strong><em>The sun sets on an adventure and there is a moment to pause and reflect on everything that came before.<br></em></strong><strong><em>A group sits around a campfire before they have to say goodbye to one of their friends.&nbsp;<br></em></strong><strong><em>A lone hero rests in the shadow of the construct that could lead to their own demise.</em></strong></p>
<p class="text-center"><strong><em>Tales‚Äô End</em></strong> is an improvisational game about a group (or individual) remembering the journey that brought them here and reflecting on how they and the world around them have changed. Designed to open up a dialogue with prompts, the game guides players to experience an entire adventure through vignettes on the eve of the end of their travels.</p>
<p class="text-center">The game is genre-agnostic, GM-less, and can also be experienced as a solo journaling exercise. It is intended to provide a streamlined experience for beginners, or a unique experience for established groups. The direction of the story is up to the players, with a system of prompts to provide guidance and tools to keep moving forward.</p><p class="text-center"><strong>Creator's Note</strong>: <em>This game is a bit different from my past releases! It is very mechanics light and focused on storytelling and improvisation. It is a bit of an experiment and priced as such. I hope that it can help those new players&nbsp;who might feel intimidated getting into tabletop, or for those looking for a solo experience.</em><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p class="text-center"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQzMTkyMTcucG5n/original/uxmkQ0.png" loading="lazy"><br></p><p class="text-center"><a href="https://www.dicebreaker.com/games/tales-end/news/tales-end-rpg-released" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQzMzIwMTkucG5n/original/ne90un.png" loading="lazy"></a><br></p>
<figure><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQzMTkyMTAucG5n/original/t0DjmU.png" style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit" loading="lazy"><span></span><br></figure>
<p class="text-center"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQzMTkyMTgucG5n/original/vE82vp.png" loading="lazy"><br><br></p>
<div class="text-center" style="max-width:300px; margin: 0 auto"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc4NzkwMjIucG5n/original/w4YTRO.png" loading="lazy"><br></div>
<p><br><br></p>
</div>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc4Nzk3NzYuanBn/original/jHKsOY.jpg]]






<p class="text-center"><strong>Talking Swords!</strong></p>
<p class="text-center"><em>In a world where humans cannot speak and swords can, talking swords are incredibly commonplace and are used to solve all conflicts, be they social or physical. As a result, talking swords are a requirement for all - not just adventurers - but are quickly abandoned if they fail to impress The One Who Wields Them...<br></em></p>
<p><em></em></p>
<p class="text-center">Talking Swords is a one page RPG about talking swords and those that wield them. You play as a talking sword carried by a non-verbal adventurer and serve as both their weapon of choice and a diplomat, and must balance the two roles; go too far in one direction and your owner is sure to ditch you for a more balanced blade.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="text-center">Suitable for as little as one player and a GM, Talking Swords is a great choice for a short, fun game or a long, epic fantasy adventure - just don't get too attached to your blade, The One That Wields Them certainly won't! <br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Included:<br>- One page of rules.<br>- One page of four character sheets (wow, v. generous! Great value.)</p>
<p><br>What you need:<br>- 2d6 per player (or you could share).<br>- Pen or pencil.<br></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY2NzU5MzEucG5n/original/PM7bB6.png]]






<p>Enclosed are 22 characters usable with any game but contain stats for Troupe. Cards are based on the Major Arcana, and all fit on index cards. To select a random character, draw a Major Arcana.<br></p>
<p>Character's include:</p>
<ul><li>Yart, The Miracle Worker</li><li>Xen, The Blind Bard</li><li>Benny, The Gambler</li><li>Liz, The Sharp Shooter</li><li>And Many Others!</li></ul>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY3Nzg5NjguanBn/original/xrEkFH.jpg]]






<p><em>Tavern. Publichouse. There are a lot of words for the thing you run. The one you like these days, as occupiers‚Äô boots tramp through your streets, is </em>refuge<em>. You offer a hard drink, a good meal, somewhere to hide. And other, more slippery things. Until they shut you down.</em></p>
<hr>
<p><strong>T<small>AVERN AT THE </small>E<small>ND OF THE </small>W<small>ORLD</small></strong> is a journaling role-playing game for one player. It requires a tarot deck and can be played in half an hour or more. And it fits on one printed page.</p>
<p><strong>The city is under occupation.</strong> You keep your establishment afloat by serving this embattled community. But if you want to continue to do it, you'll need to stay off the occupying forces' radar.<br></p>
<p><strong>Receive visitors to your establishment.</strong> Turn over a tarot card and use the game prompts to help decide who comes calling and what they're looking for. A drink, a hot meal, a secret meeting to ferment revolution.<br></p>
<p><strong>But keep a low profile.</strong> Throw coins to find out what kind of heat your visitor brings down on you. What kind of action are you willing to take to keep the occupiers away from your doorstep?<br></p>
<p><strong>Write in your journal.</strong> But be sure to hide any illegal activity behind coded language or euphemism. If your establishment gets raided, your journal could be seized as evidence against you.<br></p>
<p><em>One of our city‚Äôs new protectors stopped in for a nightcap, but objected to sharing the bar with refugees. Once he tasted the drink I mixed up special for him, though, he quieted down immediately.</em></p>
<hr>
<p>Designed &amp; written by Anna Anthropy and&nbsp; illustrated by&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/smallsmallwitch" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Rayne Klar</a>. Shout out to <a href="https://twitter.com/sharangbiswas" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Sharang Biswas</a> for coming up with the name.&nbsp;The tarot deck in the photo is the <a href="http://www.aeclectic.net/tarot/cards/pagan-cats/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Tarot of Pagan Cats</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Tavern at the End of the World</strong> is a <em>Princess Sword</em> game, and is based on my other game&nbsp;<a href="https://w.itch.io/cursed-sword">Princess with a Cursed Sword</a>.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjc5OTczLzM3MzU1MzcucG5n/original/%2FPV8R6.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjc5OTczLzM3MzYwNjcucG5n/original/Tok8U%2B.png]]






<p>Deep in the heart of Central City, a strange phenomenon has occurred: Normal citizens are suddenly changing into strange, flowery monsters with flower-based powers! But to what end? Why are they here? And why are they working for Earl Grey, the illusive thief? Gather your friends, get your transformation sequence out of the way, and get ready to monologue every time you use a power because it's time for Tea &amp; Crumpets: A game of magical girls and tea leaves!</p><p></p><p>"Really well written!" - Jupiter Hadley<br></p>"Neat, efficient, great theming.&nbsp;Love the inclusion of a Cliffhangers table, and I love&nbsp;<em>love</em> the dedicated&nbsp;Monologue mechanic. Super cute!" - Tintenseher<br><p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgxNjEwNjkucG5n/original/6nUZJV.png]]






<p><strong><em>Teenage Angst</em></strong> is a <em>solo scrapbooking TTRPG</em> about <em>being a teenager with a lot of feelings</em>, obsessed with a single song that speaks to them so intimately that they feel like it was written specifically for them.<br><br><strong><em>My Patrons at Cool Cool Person tier&nbsp;get this game for free</em></strong>, so if you want to check it out, here's the link for my&nbsp;<a href="https://www.patreon.com/ArmandaH" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Patreon.</a><br></p>
<p>You choose your <em>scenario,</em> one of the&nbsp;10 songs that were chosen for the game, you create your <em>character</em> - a teenager - and <em>by scrapbooking and listening to the song from your scenario in a loop, you resolve the prompts. </em>By the end, you'll have some pages of a scrapbook that belongs to a teenager, who might or might not remind you to yourself some years ago.&nbsp;<br></p>
<p>This game started as an easy idea&nbsp;for the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/staj" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit">Song Title Adventure Jam</a>&nbsp;and ended up being a monster that devoured my time.&nbsp;<br></p>
<p>A PERSONAL NOTE ON THIS CREATIVE PROCESS:<br>Making this project was intense. Finding fonts, finding drawings and pictures that are royalty-free for you to print and making an extra document with that material so you can get something as a base to work on the scrapbooking, making the Pinterest boards in case you want to play it on it instead of cutting stuff, the layout, the writing, the choosing of the songs, the making of the playlists. I made it all on my own and this game in my head sounded easier than it was, though it was extremely rewarding to have finished it and I can't believe I made this that it looks so awesome (to me). This game took an exorbitant amount of time and work.&nbsp;This is the reason it costs this much. Also, it will have always Free Scrapbooks,&nbsp;so anyone who wants to can play it.&nbsp;<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI4Nzg3OC83NDkzNjY4LmpwZw==/original/X2fQgH.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI4Nzg3OC83NDkzNjY5LmpwZw==/original/A%2FvXTw.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI4Nzg3OC83NDkzNjcwLmpwZw==/original/KR1%2F4Q.jpg]]






<p>The longest night is here again! The dwarves of the Long Winter Vale are keeping their fires burning bright to drive back the darkness. They pass around plates of bread and drink spirits reserved for this night. Come the dawn, they‚Äôll celebrate the coming of the new year. Unfortunately, in the midst of their celebration, the lights begin to go out‚Ä¶</p>
<p>In&nbsp;<em>Tenarlian: The Dying of the Light</em>, you attempt to survive in an adventure where torches are more powerful than magic. Evil things have come to the valley. Can you escape the encroaching darkness in this survival horror adventure for 5E?</p>
<p><br></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODUzMjQ0LzQ3ODU5MDQuanBn/original/hIuG88.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODUzMjQ0LzQ3ODU4NDguanBn/original/2k4Mj6.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODUzMjQ0LzQ3ODU4NTAuanBn/original/cs%2B5%2F2.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODUzMjQ0LzQ3ODU4NDkuanBn/original/0GNJ5n.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODUzMjQ0LzQ3ODU4NTEuanBn/original/tzhzPf.jpg]]






<p><strong><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI3MzEzODQucG5n/original/Zc8UBR.png" loading="lazy"><br></strong></p>
<p><strong>Tenarlian. The longest night.</strong></p>
<p>The winter solstice on Samsarras is when the demons are closest. The elves are silent, hoping to escape the notice of the dark ones until the sun returns in the morning.&nbsp;</p>
<p>This heavy metal Christmas adventure is the perfect one shot this holiday season.</p>
<ul><li>6 pregenerated 9th level characters with backstories and their own secrets.</li><li>A grim dark adventure through Elgolor manor, where the house‚Äôs dying matron has attracted the notice of dark things.&nbsp;</li><li>Two beautiful maps of the three story manor, one for the DM and one for the players.</li></ul>
<p>Carnage, darkness, and madness runs rampant in this holiday one shot adventure for 5th edition.</p>
<p>CrumblingKeep.Com</p>
<p><br></p>
<p class="text-center"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI3MzEzOTIucG5n/original/YHk%2BWM.png" loading="lazy">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;<img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI3MzEzOTYucG5n/original/QULb8j.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/R0luTA7HIiY" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTI1ODI4LzI3NDE2MDgucG5n/original/AtlKnR.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTI1ODI4LzI3NDE2MTAucG5n/original/XhWJeh.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTI1ODI4LzI3NDE2MDkucG5n/original/lewDiS.png]]






<p>Tension is a Tarot based roleplaying game for telling stories like <span class="">Killing Eve</span> and <span class="">Hannibal</span>, letting you explore queer experiences in the cat and mouse genre.<br></p>
<p>Play as an investigator and a killer as they get entangled in each other. You will pursue&nbsp;after another back and forth while everyone in your orbit drops like flies. But it‚Äôll all be worth it, because you‚Äôll be in love. Or dead. Or both maybe? How exciting!<br></p>
<p><img src="https://ksr-ugc.imgix.net/assets/032/030/039/6d99c7f6c9560213e987f3edadca784d_original.png?ixlib=rb-4.0.2&amp;w=680&amp;fit=max&amp;v=1610761025&amp;auto=format&amp;gif-q=50&amp;lossless=true&amp;s=5c01ce1c64ca392ac801b5f661bd862c" alt="https://ksr-ugc.imgix.net/assets/032/030/039/6d99c7f6c9560213e987f3edadca784d_original.png?ixlib=rb-4.0.2&amp;w=680&amp;fit=max&amp;v=1610761025&amp;auto=format&amp;gif-q=50&amp;lossless=true&amp;s=5c01ce1c64ca392ac801b5f661bd862c" class="" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>Up to three players will create a full cast of 22 characters, one for  each of the Major Arcana. In Tension everyone has a hand of tarot cards  they play over a series of scenes, revealing twists and turns as the  story progresses between the two main characters.&nbsp;Players might be  triggering mood shifts, activating character specific actions,  introducing orbiting characters, or even killing people off.
  </p>
<p>Tension is a "gm-full" game as opposed to "gm-less," with all players  involved taking active stock in the progression of the story and the  actions of the each of the characters. Players are encouraged to move  between actor and director stance fluidly.
  </p>
<p>When playing with two players, one inhabits the investigator and the  other the killer, stepping in to inhabit the orbiting minor characters  as the scene calls for. In the three player variant, one player is the  Ensemble. They guide the orbiting characters and amp up the drama, able  to twist the emotional knife with the two main characters from their  outside perspective.
  </p>
<p>Tension is not a mystery, it‚Äôs a dark comedy thriller romance. The  killer and the investigator know who the other is, yet they are still  inexplicably drawn together.&nbsp; Hijinks and drama ensue as they are  trapped in a complicated web of attraction, lies, and even truth.
  </p>
<p>Tension can tell tight one shot stories over a few hours, or it can  tell a longer season of multiple episodes strung together. Characters  might be revealed to have miraculously survived, loyalties can shift,  and slow burn secrets can reveal themselves. Whether you just want a  single night of fun or weeks of emotional exploration, Tension delivers.
<br></p>
<p></p>
<p><img src="https://ksr-ugc.imgix.net/assets/032/030/049/6bb100f0a0c91502a8eb4bbf44b2eec8_original.png?ixlib=rb-4.0.2&amp;w=680&amp;fit=max&amp;v=1610761104&amp;auto=format&amp;gif-q=50&amp;lossless=true&amp;s=88bb7a43774e11d5f28f8f10d514ce0d" alt="https://ksr-ugc.imgix.net/assets/032/030/049/6bb100f0a0c91502a8eb4bbf44b2eec8_original.png?ixlib=rb-4.0.2&amp;w=680&amp;fit=max&amp;v=1610761104&amp;auto=format&amp;gif-q=50&amp;lossless=true&amp;s=88bb7a43774e11d5f28f8f10d514ce0d" class="" loading="lazy"><br>Game by Adira Slattery</p>
<p>Art and Layout by Francita Soto</p>
<p>Editing by&nbsp;Dominique&nbsp;Dickey
 					
 				
 			
 		
 	 </p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODU2MDU1Lzc2NDg2NDguanBn/original/8bIAEK.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODU2MDU1Lzc2NDg2NDkuanBn/original/t6aiAV.jpg]]






<p></p>
<p><strong>A GAME OF EXHILARATING, TERRIFYING FREEDOM</strong></p>
<p>
In 2064, a coalition from beyond the stars set out on the universe's greatest
rescue mission: saving us from ourselves. Now, humanity explores skies
filled with alien worlds, mingles with unique cultures, and adapts to
technology never made for them.</p>
<p>
Once, you lived a harsh life in the Sol system, but now you live in a galaxy
filled with opportunity, mystery, and peril. What will you discover? Who will
you become?</p>
<p>
TERMINATION SHOCK is a science fiction adventure role-playing game for 3+
players. It contains:</p>
<p>
‚Ä¢ Quick character generation.
‚Ä¢ A simple, robust system.
‚Ä¢ Guidance for playing science fiction adventures</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQxOTExNDMucG5n/original/UoQqNq.png]]






<p><em>The Adversary is talented, proud, and determined to be the best. Unfortunately, there always seems to be someone better, a Rival who they just can‚Äôt beat, no matter how hard they try. They‚Äôll try anyway, of course, constantly competing to prove themself no matter what it takes.</em></p>
<p><em>Their central conflict lies in the difficulty of comparing themself to others and the toll that thinking of themself as second-best can take on their self-worth.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p>What's gayer than an intense rivalry? Not very much. Turn everything into a competition, just to prove that you're better than your Rival - better at sword-fighting, better at turning into a car, better at kissing, you name it!&nbsp;Anything they can do, you can do better!&nbsp;Because if you can't, then... what else do you have to combat the insecurities gnawing away at you, the fears that maybe you'll only ever be the second best?</p>
<p><strong>The Adversary</strong> is an additional playbook for the <a href="https://evilhat.itch.io/thirsty-sword-lesbians">Thirsty Sword Lesbians</a> roleplaying game by April&nbsp;Kit Walsh and published by Evil Hat Productions - you will need a copy of Thirsty Sword Lesbians in order to use this playbook.</p>
<p>Playbook art is the&nbsp;<a href="https://dejinyucu.itch.io/temmie-visual-novel-sprite">Temmie</a>&nbsp;sprite by&nbsp;DejiNyucu!&nbsp;If you're interested in getting playbook art on a budget, I absolutely encourage you to check out their work, as well as the work of&nbsp;other artists selling <a href="https://itch.io/search?q=visual+novel+sprite">visual novel sprites</a> on itch!&nbsp;</p>
<p>This playbook is also still being playtested and revised, so you may occasionally get updated PDFs at no additional cost - that said, I don't anticipate any major changes. If you play the Adversary in a game, shoot me a message on twitter @Lexi_the_Fae, I'd love to hear about how it went!&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMxNzQyMy83NjY5NjUwLnBuZw==/original/A7C5uz.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMxNzQyMy83NjYwODg3LnBuZw==/original/bvZ89N.png]]






<p><strong>Welcome to Varas! </strong><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>And welcome to The Blue Lotus Hack! Inside the pages of this Black Hack variant, you'll find:</p>
<p>* New classes and variants of the original Black Hack classes<br>* Magic spells and psychic gifts<br>* Scores of monsters<br>* Dozens of enchanted items<br>* And a mini campaign setting, the southern reaches of the continent of Varas, a world marked by the scars of an ancient immortals' war and the incursion of the Pale Lords and their soul-eating ephemeral hordes.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p><em>The Blue Lotus Hack is built on the Black Hack 1e ruleset and was originally published on Drivethrurpg in 2018. &nbsp;I've chosen to unearth it and offer it here, finally linking it -- and the alias I used for it at the time -- to myself.</em><br></p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzMzMDA2NTQuanBn/original/9pL705.jpg]]






<p>History has a way of misaligning cultures in its pages.&nbsp; There are many reasons for this: misunderstanding, neglect, and malice to name a few.&nbsp; But as facilitators and players at the table, we have an opportunity to include our own perspectives and voices into the narrative we tell.&nbsp; We have an opportunity to promote empathy and understanding of the fantastic cultures in our stories.</p>
<p>You play a scholar visiting a culture or location that you‚Äôve read about.&nbsp; However, you realize that your history books depict people and places with egregious errors.&nbsp; As you spend time with the culture, you jot down notes to set the record straight so that the next adventurers passing through can approach the culture with better understanding and knowledge.</p>
<p><em>The Books Were Wrong </em>is a game that assumes that history is written by imperfect people and attempts to recontextualize the entry in order to give power back to cultures commonly depicted as "evil".</p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQxNjMyNzEuanBlZw==/original/ycdXu1.jpeg]]






<p><strong>AS FEATURED ON DICEBREAKER'S <a href="https://www.dicebreaker.com/categories/roleplaying-game/best-games/best-rpg-systems-hack-custom-game-srd" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">9 BEST TABLETOP RPG SYSTEMS TO HACK INTO A CUSTOM GAME</a></strong><br></p>
<p>Welcome to v0.0 of the Caltrop Core, an introductory game design system using the humble and sharp d4! Developed with @aghostofeli and @n_quests on Twitter,&nbsp;it's extremely simple and bare bones so anyone can make a game with it, regardless of your experience level! It can have as much or as little complexity as you like.</p>
<p>I'm new to game design as well, but often the hardest thing about trying something new is&nbsp;getting started. So I wanted to provide a deeper explanation of how to use the dice core for anyone that's new to this!</p>
<p>There's a suggested donation of $1, but please download for free (especially if you've already made a game with CC!), as it's extremely early in development and largely untested. You can always come back later and drop a few dollars if you found it worthwhile. The screenshot on this page has everything you need to use the system, so really, go for it! All I ask is you let me know what you make with it! Add "Built on Caltrop Core" or "A Caltrop Core TTRPG" to your doc, and you're good to go!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIzNjgyOS83MjM0ODg2LmpwZw==/original/YG21yw.jpg]]






<p><strong>Battle your way through time&nbsp;</strong></p>
<p>An ancient crypt has emerged from the ashes of the Dusk, warping and twisting time and reality.&nbsp;Something has awoken beneath the earth, and you need to destroy it.&nbsp;<br><br>In this mission for NOVA your team of Sparks will fight through the past, present and future to uncover a deadly foe that threatens to rend the fabric of the reality asunder.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Bet you thought that after the sun exploded life couldn't get any worse?</p>
<p>An atmospheric companion playlist for this adventure is available on Spotify, compiled by Irfon Brandon-Toki&nbsp;Rickard.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p><br></p>
<iframe src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/playlist/0YvtxQtCpdI2g9WoBll35U?utm_source=generator&amp;theme=0" width="100%" height="380" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>
<p></p>
<p>___________________________________________________________________________</p>
<p>‚ÄúThe Chronomancer‚Äôs Tomb‚Äù is a mission for <a href="https://gilarpgs.itch.io/nova">NOVA</a> by Spencer Campbell and was created as part of the NOVA Jam on Itch.io. You can find more entries to this jam at <a href="https://itch.io/jam/nova-jam">https://itch.io/jam/nova-jam</a>&nbsp;<br></p>
<p>The title of the adventure was created using the Random Adventure Title Generator by Loot the Room, available at <a href="https://loottheroom.uk/random-adventure-title-generator" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://loottheroom.uk/random-adventure-title-generator</a>&nbsp;
</p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1MDkzOS83OTEwNjgwLnBuZw==/original/MBVrEd.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1MDkzOS83OTEwNjU3LnBuZw==/original/F4%2FNL1.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1MDkzOS83OTEwNjU4LnBuZw==/original/0DK2G5.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1MDkzOS83OTEwNjU5LnBuZw==/original/7NySXn.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1MDkzOS83OTEwNjYwLnBuZw==/original/kS8Xb8.png]]






<p><strong>LET‚ÄôS BE CLEAR</strong>: <a href="https://mega-corp.itch.io/the-company">The Company</a> sent you to die. <br></p>
<p>At best, they thought you'd only just do your job, taking the asset out and yourselves with it. At worst, you were nothing more than data they‚Äôd use to predict their losses, weighing it against future costs needed to recover their spoiled investment. With The Company, always assume the worst. It's always right, and when it isn't, it's a coincidence, not a kindness; just corp machinery aiming briefly in a less shitty direction. <br><br><strong>WHAT THEY DIDN‚ÄôT EXPECT</strong>: You managed it. You secured the asset, allied with it, or led it on a chase where you pick the final destination and you know where to take it: Company HQ. They wanted it and you're going to let them have it, delivered straight to the front lobby, the roof, or anywhere you can find a good entrance. You have more in common with the asset than them anyway. To them, you‚Äôre just a list of qualifications in a dossier and a too-low payout hidden away on some spreadsheet. All a means to the same, predictable end. </p>
<p>Now we see what happens.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzczMTQ1MTYucG5n/original/3v2VLg.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p><strong>Project Ricochet is a reversal module for <a href="https://mega-corp.itch.io/the-company">The Company: Corporate Horror Survival</a>in which you take on the role of a mistreated ARC team bringing a dangerous asset back to Company HQ&nbsp;finally bring the whole operation crashing down once and for all.</strong></p>
<p>If most modules for The Company are about how powerful corporations are able to endlessly abuse their power, Project Ricochet is about finally doing something to make them pay.</p>
<p>Inside you'll find:</p>
<p>- 3 unique assets for your team to employ in their attack<br>- Guidelines for creating and running your own<br>- 3 new enemy types deployed by the corporate security forces<br>- 3 angles of attack each with changing corporate responses<br>- Simplified HQ map and location descriptions to focus your attack</p>
<p>Project Ricochet is less a massive dungeon crawl and more&nbsp; an action movie-style blowout. End a campaign with it, run it as a fun anti-corporate one shot, or start a new story of an ARC Team on the run!<br></p>
<figure><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzczMTQ2NTEucG5n/original/P4qJXP.png" loading="lazy"><br></figure>
<p><span></span><span></span>Writing, Design and, Layout by Christian Sorrell (c)2021<br><a href="http://www.christiansorrell.com" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">christiansorrell.com</a> | <a href="http://twitter.com/elitemeatagent" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@elitemeatagent</a></p>
<p>Art by Thomas Novosel<br><a href="http://www.thomas-novosel.com" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">thomas-novosel.com</a> | <a href="http://twitter.com/thomasanovosel" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@thomasanovosel</a></p>
<p>Project Richochet was created as part of The Company Mandatory Content Jam in October of 2021.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzczMTQ1MTcucG5n/original/%2FW%2BwO8.png" loading="lazy"><br><br><span></span><span></span>Project Ricochet is an independent production by Christian Sorrell and is not affiliated with THE COMPANY or MEGACORP Games. It is published under THE COMPANY Third Party License.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI1NTI3OS83MzE0NDY1LnBuZw==/original/SgCNHk.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI1NTI3OS83MzE0NDY2LnBuZw==/original/NdJyr6.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI1NTI3OS83MzE0NDY4LnBuZw==/original/h0cThl.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI1NTI3OS83MzE0NDY5LnBuZw==/original/OqlxSI.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI1NTI3OS83MzE0NDcxLnBuZw==/original/LujEr5.png]]






<p>You've always wondered what was just beyond the doors of the spooky house at the end of the block. Now, make it your very own.</p>
<p><strong>Choose your witch archetype</strong></p>
<p>Enchanter:&nbsp;<em>use crystals and stones to cleanse auras and promote positive well-being</em></p>
<p>Goth: <em>d</em><em>raw on ancient knowledge with blood, tears, and artistry</em></p>
<p>Hag:&nbsp;<em>with woodwork and an oven, anything is possible</em></p>
<p>Herbalist: <em>potions, poisons, and a gift for all things green</em></p>
<p>Occultist: <em>see beyond the veil with gifts of loved ones long gone</em></p>
<p><strong>Choose a familiar</strong></p>
<p><strong>Create your home</strong></p>
<p>Created for Folklore Jam 2020,&nbsp;Rainbow&nbsp;Jam 2020, and Witch Jam, The Coven at the End of the Lane is a dice pool game of spell casting, tarot, and community.&nbsp;<br></p><p>Want to play this with Dracula in it?&nbsp;Check out&nbsp;<strong><a href="https://angrynerdgirl.itch.io/the-dracula-at-the-end-of-the-lane" target="_blank">The Dracula at the End of the Lane</a></strong> instead.&nbsp;</p><p>Prefer vampires to witches?&nbsp;Try&nbsp;<strong><a href="https://angrynerdgirl.itch.io/oops-all-draculas" target="_blank">Oops All Draculas</a>!&nbsp;</strong></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzQ0MzA1LzQxNDkzOTUucG5n/original/2G3Vsq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzQ0MzA1LzQxNDkzOTkucG5n/original/l5AKKv.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzQ0MzA1LzQxNDkzOTgucG5n/original/77NuuY.png]]






<p>The Creature Comes for Us is a&nbsp;game that can be played solo or multiplayer which uses a standard deck of cards, two six-sided dice, and the players' imagination.&nbsp;</p>
<p>You play as a group of people preparing to fight against a currently unknown threat. You will learn (through drawing cards) about the creature that is coming for you, you will find resources and tactics to fight against them, and you will learn more about the unique traits and talents of the player characters. The second part of the game brings together what you've gathered to fight the looming horrors and you will find out if your characters and world&nbsp;can survive the onslaught.</p>
<p>The game can be used for a standard one-shot game with friends or for world-building and character-building purposes to slot into other systems.&nbsp;A finished game can leave you with a well-developed world in which to set a post-apocalyptic game for&nbsp;another RPG, or with ruins and&nbsp;a story for a future adventuring party to explore.</p>
<p>The download includes two versions. Both have been designed by an accessibility consultant to&nbsp;work on screen readers however&nbsp;the plain text version is specifically created with a range of visual accessibility needs in mind.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Recommended: 2-5 players or as solo game. 2-3 hours to play. No GM (game master) is required to play.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzU4MDA1LzQyMzcyMzgucG5n/original/zAx552.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzU4MDA1LzQyMzcyMzkucG5n/original/I9gzAq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzU4MDA1LzQyMzcyNDAucG5n/original/YNYVlm.png]]






<p>The Apocalypse came not with a bang, but with an exhalation of the CRYPT DOOR.&nbsp;</p>
<p>There is still debate on when it happened or even where it began. All that is known is that doorways to what is now known as the Crypt have opened all across Earth. The dead walked the streets, spirits tore through homes, and monsters of legend and myth stalked openly in the night. The CRYPTIDS had awoken.</p>
<p>All seemed lost in the Hellscape. Nations, even with all their technology, began to fall. What good are bullets against the wail of a BANSHEE or a POLTERGEIST that turns your defenses against you? Each day bore new terrors from Crypt and marched the world toward doom. There was no hope.</p>
<p>That was, until magical practitioners felt a new connection to a power with which they could use to fight back. The ancient traditions and incantations and rituals proved to be a warning, a way to prepare us for the coming war against the Crypt. It didn‚Äôt take long before the tide began to turn.</p>
<p>The year is 1993. The Crypt is still a daily threat. Many of the world‚Äôs old nations and social structures have collapsed and populations decimated. But the Wizards are fighting back and gaining ground against the Cryptids, Crypt Cults, and more nefarious organizations attempting to take advantage of the weakened world.</p>
<p>All it‚Äôll take is a bit of magic.</p>
<p>Jump into this wild new approach to ACTIVE wizard dueling using the IMPOSITION SYSTEM. Currently in Beta Test phase.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc5NTk3NTUuanBn/original/VSAbUI.jpg]]






<p><em>The Curse of the House of Rookwood</em>&nbsp;is a gothic horror tabletop roleplaying game where you create a cursed family with supernatural powers and troubled relationships, and take them on strange adventures in an alternate history haunted by mythical monsters and dark magic. Will you work together to bury your skeletons, or will family drama bring your house to ruin?</p>
<p><strong>Rookwood is...</strong></p>
<p>A&nbsp;<strong>supernatural adventure</strong>&nbsp;where your family must survive together against a world of secret societies, terrifying spirits and monsters, and ancient evils lurking in the hidden corners of the earth.</p>
<p>A&nbsp;<strong>family drama</strong>&nbsp;of troubled relationships and opportunities for your family to grow closer or further apart. Whether funny, poignant, or cathartic, your characters' lives will feel immediately familiar, personal, and relevant.&nbsp;<strong>Make the family you want&nbsp;</strong>-- there are no prescribed roles or hierarchy, just meaningful relationships.</p>
<p>A&nbsp;<strong>gothic alternate history</strong>&nbsp;that you create, portraying generations of the same family in different iconic time periods. Stalk aristocratic vampires in the gothic 1880s. Search for secrets in lost jungle ruins in the pulpy 1920s. &nbsp;Protect London from the Ghost Blitz in the wartorn 1940s. Thwart clairvoyant Russian spies in the spy-fi 1960s.<br></p>
<p>The game has been fully funded on Kickstarter, and is production now.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Learn more on our <a href="https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/nerdypupgames/the-curse-of-the-house-of-rookwood" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">project page!</a></p>
<p><strong>Social Distancing Special! Each purchase unlocks one Community Copy!</strong><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTMyODQxLzI3NzAzMDYucG5n/original/r1PAmC.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTMyODQxLzI3NzAyOTkucG5n/original/6XSfXt.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTMyODQxLzMxODg3ODgucG5n/original/sFaN7H.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTMyODQxLzMxODg3ODkucG5n/original/whOMCc.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTMyODQxLzMxODg3OTEucG5n/original/bXND9H.png]]






<p class="text-center"><strong>The Devil Is In The Detail</strong></p>
<p class="text-center"><em>&nbsp;-Popular Idiom</em></p>
<p>Being the Devil isn't easy. Every day you are presented with a massive list of tasks that all require your attention.</p>
<p>If you're not stoking the flames of the underworld, you're busy filling man's heart with evil. And that's before you deal with your personal hygiene and other needs.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="text-center">Thankfully, the Devil has you!&nbsp;</p>
<p class="text-center">The details!&nbsp;</p>
<p>The details are tiny parts of the Devil's psyche that help the Devil operate at peak efficiency.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYwNDc1NTEucG5n/original/doj7S%2B.png" loading="lazy"></p>
<p><em>The Details In The Devil </em>is a cooperative storytelling ttrpg where the players take control of the Devil and try to complete every task on the Devil's to-do list!&nbsp;</p>
<p>However, each player only gets to control one limb each day, forcing the group to work together&nbsp;if they want to complete all of the Devil's tasks.&nbsp;</p>
<p>One wrong move might see you trying to make toast with your foot or walking around hell on your hands!&nbsp;</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYwNDc1NTEucG5n/original/doj7S%2B.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>The Game Includes:&nbsp;</p>
<ul><li>Rule Book</li><li>Sheet Of Limb Tokens</li></ul>
<p>You&nbsp;Will Need:&nbsp;</p>
<ul><li>Hat, Bowl, Or Container&nbsp;</li><li>1 D6 Per Player</li><li>The Urge To Get Things&nbsp;Done</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1NjczMC82MDQ4MjIzLnBuZw==/original/mplkwF.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1NjczMC82MDQ4Mjk1LmpwZw==/original/iOZNg4.jpg]]






<p>The Dreaded and the Deep is a nautical terror roleplaying game for 3-7 players and a storyteller. It is built on <a href="https://titanomachyrpg.itch.io/" target="_blank">Titanomachy's</a> Caltrop Core and inspired equally by games like <em>Sunless Sea</em> and works like <em>The Rime of the Ancient Mariner</em>. Characters encounter the terrors of the haunted and twisted Dosolti Sea as they voyage across the waves to stave off their ultimate demise. But the sea takes all, eventually.</p><p>Features:</p><ul><li>Full rules for playing the game</li><li>Supernatural abilities for characters</li><li>8 Ports on the Dosolti Ring</li><li>Options for creating encounters at sea and islands</li><li>Death at sea</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc5MTc5OTMuanBn/original/iADrPG.jpg]]












<p><em>Does the Empire&nbsp;dream of its Empress ‚Äì its human handler, master, prisoner? She&nbsp;does not shoulder her duties alone. She has advisers, generals, spies, poison tasters, lovers. But she has no one so important as you. For you are all these things, and more. You are her</em> Seer.<br></p>
<hr>
<p><strong>T<small>HE</small> E<small>MPRESS AND HER </small>S<small>EER</small></strong> is a journaling role-playing game for one player. It requires a tarot deck and can be played in half an hour or more. And it fits on one printed page.</p>
<p><strong>Interpret the Empress' dreams. </strong>As her Seer, this is your duty.&nbsp;Turn over a tarot card and let the game prompts and the card image guide your interpretation. Is it an omen of danger abroad? A jealous cousin? Knives in the dark?&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Face challenges to her rule.</strong>&nbsp;Her court is full of rivals waiting for any sign of weakness.&nbsp;Throw coins to find out if your prognostication has prepared her for the threat ‚Äì or if your charms have left her distracted and off-guard.</p>
<p><strong>You are the only one she can trust.</strong>&nbsp;She&nbsp;<em>can</em> trust you, right? You wouldn't take advantage of the Empress' confidence to advance your own agenda&nbsp;‚Äì would you?</p>
<p><strong>Chronicle your memoirs.</strong>&nbsp;At court, falls from grace come frequent and hard. Record your experiences as the Empress' Seer in case you someday have need to sell them to a publisher.</p>
<p><em>‚ÄúYou dream of a journey? My Empress, it‚Äôs a sign from God, demanding a pilgrimage. You may send your Head Priestess ‚Äì she has been rather occupying your time of late. Worry not, I will be glad to take over her services ‚Äì and to occupy your time most generously ‚Äì until her return.‚Äù&nbsp;</em>
</p>
<hr>
<p>Designed &amp; written by Anna Anthropy and&nbsp; illustrated by&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/smallsmallwitch" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Rayne Klar</a>. The deck in the photo is <a href="https://www.lisasterle.com/mwt" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Modern Witch Tarot</a> by Lisa Sterle.</p>
<p><strong>COMMUNITY COPIES:</strong>&nbsp;If you're a marginalized person facing economic hardship and can't spare the money for the game, email me at collectfruit at gmail dot com to request a free pdf copy.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzYxMDE3LzQyNTU3ODYucG5n/original/IJzJbQ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzYxMDE3LzQyNjYxNDIucG5n/original/1%2F%2B3B0.png]]






<p>You were the newest rising star of the hero world. But not anymore, you've lost what you thought made you special. You could have hung it up then, but there was work to be done. Others may think you‚Äôre washed up or out of your depth, but you know powers or no powers you are a hero.</p>
<p>The Enduring is an&nbsp;unofficial playbook for Masks:&nbsp;A New Generation by Brendan Conway. The Enduring is a playbook about playing a hero who has lost their powers but has&nbsp;decided to keep on being a hero. It deals in themes of loss, recovery and how you redefine yourself after a loss.<br><br>This is a perfect second playbook for a character who loses their powers, for example a doomed who defeats their doom, but doesn't feel like the beacon fits their new arc.<br><br>This playbook has been updated since it originally appeared in <a href="https://lhcodega.itch.io/fan-favorite-a-masks-rpg-fanzine">The Fan Favorite</a>, with expanded and updated text, new art, and full playbook layout.<br>Now also includes a how to play guide.</p>
<p>Future plans for this playbook include a Behind the Mask section for GMs.<br></p>
<p>Special thanks to Zak for the layout as well as providing helpful feedback, you can contact them at&nbsp;<span></span><a href="mailto:zakaria.aboukhalid@gmail.com" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">zakaria.aboukhalid@gmail.com</a>.<span></span></p>
<p>Art by <a href="https://twitter.com/Spiral_Joe" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@Spiral_Joe</a>&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzQ3Mzk3LzQxNjkyOTAucG5n/original/lTzqNQ.png]]






<p>A quick and simple game of remembering a loved one. Take turns telling brief stories about a dear friend who has passed on. As you do so, a picture of the deceased will start to appear. When you have a solid understanding of the person who passed away, select one character to deliver the eulogy.</p>
<p>For replays, try a different setting. Maybe it's an Irish wake in the early 1900s. Or a funeral for a Viking warrior. Maybe even a&nbsp;cabal of undying sorcerers, reuniting for the first funeral in centuries.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The Eulogy can also be dropped into your ongoing campaign, regardless of system. Spend a scene in character remembering someone who died, then find their murderer and bring then to justice. <br></p>
<p>Zip file includes both sides of the business card and the same text as a 8.5" x 11" page.</p>
<p><em>(Financial disclosure:&nbsp;I&nbsp;paid $24 for stock photos. Any help to offset those costs would be appreciated but by no means required.)</em><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTUzODgyLzU0MDc1NzgucG5n/original/g6xOTW.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTUzODgyLzU0MDc3MDYucG5n/original/xNhZrl.png]]






<p>A gm-less,&nbsp; diceless, game for 3-6 players, in the&nbsp;<em><a href="https://buriedwithoutceremony.com/dream-askew" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">belonging outside belonging</a></em> family. To play this game, you'll need to look at the rules there for Playing the&nbsp;Dream.</p>
<p>A playset inspired by Hermann Hesse's&nbsp;<em>The Glass Bead Game</em>. Play as academics, students, bureaucrats, and people, working together to build a better world through understanding beauty and games. Overcome the scars of war and apocalypse. Grapple with the shortcomings of academic and well-intentioned communities. Teach classes and go to your friends' lectures. Build a utopia together, for everyone, if you can.</p>
<p>A submission to the&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/jam/belonging-outside-belonging-jam">belonging outside belonging jam</a>.</p>
<p>-</p>
<p>The cover image&nbsp;is from a cosmography manuscript of the 12th century, courtesy of <a href="http://www.thedigitalwalters.org/Data/WaltersManuscripts/html/W73/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">The Walters Art Museum</a>. The background image is courtesy of <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Marbles" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Wikimedia</a>. Both images are in the public domain.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDAxOTY2LzIwMzU2MzAucG5n/original/3vMppC.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDAxOTY2LzIwMzU2MzEucG5n/original/hD9eA6.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDAxOTY2LzIwMzU2MzIucG5n/original/vmcnMY.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDAxOTY2LzIwMzU2MzMucG5n/original/beD3q2.png]]






<p class="text-right"><em>You are a Tethered - a supernatural being bound to an apartment complex.</em><br></p>
<p class="text-right"><em>Your Daylight Hours are your own. Perhaps you spend them holed up in your apartment; perhaps you venture out into the World. You appear as any human might.</em></p>
<p class="text-right"><em>In sleep, you enter the Zephyr: an ever-changing, surreal, vast sort of dreamscape.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p class="text-right"><em>There are rumors that the Zephyr answers only to one being of unspeakable power: <br></em><em>the Hierophant, They Who Were Conjured From Aether.</em></p>
<p class="text-right"><em>But the Hierophant, it is said, has gone away for a while,</em><br><em> and in their absence, you may roam the Zephyr with nothing to hide. <br>You are Yourself there, every beautiful and strange part of you.
<br></em></p>
<p>~*~<br></p>
<p><em>the hierophant's gone away for a while </em>is a game about queer joy and found family. <em><br></em></p>
<p>tell the story you wish to tell together.</p>
<p>~*~</p>
<p><strong>this game is currently in early access.</strong> you will receive an organized .pdf and plain text (.txt) version of the game. once funded and completed, you will receive a .pdf of&nbsp;the game with full layout, along with an updated plain text version if edits are made.&nbsp;</p>
<p>~*~</p>
<p><em>hierophant&nbsp;</em>first debuted on <a href="https://twitter.com/huetopiatv" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">huetopia</a> as part of pride brunchathon. check out the vod below! a massive thank you to huetopia, rk wilde, and that group of&nbsp;wonderful players.<br></p>
<p class="text-center"></p>
<div class="text-center"><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VCtiYXBLl0Q" allowfullscreen="" width="500" height="281" frameborder="0"></iframe></div>
<p class="text-center"></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VCtiYXBLl0Q" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYzNzU3MjcucG5n/original/1Q30ql.png]]






<p>Basically, a classic Winnie-the-Pooh style tabletop roleplaying game using Caltrop Core system created by TitanomachyRPG for Caltrop jam. &nbsp;</p>
<p>I have plans to update this with a better layout, but feel free to leave constructive feedback! </p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc3NTAzMDAuanBn/original/PIFB%2F6.jpg]]






<p>The Western States have entered an age of
wonders. Technological innovations
transform the lives of her people.
Automobiles connect vast distances
over glistening highways. Radio
waves carry new voices, thoughts,
and art to ears around the nation.
Neon lights hold back the night&nbsp;on the shoulders of massive
dams. And the train‚Äîceaseless,
thundering, unrelenting‚Äîpowers it all; pumping food, material, and people
through the veins of this great
extractive beast.</p>
<p>But these new wonders have not
brought blessings to everyone.
With the Federal Government in the pocket of powerful Robber Barons and Vampires;
the poor, and the land itself, are
dispossessed and exploited. In The Western States, many stow away on
the freight trains in search of paying
work.
</p>
<p>And then there are the monsters.</p>
<p>Werewolves prowl the Northern
Prairie. Big Foots leave the woods
in greater numbers. The dirt itself
seems to have risen up in the Dust
Bowl of the Southern Prairie. Vampires
haunt the elegant mansions of
Acadia, ruthlessly running their railroad lines.</p>
<p>The Federal Government has
effectively abandoned its people.
The wealthy can afford protection,
but most communities are
struggling to cope. This is where
you come in.
</p>
<p>You are an adventurer, a laborer, a
wanderer, and a monster hunter.
As a member of the International
Brotherhood of Itinerant Sellswords
(IBIS), you travel the rails of The Western States, selling your skills&nbsp;to whatever Neighborhood, Town
Council, Grange Hall, or whoever
will pay you for your next meal. You
are a knight of the rails.</p>
<p>It‚Äôs a dangerous, precarious life, and
probably not one you had planned
to enter, but the people need your
help. And righteousness is its own
reward. Right?&nbsp;</p>
<p>_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-</p>
<p>The Knights of the Road is a tiny hack of&nbsp;<em>Into the Odd/Electric Bastionland </em>by Chris McDowell <a href="http://www.bastionland.com" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">(www.bastionland.com)</a>. Players assume the mantle of monster hunters who hop the rails of a dystopian early 20th century, taking contracts to kill creeps and monsters, all the while avoiding the wrath of evil Barons of Industry.</p>
<p>Work together to tell a fun
story, solve puzzles, improvise, joke,
eat, and enjoy your time together.</p>
<p>_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-</p>
<p>What do you get?</p>
<p>PDF versions of three 16-page booklets: the main rule book, a bestiary, and a book of GM advice.</p>
<p>32 hand-drawn, black-and-white illustrations.</p>
<p>A high-quality PNG of an 18x24" full-color poster map of the Western States (the setting for The Knights of the Road).</p>
<p>A PDF of a printable ready-to-assemble booklet layout, with instructions for putting it together yourself.</p>
<p>_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-</p>
<p>For printing at home, make sure to select long side binding if you're printing double-sided,&nbsp;&nbsp;flip the page on the long side if you're hand-feeding&nbsp;it. Also, make sure to scale it to fit in your printable area on your printer. Hand-feeding will be more accurate to line up the printed area on both sides of the paper.<br></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pvy7C0Bjhnk" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIyMzM2LzUyMTU4MTcucG5n/original/d0yo04.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIyMzM2LzUyMTU4MjEucG5n/original/g3CJEv.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIyMzM2LzU4NTE3NzkucG5n/original/OqPRcQ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIyMzM2LzU4NTE3ODcucG5n/original/oa0vsV.png]]






<p>The Maker's Call is a single-player tabletop RPG about the creation of new magic! Spend time cataloging the attempts of The Maker as you seek to create a previously unseen type of magic. Play at the pace you want: you can do a session every day, every week, or however often you feel like playing!<br></p>
<p>What You Need To Play:</p>
<ul><li>A journal with approx. 30 available pages</li><li>Your favorite writing tool</li><li>One 20-sided die OR two 6-sided dice</li><li>A tarot deck</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTMxMDE2LzMyODEyNTAuanBn/original/%2FtyNwY.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTMxMDE2LzMyODEyNDYuanBn/original/B4Kn%2FM.jpg]]






<p><em>During a repair job to the remote freespace station PIRAD ONE, you meet a unique group of social and political outcasts and quickly learn that some have more powerful secrets than others. There is a force working from the shadows - one commune member is here on behalf of DEXTRO-SINGLETON, a powerful corp willing to do whatever it takes to secure the station and a valuable asset hidden within it. When things go bad, will you aid the disenfranchised that call PIRAD ONE home?<strong><br></strong></em></p>
<p><em><strong><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY4Njg0NjcucG5n/original/HZ04od.png" loading="lazy"></strong></em></p>
<p><strong>THE MOLE ON PIRAD ONE</strong> is a pamphlet adventure for use with the MOTHERSHIP sci-fi horror RPG.</p>
<p> Easily played as a one-to-two session standalone adventure or slotted into an existing campaign, <strong>THE MOLE ON PIRAD ONE</strong> sees players trapped aboard a damaged station and pitted against an undercover corporate agent with a very pressing deadline. <br></p>
<p>In addition to both standard and printer-friendly PDFs, purchase includes a Digital Asset pack featuring a number of assets for running the adventure virtually (high-res crew portraits, animated GIFs, maps, and more).</p>
<p class="text-center"><strong>LOOKING FOR A PHYSICAL COPY (AND LIVE IN THE U.S.)?<br></strong><strong>CHECK THE REWARDS BELOW!<br></strong></p>
<p><strong>Physical copies also available at:<br></strong></p>
<ul><li><strong><a href="https://www.nobleknight.com/P/2147929106/Mole-on-PIRAD-ONE-The" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Noble Knight Games<br></a></strong></li><li><strong><a href="https://floatingchair.club/products/the-mole-on-pirad-one?_pos=1&amp;_sid=7d7b7d25a&amp;_ss=r" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Floating Chair<br></a></strong></li><li><strong><a href="https://spearwitch.com/products/the-mole-on-pirad-one" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Spear Witch<br></a></strong></li><li><strong><a href="https://www.exaltedfuneral.com/collections/neoteric-codices/products/the-mole-on-pirad-one-pdf" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Exalted Funeral<br></a></strong></li><li><strong><a href="https://www.rookspress.com/products/the-mole-on-pirad-one" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Rook's Press</a></strong></li><li><strong><a href="https://www.indiepressrevolution.com/xcart/The-Mole-on-PIRAD-ONE-Print-PDF.html" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Indie Press Revolution<br></a></strong></li><li><strong><a href="https://iglootree.com/the-mole-on-pirad-one-by-christian-sorrell-1483-p.asp" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Iglootree<br></a></strong></li><li><strong><a href="https://monkeyspawgames.com/collections/new-arrivals/products/the-mole-on-pirad-one" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Monkey's Paw Games</a></strong></li></ul>
<p><strong><strong><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY4Njg0MzgucG5n/original/yGead6.png" loading="lazy"><br></strong></strong></p>

<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE3OTI5NC82ODY4MzkwLmpwZw==/original/R0nfzN.jpg]]






<p>Experience your impact on the universal balance act of everyday's life!</p>
<blockquote>The Moment You Were Born is a very personal journaling experience. You will recall the stories you hear about your own birth and will explore the universal balance between light and dark.</blockquote>
<p>The Moment You Were Born is a solo journaling experience, that means you interact with the text by yourself writing down your thoughts based on prompts provided in this book.</p>
<p>There are three ways to interact and experience The Moment You Were Born:</p>
<ul><li>Using the Element Dice System</li><li>Using a standard deck of&nbsp;playing cards</li><li>Using the space around you</li></ul>
<h4>Jam Submission</h4>
<p>The Moment You Were Born is a submission to the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/carta-jam" target="_blank">Carta Jam</a> and the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/the-five-powers-jam-2" target="_blank">Five Powers Jam 2</a>.<br></p>
<p>--------------------------------------------------------------------------</p>
<h4>Disclaimer:</h4>
<blockquote>This is a journaling experience and the information about safety is&nbsp;not professional medical advice. If you encounter or are reminded of something traumatic you should always look for professional help.</blockquote>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNzU3OS81ODYxMTM4LnBuZw==/original/AY%2BQZp.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNzU3OS81ODYxMTQxLnBuZw==/original/jVAwPn.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNzU3OS81ODYxMTQzLnBuZw==/original/IUNsB%2B.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNzU3OS81ODYxMTQ1LnBuZw==/original/b%2FBO25.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNzU3OS81ODYxMTQ3LnBuZw==/original/T9ht3E.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAyNzU3OS81ODYxMTQ4LnBuZw==/original/0tahWJ.png]]






<p>One of you is Shifting, taking terrible shape under the moon and frightened about what it means for you and the one you love.&nbsp;</p>
<p>One of you is Suspicious, seeing more and more troubling things around you at night and worried that the town you're in will eat you up and tear your love apart.&nbsp;</p>
<p>You have come together to talk things through and figure out what comes next.&nbsp;</p>
<p>It is a full moon.&nbsp;</p>
<p>I am so sorry.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTk3MTYyLzMxNjIwOTUucG5n/original/6jUyB3.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTk3MTYyLzMxNjIwNjkuanBn/original/W5Tyo2.jpg]]






<p class="text-center"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgyOTIwNzUucG5n/original/j6iOpo.png" loading="lazy"><br></p><p>Welcome, to The Nest - and to the brand new Gambit system!<br></p>
<p>In a world where a great disaster created both great innovation, and Superheroes, play&nbsp;as The Nest: a group of Powered, protecting their city so well they're actually getting bored. There are no more challenges, crime is so low they're stuck chasing down petty thieves.<br></p>
<p>Until one night, an army of mechs led by Powered Commanders marches out of the river, and takes over the city.</p>
<p>The Nest must find out what's happening, who's doing it, and how to stop them, before their foothold becomes immovable, and the city is lost.</p>
<p>Play one of 4 ready-made Superheroes: The Face, The Shadow, The Hustler or The Noob, or make your own with a simple, two-step creation process. Find the secret lair and make your way through to the Command Centre to confront Transistor, and shut down her army.</p>
<p>Or, GM your Players as The Net's man in the van: The Controller. Move the enemy soldiers and Commanders, and their mechs, as Transistor. Cause havoc, chaos, and perform the best Supervillain Speech you can muster!</p>
<p>Play The Nest using the Gambit system, an adaptable, easy-to-play, playing card system, with three levels of intensity to choose from. All you need are some packs of cards, some Players, and the willingness to be the cheesiest Superhero trope you can be!</p>
<p>Included in this zip file, you will find:<br></p>
<ul><li>Gambit&nbsp;- full rules, including 3 intensity levels</li><li>The Nest - full background, story, setup and character profiles (including Top Secret GM Info)</li><li>5 Superhero character sheets, ready to pick up and play</li><li>10 character sheets, with ready to use enemy soldiers, Commanders, Mechs, and your Supervillain; Transistor</li><li>6 Maps, drawn by Lex Jones, ready to throw The Nest into</li><li>An editable character sheet, to create your own Powereds, enemies, etc</li></ul>
<p>I hope you enjoy the world, game, and system. Gambit will be used in more scenarios, so follow me here or <a href="http://twitter.com/leekhulme" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">on twitter</a>&nbsp;to keep up to date!</p>
<p>If you're interested in just checking out Gambit on it's own,&nbsp; <a href="https://leekhulme.itch.io/gambit-system" target="_blank">it's right here</a>, and&nbsp;it'll adapt to just about anything you want to make.</p>
<p>All feedback welcome, please leave a rating and comment.</p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc4ODA1NTYucG5n/original/qv7AUL.png]]






<h3 class="text-center">The Partisan is an in-development playbook by Lawson Coleman for&nbsp;<a href="https://austin-ramsay.itch.io/beamsaber">Beam Saber</a> by&nbsp;Austin Ramsay, Focused on the relationship between a Pilot and Their own direct superior: The Handler.&nbsp;</h3>
<p>Partisans live and die on the battlefield for their handlers, who in return provide them with resources, information, and institutional power.&nbsp; Many Partisans are prideful of their station, considering themselves proud servants of a greater cause that benefits them, while others resent the ways in which their conditions push them to the edge.&nbsp;</p>
<p>This 31 Page Playbook Contains:&nbsp;</p>
<ul><li>8 Playbook Abilities, with tips/advice for both the GM &amp; the player for each&nbsp;</li><li>5 Pieces of Pilot Gear</li><li>4 Pieces of Vehicle Gear</li><li>Example allies, rivals, and handlers</li><li>Example tables for handler-issued side objectives and orders</li><li>Advice for running the handler, including ways to play GMless handlers</li><li>"The Scrapyard", a growing collection of cut &amp; experimental content for the Partisan(currently contains 2 abilities,3 playbook-specific downtime activities, 3 Pieces of pilot gear&nbsp;and 4 Zenith Abilities, a set of unique late-game specialization options)</li></ul>
<p><em>The Partisan is a&nbsp;<a href="https://austin-ramsay.itch.io/beamsaber/devlog/174666/the-beam-saber-supply-drop-licence">Beam Saber Supply Drop</a>. This material is an unofficial supplement and is not affiliated with Austin Ramsay.</em><em></em><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODc2NjE1LzUxMTA3MjgucG5n/original/TQDivV.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODc2NjE1LzUwNzIwMzIucG5n/original/utwT%2Bj.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODc2NjE1LzUwNzE4NjYucG5n/original/W9980L.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODc2NjE1LzUxMjcwNTAucG5n/original/wRI%2BGZ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODc2NjE1LzUxMjczNzMucG5n/original/1nUZFs.png]]






<p><em>You have heard of the house for many years, but never sought it out, assuming the endeavor wouldn‚Äôt be worth your time. Or worse yet that you would find exactly what you always feared.</em></p>
<p><em>Yet, something drew you towards its estate‚Äîa power, a thread dangling from the unwinding hem of a shirt, longing to be pulled. Reason and history warned you not to make the journey, not to cave to those newly-formed, yet eons-old, desires to seek out the house. However, now you are here...</em>
</p>
<p>The Portal at Hill House is a solitaire journaling game of cosmic horror that only requires the zine, paper, a six-sided die, and a deck of standard playing cards to play. On kickstarter in October of 2020, The Portal at Hill House is a 20-page RPG zine of cosmic horror.
</p>
<p>Co-designed with Lindi Farris-Hill.</p>
<p></p>
<p><strong><a href="https://www.presspot.games/store/p/portal-at-hill-house" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Go here to purchase a physical copy.</a></strong></p><p><strong><a href="https://presspotgames.itch.io/the-mirror-in-hill-house">Grab the two player version, The Mirror in Hill House, here.</a></strong></p><p><strong></strong></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzExMjcyLzYxODM5MDUucG5n/original/FVYcqA.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzExMjcyLzYxODM5MDQucG5n/original/%2FTHp7p.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzExMjcyLzYxODM5MDMucG5n/original/Bd54dk.png]]






<h4>WARNING: This book involves significant body horror&nbsp;elements and may not be suitable for players sensitive to such&nbsp;content.</h4>
<p><em>Once, this town only whispered about the sordid histories of its rare newcomers and the abundant setbacks of its long-time residents. But a brilliant flash in the sky a few nights back has brought new topics to the hushed tones of worried recluses and nosy neighbors: odd shapes along the treeline, mysterious lights deeper within, and notes pleasant to the ear dancing on the wind. You‚Äôve heard more enticing rumors, though, those of priceless gems unlike any other, ripe for the taking, and your thoughts can‚Äôt escape the tinge of colors you‚Äôve never witnessed before, strange but welcoming, emanating unseen from the woods that were once your childhood playground‚Ä¶</em><strong style=""></strong><em></em><br></p>
<p><em><strong>The Pried Eye</strong></em>&nbsp;is a psychedelic one-shot adventure for Jesse Ross‚Äôs&nbsp;<em><a href="https://trophyrpg.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Trophy Dark</a></em>&nbsp;in which the sudden appearance of something&nbsp;spectacular and indescribable&nbsp;in the backwoods of rural 20th-century America will lure the players into hunting for otherworldly gems, hoping to seize their independence and break free from their small town‚Äôs lack of opportunity.<strong> A tense and eerie descent into body horror, cosmic weirdness, and ego murder</strong><strong>,&nbsp;</strong><strong>this book contains all of the rules you need</strong><strong>&nbsp;to play</strong>, including all-new character creation options.</p>
<hr>
<blockquote><em></em><em>Truly amazing and beautifully presented. Possibly <strong>my favorite TTRPG book</strong> to just look at or read!<br></em>‚Äî<strong>Ewan</strong>, fan</blockquote>
<blockquote><em></em><em>I picked this up and ran it with my D&amp;D group. None of us had played the&nbsp;</em>Trophy Dark<em>&nbsp;system, and&nbsp;<strong>we had a blast</strong>. Last night will go down as&nbsp;<strong>one of my top RPG experiences</strong>, especially as a GM. The players picked up on the themes of the incursion and went with it. Some really good evocative (and pretty gross) imagery. This was&nbsp;<strong>awesome and inspiring</strong>.<br></em>‚Äî<strong>Jesse S.</strong>, early adopter</blockquote>
<hr>
<p>
</p>
<h3 class="text-center">Theme: Communion</h3>
<p>The book is 28 pages long and has a lot of&nbsp;evocative artwork. &nbsp;It includes:</p>
<ul><li>4 new occupations and 6 new backgrounds, drives, and rituals for character creation</li><li>15 moments</li><li>10 conditions</li></ul>
<p>You can also use the new character creation options from this adventure in the character keepers for <a href="https://www.arktosaur.us/keepers/trophydark" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><em>Trophy Dark</em></a> and <a href="https://www.arktosaur.us/keepers/trophygold" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><em>Trophy Gold</em></a>&nbsp;by&nbsp;Drew/Arktosaur for easier online play!</p>
<p>With purchase, you get the following fully bookmarked PDFs:
</p>
<ul><li>Single-page layout
