</li><li>Facing-spread layout
</li><li>Printer-friendly, black-and-white, art-less version
</li><li>A separate file for character sheets
</li></ul>
<p><strong>Or get a print-on-demand hardcopy <a href="https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/353200/The-Pried-Eye-A-Trophy-Dark-Incursion" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">through this link</a>!</strong></p>
<hr>
<p>
</p>
<p>A limited number of free community copies are available below for those who are currently struggling. <strong>Every purchase of&nbsp;<em>The Pried Eye</em> will unlock one additional free community copy for another user.&nbsp;</strong>If you are feeling particularly generous, you can increase your purchase price, and for every $9.00 above the default price you pay, another free community copy will be unlocked!<br></p>
<p></p>
<hr>
<p>If you want a subtler, more contemplative one-shot adventure, check out my other&nbsp;<em>Trophy Dark</em> incursion <strong><em><a href="https://atypicalfaux.itch.io/penumbra">Penumbra</a></em></strong>!</p>
<iframe frameborder="0" src="https://itch.io/embed/1094174?bg_color=000000&amp;fg_color=5cceff&amp;link_color=fad285&amp;border_color=5cceff" width="552" height="167" style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit"></iframe>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTkwMDY5LzU4NDQ2ODMucG5n/original/vHbh7b.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTkwMDY5LzU4MTQyOTcucG5n/original/9o2PmQ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTkwMDY5LzU4MTQyOTgucG5n/original/T8kPP6.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTkwMDY5LzU4MTQyOTkucG5n/original/fet5ui.png]]






<p><em>Hemera is dying; cut off from a galaxy of plenty by the very people who created it. Badass fighters in stolen ships steal, fight and explore their uncertain future.&nbsp;</em><br></p>
<p>A Powered by Lesbians adventure about&nbsp;societal collapse, ancient legacies, brighter futures and rainbow rocket star ship fighting. 45 pages with original illustrations. Setting guide, adventure hooks, custom move and campaign suggestions.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Originally written for Chris Bisette's #AdventureJam using their Random Adventure Title Generator.</p>
<p>Includes plain text PDF, intended to be screen-reader friendly,&nbsp;as well as&nbsp;html and epub versions.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>'Your writing is so clear and evocative, I feel like I could run this after just a quick read through!'</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>This work uses material from the Thirsty Sword Lesbians roleplaying game (found at https://swordlesbians.com), designed by April Kit Walsh and published by Evil Hat Productions, LLC, pursuant to the open license available at poweredbylesbians.com. Thirsty Sword Lesbians‚Ñ¢ is a trademark of April Kit Walsh. The Powered by Lesbians Logo is ¬© April Kit Walsh, and is used pursuant to the open licensing terms at &nbsp;<a href="http://poweredbylesbians.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">http://poweredbylesbians.com</a><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgxMjQxNTUucG5n/original/yiC3rh.png]]






<p>Dedicated to my mother, who held me whenever I was too scared of death to sleep.<br></p>
<p>The Reaper's Almanac is an epistolary rpg, a gm-less game played between players by taking it in turn to write each other letters. The players will portray Reapers who write to one another after reaping a human in order to keep them alive in memory. Over the course of the letters, the reapers &nbsp;will change and grow alongside their harvest. Included in the pdf is The Path, a collection of guided prompts for The Reaper's Almanac.<br><br>Created for the Correspondence Jam by <a href="https://dancynrew.itch.io/" target="_blank">Annie!</a><br><br>Shout out to the F@TT Oneshot Community and <a href="https://magicole.itch.io/" target="_blank">MagiCole</a> whose work inspired me.<br></p>
<p>Cover Art:<br><a href="https://www.freepik.com/free-photos-vectors/flower" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Flower vector created by lembrik - www.freepik.com</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI2NDE1OTMucG5n/original/DygG42.png]]






<p>You are the dead. You were betrayed, executed, exiled, mocked, and mutilated by your Foe. Your head was taken, and a beast‚Äôs head was crudely sewn on it‚Äôs place. Your form was left to rot.&nbsp;</p>
<p>But vengeance does not die, and neither do you. Now, you walk again, the head of a brutal monster on your shoulders, but a human heart beats in your chest. And there is still work to do, people to free, and vengeance to take.</p>
<p><strong>The Scourge </strong> is a <strong>Lasers and Feelings</strong> hack about being an undead monster, grappling with your own humanity, and taking revenge. If you ever wondered what would happen if Robb Stark came back to life and exacted bloody vengeance, this is the game for you. </p>
<p>This game will remain PWYW&nbsp; due to it's licensing as a Lasers &amp; Feelings Hack.<br></p>
<p>Written by:</p>
<p>&nbsp;ErikTheBearik (he/him)<br></p>
<p>Art by:&nbsp;</p>
<p>Florian-Ayala Fauna (she/her)</p>
<p><a href="https://www.florian-93.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://www.florian-93.com/</a></p>
<p><a href="mailto:sinewaves23@gmail.com" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">sinewaves23@gmail.com</a></p>
<p>The Scourge is a hack of Lasers &amp; Feelings by John Harper</p>
<p>Available at: <a href="mailto:oneseven@gmail.com" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">oneseven@gmail.com</a> - <a href="http://www.onesevendesign.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">onesevendesign.com</a>&nbsp;</p>
<p>this game is licensed under a CC by-nC-sa 3.0 license. <a href="http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/us/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/us/</a></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDU4NjEzLzIzMzEzOTcucG5n/original/2%2FP1vE.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDU4NjEzLzI2MDk5MjYuanBn/original/gY4chG.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDU4NjEzLzIzMzEzOTMucG5n/original/tTe6Ts.png]]






<p>The villagers of Stormlook are at their cliff‚Äôs edge. One of their own went missing. Another turned up dead. Their fish stocks are dwindling, and they‚Äôre hungry to blame one group: the selkie, a people who can transform between human and seal.
</p>
<p>Stormlook's leader asks for your help to traverse the Captiva Icemark, a perilous ice shelf, and&nbsp;establish contact with&nbsp;the selkie. Will you swear upon iron to complete this journey and bring peace between both communities, or will you succumb to the icy depths? Play to find out.</p>
<p><strong>Module features</strong><br></p>
<ul><li>A 2-4 hour one-shot for Shawn Tomkin's&nbsp;<em><a href="https://shawn-tomkin.itch.io/ironsworn" target="_blank">Ironsworn</a></em>, suitable for solo, co-op, and guided play</li><li>A new delve site, the Captiva Icemark, complete with a denizens matrix and suggested encounters</li><li>2 new&nbsp;<em>Ironsworn</em> foes: the selkie and walrus</li><li>1 new artifact: Phelphia's pelt</li><li>6 major NPCs and 6 locations between 2 settlements<br>
</li><li>1 iron vow that will lead your hero through a perilous journey and inter-community tensions</li><li>Optional&nbsp;<em><a href="https://shawn-tomkin.itch.io/ironsworn-delve" target="_blank">Ironsworn: Delve</a></em> support with guidelines for non-<em>Delve</em> play</li></ul>
<p><strong>Content notes</strong>
</p>
<p>This text contains the following themes: violence, natural disasters, drowning, starvation, murder, kidnapping, war, familial conflict, violence against animals, the undead, characters exoticizing other cultures, and potentially mob violence. Of note, the story revolves around fantasy xenophobia that can be read as an allegory for anti-indigenous racism or colonialism.
</p>
<p><strong>More information</strong><br></p>
<p>This module was written for the RPG Writer Workshop course "Write Your First Adventure | Fall 2021," as taught by <a href="https://www.storytellingcollective.com/" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Storytelling Collective</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Photo Credit:</strong> Cover photo by <a href="https://unsplash.com/photos/oAeLoen2TFA" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Marc Grove</a> on <a href="https://unsplash.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Unsplash</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc1ODczNTAucG5n/original/kg3R2E.png]]






<p><span></span><span></span>THE SMALL OLD KINGDOM OF SOMNAIRE is an odd little place.<br> <br>A minuscule corner of land. A slender tract of earth between more profitable claims. Barely worthy of the status of county, be it in any other nation.<br> <br>And yet a century or maybe a millennium ago, it held within its borders a swath of enigmatic people and so strangely shifting spaces. Some are still there.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzcyMTYxNDQucG5n/original/vhca1L.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>A system-free fantasy RPG setting created for #PocketPlaces Jam 2021<br>A4-sized (but easily printed on Letter and trimmed down before folding)</p><p>Here's a quick-and-easy guide on how to fold this type of pocket zine (sometimes called a pocketmod):<br><br></p><div class=""><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IAb31rIeGZo" allowfullscreen="" width="500" height="281" frameborder="0"><br></iframe></div>Created by Christian Sorrell<br>Art by THE PUBLIC DOMAIN<br>Figma Template by CoMiGo Games <br><p></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IAb31rIeGZo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIzNzg2MC83MjE2MTAxLnBuZw==/original/bUN3El.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIzNzg2MC83MjE2MDk2LnBuZw==/original/N9M4jf.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIzNzg2MC83MjE2MDk0LnBuZw==/original/QYf3HR.png]]






<p>We all get stuck in ruts. It's not easy to consider different ideas about what we do day-to-day and how we could improve things. But what if Bob Ross was able to telepathically speak with you throughout your day? Or MacGyver, Maya Angelou, or an alien from outer space?</p>
<p><em>The Spectacular Spectacles: an <a href="https://bethmakesgames.itch.io/everyday-enchanter" target="_blank">Everyday Enchanter</a> experience</em> shows you how, in two short pages and a grid of potential (non)fictional entities, to see your life in a new way. It also includes a blank grid to fill out yourself, using any entities you want!&nbsp;Maybe your cat, the one that never quite makes that jump onto the bed yet never quits trying, could show you how to be more persistent. Maybe Martin Luther King, Jr. can help you tackle unfair situations with patience and understanding, but also with courage and strength. And Captain Picard would certainly tell you to "make it so" on a task you're procrastinating!<br></p>
<p>The more you follow the three steps ‚Äîpick a personality, live your life, and journal your journey‚Äî the more you'll learn from potentially endless (but only 30 are included lol)&nbsp;points of view.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM3OTk0OC84MDM3MTUxLmdpZg==/original/jmhrJQ.gif]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM3OTk0OC84MDM3MTQ5LmpwZw==/original/smHm6P.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM3OTk0OC84MDM3MTUwLmpwZw==/original/cloxNa.jpg]]






<p><em>Somewhere in the vast multiverse, there is a post office box. It looks like all post office boxes in all parts of every world, and sits on the corner of any--or possibly every--street. Inside are many levels, inhabited by small spirits whose sole tasks are to ensure that the tiny pieces of every metaphorical puzzle arrive where they are needed before someone needs them. You are one of these spirits. Perhaps someday, you will rise to become a deity.</em></p>
<p>In The Spirit of Small Gifts, as you talk to your friends about the TTRPG games they're playing, you get to be the answer to the question "Is it reasonable that I'd have _____ in my inventory?" A Spirit of Small Gifts drops small, seemingly valueless trinkets&nbsp;in the mail so that the recipient has them in their pockets when they need them.</p>
<p>----</p>
<p>Up front, the goals of this game are these: To get people talking to their friends about their RPGs, foster some creative problem solving, and give you an excuse to put some letters in the mail. The goal of this game is explicitly <strong><em>not </em></strong>to override, pressure, or force anyone running a game playing along with your fiction.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjQ0MTY3LzUwMzU5NjkucG5n/original/qyS23N.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjQ0MTY3LzUwMzU5NzAucG5n/original/pFFXRl.png]]






<h3 class="text-center">The Starbreaker is an in-development playbook by Lawson Coleman for&nbsp;<a href="https://austin-ramsay.itch.io/beamsaber">Beam Saber</a> by&nbsp;Austin Ramsay, Focused on the use of powerful magic siphoned from something important for all life.</h3>
<p>What does magic look like in a world dominated by war and technology? What lessons do factions learn when their enemies use arcane power to laterally push through the constant arms race of ever-increasing war machines?&nbsp;</p>
<p>Starbreakers are incredibly skilled and dangerous arcanists, whose employers struggle to contain and command their power. They each have their own personal style of Magic, and their loyalties vary greatly, but they all have one thing in common: <em><br></em></p>
<p><strong><em>Their Power is stolen. </em></strong><br></p>
<p>This 19 Page Playbook Contains:&nbsp;
    </p>
<ul><li>10 Playbook Abilities</li><li>4 Pieces of Pilot Gear
</li><li>6 Arcane Abilities, Magical powers that can be hot-swapped during a mission</li><li>Example Gather Information Questions and Beliefs</li><li>Example Allies and Rivals</li><li>A Playbook XP Trigger</li></ul>
<p><em>The Starbreaker is a&nbsp;<a href="https://austin-ramsay.itch.io/beamsaber/devlog/174666/the-beam-saber-supply-drop-licence">Beam Saber Supply Drop</a>. This material is an unofficial supplement and is not affiliated with Austin Ramsay.</em>
    </p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTE1MjA2LzU2MDIwMDkuanBn/original/R5kuEZ.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTE1MjA2LzU2MDIwMDEucG5n/original/T1UQvL.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTE1MjA2LzU2MDE5NDkucG5n/original/e1YlzS.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTE1MjA2LzU2MDE5OTMucG5n/original/1dTxaW.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTE1MjA2LzU2MDE5OTUucG5n/original/2jhKt4.png]]






<p><br><strong>CONTENT WARNING: THIS PRODUCT CONTAINS MENTIONS OF SELF HARM, DRUG USE AND SUICIDE</strong></p>
<blockquote>Kid, leave sarge alone will ya? She needs her space. Out there, the stars aren't the only ones burning out.</blockquote>
<p>It's hard out there, in the great nowhere. "No one will hear you scream" stops being a throwaway gag once you're out in the void and the closest thing to your ship is several lifetimes away.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Time in space takes a toll on you, and sometimes, you're going to travel places meant for no one to see, things will get violent, people will die, and that will slowly make your life harder.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Trauma is no joke.</p>
<p>Trauma and mental illness are things I, the author, as a person, have to deal with, every day.</p>
<p>One day, it might even get me.</p>
<p>But that day hasn't come yet, and it's why I play games where I can vicariously experience other people dealing with the same shit that I do, and triumphing anyway.<br></p>
<p>Today, I bring you a modification of the rules for panic effects in Mothership that put the emphasis on player choice: instead of losing control, your character will find ways to cope.&nbsp;</p>
<p>These ways to cope might not be healthy, but they help stay somewhat sane. They will make it easier to not run away screaming, but at a cost. Perhaps you'll punish your body, perhaps you'll start retreating behind a wall of silence, perhaps you'll grow hateful and abusive, but at least, you'll be functional. Sometimes.</p>
<p>These mechanics put your character in complete control of how they deal with the trauma they get saddled with: your character will never go berserk unless you <strong>make them</strong>. The idea is to make rules that encourage roleplaying trauma without forcing you to, because I find that it makes it harder to feel something when a game just tells you to feel it.<br></p>
<p>This add on also comes with fun additionnal drugs, including some specifically made for androids, and an adventure location for cheap stress relief at a terrible cost.</p>
<p></p>
<p><em>This product is based on the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror Role Playing Game, published by Tuesday Knight Games. This product is published under license. Mothership RPG is a trademark of Tuesday Knight Games. All rights reserved. For additional information, visit <a href="http://www.tuesdayknightgames.com" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">www.tuesdayknightgames.com</a> or contact contact@tuesdayknightgames.com.</em></p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTcwODQ2LzU1MTQ5MzcuanBn/original/H5QuKh.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTcwODQ2LzU1MTQ5MzEucG5n/original/LQc4xr.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTcwODQ2LzU1MTQ5MzAucG5n/original/8wTIcu.png]]






<p><strong>The Steadfast and the Rebellious&nbsp;</strong>is a tabletop role-playing game and a storytelling game. It is a hack of <a href="https://temporalhiccup.itch.io/reincarnation" target="_blank">REINCARNATION REDUX: Our Requiem</a> by Rae Nedjadi, written for Jammi Jam Jam.</p>
<p>You are all inhabitants of the city, and you have been living in false peace under the rule of the demon king. The last wall, which offered your city limited protection against the demon king, has fallen. Citizens are left with two choices; do everything the tyrant demands, or <strong>resist</strong>. Will we rise victorious against the demon king, or will our resistance be futile? We play to find out.</p>
<p><em>This game is intended to create a quick but rich prologue for characters who rise up against the demon king in a fantasy setting. It is possible to use this game to create a setting and characters for your preferred game about enclosed spaces and giant lizards.</em></p>
<p>To play this game, we will need 1-2 hours, 2-4 players, a deck of playing cards, a conductive space, index cards, writing materials and a copy of this game (digital or printed). One of the player is the <strong>Facilitator</strong>, who has read this document beforehand.</p>
<p>Jess (<a href="https://twitter.com/go_jg" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@go_jg</a>),&nbsp;Kevin (<a href="https://twitter.com/Knit_Nack" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@Knit_Nack</a>), Corvyn (<a href="https://twitter.com/CorvynAppleby" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@CorvynAppleby</a>) &amp; Jordon (<a href="https://twitter.com/MadeOfCartoons" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@MadeOfCartoons</a>) did an actual play of the game:</p>
<div class=""><iframe style="width: 500px; height: 281px" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-6HP0wf09SQ" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-6HP0wf09SQ" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTExNTM4LzI2NTYzMTcucG5n/original/Sezoiq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTExNTM4LzI2NTYzMTkucG5n/original/eTuPN2.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTExNTM4LzI2NTYzMjAucG5n/original/qq3f6y.png]]






<p><em>The Stellar Beacon </em>zine has new adventures for the Indie Groundbreaker nominated sci-fi RPG Return to the Stars, and it explores&nbsp;geek pop culture with non-fiction essays.&nbsp; This issue includes:<br></p>
<p><em>One Atom of Justice, One Molecule of Mercy, and the Empire of Unsheathed Knives </em>an original essay by novelist and 2019 Hugo nominee&nbsp;Alexandra Rowland, exploring a new science fiction sub-genre: Hopepunk.</p>
<p><em>Aphrodite on Deck</em><br>A solarpunk-themed scenario for Return to the Stars by designer&nbsp;Beau J√°gr Sheldon.</p>
<p><em>Fallen Juggernaut</em><br>Emmett O‚ÄôBrian brings us a ‚Äúhard sci-fi‚Äù adventure where players explore a mysterious megastructure.</p>
<p><em>Beginning Gamemaster Pep Talk</em><br>Comics writer and illustrator Amy King provides encouragement for new game masters from a new game master.</p>
<p><em>The Stars, My Sandbox</em><br>Non-linear story prompts and encounters for Return to the Stars.</p>
<p>Get your copy today!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMzY0MTEwLzE4MjE0NjcucG5n/original/AK25hP.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMzY0MTEwLzE4MjE0NTMucG5n/original/h7KAYU.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMzY0MTEwLzE4MjE0NTQucG5n/original/7%2BRBBX.png]]






<p>A <strong>cinematic weather system </strong>for <em>Blades in the
  Dark</em>.</p>
<h3>Features</h3>
<ul>
    <li>Weird weather <strong>score hooks</strong>, for when
    strange weather rolls in.</li>
    <li>Evocative <strong>moments</strong> of flavor you can pepper scenes
    with.</li>
    <li>Generators to help you create <strong>weird
    weather</strong> and <strong>moments</strong> of your own.</li>
    <li>Simple mechanics that change the weather depending on what
    it was previously.</li>
    <li>Intuitive layout that keeps reduces page flipping to a
    minimum.</li>
  </ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTc3NjI5LzU1NTM3NTEucG5n/original/yRFsXk.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTc3NjI5LzU1NTM3NTAucG5n/original/xCnWjE.png]]






<p></p>
<h1>Whispers from the Swarm</h1>
<p><strong>"Urban legend&nbsp;</strong>has it that the Moth Man will sit above your porch and doomscreech to you, which&nbsp;is kinda like doomsaying, but more shrill. They say he haunts the night. They say he's pretty gay.&nbsp;</p>
<p>So it's only natural that I'd feel kinship with the dude when one day I realised I had moths inside of me.&nbsp;</p>
<p>They showed me&nbsp;<strong>things</strong>. I could see it, touch it, smell it...&nbsp;</p>
<p>No, believe me!&nbsp;</p>
<p>Please, don't leave.&nbsp;Please, don't go, don't go there. I beg you. I don't want to see it again, what happens to you...&nbsp;</p>
<p>Please..."</p>
<h2>The Swarm Speaker</h2>
<p></p>
<p><em>A portent of doom, they know when things end. They can feel it, smell, sometimes even see it, glimpses of a sword of Damocles that hangs and swings above the city‚Äôs head. The chittering, these whispers, they can‚Äôt ignore them, but everyone else seems to, and so this burden is theirs to bear, alone, eating away at them.</em><br></p>
<p><em>Literally.</em></p>
<p>The Swarm Speaker is a fanmade Playbook for Monsterhearts 2 by Avery Alder, which you can find at&nbsp;<a href="https://buriedwithoutceremony.com" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://buriedwithoutceremony.com</a>. You should definitely check out the other amazing things there.</p>
<p>The Swarm Speaker has a power of foresight that gives them an edge in many situation, but they're single-minded, as their agency is slowly eaten away by the moths living inside of them.</p>
<p>All in all, their life sucks, but if you want a character with a simple, sweet life, why are you checking out Monsterhearts 2?</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Art &amp; Writing by me<br>Layout by Kleme, on a template given by Avery Alder</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODg1NjI4LzQ5OTIwOTAucG5n/original/%2Blc8Mq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODg1NjI4LzQ5OTIwOTEucG5n/original/PsE63N.png]]






<p><em><strong>This playbook is currently in play test. If you purchase it, you will also receive the updated final version when it‚Äôs released.&nbsp;</strong><br></em></p>
<p><em>The Tempered has had life-changing experiences. But, like a well-tempered sword, after being shaped in fire and&nbsp;facing the heat they‚Äôve become honed, sharp, and capable. They want to forge&nbsp;a new life filled with love. But they must first find balance ‚Äî weighing safety,&nbsp;</em><em>stability, and vulnerability against change, justice, and facing foes.</em></p>
<p><em>‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî<br></em></p>
<p>Balance your sharpness and tenderness with The Tempered,&nbsp;&nbsp;a new unofficial playbook for Thirsty Sword Lesbians. This Powered by Lesbians community playbook includes 5 beautiful pages of content, including:</p>
<ul><li>&nbsp;The Tempered playbook</li><li>Relationship questions</li><li>GM moves</li><li>Table of friends, threats, and plots</li></ul>
<p><strong>The Brooding or Burning Hero</strong><br>This playbook takes inspiration from&nbsp;the brooding, silent&nbsp;sword-for-hire archetype and the throw-caution-to-the-wind fighter archetype.&nbsp;&nbsp;But it&nbsp;intentionally adds&nbsp;in moments that break the silence and offset the conflict, so&nbsp;allies and adversaries &nbsp;alike can&nbsp;&nbsp;feel the angst from your character‚Äôs troubled past and see their&nbsp;yearning for the chance to be vulnerable and be close to someone again. It also leaves room for building new relationships, with moves like Test of Mettle and&nbsp;A Life You Once Loved. <br><br><strong>Unstoppable, Unbreakable<br></strong>Get those cinematic climactic moments with The Tempered‚Äôs core playbook feature, Mettle. When your Mettle goes off the scale, your character can become either Unstoppable or Unbreakable, giving them incredible, spotlight-grabbing powers. Each one comes with a cost, though ‚Äî one that makes it more likely for allies and adversaries alike to reach out and try to get closer.</p>
<p><strong>Level Up Your Zingers and Flirts<br></strong>The Tempered isn‚Äôt all brooding&nbsp;and physical conflict. Flirts and charged moments are easy to get too, with a range of moves that let you choose whether to dig into angst or keep it flirty and fun.</p>
<p>&nbsp;Not into any traumatic past, but still want to up your flirting?&nbsp;Whet Your Appetite is great for your next playbook advance. If you‚Äôre looking for your current character to get&nbsp;more impact from heated retorts or icy glares, Hot and Cold helps you deliver.</p>
<p><br>‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî<br>This playbook was designed in the Tamien Nation and Chochenyo, also known as San Jose and Oakland, on the unceded territories of Chochenyo, Muwekma, and Tamien Nation Oholone peoples.<br>‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî</p>
<p>This playbook was designed by Christie R. Fremon.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Art and layout also by Christie R. Fremon, referencing prior work by Kanesha Bryant and Fred Hicks.</p>
<p>‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî<br></p>
<p>This work uses material from the&nbsp;<em>Thirsty Sword Lesbians</em>&nbsp;roleplaying game (found at https://swordlesbians.com), designed by April Kit Walsh and published by Evil Hat Productions, LLC, pursuant to the open license available at poweredbylesbians.com.<br></p>
<p>Thirsty Sword Lesbians‚Ñ¢ is a trademark of April Kit Walsh. The Powered by Lesbians Logo is ¬© April Kit Walsh, and is used pursuant to the open licensing terms at&nbsp;<a href="http://poweredbylesbians.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">http://poweredbylesbians.com</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc0NTA1NjgucG5n/original/3Tlv6F.png]]






<p>Six Haunting Scenarios for the 7th edition Call of Cthulhu horror tabletop roleplaying game.<br></p>
<p><em><strong>Customers&nbsp;are advised that contents of this book include themes of disease, infection, and contamination that may upset the reader (and players).</strong></em></p>
<p><strong>The Things We Leave Behind</strong>&nbsp;is an ENnie award winning anthology of 6 modern day scenarios for the&nbsp;<em>Call of Cthulhu</em>&nbsp;roleplaying game published by&nbsp;<strong>Chaosium, Inc,&nbsp;</strong>edited by Jeff Moeller and written by Brian M. Sammons, Scott Dorward, Simon Brake, Oscar Rios, and Jeff Moeller, with art by Davide Como, Badger McInnes, Dean Engelhardt,&nbsp;and Stephanie McAlea.</p>
<p>Taking its inspirational cues from&nbsp;<em>Delta Green</em>,&nbsp;<em>Fargo</em>,&nbsp;<em>Blood Simple</em>, and&nbsp;<em>True Detective</em>, the book takes a mature look at the horror of human nature and its ability to be just as disturbing as anything from the Mythos.&nbsp;</p>
<h2>The Scenarios</h2>
<ul><li><strong>Ladybug, Ladybug, Fly Away Home</strong>, by Jeff Moeller.&nbsp;The investigators search for an abducted child in suburban Cleveland, Ohio, where time becomes a serious concern.</li><li><strong>Forget Me Not</strong>,&nbsp;by Brian M. Sammons. &nbsp;An accident in a TV truck&nbsp;in rural Michigan sees the investigators awake in a ditch with no recollection of how they got there.</li><li><strong>Roots</strong>,&nbsp;by Simon Brake. Inquiries into a missing teen will teach the investigators that some mid-west communities prefer to be left alone.</li><li><strong>Hell in Texas</strong>,&nbsp;by Scott Dorward. After a suicide at a church's east Texas Halloween haunted house, strange events threaten the lives and sanity of all those in the vicinity, including the investigators.</li><li><strong>The Night Season</strong>, by Jeff Moeller, shows that fandom in Anchorage, Alaska, can go too far when reality begins to shift.</li><li><strong>Intimate Encounters</strong>, by Oscar Rios, warns us that an indiscrete rendezvous can lead to problems other than a risk of STDs.</li></ul>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4qoh5361IY8" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA0MzA1LzMyMDU2NTQuanBn/original/MCEyRk.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA0MzA1LzMyMDU2NTUuanBn/original/sX%2F8zV.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA0MzA1LzMyMDU2NTguanBn/original/i8hlnH.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA0MzA1LzMyMDU2NTkuanBn/original/tBAyfJ.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA0MzA1LzMyMDU2NTYuanBn/original/CmVcYl.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA0MzA1LzMyMDU2NTcuanBn/original/Rs8BvC.jpg]]






<p><em>The Thirteen</em>&nbsp;is a supporting booklet for&nbsp;<em>Hudson &amp; Brand, Inquiry Agents of the Obscure</em>&nbsp;for&nbsp;7th edition&nbsp;<em>Call of Cthulhu</em>, and is an official&nbsp;<em>Cthulhu by Gaslight</em>&nbsp;product. This chapbook introduces an organization of immortals, for the benefit of Keepers who wish to add something a little unusual to their games.</p>
<h2>The Thirteen</h2>
<p>While there are no chapters, the 15 different sections of the book can be grouped together, roughly, as follows:
</p>
<p><strong>Section 1: The Society of the Thirteen</strong>. These sections introduce a new organization of Mythos-aware NPCs, set in foggy Victorian London. The book starts off by covering their history, complete with a timeline dating back to the late Stone Age, from when (and how) they first gained immortality, up to the Victorian era.&nbsp;
</p>
<p><strong>Sections 2-5: Summary of the Society of Thirteen</strong>: The Society of Thirteen is, basically, human, and can serve easily in the role of enemy, ally, or merely other interesting NPCs for your investigators. These sections detail some of the role-playing challenges a Keeper should expect when playing ancient humans, and a couple of driving motivations for the members of this group. Also covered is how members of the society keep the Sanity-rending effects of the Mythos at bay, and how they cope with all they've seen over the millennia.
</p>
<p><strong>Section 6: Playing the Society as an Organisation</strong>: This part covers the organisation's group motivations and goals, what their limitations are, why they stay together, etc. It also delves into how they typically interact with outsiders (like those nosey Investigators). Lastly, it covers the resources that the Society of Thirteen has, including The Whiteacre Estate, some 10 miles to the west of London (easily reached from 33 Golden Square), as well as the source of their power/"immortality."&nbsp;
</p>
<p><strong>Sections 7-14: The Society Members</strong>: These portions of the chapbook cover the surviving members of the group (and provide a list of the deceased members and what role they had served while still living). Each NPC is provided with a detailed history, their role in both the Society as well as Victorian society, a stat block, encounters with famous, past figures they may've had, and then tips on role-playing each member.&nbsp;
</p>
<p><strong>Sections 15-16: Dealing with External Threats</strong>: The final two sections cover how the organization will react to the deaths of any members as well as how they may react, long-term with any investigators that have been useful to them.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgyNjE1MDcucG5n/original/PHL%2BXK.png]]






<p>One of your parent‚Äôs suffered from a mysterious ailment where they would uncontrollably become detached from time. They ultimately succumbed to the dangers of time travel, and died tragically, but not before having a child, you. Now scientific progress has demystified the rare disease known as Solutus Tempus, and a cure is available. Through research, it is also now possible for those suffering from the illness to take small items with them on jumps.<br></p>
<p>And so you hatched a plan to give your parents an impossible gift, a life lived together in the same direction. You‚Äôve infected yourself with Solutus Tempus, and have 4 doses of the cure. You‚Äôll fall through time hoping to land in the same moment as your time afflicted parent, cure them, and return safely to your present to cure yourself.
</p>
<p>This is your story.
</p>
<p>The Time Traveler‚Äôs Child is a playbook for The Time Traveler‚Äôs Life by William Lentz that adds a third player to the game. This player will take the role of the child of the Time Traveler and their Significant Other. To play you will need 3 players,&nbsp;a copy of The Time Traveler‚Äôs Life (<a href="https://gamenomicon.itch.io/the-time-travelers-life"><span class=""></span></a><a href="https://gamenomicon.itch.io/the-time-travelers-life">https://gamenomicon.itch.io/the-time-travelers-life</a>), a d20, and three d6s (one for each player).<br></p>
<p>This game was an entry in the Finish your Damn RPG jam&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/jam/finish-your-damn-rpg-jam">https://itch.io/jam/finish-your-damn-rpg-jam</a>&nbsp;and the One Page RPG Hackathon 2021 jam&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/jam/one-page-hack-a-thon-2021">https://itch.io/jam/one-page-hack-a-thon-2021</a>.</p>
<p><strong>SHAMELESS PLUG: If you are a fan of these kinds of games, you'll love what I&nbsp;have in store for season 2 of Instadeath Survivors Support Group. Subscribe now so you don't miss the awesome!&nbsp;Listen to the&nbsp;<a href="https://anchor.fm/instadeath" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Podcast</a>. Watch on&nbsp;<a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwTrrTuIv-EcWMhvuEJSPzQ" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Youtube</a>.</strong><br></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/sX9C1N_8jUw" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMxMDc1NS83NjI3MTc0LnBuZw==/original/8uLFIs.png]]






<p>From the heart of a black hole comes the voice of the Void. it claims to be a god, and it grants it followers impossible power. How will you use the gifts bestowed upon you ?&nbsp;</p>
<p>You like mecha ? You like some friendly competition and a lot of chaos ? You're in the right place. Touch of The Void is a fast, simple and frantic pvp mecha combat game with some roleplay opportunities stirred in for flavor.</p>
<p>Hope you have fun !&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgwMTU5MDcucG5n/original/e%2BTaU3.png]]






<p>IT WAS A FORTNIGHT AGO that the creature descended upon you in the dark. The searing pain in your neck, a slumber deeper than&nbsp;you've ever known, and then the violent hunger. You've become a creature you once thought only existed in fables and nightmares: a vampire. You soon discover you are not alone in your damnation. You manage to acquire the location of a fellow vampire and begin to write to them.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The world around you changes with the centuries, but delivery of the written word stays comfortably the same. So you write and share with your companion tales of your cursed existence along the unlit path.<br></p>
<p>#SaveTheUSPS<br></p>
<p>*****************&nbsp;<br>Our games&nbsp;got a really kind shout out from the team at Dicebreaker in a recent episode of&nbsp;their podcast. Give it a listen&nbsp;<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K0QxYE6wgNs" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a>&nbsp;around 24:08.</p>
<p>******************</p>
<p>Designed specifically to be played through the mail, The Unlit Path has two players using regular playing cards as prompts as they write and send correspondences as vampires wandering the world and watching the centuries sail by.&nbsp;However they do not draw their own prompts. Instead, with each letter players send, they'll enclose a playing card to inspire their partner's reply. <strong>No GM needed.</strong></p>
<p>Download includes a two-sided 8 1/2x11 trifold guide to play the game. Both you and your partner will need a copy of the rules (no need to purchase twice, just send the pdf to the other player), a six-sided die, a deck of regular playing cards, paper, postage, and envelopes.&nbsp;</p>
<p><em>For a single player solo&nbsp;variant, simply create the deck as instructed, follow directions for the opening entries&nbsp;and play as though keeping a journal as your character. Add in additional cards for longer games if desired.&nbsp;<br></em></p>
<p>If, for any reason, you are unable to purchase at this time, DM me through twitter (@tozieer) for a download key, no questions asked.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Created by Daniel Tozier&nbsp;<br>Check out my other games here:&nbsp;<a href="https://adventurebymail.itch.io/">adventurebymail.itch.io</a></p>
<p>Photo by Cassi Josh&nbsp;via Unsplash.<br>(Inspired by Adira Slattery's&nbsp;The Machine)</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzk1ODI3LzQ0Njc4MDQucG5n/original/RHnr22.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzk1ODI3LzQ0Njc4MDYucG5n/original/2CeqFq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzk1ODI3LzQ0Njc4MTUucG5n/original/jtEfYx.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzk1ODI3LzQ0Nzg3NjUucG5n/original/xA9C%2Fw.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzk1ODI3LzQ0Njc4MDIucG5n/original/GO59i4.png]]






<p><em>You rose ‚Äì alone, confused, and hungry. The vampire found you, explained what you were, and promised to help shepherd you into this new phase of (un)life. But when you went to visit them, all you found was a pile of dust and a departing Vampire Slayer.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p><em>Maybe you want to guarantee your safety. Maybe you‚Äôre looking for revenge. Maybe you just need to prove that you didn‚Äôt end the vampire yourself. Whatever the reason, you‚Äôre now hunting the Vampire Slayer. They‚Äôve retreated to their Hideout; get them.</em></p>
<p>This game is a hack of Grant Howitt's <a href="https://gshowitt.itch.io/the-witch-is-dead" target="_blank">The Witch is Dead</a>. It's easy to play and run, with (optional) rollable tables for generating PCs, plot, adversaries,&nbsp;and setting.</p>
<p>The Vamp is Dust was written for <a href="https://itch.io/jam/bipocvampjam" target="_blank">BIPOC Vamp Jam</a> 2021.</p><p><strong>Update 1.1 (9/12/21)</strong>:&nbsp;Trait descriptions edited based on playtesting.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE4NTI2OS82OTA5OTg0LnBuZw==/original/DZSGjR.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE4NTI2OS82OTA5NzkyLnBuZw==/original/inlPwj.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE4NTI2OS82OTA5Nzk2LnBuZw==/original/8Pkc%2Bn.png]]






<p></p>
<p>YOU AND YOUR FRIEND&nbsp;wait to board two ARK-4 Civilian Class Shuttles charted for new colonies in the hinterlands of space. Though you will be several light-years apart, you promise to keep in touch through the interstellar communication network known as the Unified Starways Parley System. You'll use this network to tell each other about the life you build and the love you discover in the far reaches of space...</p>
<p>#SaveTheUSPS<br><br>*****************<br>Our games&nbsp;got a really kind shout out from the team at Dicebreaker in a recent episode of&nbsp;their podcast. Give it a listen&nbsp;<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K0QxYE6wgNs" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a>&nbsp;around 24:08.<br>******************</p>
<p></p>
<p>Designed specifically to be played through the mail, The Wanderers has two players using regular playing cards as prompts as they write and send correspondences about the love they find and the lives they live as they build a new home in the interstellar colonies. With each letter players send, they'll enclose a playing card to inspire their partner's reply. Together, they'll write stories, find love, and build a new life light years from Earth. <strong>No GM needed.</strong></p>
<p><em>For a single player solo&nbsp;variant, simply create the deck as instructed, follow directions for the opening entries&nbsp;and play as though keeping a journal as your character.&nbsp;Add in additional cards for longer games if desired.&nbsp;</em><br></p>
<p>Created by Daniel Tozier&nbsp;<br>Image by Jake Weirick via Unsplash<br>(Inspired by Adira Slattery's&nbsp;The Machine)<span></span></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzY4NjE2LzQzMDM5OTEucG5n/original/gbcedJ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzY4NjE2LzQzMDM5OTIucG5n/original/eBzRs1.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzY4NjE2LzQzNjY4MzgucG5n/original/TdW3BO.png]]






<p><strong>The Wasteland Covenant</strong> is a rules lite post-apocalyptic story game about exploring new settlements and the history and life of your Trade Envoy.</p>
<p>The game is the first to use the <strong>Told by Travelers</strong> system, a diceless round-robin GM game where the currency of play is found in questions to be asked and answered.</p>
<p>In <strong>The Wasteland Covenant </strong>everyone will take turns playing a sort of GM as they take on their roles as Settlements one at a time. While one player takes on the role of the Settlement, everyone else takes on the roles of <em>Trade Envoys </em>visiting the settlement for the first time.</p>
<p>Questions will lead to two outcomes:&nbsp;</p>
<ul><li>Free Play: back and forth style freeform gameplay&nbsp;between Settlement and Envoy(s)</li><li>Flashback: The character activating a Flashback (usually an Envoy) recounts a memory or scene from a player's past, which is often done solo, while everyone else takes a moment to listen.</li></ul>
<p><strong>Play this game to:</strong></p>
<ul><li>Play a game that works best as a one-shot or short campaign.</li><li>Improvise interactions and descriptions as both Settlement and Trade Envoy.</li><li>Create in the moment&nbsp;rich worlds and meaningful characters with storied pasts.</li></ul>
<p><strong>The journey, not the destination</strong></p>
<p>"You may structure this game as much as possible. If you want, you can set up what deals will be made before the game itself even starts, during character creation. That is a completely valid way to play and it won‚Äôt break the game or make it any less fun.</p>
<p>This game was written with the assumption that by the end everyone has the resources they need; in the end everyone will ‚Äúwin.‚Äù The point of the game is to engage with the story, to build exciting worlds and to play in a bit of post-apocalyptic wonder and drama."</p>
<p><strong>File Formats:&nbsp;</strong>The game is available in both a digest-sized&nbsp;PDF and a Mobile friendly PDF, both of which are available in large and small file sizes.</p>
<p><strong>Audio:</strong> a 32 minute mp3 of an audio transcription read and edited by myself is now available.<br></p>
<p><strong>Community Copies are available!</strong></p>
<ul><li>Launch with <del>25</del>&nbsp;29 Community Copies.</li><li>Every <strong>Sale</strong> is +1 Community Copy.</li><li>Every <strong>Rating</strong> is +1 Community Copy.<ul><li>If you plan to leave a less than 4-star rating, please leave a review on what you think could improve it.</li><li>Please do not leave a bad rating if you don't like story games, post apocalypse games, or any other working as intended features, just because they are not to your preference.</li></ul></li></ul>
<p><strong>Feedback is always appreciated!</strong></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTU5MS82MzQ2NTYxLnBuZw==/original/Rp0z57.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTU5MS82MzUxNDM0LnBuZw==/original/lYIF%2Bl.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTU5MS82MzQ2NjQyLnBuZw==/original/06JnKo.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTU5MS82MzQ2NjQ5LnBuZw==/original/ib4%2F7n.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTU5MS82MzQ2NjY0LnBuZw==/original/fKwiTi.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NTU5MS82MzQ2NTcyLnBuZw==/original/w9dV8x.png]]






<h2>The Wellspring is an in-development playbook by Lawson Coleman for&nbsp;<a href="https://austin-ramsay.itch.io/beamsaber">Beam Saber</a> by&nbsp;Austin Ramsay, Focused the exploration of character relationships using plant magic and the mechanics of Beam Saber.</h2>
<p>In the Face of Endless war and suffering, and in conflict with constantly escalating technology to fuel it, a new sort of magic has arisen. Giant, powerful plants capable of providing for, protecting, and healing massive populations have risen in places where the marginalized suffer the most. <br></p>
<p>A Wellspring is someone who is connected to, and can control these plants in some way. What they use this great power for is up to them, once granted. <br></p>
<p>This 14 Page Playbook Contains:&nbsp;         </p>
<ul><li>10 Playbook Abilities
</li><li>4 Pieces of Pilot Gear 
</li><li>4 Pieces of Vehicle Gear</li><li>Example Gather Information Questions and Beliefs
</li><li>Example Allies and Rivals
</li><li>A Playbook XP Trigger
</li></ul>
<p><em>The Wellspring is a&nbsp;<a href="https://austin-ramsay.itch.io/beamsaber/devlog/174666/the-beam-saber-supply-drop-licence">Beam Saber Supply Drop</a>. This material is an unofficial supplement and is not affiliated with Austin Ramsay.</em>     
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTE1NDM2LzU4MzI2ODkuanBn/original/3poFcX.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTE1NDM2LzU4MzI2NzkucG5n/original/CTzJ6r.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTE1NDM2LzU4MzI2NjkucG5n/original/loG16V.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTE1NDM2LzU4MzI3MDkucG5n/original/n4wbfi.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTE1NDM2LzU4MzI3MTQucG5n/original/QV27UH.png]]






<p><em>The world is ending in one week. This we know for a fact. It is too late to stop it. It cannot be slowed down anymore. Especially not by you, because you are just a group of large dogs. All you can do is try and make the final days as best as you can for those that are near and dear to you. Your owners, your community, the other wild dogs in the park, whoever you hold dear.</em>   </p>
<p><strong>The World is Ending and We Are Very Large Dogs</strong> is a GM-less collaborative storytelling game for 2+ players, wherein the players work to weave stories of bright moments in the face of Armageddon. The mood, intensity and tone of this game are up to you, the players, to decide,&nbsp;as&nbsp;the&nbsp;adaptable&nbsp;ruleset&nbsp;is&nbsp;designed for anything&nbsp;from a&nbsp;pulpy&nbsp;Mars&nbsp;Attacks-esque&nbsp;alien&nbsp;invasion&nbsp;to a&nbsp;a&nbsp;dark, mournful, melancholic ending.</p>
<p>---</p>
<p>This is version 1.0 of Very Large Dogs, however if you purchase it you will recieve any updates or revisions free of charge.<br>  
  </p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ5NzgwNDYucG5n/original/TABVzn.png]]






<p></p>
<p><em>Slayer. Headsman.&nbsp;Hunter.</em></p>
<p><em>Bastard. Murderer. Monster.</em></p>
<p><em>You have been called many things-</em></p>
<p><em>Your kind are found in every corner of the land yet your numbers are so small, and dwindle with each passing year. Despite this, your kin tend to find one another, banding together and finding solace in the darker corners of the world.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p><em>But with each each hunt and every life lost, a question plagues your every thought:&nbsp;</em></p>
<p><em><strong>"Are the monsters the one you hunt, or perhaps the ones you serve?"</strong></em></p>
<figure><img class="" src="https://ksr-ugc.imgix.net/assets/027/890/120/1abe631a497f26b0f77768fceaeff90a_original.png?ixlib=rb-2.1.0&amp;w=680&amp;fit=max&amp;v=1580234638&amp;auto=format&amp;gif-q=50&amp;lossless=true&amp;s=d8b957da04e486d1bfbe4220159f6c01" style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; max-width: 100%" loading="lazy"></figure>
<p><strong>They Cried Monster is a monster-hunting hack for the world‚Äôs most popular role-playing game.</strong></p>
<p>Based on stories like&nbsp;<em>Hellboy, The Witcher</em>, or&nbsp;<em>Mushishi</em>,&nbsp;<strong>They Cried Monster</strong>&nbsp;tasks a group of world-weary Hunters to track monsters, solve mysteries, and face the ethical dilemma of protecting humanity or the monsters they have been hired to slay. Hunters must balance social standing with the settlements and locals, as well as being quick to action facing down the dangerous creatures that lurk in the wilderness.</p>
<figure><img class="" src="https://ksr-ugc.imgix.net/assets/027/948/784/ee776682cfe0cdf379ff38d54a1b7763_original.png?ixlib=rb-2.1.0&amp;w=680&amp;fit=max&amp;v=1580696139&amp;auto=format&amp;gif-q=50&amp;lossless=true&amp;s=b7b7521d0dd1ee77bce7d94180a4e633" style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; max-width: 100%" loading="lazy"></figure>
<figure><img class="" src="https://ksr-ugc.imgix.net/assets/027/890/151/7a3b71267692c0da424088b2785d22b6_original.png?ixlib=rb-2.1.0&amp;w=680&amp;fit=max&amp;v=1580234776&amp;auto=format&amp;gif-q=50&amp;lossless=true&amp;s=0b74f5c704eaabe6f314e0d92d7b3a48" style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; max-width: 100%" loading="lazy"></figure>
<p><strong>They Cried Monster</strong>&nbsp;contains:</p>
<ul><li>&nbsp;<strong>Steps for creating and playing as a grizzled Hunter,</strong>&nbsp;including character creation quirks and an on-the-fly inventory system.</li><li>&nbsp;<strong>A guide for generating settlements and NPC's</strong>&nbsp;beleaguered by monsters.</li><li>&nbsp;<strong>Social Systems for gathering information,&nbsp;</strong>placating superstitious locals, and trying to avoid a mob.</li><li>&nbsp;<strong>Adventure system based on tracking monsters</strong>&nbsp;and discovering clues as to why they are attacking.</li><li>&nbsp;<strong>Four unique and DANGEROUS monsters,</strong>&nbsp;each with habits, quirks, and reasons for attacking civilization.</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTg0OTQ0LzMwODM5NzcucG5n/original/b29CK1.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTg0OTQ0LzMwODM5NzkucG5n/original/7T%2BpD0.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNTg0OTQ0LzMwODM5NzgucG5n/original/QUN8N%2B.png]]






<p>This is a game designed to be played throughout your workday/session if you are someone who works at a desk.&nbsp; <strong>They </strong>do not want you to work. <strong>They</strong> want you to play with Them, and build Them a nice city to live in. You should do what they ask.</p>
<p>The items needed are the kind frequently found at desks, including paper clips, sticky notes, notebooks, business cards, and your smartphone or computer, however, expect more updates with more games using other workstation items.&nbsp;</p>
<p>If you have a request for an item to be made into a mini-game for this - please let me know in a comment or by email at superdillin@gmail.com and I will include one in the update!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5MzYwMC83NTMzMzU3LnBuZw==/original/t6P6ei.png]]






<p><strong>Love, swords, and adventure.</strong></p>
<p><em>Thirsty Sword Lesbians battle the Lady of Chains when her enforcers march down from the frosty north. They rocket through the stars to safeguard diplomats ending a generations-old conflict. Even when swords are crossed, they seek peace with their opponent‚Äîand sometimes connect more deeply than anyone expects.</em>
</p>
<p>A sword duel can end in kissing, a witch can gain her power by helping others find love, and an entire campaign can be built around wandering&nbsp; matchmakers flying from system to system.
</p>
<p><strong>Thirsty Sword Lesbians</strong>&nbsp;is a roleplaying game for telling queer stories with friends. If you love angsty disaster lesbians with swords, you have come to the right place.
</p>
<p>In this book, you‚Äôll find:
</p>
<ul><li>Flirting, sword-fighting, and zingers in a system designed for both narrative drama and player safety.
</li><li>An innovative take on the&nbsp;<em>Powered by the Apocalypse</em>&nbsp;family of games.
</li><li>Nine character types, each focusing on a particular emotional conflict: Beast, Chosen, Devoted, Infamous, Nature Witch, Scoundrel, Seeker, Spooky Witch, and Trickster.
</li><li>Guidance and support for running the game, including how to make appealing adversaries, set the tone, pace the game, and structure play.
</li><li>Tools to create your own settings and stories, alongside a dozen pre-written options including the cyberpunk&nbsp;<strong>Neon City 2099</strong>, steamfunk poets battling oppression as Les&nbsp;<strong>Violettes Dangereuses</strong>, laser swords and intrigue in the&nbsp;<strong>Starcross Galaxy</strong>, and more.
</li><li>World building worksheet for custom scenarios and starting scenario seeds to play with:&nbsp;<strong>Best Day of Their Lives</strong>,&nbsp;<strong>The Constellation Festival</strong>,&nbsp;<strong>Gal Paladins</strong>, and&nbsp;<strong>Sword Lesbians of the Three Houses</strong>
</li><li>Variant rules to highlight different identities, emotional connections, and setting elements.
</li><li>Strategies to adapt any setting where swords cross and hearts race for&nbsp;<strong>Thirsty Sword Lesbians</strong>.
</li></ul>
<p><strong>Ready? Let‚Äôs go!</strong>
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYxMjUyODYuanBn/original/5xhNNk.jpg]]






<p><em>This Party Sucks</em> is a collaborative story game about being a queer and/or trans twentysomething who is (badly) processing a recent breakup. You will play out a piece of their story as they attend a series of three parties while trying (and failing) not to think about their ex. The game encourages a group of three players to laugh, wince, and (possibly) reflect on their own lives and relationships while telling their shared protagonist's story with honesty and tenderness.<br></p>
<p><em>This Party Sucks</em> now features updated PDFs, one formatted for digital reading and the other a print-and-play zine format. This edition also has expanded gameplay tools built based on playtester feedback, including tips for creating a main character, determining themes and details of the game setting, and managing game tone if gameplay veers humorously or awkwardly close to players' own relationship histories. You can also access a random character generation tool I designed specifically for this game <a href="https://beatingthebinary.itch.io/this-party-sucks-character-generator" target="_blank">here</a>.<br></p>
<p>Inspired by Mal Blum's queer folk punk album <a href="https://malblum.bandcamp.com/album/tempest-in-a-teacup-2013" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Tempest in a Teacup</a>, and made for the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/recordcollection2k19">ReCo2k19</a> game jam. The original game jam version and interim drafts are still available through <a href="https://www.patreon.com/adanarama" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Patreon</a> for those who enjoy seeing the game's development arc.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzI5MzMzOTkucG5n/original/MFUxEb.png]]






<p><em>The world is slow to change, yet ever-changing, and we are mere players on tiny stages that we have somehow managed to make revolve around us. Fortunately, the world continues to spin despite our attempts to slow down time. With our time here, where should our focus lie? On ourselves? On the world around us? On each other?</em></p>
<p><em>Ultimately, what legacy are we leaving behind when it is time to pass on, and what are</em>&nbsp;<em>we giving to those who</em>&nbsp;<em>come after us?</em>
</p>
<p>In&nbsp;<strong>this world is not yours</strong>, one player plays the roles of numerous families over the span of four generations, while the other person plays the role of the house they live in. Over time, the families change and grow, while the house remains as it was, yet still changing and growing with the families as they do.&nbsp;
</p>
<p>Players alternate taking turns exploring three different elements of their shared history:&nbsp;<strong>Events</strong>,&nbsp;<strong>Environments</strong>, or&nbsp;<strong>Emotions</strong>. These are written on notecards and laid out between players, creating a visual representation of what is left behind.&nbsp;
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEwMjE4Ny82MzU4MDk1LnBuZw==/original/GzfMn9.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEwMjE4Ny82MzU4MDk3LnBuZw==/original/fy1mSP.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEwMjE4Ny82MzU4MDk2LnBuZw==/original/Es2EVQ.png]]






<p><strong>Those of Us Who Know Better </strong>is a tabletop roleplaying game about transgender superheroes whose powers come at a price. Civilians by day, in community every other Thursday evening, and heroes by night, the players use their powers to problem solve and offer protection and support around town. These powers must be used sparingly, however, because every use of a superpower demands a specific and costly remuneration.</p>
<p>Consider if Aquaman had to persuade an animal to bite him every time he talked to fish. Or if Miles Morales had to stop and watch a YouTube video every time he shot webs out of his hands. It‚Äôs like that. Also, you're&nbsp;trans.</p>
<p>Those of Us Who Know Better is a mission-based game. Each session begins with the heroes encountering a problem they must address. The session conclude&nbsp;when the heroes feel they have adequately resolved the situation. This game supports both one-shots and campaign play.</p>
<p><strong>Those of Us Who Know Better includes:</strong></p>
<ul><li>An original game system with 5 stats, simple mechanics, entirely customizable characters, and simple rolls that require only a D10 die.   </li><li>Options for powers and prices that alter the characters' base stats, enormously shifting their success potential with consequences both predictable and unexpected.   </li><li>Simple combat mechanics that function as a means of resolution for rapidly occurring events, rather than forcing the players to choose violence.   </li><li>A GM guide with tips for running the game.</li><li>An FAQ for cis people, so you don't have to ask your trans friends.&nbsp;</li><li>A single-page play aid.&nbsp;</li></ul>
<p>Those of Us Who Know Better features writing and game design by Charles Jamie Linton, layout by <a href="https://www.elizabethhaleymorton.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Elizabeth Morton</a>, and art by <a href="https://layaroseart.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Laya Rose</a>.     </p>
<p><strong>Number of players:</strong> 2-5 players and 1 GM.<br><strong>Length:</strong> 2-4 hours per game session.&nbsp;<br><strong>Assets:&nbsp;</strong>Core Book ‚Äì a 21 page book&nbsp;of everything you need to play or run the game.<br>Starter Adventure ‚Äì <em>Unconventional Methods</em>, a&nbsp;17&nbsp;page, far-more-detail-than-you-need starting scenario, including a setting and pre-generated characters.<br>Character Sheets ‚Äì form fillable.<br><br>
<strong>A playlist for the game:</strong></p>
<p><iframe src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/playlist/55jTghG2H9enFIb5UwjRbb" width="300" height="380" frameborder="0"></iframe>&nbsp;<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzUwMjQ2LzQ4MjI4NTgucG5n/original/bxYUZz.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzUwMjQ2LzQ4MjI4NTcucG5n/original/1MWKlA.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzUwMjQ2LzQ4MjI4OTYucG5n/original/L3SJvk.png]]






<p>You are three (or more) kobolds in a trenchcoat. Working together, you are trying to pass off as human.&nbsp;</p>
<p>You have a specific thing you're trying to do. You win if you do it. You lose if you get caught being kobolds.</p>
<p>Art by <a href="https://twitter.com/eldritchsmite" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@eldritchsmite</a></p>
<blockquote>"I enjoyed Kobolds so much, it's literally joining my roster as one of my absolute top RPGs to GM." - an incredible person</blockquote>
<p>Want to see it in action? Here's&nbsp;a VOD&nbsp; from The Welcome Inn, who featured Three Kobolds on their monthly series Round Table:&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<div class=""><iframe width="500" height="281" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JbvXF8UkJ58" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div>
<p>Korean translation provided by <a href="https://twitter.com/0_Alucard_" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">0_alucard_</a>!&nbsp;</p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JbvXF8UkJ58" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQyMjI1NDAuanBn/original/f2rnm5.jpg]]






<p>One of you has seen the other from afar, smitten as a schoolchild.You‚Äôve never known a love as deep or as swift as this--as if you‚Äôve known this person forever, actually, as if your love surpasses timelines.</p>
<p>The other of you has noticed unfathomable things in the clear light of day: evidences in dreams that your world has ended before, or signs in the stars that it‚Äôs ending now. In each of them, you have been a savior of that world, one of few who have emerged changed from the ordeal--and somehow, so has this nerd who says they like you.</p>
<p>One of you has asked the other out on a date. Perhaps if you can just happen to chill out tonight and have a nice meal, the sights will stop.&nbsp;</p>
<p>They don‚Äôt.&nbsp;</p>
<p>In fact, on tonight of all nights, they‚Äôre rather insistent.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY1NzQxODAuanBn/original/h%2FLm72.jpg]]






<p>Timeskip is a collaborative <span class="">worldbuilding tool for jumping characters from a previously-established tabletop campaign into the future.</span> Together with your table, imagine new outfits, new jobs, and even new family members that arrive in your characters' lives as time continues to pass. Furthermore, Timeskip allows each player to make choices about significant factions or NPCs in your campaign, altering them as well as their characters.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong>Players</strong>- 2 to 8</p>
<p><strong>Time to Play</strong>- 20 minutes to 3 hours</p>
<p><strong>Materials Required</strong>- Something to write on + writing utensil, or a word processing document. Optional materials include a ten-sided die and a coin. <br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5NzY3MS83NTQ4ODY3LnBuZw==/original/zHvV5Y.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5NzY3MS83NTQ4ODY2LnBuZw==/original/sLyPa%2F.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5NzY3MS83NTQ4ODY1LnBuZw==/original/%2BBA47T.png]]






<p><em>The Elder God awoken after a long slumber, malnourished, and in need of the energy transferred by worship and effigy. As a group of mortals enters its demesne, the artwork and artifacts they carry inspire a plot for this Elder Being to acquire that much-needed energy to survive.</em></p>
<p></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzcxODA3MTMucG5n/original/Btbf%2FD.png" alt="brush stroke divider" width="52%" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<h2>Montega√±o is in crisis!<br>
</h2>
<p>Caught in the tangle of religious and political strife, players are tasked with helping decide the future of&nbsp;Montega√±o. In this system-neutral adventure ‚Äì setting inspired by my Taino ancestors ‚Äì the village of&nbsp;Montega√±o is at risk of missing&nbsp;its annual harvest festival due to the apparent death of its leader and Bohique <em>(priest)</em>, <strong>Pachu</strong>.&nbsp;</p>
<p>This news and subsequent power vacuum&nbsp;set off a chain of events that will change&nbsp;Montega√±o forever.&nbsp; Truths about the harvest god Corakitu, machinations of the recently acknowledged prophet Edwin, and the fate of village exiles&nbsp;Los P√≠caros begin to unravel and the player characters find themselves in the middle of this turmoil.</p>
<p><br></p>
<h3><strong>Features:</strong></h3>
<ul><li>Colorful list of notable residents important to the story</li><li>Encounter Table to help make treks up the mountain unique</li><li>Table of Taino/Puerto Rican inspired&nbsp;names for creating additional NPCs&nbsp;&nbsp;at your table</li><li>List of questions and hooks to alter/customize the experience for replayability</li></ul>
<p></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzcxODA3MTMucG5n/original/Btbf%2FD.png" alt="brush stroke divider" width="52%" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p></p>
<p><em><strong>*Dedication ‚Äì</strong> This project exists as a personal exercise to decolonize my thinking and to actively learn, embrace, and cultivate the historic culture of my ancestry that I've unconsciously pushed aside and ignored for too long.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzcxNzgzMTAucG5n/original/Vfwy9h.png" alt="latinx and hispanic heritage month graphic" width="37%" loading="lazy"><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIxOTE0Ni83MTgxMDU3LnBuZw==/original/njTwDf.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIxOTE0Ni83MTgxMDYwLnBuZw==/original/l%2BeKR1.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTIxOTE0Ni83MTgxMDYzLnBuZw==/original/FaNEVW.png]]






<h1></h1>
<h1>To Sleep in the Treebanks of Ancestors</h1>
<p>This is a game about families.&nbsp;If you do not want to ape at the feeling of telling your family heritage gossip tsismis as if it were fabled archelogized, witty, this is not the game for you. I am pained that i must say this, that we must be so terrified of telling the stories of how we are who we are and how we‚Äôve become but we are here in a hard knocked life and I guess I just invite you to have fun w/ a glory heart open, surgeoned.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Life is hard, the game is, but it doesn‚Äôt mean that we it can‚Äôt be fun.&nbsp;</p>
<p>.<br></p>
<p>Plays 2-3 hours for 1-3 players.</p>
<p>Themes: lyrical-emotional, ancestry, self</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI3NzI3Ny83NDM2NDU2LnBuZw==/original/K7L2A0.png]]






<p>Top of the Table Soccer (TOTTS) is a competitive two-player role-playing game that simulates a game of soccer.&nbsp;</p>
<p>To play this game you need a pencil, eraser and a fist full of six-sided dice.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The mechanics for TOTTS are simple, yet winning a match requires lots of strategy and a dash of luck.</p>
<p>The game is designed to incorporate a role-playing element, which encourages players to weave their own narratives into any given match. The goal of TOTTS is to beat your opponent, but also tell the story of how that happened.</p>
<p>Please rate this game and let me know what you think about it in the comment section below. <br></p>
<p><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTA4MTQxLzU1NTI0MDguanBn/original/i7%2FiOL.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTA4MTQxLzU1NTI0MjAuanBn/original/YVgFuW.jpg]]






<h3> WHAT IS A (HU)MAN?</h3>
<p>...but a miserable pile of animals. <br></p>
<p>You play as one in a stack of creatures in a trench coat. You must perform a variety of normal human tasks without being discovered. These can be going to the mall, participating in a dinner party, working in an office job, or a series of small vignettes throughout a day in the life of a human adult. Anything that a totally normal human adult would be seen doing during totally normal circumstances.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Work together (or against each other in teams) to be the most credible human you can be.</p>
<p>
</p>
<p><em>This game was made as part of the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/one-page-rpg-jam-2020" target="_blank">One-Page RPG Jam 2020</a>. </em><br></p>
<h4></h4>
<h4>An Actual Play of TRHA</h4>
<p>An amazing group of people played a session of the game on stream! Watch it below or <a href="https://youtu.be/iTRmOeU48MU" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">click here</a>.<br></p>
<p></p>
