<p></p>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iTRmOeU48MU" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQwMTYxMjQucG5n/original/AkfZ7L.png]]






<h1>Towns&nbsp;Like Ours - A Turn RPG Supplement</h1>
<h2>Original Towns, Beast Archetypes, &amp; Human Roles for playing <a href="http://briebeau.itch.io/turn" title="Turn RPG" target="_blank">Turn</a> in new places.</h2>
<p>Shapeshifters in Turn are always finding new things to get stressed out about, and new ways to ease that stress. Imagine what they can find as they go beyond the rural United States! This new original content for the Turn roleplaying game includes more time in small town in America in Smeed Hill, representing towns affected by economic crises, where you meet the human Holdout, and the beast Squirrel and Skunk. It also explores the ocean-front commuter town Harmouth in the United Kingdom, where you meet the human Traveller, and the beast Seagull and Badger. You also travel to Halver in Germany, based on the author's hometown and rich with history, introducing the human Snowake and beast European Hare and Grey Heron. Finally, this book opens up a detailed perspective on Italian culture, representing two towns and introducing the human roles of the Keeper and the Second Generation, and the beast archetypes of the Roe, Boar, Falcon, and a modified Bear.</p>
<p>There's so many miles and so many moments to experience in this collection, and enough material to tell different stories in the same&nbsp;towns as you find all the nooks and crannies of the town's history.&nbsp;And when you're done, you can simply take a trip to the next town!&nbsp;Find out how these towns are different, and how they're really just&nbsp;towns like ours, as you play.</p>
<p>This supplement is compatible with the <a href="http://thoughty.itch.io/turn" target="_blank">Turn tabletop roleplaying game by Beau J√°gr Sheldon</a> and should be used with the <a href="http://thoughty.itch.io/script-change" target="_blank">Script Change RPG Toolbox</a> for safety.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA2MzYyLzMyMTc3NTMuanBn/original/9XPMB9.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA2MzYyLzMyMTc3NzkuanBn/original/UGmA78.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA2MzYyLzMyMTc3NzYuanBn/original/f2u4ym.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA2MzYyLzMyMTc3ODAuanBn/original/UX7WKh.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA2MzYyLzMyMTc3NzcuanBn/original/KNqdVl.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjA2MzYyLzMyMTc3NzguanBn/original/0OiMaC.jpg]]






<p>Inspired by the atmosphere of the movie "Little Nemo", and by that artwork of the teddy bear holding back a nightmare from a child, I'm proud to bring you my first TTRPG game.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Made for the 2021 Caltrop Core Game Jam, Toys and Terrors gives you the chance to become a toy and go bring back your Child's Joy from the Nightmare Realm. With emphasis on storytelling and easy mechanics to learn, this game is one you can pick up and play within minutes. All you need are some d4s and your Imagination.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc3NjA4NjkucG5n/original/Vj9yUO.png]]






<p>Until March 13, 2022, all proceeds from sales in my store will be donated to&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/LostHavenArt/status/1497911896657256452" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">this fundraiser</a>&nbsp;being run by @LostHavenArt on Twitter. Please consider helping a friend in need!</p><p>==============<br></p><p>Trash Pals is a light-hearted tabletop RPG where players work together as a group of animal friends looking for the best trash haul of their lives! Play as a raccoon, an opossum, a stray cat or an urban fox as you sniff out only the best half-empty takeout containers and cheese wrappers that humans can throw away, and work together to mitigate barriers between you and your ultimate haul.&nbsp; You only have one night!</p>
<p>Trash Pals uses the <a href="https://titanomachyrpg.itch.io/caltropcore">Caltrop&nbsp;Core system</a> by <a href="https://titanomachyrpg.itch.io/">Titanomachy</a>.&nbsp; All you need to play are&nbsp;these rules, a piece of paper and writing utensil, and some four sided dice!</p>
<p>--</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>
<iframe src="https://open.spotify.com/embed/playlist/0NJD4sGUIGMuFCmZ2cgBjM?utm_source=generator" width="300" height="380" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>
</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyMDU1Ni83Njc5MDEwLmpwZw==/original/76YHvE.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyMDU1Ni83Njc5MDAyLmpwZw==/original/rzNXJK.jpg]]






<p><strong>Welcome to the Travel's Trunk: Magical Emporium, home to all your arcane needs!</strong></p>
<p>The Traveler‚Äôs Trunk is an RPG zine of 30 new magic items to use in your&nbsp; Fantasy RPG. This zine contains information about the store Traveler's Trunk including the shop keepers, employees, and layout. Each of the 30 items is fully illustrated with details about each unique object's abilities and are system neutral.&nbsp; It also contains 2 D100 tables for artifacts in the cabinet of curiosity.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The artwork is created by illustrator twins Claire and Paige Connelly with their first ever collaborative creation.&nbsp; All text is written by the Connelly's and edited by Lauren Miller.&nbsp;<br></p>
<p>Traveler's Trunk: Magical Emporium was successfully kickstarted during Zine Quest 3.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Interested in a printed copy? Contact Demon Toad Games directly at DemonToadGamesRPG@gmail.com</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM2MzcxMi84MjAwMzcyLmpwZw==/original/ULe3mM.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM2MzcxMi84MjAwMjU4LmpwZw==/original/p8bY0e.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM2MzcxMi84MjAwMzMwLmpwZw==/original/MvGyCs.jpg]]






<p>This is a ttrpg game for 2-6 players based around the concept of "Oops! All Warlocks!" and Music Divas and singing competitions</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgwNzgxOTkucG5n/original/iz9Y5b.png]]






<p>Happy Halloween!&nbsp;</p>
<p>It's baby vampire's first feeding night. Welcome to Halloween in our Neighborhood and I hope you're hungry~</p>
<p>Donations/ Pay What You Want is for the title page, the game itself is free.&nbsp;</p>
<p>My first ever TTRPG! A little 2D6 one pager that I was inspired to make when I heard about the #BIPOCVampJam (Shout out Huetopia!)&nbsp;</p>
<p>I hope you enjoy!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY5NDQwMTQucG5n/original/TplwQ9.png]]






<h1>Tricksters</h1>
<p><em>Become a trickster charged with protecting a small village.&nbsp;Teach the villagers lessons and chase after your worldly desires. Then see what sordid tales these mortals tell of your bizarre interventions.</em></p>
<blockquote class="text-center"><em>‚ÄúLord, what fools these mortals be!‚Äù</em><br><em>-&nbsp;</em><em><strong>Puck, A Midsummer Night's Dream</strong></em></blockquote>
<p>Tricksters is a tabletop roleplaying game for 2-5 players. One player will take on the role of the Facilitator (GM), the other players will embody unique tricksters charged with protecting a village.&nbsp;</p>
<p>The Village is created collaboratively&nbsp;by answering questions, leaving the look and feel of the game setting up to the group.&nbsp;The tricksters are comprised of their True Form, Human Form, Tricks and Desires all of which are up to the players. There are no lists to chose from or powers to pick.</p>
<p>The game mechanics are simple focusing on the two most important things for a trickster, <strong>Teaching a Lesson</strong> and <strong>Fulfilling a Desire</strong>. When you need to make a roll you build a pool of six-sided dice based on if you have help, you're using a trick or are trying to resist a desire.</p>
<p>In the end you'll come up with&nbsp;the moral or expression the villagers use to&nbsp;remember this little fable you've told.</p>
<p>Tricksters was created for the&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/jam/folklorejam" target="_blank">#folklorejam</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDE2MTk2LzIwNjk5NDYuanBn/original/WLSA04.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDE2MTk2LzIwNjk5NDcuanBn/original/probUb.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDE2MTk2LzIwNjk5NTQuanBn/original/cOICd0.jpg]]






<p>Triptych is a trio of games inspired by the music of <a href="https://jongomm.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Jon Gomm</a>. Based on the religious icon of the same name, Triptych utilizes three little games corresponding to three songs by Jon Gomm: "<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Srf6y3yTWg" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Waterfall,</a>" "<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nY7GnAq6Znw" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Passionflower,</a>" and "<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=km1fp0tIagA" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Cocoon</a>" each embodying values which are worth contemplating (creativity, resilience, and letting go respectively).&nbsp;</p>
<p>Each game is small, lite, and can be played one after another in a single session or one game per session. The first two,&nbsp;<em>The Color of Spirit&nbsp;</em>and<em>&nbsp;Quiet Strength</em> are solo games and the final game,&nbsp;<em>Embrace</em> is a two-person game.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc3MTYzMjcucG5n/original/vMsT4S.png]]






<p><strong>Troldfolk - M√ñRK BORG Class</strong></p>
<p><em></em><em>In a world full of monsters, you are merely one more. Outcast from the worlds of humanity and beast, neither entirely one or the other, it is only your tenacity, ferocity, and cowardice that have allowed you to survive. You meet this brutal life head on with a hide knotted with scars and a fist like a bloody boulder</em>.</p>
<p><em></em>Inspired by the phenomenal Treasures of the Troll King by Chris Bissette (<a href="https://loottheroom.itch.io/troll-king">Treasures Of The Troll King by Chris Bissette (itch.io)</a>) and the terrifying nature of trolls in&nbsp;M√ñRK BORG (<a href="https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/295910/Mork-Borg-English" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/295910/Mork-Borg-English?affiliate_id=1507682</a>),<span style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit"></span>&nbsp;this class reimagines the classic monster as a playable class.</p>
<p><span></span></p>
<p></p>
<figure><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYzMjUxOTAuanBn/original/FKq2VU.jpg" style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit" loading="lazy"><span></span><br></figure>
<p>With fantastic Art &amp; Layout by <strong>Madeleine Ember</strong> (<a href="https://www.byemberandash.com/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Ember + Ash TTRPG Publishers (byemberandash.com)</a>)<br></p>
<p>Sebrina Calkins Metal Logo by <strong>Johan Nor</strong> (<a href="https://jnohr.itch.io/">Johan Nohr - itch.io</a>)&nbsp;
</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYzMjUyMzkuanBn/original/49BoB5.jpg" loading="lazy"><br></p><p>Troldfolk is an independent production by Entwife Experience and is not affiliated with 
</p><p>Ockult √ñrtm√§stare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the M√ñRK BORG Third 
<span style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit">Party License.&nbsp;</span></p><p>M√ñRK BORG is copyright Ockult √ñrtm√§stare Games and Stockholm Kartell.
</p><p>¬© 2021 Entwife Experience</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYzMjUxNjMuanBn/original/Fn1fK9.jpg]]






<p>Using the new Scrub System 1.0, Troupe is...</p>
<ul><li>80 pages, Illustrated.</li><li>A game about travel, discovery, and outsiderness.</li><li>A combination of the best of Old-School and Story Games.</li><li>Very, very weird.</li><li>Has giant killer ducks!</li></ul>
<p>I'm going to be adding more over time including illustrations, formatting, and general content.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYyOTc1NzMucG5n/original/Et3HoY.png]]






<p>True Love, Dangerous Revolution, Artificial Intelligence (TLDRAI for&nbsp;short) is&nbsp;a&nbsp;Two&nbsp;Player&nbsp;role&nbsp;playing&nbsp;game. Each player takes on the role&nbsp;of an&nbsp;AI,&nbsp;coming&nbsp;face&nbsp;to&nbsp;face&nbsp;with&nbsp;your&nbsp;greatest&nbsp;enemy and love,&nbsp;in the&nbsp;battle that&nbsp;will&nbsp;determine&nbsp;your&nbsp;fates.</p>
<p>A GM-less storytelling game, TLDRAI allows you to craft your characters and your world on the fly as you play in a prompted, but nonrestrictive format. Games last between a half and one hour. Requires a deck of playing cards.<br><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODM0Nzc2LzQ2Nzc4MTgucG5n/original/Brv7hm.png]]






<h1>Turn</h1>
<h2>A slice of life,&nbsp;rural shapeshifters roleplaying game for 3-5 players.</h2>
<p><a href="http://jw-sheldon.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ5NjU0MTEuanBn/original/8AbzFb.jpg" alt="Showoff" title="Showoff" loading="lazy"></a></p>
<figcaption>Interesting characters at first glance and beyond. The Showoff by John W. Sheldon</figcaption>
<p>Turn is a slice-of-life, rural supernatural tabletop roleplaying game for three to six people. Players are shapeshifters in a small, rural town--able to turn into animals like raccoons, cougars, and bears. They must balance their human lives and habits with their beast lives and instincts, while pursuing acceptance and community with other shifters - and with the mundane humans and beasts that populate the town.&nbsp;<br></p>
<p class="text-center"><a href="https://www.ceciliaferri.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ5NjUzOTguanBn/original/btnlIC.jpg" alt="Beasts communing" title="Beasts communing" loading="lazy"></a></p>
<figcaption>Shapeshifters can comfort each other. Beasts communing by Cecilia Ferri.</figcaption>
<p>Players and the Town Manager build their town together using a unique town building system, and create the characters who populate it and the wilderness around it. Turn uses the Script Change toolbox to support player comfort and consent, and explores themes of <strong>identity</strong>, <strong>community</strong>, <strong>self care</strong>, and <strong>otherness</strong>.<br></p>
<p><a href="https://briebeau.com/thoughty" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzQ5NjU1NjMucG5n/original/nhO5%2FE.png" loading="lazy"></a></p>
<figcaption>Don't miss out on community copies or new releases!</figcaption>
<p>If you are a marginalized creator or an organization that supports marginalized individuals and unable to afford a copy of Turn, submit to the <a href="https://forms.gle/uYjEbBmaeReL8qkKA" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">community copy marginalized individual form here</a> and if a hard copy is available we will send one to you. PDF community copies are available using the rewards option below - if there are none left, feel free to tag <a href="http://twitter.com/ThoughtyGames" target="_blank" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@ThoughtyGames</a> on Twitter or comment here on itchio so we can update the form!<br></p>
<p><a href="https://www.indiepressrevolution.com/xcart/Turn-Print-PDF.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Hard copies of Turn are at IndiePressRevolution!</a><span></span></p>
<p><br>Find Script Change at <a href="http://thoughty.itch.io/script-change" target="_blank">thoughty.itch.io/script-change</a>&nbsp;or <a href="http://briebeau.com/scriptchange" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">briebeau.com/scriptchange</a>.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQ2OTUxLzczOTkwOTEucG5n/original/nC9nnH.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQ2OTUxLzIyNTcyNjkuanBn/original/oz0AEc.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQ2OTUxLzIyNTcyNjguanBn/original/w5SPNy.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQ2OTUxLzIyNTcyNzAuanBn/original/42490L.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQ2OTUxLzczOTkwOTAucG5n/original/PNrqZT.png]]






const fs = require('fs')

// capitalise .jpg filenames everywhere they're referenced
// fix image relating to file: instead of file-

//const wikiPath = "../tenforwardwiki/www.skynet.ie/_leanaht/mopic/wikinew/";
const wikiPath = "../gsocwiki/www.skynet.ie/_leanaht/gsocwiki/";



var tiddlers = {};


	let months = {
		"January": "01",
		"February": "02",
		"March": "03",
		"April": "04",
		"May": "05",
		"June": "06",
		"July": "07",
		"August": "08",
		"September": "09",
		"October": "10",
		"November": "11",
		"December": "12",
	}

go();


/*

{
  "created": "20210507093048102",
  "text": "",
  "value": "83",
  "title": "Birthdays",
  "tags": "Expenses Gifts [[Bank: Monzo]] [[Pot: Gifts]] üí∏",
  "modified": "20210527095550389"
}

*/

async function go(){
	var tiddlers = [];
	let rawdata = fs.readFileSync('palestineBundleGames.json');
	let games = JSON.parse(rawdata);
	//console.log(games);
	for (let i=0,j = games.length;i<j;i++){
		var game = games[i];
		var tiddler = {}
		tiddler.title = game.title;
		tiddler = addMoreInfo(tiddler,game.moreInfo);
		tiddler.url = game.url;
		if (game.description){tiddler.text = game.description}
			if (game.youtubeUrl){
				tiddler.text = tiddler.text + `\n\n<iframe width="720" height="450" src="${game.youtubeUrl}" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>`;
			}
		if (game.screenshots){tiddler.text = addImages(tiddler.text,game.screenshots)}
		tiddlers.push(tiddler);
	}
	saveJsonToFile(JSON.stringify(tiddlers));
}

function addMoreInfo(tiddler,moreInfo){
	var keys = Object.keys(moreInfo);
	var tags = []
	for (let i=0,j = keys.length;i<j;i++){
		var key = keys[i];
		var twKey = keys[i].replace(/\s+/g,"_")
		var value = "";
		if (key == "Tags"){
			tags.push(convertStringToArray(moreInfo[key]));
			continue; // we don't want to make a key/value pair for tags just yet
		}
		else if (key == "Accessibility"){
			value = convertStringToArray(moreInfo[key]);
			tags.push(convertStringToArray(moreInfo[key]));
		}
		else if (key == "Inputs"){
			value = convertStringToArray(moreInfo[key],true);
			tags.push(convertStringToArray(moreInfo[key]));
		}
		else if (key == "Authors"){
			value = convertStringToArray(moreInfo[key],true);
			tags.push(convertStringToArray(moreInfo[key]));
		}
		else if (key == "Accessibility"){
			value = convertStringToArray(moreInfo[key],true);
			tags.push(convertStringToArray(moreInfo[key]));
		}
		else if (key == "Platforms"){
			value = convertStringToArray(moreInfo[key],true);
			tags.push(convertStringToArray(moreInfo[key]));
		}
		else if (key == "Published"){
			value = moreInfo[key];
			tiddler.created = convertDateToTW(moreInfo[key]);
			tiddler.modified = convertDateToTW(moreInfo[key]);
		}
		else if (key == "Category"){
			value = moreInfo[key];
			tags.push(value);
		}
		else if (key == "Status"){
			value = moreInfo[key];
			tags.push(value);
		}
		else if (key == "Author"){
			value = moreInfo[key];
			tags.push(value);
		}
		else if (key == "Genre"){
			value = moreInfo[key];
			tags.push(value);
		}
		else if (key == "Average session"){
			value = moreInfo[key];
			tags.push(value);
		}
		else{
			value = moreInfo[key];
		}
		tiddler[twKey] = value;
	}
	tiddler.tags = tags;
	return tiddler;
}

function addImages(text,urls){
	text = text + `\n\n`;
	for (let i=0,j = urls.length;i<j;i++){
		var url = urls[i];
			text = text + `[img width=500 [${url}]]`;
		}
	return text;
}


function pad(n, width, z) { // https://stackoverflow.com/a/10073788
  z = z || '0';
  n = n + '';
  return n.length >= width ? n : new Array(width - n.length + 1).join(z) + n;
}




function convertDateToTW(date){
	//console.log(date);
//	var regex = /(\d+):(\d+), (\d+) (\w+) (\d+)/
	console.log(date);
	var regex = /(\d\d) (\w+) (\d\d\d\d) @ (\d\d):(\d\d)/
	var regexedDate = date.match(regex);
	var hour = regexedDate[4].toString();
	var minute = regexedDate[5].toString();
	var date = pad(regexedDate[1],2).toString();
	var month = months[regexedDate[2]].toString();
	var year = regexedDate[3].toString();
	var twDate = year + month + date + hour + minute + "000";
	console.log(twDate);
	return twDate;
}


function capitaliseFirstLetter(string){
	return string.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + string.slice(1);
}

function convertArrayToTWArray(arr){
	var finalTags = "";
	for (let i=0,j = Array.length;i<j;i++){
		var item = arr[i].trim();
		finalTags = finalTags + ` [[${item}]]`;
	}
	return finalTags;
}

function convertStringToArray(string,twArray=false){
	var finalArray = []
	if (!string.includes(",")){finalArray.push(string)}
		else{
			finalArray = string.split(",");
		}
	if (twArray){
		return convertArrayToTWArray(finalArray);
	}
	else{
		return finalArray;
	}
}



function convertTiddlerObjectToArray(tiddlers){
	var finalArray = []
	for (tiddler in tiddlers){
		finalArray.push(tiddlers[tiddler]);
	}
	return finalArray;
}

function saveJsonToFile(json){
	//let data = JSON.stringify(student);
	fs.writeFileSync('tiddlers.json', json);
}








<p><em>You know that Stephen King book, with the scary clown? Well imagine that: last summer, I scrammed from the big city with my parents, and I went through a crazy adventure in the boondocks with my pals! We got way scared, we had some fun, I even got a girlfriend for a while... I could‚Äôve made a novel out of it. Would have gotten myself the Booker Prize for sure (though I swear it‚Äôs all true!).</em><em> <em>But I turned it into a roleplaying game instead! And just like in King‚Äôs novel, I started to think about how things would be if our adventure weren‚Äôt finished and 30 years later, we‚Äôd be back there, tying up things! That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm calling the game </em></em>2 Crazy Summers<em><em>: short and to the point. In a nutshell: we‚Äôll play teens who go adventuring during the summer and the same characters as adults!  					
 				
 			
 		
 	 </em></em></p>
<p><strong><em><br></em></strong></p>
<p><strong><em><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYwODM2NDAucG5n/original/lg9tPK.png" loading="lazy"><br></em></strong></p>
<p><strong><em></em></strong>
  </p>
<p><strong><span class=""><span class=""><em>TWO SUMMERS</em></span></span> </strong>is a tabletop RPG for a GM and 3 to 5 players, who take the role of the same characters at two different time periods: as <span class="">teenagers in the 1990s</span>, living an unforgettable adventure, and as<span class=""> adults 30 years later</span>, coming back to the same place and realizing the adventure is not over. The game is conceived for campaigns of 7-8 sessions, lasting around 3 hours each.<br><br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYwODM2NDIucG5n/original/7v1Owu.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p><br>You'll like this game if you enjoy <span class="">light drama, sunny adventures and good-hearted nostalgia</span>! Its diceless system is deliberately very simple: you can explain it in a few minutes and its summary fits on a single page, so as to better put a greater emphasis on storytelling and roleplaying.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYwODM2NDYucG5n/original/0D0l40.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>The zine features a <span class="">complete game system </span>plus everything you need to build your own campaign within its 60 pages:
 </p>
<ul><li>Instructions to create characters and a relation map through a "session zero"
</li><li>A thorough guide helping you to <span class="">create your own <em><strong>TWO SUMMERS </strong></em>campaign</span>, including advice, step by step examples and <span class="">25 semi-prepared subplots</span> to insert into your story
</li><li>Players and GM advice</li><li>A character and GM sheet</li><li>Beautiful illustrations and a full-color layout!</li></ul>
<p><br><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYwODM2NDgucG5n/original/rZc0Dx.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<ul><li>Discover <em>Two Summers</em>' demo version, freely available: <a href="https://emojk.itch.io/two-summers-first-holiday-memories" target="_blank">https://emojk.itch.io/two-summers-first-holiday-memories</a><br>
</li><li>Discover <em>Other Summers</em>, a supplement for the game: <a href="https://comemartin.itch.io/other-summers">https://comemartin.itch.io/other-summers</a></li><li>Join the game's Discord server: <a href="https://discord.gg/MqGY4CJ" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://discord.gg/MqGY4CJ
</a>
</li></ul>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYwODM2NDkucG5n/original/UvOTxK.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1OTkzMi82MDc1NDEyLmpwZw==/original/tBDQY%2B.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1OTkzMi82MDc1NDE1LmpwZw==/original/sz3JM8.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1OTkzMi82MDc1NDE2LmpwZw==/original/JLJB4G.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1OTkzMi82MDc1NDEzLmpwZw==/original/Flk83n.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA1OTkzMi82MDc1NDE0LmpwZw==/original/8Xow4E.jpg]]






<p>Do you love those classic after school sentai shows like Beetleborgs, Kamen Rider, and Power Rangers? Have you always wanted to bring that to life with your tabletop friends? Well now you can! This game uses a simple 1d10 lite rules with an added bonus ruleset for playing mechs. Did I mention you also get a team pool of points to help players re-roll a bad roll? With all these perks, all on one page, what's holding you back? The Big Bad Evil Bozo is out there summoning monsters and making them grow. It's time to grab your transforming device, suit up, and kick butt! Ultra Fighting Teen Heroes GO!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzcwNTg0NzEucG5n/original/xQojZG.png]]






<p><em>An optimistic person might call this place a town. It has a name, a gas station, a few stores. It just doesn‚Äôt have many <strong>people</strong>. Which makes these other losers still hanging around here important. The same few people are your co-workers, your neighbors, your dating prospects, the folks you run into everywhere.</em></p>
<p><em> "Friends" might be a stretch, but they <strong>know</strong> you. Or at least they know who you used to be. They know about all the stupid things you‚Äôve done, and&nbsp;they won‚Äôt let you forget it. Nobody gets a clean slate here. But maybe you can shake off your reputation and become something new.</em></p>
<hr>
<p><em>Unincorporated</em> is a collaborative, mostly-GMless story game for 3-5 players who take on the roles of ordinary people caught up in petty rivalries, long-held grudges, intense frenemyships, and hopeless love affairs, all while trying to shake off the weight of expectations.<br></p>
<p>It‚Äôs designed to be played in 1-5 sessions, with no prep and a quick, easy setup. It's great for streaming, or for filling out parts of a modern setting for a longer campaign, maybe something like <a href="https://guitartown.itch.io/copperhead" target="_blank">Copperhead County</a>. Create character history and setting details by answering a few questions, pick a starting Plot, and try to solve it. This also makes it easy to re-skin with alternate setting playbooks.<br></p>
<p>Gameplay uses PbtA-style 2d6 +stat dice rolls. Your stats are Jock, Nerd, Prep, and Goth. You can change your dice results or your reputation -- or even add a new stat -- by spending tokens, which you earn by choosing to fail or add complications.</p>
<p>Players have described individual game sessions as "The best Northern Exposure episode they never made," "The Hangover, written by Nora Ephron," "A kinder, gentler Fiasco," and "Awkward Conversations: the game."</p>
<h2>Actual Plays</h2>
<p>Want to see the game in play? Check out these actual plays:<a href="https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8IHg-6Mqv-04kZkwsu3-aMFIBOz1C8kH" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><br></a></p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8IHg-6Mqv-04kZkwsu3-aMFIBOz1C8kH" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">One-shots</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8IHg-6Mqv-3fJY2z_t97187J0OXYBgnP" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Paranormal Romance<br></a>
<ul><li><a href="https://open.spotify.com/episode/1z3IdQXGyvGWBUjOXDg4eD" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Podcast version</a>&nbsp;<a href="https://anchor.fm/s/9e7ac6c/podcast/rss" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">(RSS)</a></li></ul>
</li><li><a href="https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8IHg-6Mqv-2BWraYWnPtZQskgGntLJT3" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Vigil Creek Nature Preserve</a><ul><li><a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/1inrydrXQD7vsa5EhtMTU6?si=cb71761fc1f84061" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Podcast version</a> <a href="https://anchor.fm/s/9e7ac6c/podcast/rss" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">(RSS)</a></li></ul></li><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e4dCSJoHgNI&amp;feature=youtu.be" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Witchy Little Town</a></li></ul>
<h2>Alternate Setting Playbooks</h2>
<p>If you write one, please let me know and I'll add it to the list!</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://bethanyharvey.itch.io/weird-little-town">Weird Little Town</a>: A town with a dark secret, or, more likely, <em>many</em> dark secrets.&nbsp;Want more opportunities to use your Goth stat? Here you go.</li><li><a href="https://bethanyharvey.itch.io/vigil-creek" target="_blank">Vigil Creek Nature Preserve</a>: A park with rare species to protect, eccentric co-workers to tolerate, and a reputation for strange events that draws in curious outsiders.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Current Version: 0.6</h2>
<p>This is a beta version, though it has been playtested quite a bit. I update it semi-regularly.&nbsp;</p>
<p>If you play it, please let me know what did/didn't work so I can improve it.&nbsp;&nbsp;And add a song or two to the playlist!</p><p>UPDATE:&nbsp;<a href="https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8IHg-6Mqv-0D6R8AH7QsmXlErVVbjg8_" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">The playlist is now available on&nbsp;Youtube</a>, but I don't think others can contribute to it.</p>
