[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDU2Nzg2LzUwOTE3MDkucG5n/original/MhbB09.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDU2Nzg2LzM3NDgxNzYucG5n/original/6Vo4pO.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDU2Nzg2LzI4MjQwOTYucG5n/original/czcC9v.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDU2Nzg2LzM3NDgxNjcucG5n/original/C9WtOR.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDU2Nzg2LzM3NDgxNjYucG5n/original/eYNoAy.png]]






<p>In this game, patterned after camp games like Mafia and Werewolf, players take the roles of union leaders, bosses, and scabs, and work to unionize their shop, or stop the same. Playable over the course of 45 minutes to an hour, this game requires index cards, a deck of playing cards, and some pencils.&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM3NTk2NjQucG5n/original/3TuOuu.png]]






<h1>Unreality/Strictness</h1>
<h2>A Six Elements Storytelling Game for 1-2 Players</h2>
<p>by Edaureen Muhamad Nor</p>
<p><em>In This dimension, you are a prisoner to the rules that dictate your life.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p><em>In That dimension, you are a nigh-omnipotent being facing rebellion.&nbsp;</em></p>
<p><em>When you find a way to connect these two selves, you tap into powers that could&nbsp;solve all your problems... or leave you even worse than where you started.</em><br></p>
<p>Unreality/Strictness is a role-playing game where you create a character who exists as two connected entities in separate dimensions. In This dimension, you are ruled by Strictness. In That dimension, you rule by Unreality. When you discover your connection, you realize that you can channel the plentiful Strictness or Unreality of the other dimension to help you either bind obstacles or warp them to your will.<br></p>
<p>You may play this as a solo journaling game with one person playing both entities, or assign one entity to each of two players. You will need a six-sided die (d6) or online equivalent to play, as well as a way to keep score. You may also want a method to document your game, especially if playing solo.</p>
<p> This is the single-page version of Unreality/Strictness, created for the&nbsp;<a href="https://itch.io/jam/tiny-tome-jam" target="_blank">Tiny Tome Single-Page RPG Jam</a>.&nbsp; While this was originally designed as a single-page game, the idea has grown in my head to write far more for it, including a Ruled By/Rule SRD. Expect a full length version in Summer 2022!</p>
<p>Unreality/Strictness was inspired by the&nbsp;<a href="https://twostats.neocities.org/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Two Stats</a>&nbsp;generator created by James Chip.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMxMDM2NC83ODM5OTQ3LnBuZw==/original/EaM8tL.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMxMDM2NC83ODM5OTQ4LnBuZw==/original/fzd%2BMn.png]]






<p>A short, roleplay intensive TTRPG.&nbsp; This is a fluffy game with intense roleplay. I would say this is an introspective psychological thriller/horror.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgyNjYzNTMucG5n/original/goEfqJ.png]]






<p>Vade Arcanum provides mechanical scaffolding to support role-playing when a player decides that their PC wants to&nbsp;develop a new spell in game. It was initially developed and playtested during 2020, and released on my patreon in early 2021.</p>
<p>This edition includes a sample playthrough, a dozen new spells, a new magic-item, and two new monsters (all stats are for OSRIC.)</p>
<p>According to <a href="https://twitter.com/BlackDragonCan" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@BlackDragonGames</a>, a professional DM in Canada, "This is an oft ignored area of the game, I warmly recommend this supplement!"</p>
<p>Sales of this game will help fund additional development (editing, art, and expansion.)<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTg1MjMxLzU2MDE2NzkuanBn/original/ewlbE%2B.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTg1MjMxLzU2MDE2NDguanBn/original/a9qu4g.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTg1MjMxLzU2MDE2NDkuanBn/original/nAgCP%2F.jpg]]






<p><span class="">Village Witch is a solo journaling game about a witch finding a home.</span><span></span></p>
<p><span class="">You‚Äôve completed your training and are ready to become a village witch. You‚Äôve been sent by the order to find a village to work in and have a year to find the place you want to make your life.</span></p>
<p><span class="">To play, you need one 6-sided die, a standard deck of cards or a deck of tarot cards, and a way to record your story.</span> Answer questions and use the given prompts corresponding with the cards to craft your story.</p>
<p>Now includes a two player option, as well as separate files of the card tables if you would prefer to use those instead of scrolling up and down in the document.</p>
<p>If you'd like a character building supplement for your witch, my <a href="https://eliotsilvarian.itch.io/build-a-witch" target="_blank">Build a Witch</a>&nbsp;pack has prompts and adoptable characters.</p>
<p><span class="">As a supplement to Village Witch, check out the postcard game <a href="https://eliotsilvarian.itch.io/village-witch-post" target="_blank">Village Witch Post</a>! Write a letter from your character to a friend (real or fictional) telling them about your experience, using the prompts on the front to craft your letter. It can be a standalone mini game or a supplement to this one. If you use it in conjunction with your Village Witch experience, you can write letters for each season as you progress through your year, sharing your journey with your friend, or once you‚Äôve settled into your more permanent village home.</span></p>
<p>Thanks to a request in the comments, I created a <a href="https://villagewitch.dreamwidth.org/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Dreamwidth community</a> for people to share their stories and playthroughs of Village Witch! I'm so excited to get to read people's stories and it's amazing to see all your creations. Feel free to join and share!</p>
<p>You can also order a Village Witch tea blend created in collaboration with Friday Tea <a href="https://www.fridaytea.com/products/village-witch?ref=eliotsilvarian" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a>! (affiliate link)</p>
<p>For every copy bought, a community copy will be added. If you enjoy this game, I&nbsp;would love to hear about it! You can drop a review or tag me on Twitter <a href="https://twitter.com/EliotSilvarian" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@eliotsilvarian</a>.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzU5MTY3Lzc0OTY2NzkucG5n/original/Op%2FY3h.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzU5MTY3Lzc0OTcxNDEucG5n/original/cT9St8.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzU5MTY3Lzc0OTcxNDMucG5n/original/KIIMcG.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzU5MTY3Lzc0OTcxNDUucG5n/original/eB2Tub.png]]






<h2><span class=""><span class=""></span></span><span class=""><span class="">Vis-a-visage is a narrative combat TTRPG for 2 players inspired by cinematic rivalries. Players create characters in secret, their goals centered around each other's failure and play starts when they wake after a strange surgical procedure that has swapped their faces! Now alone and unrecognizable to their networks and loved ones, they must battle forward towards their goals, using unfamiliar resources and strange new friends.<br></span></span></h2>
<h2><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU0NTA0MDguanBn/original/KmdvCG.jpg" loading="lazy"><span class=""><span class=""></span></span><br><span class=""><span class=""></span></span></h2>
<p>The central mechanic in vis-a-visage is the interplay between the character sheet and the dice pools. The character sheet functions as a list of usable resources that players can &nbsp;invoke to access more dice for their pools. Character creation in vis-a-visage is unique in that it allows players to build the resources (in the form of narrative prompts) that their opponents will be playing with. Players then have to craft narratives around the use of these tools and networks that were dictated by their opponents. The dice pool mechanic pits players against each other in alternating turns as Instigators and Deterrents - &nbsp;Instigators attempting to progress towards their goals and Deterrents trying to thwart these attempts, occasionally turning the tides in their favour along the way. The game uses 2 clocks to track character goals and 1 to track the condition of the swapped faces. When a player has completed their goal, the final round of play begins, answering the most important question of vis-a-visage - will you get your face back?!</p>
<h4>2 Players - GMless - 1-3 Hours - zero-prep<span class=""><span class=""></span></span></h4>
<p>Included are rules for adapting play to online messaging platforms like twitter! It's a hoot! <br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU0NTA0MDIuanBn/original/4sXRgn.jpg" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<h1><span class=""><span class=""><a href="https://snaxwell.bigcartel.com/product/vis-a-visage-preorder" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><strong>Physical Copies available&nbsp; here!</strong></a><br></span></span></h1>
<h3><span class=""></span></h3>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIwNjkxLzUzNzkxMDguanBn/original/kuwd0T.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIwNjkxLzUzNzkxMDkuanBn/original/o3zn%2Bs.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTIwNjkxLzUzNzkxMTEuanBn/original/vYt9Hx.jpg]]






<p>Long ago, we left behind our natural home. Now, we traverse  the heavens, traversing an endless and enigmatic void never meant for us. All we knew for all our existance - the sun, the horizon, even our natural gravity - is long behind us. It is time we become more like the void that is our home or be lost like a stranger in the dark.<br></p>
<p>To be Voidtouched is to understand that the grand mysteries of space require more than mundane, rational thinking. If the unexplained is commonplace, then perhaps you need new explanations.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc5NzYzNzEucG5n/original/cGiXTN.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>The Voidtouched is a 1e-compatible player class for the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror RPG loosely inspired by one of the 19 teams of enemy combatants in the upcoming battle royale hexcrawl <a href="https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/bloodfields/the-bloodfields-at-blackstar-station" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">The Bloodfields at Blackstar Station</a> - Coming to Kickstarter on February 1st!</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc5NzYzNjcucG5n/original/55r9Sn.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>Written by <a href="https://christiansorrell.itch.io/">Christian Sorrell</a><br>Art by <a href="https://www.patreon.com/evlynmoreau" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Evlyn Moreau</a><br>Graphics by <a href="https://lonearchivist.itch.io/">Lone Archivist</a></p>
<p>This product is based on the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror Role Playing Game, published by Tuesday Knight Games. This product is published under license. Mothership RPG is a trademark of Tuesday Knight Games. All rights reserved. For additional information, visit <a href="http://www.tuesdayknightgames.com" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">www.tuesdayknightgames.com</a> or contact contact@tuesdayknightgames.com.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM2OTg2NS83OTc3MTg0LnBuZw==/original/aIW0uA.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM2OTg2NS83OTc3MTg1LnBuZw==/original/N46JaG.png]]






<p>Wander the Dungeon is a dungeon crawl TTRPG inspired by video games like Dragon Quest, Deltarune, and Loop Hero for up to 3 Players and 1 Master of the Dungeon.</p>
<p>Using a somewhat crunchy version of <a href="https://twitter.com/titanomachyRPG" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">titanomachyRPG</a>'s <a href="https://titanomachyrpg.itch.io/caltropcore">Caltrop Core</a>, you play as Wandering Heroes traveling through a mysterious and ever-changing Dungeon. Rest at Campfires, Traverse the Dungeon, and Encounter Monsters in turn-based combat.</p>
<p>Heroes be warned! The Dungeon and its inhabitants are unpredictable and may send you to an early grave... but that does not mark the end of your adventure! Discover hidden secrets about the mystery of the Dungeon, including Player&nbsp;options beyond death!</p>
<p>Pick Your Class,&nbsp;Collect Treasure, Survive the Night, Slay or Befriend Monsters, Discover or Lose Yourself, and of course, Wander the Dungeon.</p>
<p>Wander the Dungeon is currently&nbsp;25 Pages</p>
<p>Please excuse the formatting! I will be revising,&nbsp; rearranging, adding art, and player sheets in the near future!</p>
<p>This game was made for the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/caltrop-jam">Caltrop Core Game Jam</a>&nbsp;by&nbsp;<a href="https://titanomachyrpg.itch.io/">titanomachyRPG</a>!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzc0OS83Nzg0NjczLmpwZw==/original/Kg0JMm.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzc0OS83Nzg0Njg4LmpwZw==/original/hsAD6g.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMzNzc0OS83Nzg0Njc1LmpwZw==/original/4fA12G.jpg]]






<p class="text-justify">Wanderhome is a pastoral fantasy role-playing game about traveling animal-folk, the world they inhabit, and the way the seasons change. It is a game filled with grassy fields, mossy shrines, herds of chubby bumblebees, opossums in sundresses, salamanders with suspenders, starry night skies, and the most beautiful sunsets you can imagine.<br></p>
<p class="text-justify">You might be a tamarin who dances with small and forgotten gods, a leporine mail carrier who relies on moths to get packages where they belong, a little lizard with a big heart and a mysterious past, or a near-endless number of other thrilling  possibilities. No matter what, we‚Äôre always travelers‚Äîanimal-folk who go from village to village and get to see the length and breadth of all the world of H√¶th. The seasons will change as we play, and we will change with them. 
</p>
<figure><a href="https://possumcreekgames.com/wanderhome" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU0NzA1NTYucG5n/original/l3WWfm.png" alt="Pick up a physical copy of Wanderhome here." title="Pick up a physical copy of Wanderhome here." loading="lazy"></a></figure>
<p><em><a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU0NzA1OTYucG5n/original/x93D6I.png" alt="Softcovers and hardcovers are both available!" title="Softcovers and hardcovers are both available!" loading="lazy"></a></em></p>
<figcaption><em>Softcovers and hardcovers are both available!</em></figcaption>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"></a></p>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"></a></p>
<h1>The TTRPG</h1>
<p class="text-justify"><em>Wanderhome&nbsp;</em>makes use of a unique game system inspired by the&nbsp;<em>No Dice, No Masters&nbsp;</em>engine, developed by Avery Alder and Benjamin Rosenbaum for&nbsp;<em>Dream Askew</em>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<em>Dream Apart</em>. Each player will make a character with the help of one of fifteen possible playbooks, making choices about their personality, animal-form, look, and passions. Each of these playbooks give you a radically different approach both to navigating the setting and growing over time. From the carefree Ragamuffin to the introverted Poet, from the Guardian and their young ward to the lonely Exile, from the cheerful Dancer to the moody Veteran, there is plenty of space in&nbsp;<em>Wanderhome</em>&nbsp;to imagine every possible world that lives in your heart.
</p>
<p class="text-justify">Once you‚Äôve created your character, you and your fellow travelers guide them through the dreamlike pastoral world of H√¶th. There are no dice in&nbsp;<em>Wanderhome.</em>&nbsp;Instead, you can inconvenience yourself or step outside your comfort zone in order to get tokens, and then turn around and spend those tokens to tackle larger problems and help make the world a better, kinder space.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU1Nzk0NjAucG5n/original/OD85Ux.png" alt="Parade of Small &amp; Forgotten Gods by Jennie Lindberg" title="Parade of Small &amp; Forgotten Gods by Jennie Lindberg" loading="lazy"></p>
<figcaption><br></figcaption>
<p class="text-justify"><em>Wanderhome</em>&nbsp;is structured with an emphasis on safety and care, built on my own work designing safety mechanics and constructing alternate safety approaches beyond the industry standards. It features a bespoke set of safety mechanics built around empowering players to guide the story however they want, which are used consistently throughout the game. It is also designed to collaboratively set the tone and articulate a version of H√¶th that's perfect for your group.&nbsp;<br></p>
<p class="text-justify"><em>Wanderhome&nbsp;</em>is a GM-agnostic game‚Äìwhile you can play with a Guide facilitating the world, you can also approach it without anyone in charge, where everyone takes equal part in the collaborative conversation. And while you can play&nbsp;<em>Wanderhome&nbsp;</em>in as little as 3-4 hours, the longer you stay with&nbsp;<em>Wanderhome&nbsp;</em>the more the world will grow with you. The months will pass over time and as each season concludes you‚Äôll get to make new choices about your character, advancing them in new directions and helping them grow in ways you didn‚Äôt think was possible. If you play long enough, eventually your characters will retire or grow apart, and the journey will continue with brand-new travelers and a vast world ahead of you.
</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzUzOTA1NjQuanBn/original/IaMjD9.jpg" alt="Among The Hills by Nadhir Nor" title="Among The Hills by Nadhir Nor" loading="lazy"></p>
<figcaption><br></figcaption>
<h1>The World of H√¶th</h1>
<p class="text-justify"><em>Wanderhome&nbsp;</em>is set in the wholly original fantasy world of H√¶th, inspired by the works of Brian Jacques, Tove Jansson, and Hayao Miyazaki. The game hints at and builds a mythological language around forces like the bitter King of the Floating Mountain, the Lily Rebellion, the Slobbering God and the blade that killed her, and the fall of the great dragons of old, but refuses to elaborate or define them‚Äîleaving that exercise to the players through the journey itself. Instead,&nbsp;<em>Wanderhome&nbsp;</em>is focused on the lives of ordinary people, and the world that exists for farmers, merchants, and crafts-folk.
</p>
<p class="text-justify"><em>Wanderhome&nbsp;</em>is a world filled with animal-folk and their buggy livestock. Unlike many worlds with animal-folk, there is no morality or judgement ascribed to the various animals of H√¶th‚Äîa snake is just as capable of being a kindly farmer as a rabbit, and you can‚Äôt assume much about someone based on what animal they are. You might find a fluffy shepherd with a herd of bumblebees, a shrewish merchant riding a stag beetle the size of a house, a lonely fox riding a grasshopper from place to place, or a praying mantis that hangs out in a gecko‚Äôs pocket.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU1Nzk0NjMucG5n/original/5ZVN7r.png" alt="Candlefeast by L Henderson and Jo Thierolf" title="Candlefeast by L Henderson and Jo Thierolf" loading="lazy"></p>
<figcaption><br></figcaption>
<h1>Testimonials</h1>
<p><a href="https://www.polygon.com/reviews/22387450/wanderhome-rpg-tabletop-game-review" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU2OTA1NDYucG5n/original/NPrBm9.png" alt="Polygon Recommends" title="Polygon Recommends" loading="lazy"></a></p>
<figcaption>Polygon Recommends</figcaption>
<blockquote>‚ÄúI grew up reading Redwall. The opening pages were full of lavish descriptions of playful merriment. I loved those pages. But they always gave way to chapters about war, pillaging, and slaughter. <em>Wanderhome</em> asks: what if the meadow gets to stay safe and happy this time? What if those opening pages last forever?‚Äù</blockquote>
<p>‚Äî Avery Alder, <em>Buried Without Ceremony</em></p>
<blockquote>"After reading <em>Sleepaway</em>, I was excited to see what Jay could do with <em>Wanderhome</em> - and I was right to be excited. What's contained within this book is a keenly-observed world of miniature interlocking details and a thousand invitations to go and explore inside it; it is a patchwork clockwork machine that paints a universe in strokes both broad and minute, and gives authority to the player to establish their own foothold within. The world of <em>Wanderhome</em> is hard, but not grim; kind, but not saccharine; unreal, but not plastic."</blockquote>
<p>‚Äî Grant Howitt,&nbsp;<em>Rowan, Rook and Decard</em></p>
<blockquote>Playing <em>Wanderhome</em> feels like taking a beautiful trip with friends ‚Äî through different kinds of game mechanics, different kinds of playstyles, different emotional experiences. I find myself coming back to the stories we told and the characters we met in Wanderhome again and again."</blockquote>
<p>&nbsp;‚Äî Jeff Stormer, <em>Party Of One</em></p><blockquote>‚ÄúPlaying <em>Wanderhome</em> is an experience of explorative worldbuilding where the players can delight as much as their characters do at stunning vistas, changing seasons, lost gods, or a good cheese scone all found in the company of good friends. No game has made me want to give up oneshots and settle down into a campaign again as much as <em>Wanderhome</em>.‚Äù&nbsp;</blockquote><p>&nbsp;‚Äî Tony Vasinda, <i>Plus One Exp</i></p>
<blockquote>‚ÄúTruly remarkable.‚Äù<br></blockquote>
<p>‚Äî Brennan Lee Mulligan, <em>Dimension 20</em>
</p>
<h1>3rd Party Links</h1>
<p><strong><em>Third Party License Coming Soon!</em></strong></p>
<p><a href="https://pastebin.com/wpjRXF0g" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Wanderhome Sheets for Role</a> by <a href="https://twitter.com/peri_dotted" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@peri_dotted</a><strong></strong></p>
<h1 class="text-justify">Contained Within</h1>
<p>There are a fair few files contained within this page.</p>
<ul><li>The full PDF version of <em>Wanderhome</em>, at almost 300 pages and with illustrations by more than a dozen artists. This PDF was checked for accessibility by a hired consultant, and features alt-text for images, a fully-threaded text, and more.</li><li>A printer-friendly / colorblind-friendly version of <em>Wanderhome</em>, in black and white and with full page illustrations removed.</li><li>An insectophobe-friendly version of&nbsp;<em>Wanderhome,&nbsp;</em>with all depictions of bugs in the art either censored or removed.</li><li>A set of blank form-fillable sheets for playbooks, traits, natures, and seasons, under the DEMO section</li></ul>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin"></a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTY0MTA3LzU1ODQ2OTQucG5n/original/IVas4u.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTY0MTA3LzU1Nzg1ODYucG5n/original/aNcY5f.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTY0MTA3LzU1MDI1MjAucG5n/original/8Hb0rq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTY0MTA3LzU1MDI1MDUucG5n/original/OZ5W6k.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTY0MTA3LzU1MDM0NDUucG5n/original/plS5tY.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTY0MTA3LzU1Nzg1ODUucG5n/original/hZPxvu.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTY0MTA3LzU1Nzk0NTQucG5n/original/ox6nUt.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTY0MTA3LzU1MDI1MDYucG5n/original/aGjZBn.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvOTY0MTA3LzU1Nzk0NTUucG5n/original/58fsui.png]]






<p><span class=""><strong>Wandering Dreams</strong></span><strong> </strong>is an adventure RPG zine about exploring a <span class="">Soulsborne </span>and <span class="">Lovecraft </span>inspired world full of strange and unique locations, beings, and things that are waiting for discovery by the player. It is designed for solo play and uses custom rules for combat and encounters. Using a deck of standard playing cards and a 6 sided die (d6) the player sets off on a story telling experience into the world of the dream.</p>
<p>During your adventure you can observe, approach, fight, and run from the denizens of this world by your choice. Explore the world using the card pulls and dice for prompts as well as information on what you are dealing with. A journal is highly recommended to track where you have been, what you have seen, and how your character is doing.</p>
<figure><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM1OTA0NzMucG5n/original/nrCPz8.png" loading="lazy"><br><br></figure>
<p>The player explores the world using the zine, a deck of standard cards (jokers removed), their favourite d6 (6-sided die), a journal (or paper), plus a writing instrument (pen, pencil, quill and ink, etc.). The deck is separated into suits to represent different elements in the story that will be drawn as you progress.&nbsp;</p>
<p>‚ô† SPADES ‚ô†: Locations (here, there, anywhere)</p>
<p>‚ô• HEARTS ‚ô•: Events (happens location to location or in a location)</p>
<p>‚ô¶ DIAMONDS ‚ô¶: Things (weapons, attire, tools, antiquities, etc.)</p>
<p>‚ô£ CLUBS ‚ô£: Beings (bad, neutral, people, beasts, the unknown)</p>
<p>After drawing a card &nbsp;the player will roll their D6 and find the card suit, value, and rolled result in the tables provided inside the zine. The zine provides alternative play styles for players who want to challenge themselves further with story writing and character development.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM1OTA1MDQucG5n/original/cfIwLV.png" loading="lazy"></p>
<p>Character creation has been streamlined to a die roll before starting the adventure. Each character will have predetermined stats, starting equipment, and a small backstory prompt for the player to work with.&nbsp;</p>
<p>A total of 6 character archetypes will be included in the zine to start with templates for additional custom characters as the player sees fit.</p>
<p>Characters can be built in the game and transferred over to other game engines. <span class="">Wandering Dreams</span> can provide you a template for backstory creation and character development.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM1OTA1MDgucG5n/original/xI7vjF.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>Combat is designed to use as few cards as possible and your trusty D6. The player always attacks first and can vanquish many small Beings of the world in one round to keep the story moving forward and remove the need for constant die rolls to get through an encounter.</p>
<p>Alternatively the Player can choose to Escape and avoid the fight all together if looking for more of a exploration style to play or if you encounter a Being that is far beyond your abilities or causes too much fear.</p>
<p>Encounters can be lucrative to find new Things of interest inside the world of <span class="">Wandering</span> <span class="">Dreams</span> but can also be deadly and ultimately lead to...</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM1OTA1MTEucG5n/original/j3SeEK.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>The game ends when the player chooses to awaken from the dream world by death, achieving their end purpose, or choosing to awaken from the dream.&nbsp;</p>
<p>Finding a suitable end point can be difficult and so the zine will include a small list of ideas to get you started with objectives that reflect the world being explored. These can be expanded on with your own ideas and empty templates will be included for listing your concepts.</p>
<p>As you explore the dream more and learn about what is possible the options will continue to expand until perhaps the Beings and Things encountered become too much to handle. The game can be packed away and picked up again at another time as the player chooses.</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzM1OTA1MTMucG5n/original/k35M6j.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<p>A large part of zines is the ease of access for everyone. Perhaps you want a new 'uber' table of items to pick from... modify the provided Things tables in the provided blank templates to create something new or just move around what is provided!</p>
<p>Instructions for hacking the zine will be included at the back of it for all designers looking to explore their favourite worlds or original creations using the deck of cards and d6 system. The hacking process is something I believe in greatly for everyone interested in game design and I wouldn't have started this project without doing it myself. Some of my favourites include; &nbsp;<a href="https://natetreme.itch.io/tunnelgoons" target="_blank">Tunnel Goons</a>, &nbsp;<a href="https://noroadhome.itch.io/alone-among-the-stars" target="_blank">Alone Among The Stars</a>, and &nbsp;<a href="https://magicalbitch.itch.io/take-root" target="_blank">Take Root.</a><br><strong></strong><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY3NDAzMDYucG5n/original/E45KFC.png]]






<p class="text-center"><em>You can hear it, can't you?</em></p>
<p class="text-center"><em>The siren call of what might be on the lacy border of the known world, where new and wondrous things ‚Äì where new world --</em></p>
<p class="text-center"><em>rise from the primordial foam.</em></p>
<p class="text-center"><em>What will you find, on the Edge?</em></p>
<p class="text-center"><em>Who might you meet?<br></em></p>
<p><em><br></em></p>
<p>Once&nbsp;upon&nbsp;a&nbsp;time,&nbsp;I experimented&nbsp;with&nbsp;fitting&nbsp;a&nbsp;wee&nbsp;rpg&nbsp;system&nbsp;with wee implied&nbsp;setting&nbsp;into a&nbsp;pocketmod:&nbsp;the&nbsp;result&nbsp;of that&nbsp;experiment was&nbsp;<a href="https://taichara.itch.io/nine-black-jewel-moons" target="_blank">Nine Black Jewel Moons</a>.</p>
<p>Quite a few months and some expansions of rpg later, now there's Wandering Jewel Moons, a quarter-page-sized booklet of fantasy exploring along -- and beyond -- the Edge of the world.</p>
<p>Enjoy! :3<br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzU0MDg0MzkucG5n/original/1%2B%2FLPt.png]]






<p><em>Before you lies a silken parchment of finest make. Upon it, the terms which you must agree to, if ever your Beloved has a chance to escape. It reads as follows, in finely sinister script...</em></p>
<p><em>"The undersigned, knowing the gravity and weight of their commitment to their current course, shall be given a single chance to lead their Beloved back into the realm of the living. They will be set upon the road which leads from Hades, and their Beloved will wander with them, trailing by a distance to be determined by the Lord of the Dead. However, once along the path, they agree to not turn or look behind in any manner, lest they forfeit their opportunity entirely, and eternally damn that which they so love. These terms, as stated, are final, and not even the Fates shall interfere with such matters on the behalf of either party."</em></p>
<p><em>It begs for your signature, and you relent, a drop of blood sealing the scroll, before you set out on a desolate road amidst the Stygian Abyss.</em></p>
<p><em>In the distance, however, a figure lurks at an abandoned gate. Beyond him lie many trials along the road you chose to walk here‚Ä¶</em></p>
<p><em>Way Down Below.</em></p>
<p class="text-center">-------</p>
<p>Way Down Below is a solo journaling Descended from the Queen&nbsp;game of love, sacrifice, and the Underworld as inspired by the myth of Orpheus and Eurydice, designed by Kienna Shaw (<a href="http://twitter.com/KiennaS" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@KiennaS</a>) and Jason Cutrone (<a href="http://twitter.com/JustJasonPls" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">@JustJasonPls</a>).&nbsp;<br></p>
<p>Take on the role of a Wanderer and&nbsp;embark on a journey to bring back your Beloved from the clutches of Hades. Along the way, answer card-drawn prompts about your past, your Beloved, and your psyche to build out your own myth until you must make the final choice: will you turn around and see if your Beloved follows?</p>
<p>All you need to play is the rules, a standard deck of cards, and pen and paper.</p>
<p class="text-center">-------</p>
<p>Custom cards coming at a later date!</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjg2MTQ5LzM3Nzc0ODgucG5n/original/xRjxEJ.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjg2MTQ5LzM3Nzc0OTIucG5n/original/UOLtFD.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNjg2MTQ5LzM3Nzc0OTQucG5n/original/PdRGyr.png]]






<p><em>‚ÄòLicky Licky Lickytoads,</em></p>
<p><em>We Licktoad Goblins thee,</em></p>
<p><em>For where Licktoads goes</em></p>
<p><em>Chaos sows, be ready for our spree!‚Äô&nbsp;</em></p>
<p>Never a dull moment in the tribe of LickToad where success is only one chaotic clever idea away. In this game, Players band together as members of a Goblin adventuring party set to bring the most sought-out treasures to the tribe and earn the rank of Task Captain.</p>
<p>This game is powered by: <strong>Caltrop Core: An Introductory Game Design SRD</strong>&nbsp;by TitanomachyRPG</p>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc3NzYwOTgucG5n/original/FHg9fn.png]]






<p><strong>Overview:</strong>
</p>
<p>You know how entropy always increases? Yeah, that‚Äôs not actually true anymore. Entropy has completely crawled to a standstill, and it looks like it might even reverse soon! This is probably not great for the universe. So it‚Äôs up to all of you to increase the amount of chaos by reawakening a dormant eldritch god of chaos!
</p>
<p>Zero prep is required for this game. It is designed to be playable in person or over Discord.</p>
<p>This TTRPG was&nbsp;inspired by Mini Jam #100, a 3 day long&nbsp;video game jam in which&nbsp;the theme was "overload" and the requirement was "chaos."&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxMDAyNS84MjE0NDQwLnBuZw==/original/W8eXlq.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTQxMDAyNS84MjE0NDQxLnBuZw==/original/qrz5ug.png]]






<p>What REALLY Happened is a solo journaling game about your favorite novel and you: the character that was written out of the story. Play to find out What REALLY Happened, and why they would you be forgotten.<br></p>
<p>You play with your favorite novel, a polyhedral set of dice, and something to write your letter, setting the record straight.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1MDA5NC83ODU4MjAyLnBuZw==/original/xDUuRm.png]]






<p>Ostentia is a city of wealth, magic, and incredible disparity. The city's alchemy guilds hold all the power, with squads of street-level enforcers and an army of mercenaries playing the guilds off each other. The common folk are hired by the guilds to serve in alchemy rituals, draining life from their bodies, paying them their purse of coppers, and sending them home until the next day.</p>
<p>What the city needs is a revolution, but the best you can do is retribution. And distribution. Thwart the guilds' exploitative plots and steal as much gold as you can.</p>
<p>And when the job is done, go back to your family, friends, and familiar haunts. Spend your gold to improve your character and use downtime to help your community.</p>
<p>*****</p>
<p><em>When the Guilds Pay in&nbsp;Copper, Crime Pays in Gold</em> is a two-page tabletop RPG designed to be played with 2 or more players, one of whom should take on the role of a Story Guide to facilitate scene setup and NPC actions and dialogue.<em> When the Guilds Pay in&nbsp;Copper, Crime Pays in Gold</em>'s system uses dice pool mechanics with d6s.</p>
<p>This system gives players the initiative in deciding what their dice pools look like, and then it provides a few options for further customizing dice pools on the fly in order to give players the maximum amount of control over their chances and their character's mechanical growth.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY3MTM1MjkucG5n/original/fWPPmH.png]]






<blockquote><strong><em><del></del>When the music stopped...</em></strong><br>The ballroom had grown dim. Ornate glass baubles hung in the air, slowly drifting through the air as if through molasses, much like myself. I had leapt forward as I heard the whining of the chain keeping the lighting fixture suspended, yet it had come crashing down even before I had taken the first step. My eyes grew wide at the horrific scene in front of me as I realised droplets of blood also drifted through the air, the crimson orbs almost as pristine and magnificent as the clear glass. And I felt resolved that things didn't need to turn out like this. That's where I was when the music stopped. But we can hit rewind.</blockquote>
<p>When the Music Stops is a GMless story game for 1-5 players that should last 2-4 hours. The game is designed to be played while listening to a mixtape prepared in advance by one of the players and rewinding it to go back in time. The characters work together in order to prevent a big disaster from coming to pass, struggling against the rigidity of events and time itself. <br></p>
<p>The game is setting-agnostic, where the only assumption being made is that characters possess some method or ability to travel through time. It's also tone-agnostic, as what constitutes a "disaster" is left vague. It could be anything from a prom gone wrong due to a senior prank to the first omen of the world ending.</p>
<p>The kinds of stories that are touchstones for When the Music Stops include Puella Magi Madoka Magica, Higurashi When They Cry, The Girl Who Leapt Through Time and Life is Strange.<br></p>
<p><em>The game is loosely based on <a href="https://buriedwithoutceremony.com/ribbon-drive" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Ribbon Drive</a> by Avery Alder, which you should definitely check out if games that interweave music with the mechanic are of interest to you.</em><br><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY3MTI3NDMucG5n/original/JDSBDl.png]]






<p><em>When You Meet Your Doppelganger on the Road, You Must Make Out With Them</em> is a two-player&nbsp;&nbsp;game about meeting your doppelganger on the road and then making the decision about whether or not to make out with them. It is a game about horror and intimacy, about self-identity and self-love and self-destruction.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzIzODczODkuanBn/original/ZwmsQf.jpg]]






<p><em>You belong to the Hive,</em><em></em><br></p>
<p><em>But the Queen is dead.</em><em></em><br></p>
<p><em>You belong to...</em></p>
<p>The Hive, once a perfectly synchronized and efficient society, was thrown into chaos with the death of its Queen. The Queen's death also meant the first recognition of personal identity for most of the Hive.</p>
<p>The Hive has an opportunity to make itself whatever it wishes. Will the members of the Hive  recapture the structures lost with the Queen, or create something new? Will they rebuild on familiar soil, or find a new sky as red as honey? The Hive will have to reckon with its fate quickly as invaders hover at the edges of the system.</p>
<p><em>Where the Sky's as Red as Honey </em>is a gm-less roleplaying game made for the <a href="https://itch.io/jam/mock-cover-jam" target="_blank">Mock Cover Jam</a>. The cover and title were created by <a href="https://yurir.itch.io/" target="_blank">Yuri R</a>.</p>
<p>This game contains themes and language intended for mature audiences and thoughtful players.<br></p>
<p>Find the character sheet for free underneath the community copies in the demo section. It is identical to the character sheet that comes with purchase. <br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMTM4NS81OTExMTQ5LnBuZw==/original/jzgtip.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMTM4NS81OTExMTQ2LmpwZw==/original/aPGGkP.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMTM4NS81OTEyNzM3LnBuZw==/original/bZlSVu.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTAwMTM4NS81OTEyNzI4LmpwZw==/original/xegU%2Fr.jpg]]






<p><em>Thank you for joining us at Whistling Wolf Caf√©! Our motto is ‚ÄúYou might not always get what you want, but you‚Äôll always get what you need.‚Äù As you can imagine, serving customers by giving them what they need to feel better instead of what they prefer can be tricky, but I trust that your amazing tea-brewing skills and customer service will win them over. We average three customers an hour, so you‚Äôll have breaks in between.</em></p>
<p><em>Oh! Before I forget, there‚Äôs a small shop right next door with things that could help you out. Sometimes there are even people looking for a bit of work. Just be sure you use your own tips to purchase them or the owner will be, well, not so happy. Also, I hate to say it, but if you get three bad reviews, it‚Äôs really not going to look good for either of us. So do what you can to avoid that.</em>
</p>
<p>Whistling Wolf Caf√© is a solo caf√© sim game that takes 10-20 minutes to play. You are a master brewer who is more focused on what a customer might need rather than what they want, and that can complicate things. All you need is a deck of playing cards, a handful of six-sided dice, and something to take notes with.</p>
<p><br>A very special thank you to <a href="https://solohistorias.itch.io/" target="_blank">Antonio</a> for writing a Spanish translation of this game! He not only translated it, but took the time to fix any potential cultural gaps for anyone outside of the US! Please be sure to visit&nbsp;<a href="https://solohistorias.itch.io/cafe-el-lobo-aullador" target="_blank">Caf√© El lobo aullador</a>!</p>
<p><br>If you would like to see a playthrough, Vinca Vinye was a lot of fun to watch! You can enjoy the entire video or jump to the smoother second playthrough here:&nbsp;<a href="https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1304787280?t=01h51m14s" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1304787280?t=01h51m14s</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM5ODQyNS84MzE3OTEzLnBuZw==/original/rJgchn.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM5ODQyNS84MTUxODIzLnBuZw==/original/qhcMnS.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM5ODQyNS84MTUxODI0LnBuZw==/original/lY7K5m.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM5ODQyNS84MTUxODI2LnBuZw==/original/755LiD.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM5ODQyNS84MTUxODI3LnBuZw==/original/R16Q9Z.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM5ODQyNS84MTUxODI4LnBuZw==/original/J5wKRQ.png]]






<p><em>The Lizenby and Balrose families cordially invite you to a freeform LARP about the first marriage between a human and a ghost in recorded history. Black tie preferred, but costuming not necessary. Please, no jokes about "til death do us part".</em></p>
<p>
Wight Wedding is a dramatic-comedic freeform LARP for up to 25 players about family friction, death, and love.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzE3NTQyMjUuanBn/original/XWIEmH.jpg]]






<p><strong>Wild Duelist</strong> is a medieval action role-playing game for 2 to 6 players. You play an animalfolk warrior journeying to an arranged duel. Your journey will be dangerous. It will question your honour as well as threaten your life. The end of the journey may spell the end of your life.</p>
<p><strong>Wild Duelist</strong> is <strong>Illuminated by LUMEN</strong> for rule-chewy, fast-paced combat. It is inspired by chivalric romance, Arthurian legend, Child Ballads and the recent Green Knight film.</p>
<h3>The Land of the Chimaer</h3>
<p>When I was younger, my grandy told me how ze travelled across the <strong>Chimaer </strong>with a band of roaming rats, saw the crossing of the sea spirits, and spat in the face of the chief of an <strong>Aeberaich </strong>alligator clan. I loved my grandy, though I always wondered how true hir tall tales were.
</p>
<p>While I learned to tend to nature my mother told me of a distant war, between<strong> Maude III, King of Estamire</strong>, who they now call the Bold, and the <strong>Graesdunn Union Congress</strong>. She explained what she thought our lot in life would be. Periods of peace cut into periods of violence, be that bloody winter months or a century's worth of death. She warned me that the powerful were always fighting, whether we saw the fights or not, and they were only fighting for themselves.
</p>
<p>On nights before harvest my other mother would tell me the stories she grew up with, of the <strong>Great Exorcism of Urstar</strong>. They told me what they thought of magic, they weren‚Äôt superstitious, like the baker, nor did they place it on a pedestal, like some of the children did. They taught me magic belonged to all beastkind who cared to learn it, and that included the cruel and commanding as well as those who would stand against them.
</p>
<p>My cousin explained the fact that people met for duels, to explain how xeir father died. Xe said xeir father travelled to <strong>Oriria </strong>to challenge an owl who had promised them payment, then refused when the work was done. They met at dawn, surrounded by onlookers, they both drew their weapons and engaged at a count of ten. They sent the body home with the payment that was promised.
</p>
<p>The night before I left home, to answer a challenge delivered to me, my aunt drew me a map, and told me of those I might meet. She pointed out the villages where I‚Äôd find a bed, and warned of the paths where I‚Äôd meet with danger. She told me the journey may be more dangerous than my destination, so I should be sure I felt strongly about it.&nbsp;
</p>
<p>‚ÄúIt‚Äôs one thing to protect yourself from bandits who tried to stop you from getting home. The whole thing changes when you‚Äôre fighting on the road so you can fight in the city.‚Äù
‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to fight, I‚Äôm going to defend my honour.‚Äù
</p>
<p>She smiled at me with sad eyes. It was her way of asking me to stay, without asking me. But I couldn‚Äôt stay. The date of my duel was already set.
</p>
<h3>Buy a Print Copy&nbsp;</h3>
<p>You can find print copies of Wild Duelist available in the Lulu Bookstore, <a href="https://www.lulu.com/en/gb/shop/the-dice/wild-duelist/paperback/product-885nje.html?page=1&amp;pageSize=4" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a>. If you purchase a print copy of the game and would like a download key then email us at mackenziealter@outlook.com or DM us on twitter @plural_dice<br></p>
<h3>Contained within</h3>
<ul><li>A PDF of the game, replicating the look of the print edition,&nbsp;</li></ul>
<p>In addition we include two alternatives for those who find the PDF&nbsp;inaccessible</p>
<ul><li>An ePub of the game (if you're looking for reader recommendations&nbsp;on laptop we recommend Freda or Calibre, on our phone we've found the standard PDF Reader also serve ePubs)</li><li>An ePub specifically for Kindle devices</li></ul>
<p></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwNzY2Ny83ODE1NzA1LmpwZw==/original/JKh3rG.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwNzY2Ny83ODE1NzAxLmpwZw==/original/Ianfa9.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwNzY2Ny83ODE1NzAwLmpwZw==/original/rZ0VkJ.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwNzY2Ny83NjA2OTQzLmpwZw==/original/mi5XDI.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMwNzY2Ny83NjA2OTQ0LmpwZw==/original/Icr0rs.jpg]]






<p><em></em><em>It‚Äôs the middle of the summer and people are camping in the forest. A stray spark, and suddenly a fire breaks out! Can you and your friends find the equipment you need and make it out alive?</em></p>
<p>WildFire is a survival game for 2 or more players. The only thing required is 1 six-sided die per player and 1 deck of playing cards per 2 players. Draw a card, role a die, and see if you can make it out alive!</p>
<p><br>The instructions are short enough that they can be printed on the front and back of a single business card and slipped in with a deck of playing cards. The first two documents are the original game&nbsp;formatted to do so; the second one has a white background to be&nbsp;more printer-friendly. The next two are the same, but Solo Mode. The last document is a standard printable page, if that's what you find easiest.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNjYxNC84MzE3OTA5LnBuZw==/original/jcB7nL.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNjYxNC83NzE3NDMzLnBuZw==/original/g2Sr%2FX.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNjYxNC83NzE3NDMxLnBuZw==/original/5s%2F8CN.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTMyNjYxNC83NzE3NDM2LnBuZw==/original/5TNlp1.png]]






<<list-links "[tag[Windows]sort[title]]">>







<p><span class="">Wise Women</span> is tabletop roleplaying game in which the players take on the roles of witches living in a remote village, where life is difficult and people often fall prey to supernatural creatures.</p>
<p>The witches have the ability to use magical properties of plants to protect their community and help it prosper, but their skills are viewed with suspicion and prejudice. After all, magic is another supernatural force and the same plants that can heal, can also be used to cause harm.</p>
<p>&nbsp;Will the witches continue to strive to protect and improve their community, or will the prejudice drive them to lash out and turn to violence and Dark Magic?</p>
<p>The game is inspired by Polish and more broadly Eastern European folklore. It is based on the Powered by the Apocalypse ruleset and suitable for 2-5 players.<br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>In addition to &nbsp;currently downloadable materials, the game will contain the following supplements funded during KS campaign:</p>
<p>- Expanded Bestiary (20 additional creatures)</p>
<p>- Pre-made village</p>
<p>- An adventure including info on an additional supernatural creature</p>
<p>- Winter adventure and rules for running games set in winter</p>
<p>- Slavic festivals and customs <br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5MjI3NC83NTE4NjA4LmpwZw==/original/ps6%2B3R.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5MjI3NC83NTE4NjEwLmpwZw==/original/UH%2BbJO.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5MjI3NC83NTE4NjA3LmpwZw==/original/iQ0IaE.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI5MjI3NC83NTE4NjA5LmpwZw==/original/sZnmmT.jpg]]






<p>If you've ever wanted to learn more about the influences behind the Bayonetta game series, look no further! From exploring the history of the witch hunts, occult magic traditions and Norse gods, angelic hierarchies and demon summoning, 'Witch Time' covers the gamut of the mythic and magical sources that Platinum Games drew upon to create their fun and sexy masterpiece.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc5NzQxNTMucG5n/original/vLkmFi.png]]






<p>CW: Foul language, feminism, anarchism, witchcraft, intersectional identity politics, queerness, (un-)civil disobedience, sex, drugs, punk rock, actual societal evils, queers with liberty crests who just wanna smooch each-other.</p>
<p>WitchPunks is a fantasy tabletop RPG about punk-ass witches fighting back against a society that wants to ignore or exploit them. This is the .pdf of the core zine that includes all the rules that we suggest playing with.</p>
<p>WitchPunks uses a free-form, narrative-driven task resolution system that uses two six-sided dice and includes a "failing forward" mechanic. Character, Coven, and Setting&nbsp;creation are easy, and the adventures are whatever you want them to be. Is this a horror game? Is it a fantasy adventure? Is it a dating sim? You tell me; it's your game!<br></p>
<p>What Else You'll Need:</p>
<p>-At least two six-sided dice</p>
<p>-Pencils and paper</p>
<p>-Other people to play with</p>
<p>-Tokens to pass back and forth as Charms<br></p>
<p>-A desire to tell stories about marginalized people screaming defiance at the world&nbsp;and winning</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzM0MzQwLzQwODU5MjYucG5n/original/k1AZKB.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzM0MzQwLzQwODU5MzAucG5n/original/YYayPd.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNzM0MzQwLzQyMjk1NzQuanBn/original/0YWG54.jpg]]






<p>Your character is carrying something valuable that does not appear that way from the outside looking in.</p>
<p>The object in question must be delivered without breaching the contents &amp; learning of what lies within, otherwise the deal is off.</p>
<p>A mode of transport is headed to your extraction point, though you know not exactly when it will arrive and must stay put so as to not miss the opportunity.</p>
<p>Yet the location is so immensely&nbsp;uninteresting that you feel without a sufficient&nbsp;&nbsp;distraction, you will succumb to temptation and open the object.</p>
<p>-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</p>
<p><strong>Within a Storm of Silence&nbsp;</strong>is a GMless, solo-play tabletop RPG that involves stacking dice in order to simulate the experience of intense internal conflict. Specifically in&nbsp;how difficult it can be to keep one's mind pre-occupied or prevent yourself from giving in to a tempting, yet costly&nbsp;curiosity.</p>
<p>All you need to play is a hefty handful of dice and a means to record small amounts of information, such as a notes app on your phone&nbsp;or a pen &amp; paper. There is no character creation, the difficulty of the game is primarily decided by you and the number/type&nbsp;of dice you decide to make use of, and it should be playable in the same amount of time (or less) that it might take you to play a game of Solitaire.</p>
<p>Hope you enjoy! Feedback is always welcomed &amp; encouraged! Any experience you have playing the game or custom rules you may have added, please feel free to add below as well. :D</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzc1MzYxMDYucG5n/original/SxSBf8.png]]






<p>Working For the Corp is a cyberpunk print and play Descended From the Queen game.&nbsp; You will play characters who work at a megacorp called "The Corp" who are tasked with defending sensitive information from runners.&nbsp; Will you defend The Corp?</p>
<p>Jess Meier @burst0fhope came on to add some cards and it has really changed the game, improving it dramatically.</p>
<p>Cover and card art by @diwataMANILA</p>
<p>Edited by GC Fournier @Callishka</p>
<p>Layout by Devon Apple @devonapple</p>
<p>This is the final printer product.&nbsp; Check it out and let me know on Twitter @KDavidson925 whether or not you Defend The Corp!&nbsp;</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDcxOTQ4LzI3Nzc0MDIucG5n/original/UlaZ4X.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDcxOTQ4LzI3MjY5MDcucG5n/original/GZLc0y.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDcxOTQ4LzI3MjY5MDgucG5n/original/bKeSYw.png]]






<p>Building a fictional world from scratch is a lot of work. Whether writing a story or running a tabletop role-playing game for a group of friends, it takes practice to build an intricate setting complete with warring factions, a timeline, and non-player characters who compliment the story. Often all this effort creates details that are never relevant to your players or principle characters. World Maker is an exercise meant to focus your energy into details, relationships, and traits that are relevant to your main characters or the players at the table.<br></p>
<ul><li><strong>Players</strong>: 1</li><li><strong>Playtime</strong>: 1-2 hours</li><li><strong>Requires</strong>: A deck of playing cards with the jokers removed,&nbsp;&nbsp;a journal or 4-5 sheets of paper and something to write with</li></ul>
<h2>Video</h2>
<p>Check out Emma Lindhagen playing World Maker: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HEJ9G2vZBUg&amp;t=3s" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">First Session.</a>&nbsp;<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C4UB2ZHgs00" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Second Session.</a></p>
<p>See Verity MystisMagic playing the game: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bLkRijXgqbY" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Part One.</a> <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aLGPy1juBRw" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Part Two.</a></p>
<h2 class="text-right">Credits</h2>
<p class="text-right">Written &amp; Designed by <a href="https://www.patreon.com/notwriting" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Michael Elliott</a></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQ4NTY5LzUxMzI2NjkuanBn/original/Hgxfu5.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQ4NTY5LzUxMzI2NTkuanBn/original/W%2FNyEy.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQ4NTY5LzUxMzI2NjAuanBn/original/z0CeUC.jpg]]






<p>In the past 30 years humans, elves, and dwarves have crashed onto the coast of Revilo, discovering a land the other side of the world had never seen. The indigenous races who once welcomed these outlanders with open arms are now hesitant, as one of the humans staged a coup on one of their largest cities and is building an army to continue his conquest.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, a revered sect of 18, known as the Keepers of Secrets, are slowly being hunted down by a new cult. Inside each of the Keepers of Secrets is a fragment of an ancient, powerful god. The Keepers of Secrets fear that this new cult is collecting these pieces to try and resurrect a long-forsaken evil.
</p>
<p>Here‚Äôs some of what you will find in this book:
</p>
<ul><li>Nine New Playable Races</li><li>Five New Subclasses</li><li>New Backgrounds and Feats</li><li>Exploration of the various regions of Revilo</li><li>Major Adventure Hooks</li><li>Five Main Themes to Add Deeper Story to Your Game</li><li>15 NPCs with Full Backstories</li><li>12 Magic Items
</li></ul>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEwMDc4Mi82MzQ5MDAwLmpwZWc=/original/Z0gXcd.jpeg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEwMDc4Mi82MzQ5MDE1LmpwZw==/original/lIHwXC.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEwMDc4Mi82MzQ5MDE2LmpwZw==/original/dqUVk5.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTEwMDc4Mi82MzQ5MDE3LmpwZw==/original/F16GXe.jpg]]






<p>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>Welcome To Wyldrvir!</strong></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYzMjQ1NTYucG5n/original/ELHtSO.png" alt="The Flags! " title="The Flags! " loading="lazy"></p>
<figcaption>Welcome to Wyldrvir! The banners of our 6 city states: Torren, Cindir, Inoven, Meratoll, Oaa, and Shardelia line up to greet you. </figcaption>
<p></p>
<p><em><strong>A totally free TTRPG that has been working in a combat free and wholesome Saturday morning cartoon style of world with adorable art and simple roleplay focused storytelling!</strong></em></p>
<p>&nbsp;This book is a PDF Version of the core rule document if you would like to download it this way!&nbsp; This book is all you need to start a campaign in this world. It has amazing art from the talented Crowva, and<em> extra content thanks to the year of work we have done!</em> We spent time upgrading our year old core book into something still easy to read but full of new content to get you into the world, and starting your journey!&nbsp;<em><strong>This download comes with the stunning pdf of our core book, a character sheet download to start playing, and a oneshot so you have a story to tell right from the get go!</strong></em></p>
<p></p>
<div class=""><iframe width="500" height="281" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bGVTZ7raiv8" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div>
<p><em>Huge thank you to Eternal Sushi for writing music for our game!&nbsp;<br></em></p>
<p><br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYzMjQ1NzkucG5n/original/l5LCjJ.png" alt="The Podcast Kids " title="The Podcast Kids " loading="lazy"></p>
<figcaption>Travelers from the World of Wyldrvir Podcast! </figcaption>
<p></p>
<p>We are a team of young adult writers ages ranging from 18-21 and we have been making this game for a year! When we started making Wyldrvir, we wrote all our content on Google Docs and they still exist! In fact all our content is free on Google Drive at:&nbsp;<a href="https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/17vy0_18gGHaiDQsYfCzMnGLQ2F_AMCjf" style="font-size: inherit" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">This Link here!</a><span></span><br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYzMjQ1NjguanBn/original/GUwYsk.jpg" alt="World of Wyldrvir Map " title="World of Wyldrvir Map " loading="lazy"></p>
<figcaption>The map to our games world! Ready to be filled in during your travels!</figcaption>
<p></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>&nbsp;Wyldrvir also has a podcast and Discord server which you can link from here:&nbsp;<a href="https://worldofwyldrvir.carrd.co/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">https://worldofwyldrvir.carrd.co/</a>.&nbsp; Feel free to join us there for a community of server games, awesome creators, and of course where you can ask any questions about our world to us!&nbsp;We would love to have you!&nbsp;Huge thanks to you for considering downloading our first fully mastered and completed book, good luck on all of your journeys!&nbsp;</p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzYzMjQ1ODgucG5n/original/KDwqeI.png" alt="Moth?!" title="Moth?!" loading="lazy"></p>
<figcaption>What is this new and mysterious friend?!</figcaption>

<iframe width="720" height="450" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bGVTZ7raiv8" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NzA1NS82MzI0NjIzLmpwZw==/original/N%2FQQap.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NzA1NS82MzI0NjMxLnBuZw==/original/WOBsKW.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTA5NzA1NS82MzI0NjMyLnBuZw==/original/8rhv9A.png]]






<p><em><strong>Wyrd Science</strong></em>&nbsp;is a new, quarterly magazine celebrating roleplaying games, war-games and board games that sets out to give space wizards, gelatinous cubes and tentacled gods the respect they deserve.&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong><em>Session Zero</em></strong> is our first issue and across 90 pages features interviews with:</p>
<ul><li><strong>Kieron Gillen</strong> - One of the most exciting writers working in comics today, Kieron's greatest hits include the likes of <em>Young Avengers</em> and <em>Darth Vader</em> for Marvel and his own groundbreaking titles such as <em>Phonogram</em> &amp;&nbsp;<em>The Wicked + Divine.&nbsp;</em>We catch up with him to chat about his latest RPG inspired book&nbsp;<em>DIE</em>, his new Marvel/Warhammer 40,000 book <em>Marneus Calgar</em> and, well, pretty much everything.</li><li><strong>Simon St√•lenhag</strong> - We speak to the artist/author behind <em>Tales From The Loop</em>, <em>Things From The Flood</em> and <em>The Electric State</em> about his new book <em>The Labyrinth</em>, and&nbsp;the dangers of both nostalgia and state violence.</li><li><strong>Chris Spivey </strong>- The award winning RPG designer tells us all about his new book, <em>Haunted West</em>, and how America must both face up to the tainted legacy of its past and rediscover the stories that past has hidden from view.</li><li><strong>Banana Chan</strong> - With one of the most interesting new RPGs of the year,&nbsp;<em>Jiangshi - Blood In The Banquet Hall,</em> about to drop we find out more about the game from its co-designer.</li><li><strong>Johan Nohr</strong> - As the artist and graphic designer behind <em>M√ñRK BORG</em>, Johan Nohr has done more than almost anyone to change the look and colour of RPGs over the past 18 months, we check in with him to discover how to break the rules in the right way.</li><li><strong>Duncan Molloy</strong> -&nbsp;&nbsp;They're already responsible for publishing <em>2000 AD</em>, the galaxy's greatest comic, and now publisher Rebellion have turned their attention to tabletop games. We speak to the man heading up the new division to seee what we can expect next.</li><li><strong>Thomas Pike</strong> - We speak to&nbsp;Themeborne lead designer about their&nbsp;<em>Escape The Dark Castle/Sector</em> games and their gritty roots in the dark &amp;&nbsp;down at heel Britain of the 1980s.</li><li><strong>Dirk the Dice</strong> - We chat with the host of <em>The GROGNARD Files</em>, one of the best RPG podcasts in the UK today.</li><li><strong>Andre Novoa</strong> - We catch up with the found of new Portuguese RPG publisher Games Omnivorous about their incredible first 12 months.</li><li><strong>Sasha Bilton</strong> - One of the founder members of East London's H.A.T.E. gaming club, Sasha tells us all about the club's origins and how they've got through 2020.</li></ul>
<p>On top of all that we have an original short story from Black Library/Aconyte Books' author <strong>Josh Reynolds</strong>, featuring one of his own original characters - The Royal Occultist Charles St. Cyprian.</p>
<p>We have a look back at the changing face of tabletop gaming in 2020 with contributions from podcasters, writers and games designers including <strong>Dan Jolin</strong>, <strong>Matt Thrower</strong>, <strong>Pamela Punzalan</strong>, <strong>Danie Ware</strong>, <strong>Luke Shaw</strong>, <strong>Chris McDowall</strong>, <strong>The Smart Party</strong> and <strong>Jay Dragon</strong>.</p>
<p>Plus all our soon to be regulars features such as<strong> Mira Manga</strong>'s diary, <strong>Anna Blackwell</strong>'s game-by-game dive&nbsp;into the world of solo-RPG, <strong>Pierre Mortel</strong>'s <em>Crooked Tales</em> and <strong><em>Time Slip</em></strong> where, &nbsp;this issue, legendary Citadel Miniatures designer <strong>Trish Carden</strong> takes us back to Nottingham in the&nbsp;1980s.</p>
<p><em></em><strong><em>Wyrd Science</em></strong> is also available as a physical magazine - you'll find details of where to pick that up from our <a href="http://www.wyrdscience.online" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">website</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/Wyrd_Science" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Twitter</a> or <a href="https://www.instagram.com/wyrd.science/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Instagram</a>.</p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODg4MTI3LzcwODg5MDUuanBn/original/Zvg53R.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODg4MTI3LzUwMDg4NTkuanBn/original/xJBRLL.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODg4MTI3LzUwMDg4NTAuanBn/original/GkN3AW.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODg4MTI3LzUwMDg4NDguanBn/original/bTfigk.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODg4MTI3LzUwMDg4NDcuanBn/original/O%2BKSCG.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvODg4MTI3LzUwMDg4NDkuanBn/original/MsW3%2FT.jpg]]






<p>Wyrd Science returns with an even bigger and better second issue. 112 pages of interviews, news, features and reviews covering everything from the history of D&amp;D B/X through to the best tabletop games of today.</p>
<p>In this issue you'll find...<br></p>
<p><strong>Quickstart</strong>&nbsp;- get up to speed with what's happening with&nbsp;interviews with &amp; features on:&nbsp;<strong>What Would the Smart Party Do?</strong>,&nbsp;<strong>Coyote &amp; Crow</strong>,&nbsp;<strong>Jon Peterson</strong>&nbsp;on his new book&nbsp;<strong>The Elusive Shift</strong>, the latest gaming design trends, game inspired art and much more</p>
<p><strong>Main features</strong>:</p>
<ul><li>A celebration of&nbsp;<strong>D&amp;D B/X</strong>'s 40th Anniversary including interviews with game designers&nbsp;<strong>Stephen Marsh</strong>&nbsp;&amp;&nbsp;<strong>David 'Zeb' Cook</strong>,&nbsp;<strong>Peter Bebergal</strong>&nbsp;on the books that inspired B/X &amp; a look at the OSR scene and the best games of today inspired by it.
</li><li>An interview with&nbsp;<strong>April Kit Walsh</strong>&nbsp;about her new RPG&nbsp;<strong>Thirsty Sword Lesbians</strong>
</li><li>An interview with Cubicle 7's&nbsp;<strong>Emmet Byrne</strong>&nbsp;about&nbsp;<strong>Age of Sigmar Soulbound</strong>
</li><li>An interview with games designer&nbsp;<strong>Jay Dragon</strong>&nbsp;about their game of pastoral exploration and healing,&nbsp;<strong>Wanderhome</strong>
</li><li>An interview with&nbsp;<strong>Gavriel Quiroga</strong>&nbsp;about his new RPG&nbsp;<strong>Warpland</strong>
</li><li>A introduction to the Latin American RPG scene by games designer <strong>Diogo Nogueira</strong></li><li>A look at the new generation of model agnostic&nbsp;indie wargames from the likes of <strong>Space Weirdos </strong>to <strong>Reign in Hell</strong></li><li>An interview with&nbsp;<strong>Pontus Bjorlin</strong>&nbsp;about his new RPG&nbsp;<strong>ALTNYC88</strong>
</li><li>Interviews with pro-model painters <strong>Dana Howl</strong>, <strong>Brent Amberger</strong>, <strong>Amy Snuggs </strong>and <strong>Scott Walker</strong>&nbsp;and a look at how social media is changing that cene
</li><li>An interview with best selling&nbsp;<strong>Black Library&nbsp;</strong>author&nbsp;<strong>Guy Haley</strong>
</li><li>A look at the representation of women in the tabletop world today including interviews with the likes of Wingspan's<strong>&nbsp;Elizabeth Hargrave<strong>, 1minuteboardgames' Raina Medina, Dark Imp Game's Ellie Dix&nbsp;</strong>and<strong>&nbsp;Patricia Willenborg </strong>of<strong> Kismet Rose's D&amp;D</strong></strong></li></ul>
<p><strong>Reviews</strong>: &nbsp;Age of Sigmar (3rd Edition), RPGs including Dune, Fallout, Achtung! Cthulhu, Inspirisles, Soulbound, Word Wide Wrestling, Whitehack, Caer Mundas, Old School Essentials, Animal Adventures and many more, and board games such as Oath and Uk'Otoa.</p>
<p>All this plus lots more...</p>
<p>If you'd like to just try us you can now download the '<strong>Quickstart</strong>' Edition for free. This is&nbsp;a slimmed down version featuring our regular features and <strong>Rob Wieland</strong>'s interview with <strong>April Kit Walsh</strong>.</p>
<p><strong><em>Wyrd Science</em></strong>&nbsp;is also available as a physical magazine - you'll find details of where to pick that up from our&nbsp;<a href="http://www.wyrdscience.online/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">website</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/Wyrd_Science" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Twitter</a>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<a href="https://www.instagram.com/wyrd.science/" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Instagram</a>.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2MjYyNy83MDg5MzY5LmpwZw==/original/OL9HpM.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2MjYyNy82ODA5MjgxLmpwZw==/original/mWgDfc.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2MjYyNy82ODA5MjY2LnBuZw==/original/pco74b.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2MjYyNy82ODA5Mjc5LmpwZw==/original/QytNQ1.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2MjYyNy82ODA5MjgyLmpwZw==/original/q03Shf.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2MjYyNy82ODA5MjgwLmpwZw==/original/aqIpws.jpg]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTE2MjYyNy82ODA5Mjg3LmpwZw==/original/layfMk.jpg]]






<blockquote>You can‚Äôt remember how long you‚Äôve been stranded here.<br> Months? Years? Sometimes it feels like a lifetime.</blockquote>
<h2><strong>You, an Astronaut</strong> is a short single-player roleplaying game about being adrift in a familiar space.</h2>
<p>Your ship, LK Solo Scout, has been off-course for a long time. The  dreams of&nbsp;cryo-sleep linger after you awaken. How long have you been  here? Will your distress call be answered? At this point, do you even  want an answer?
 The game was first created for pride month in 2019, with queer themes  in mind. This is an updated edition with new writing, layout, and  artwork.</p>
<p>--</p>
<p><strong>Want a physical edition of the game?<br></strong></p>
<p><strong><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzY5MzI1NzcuanBn/original/iO6gH8.jpg" loading="lazy"></strong><br></p>
<p><em>You, an Astronaut</em> is a full-color staple-bound solo roleplaying game, 24 pages long. It's printed locally in Northampton, Massachusetts. If you'd like a physical version of the game, you can purchase it on our website <a href="https://turtlebun.com/products/you-an-astronaut" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">here</a> for $10.<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQzNDk5LzY5MzI4NjYucG5n/original/5NutGf.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQzNDk5LzY5MzI4NjgucG5n/original/BPJMoe.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvNDQzNDk5LzY5MzI1NTcucG5n/original/rRFOml.png]]






<h3><em>You are beautiful. You are loved. And above all.</em></h3>
<h3><em>You are alive.</em></h3>
<p><strong>YOUR CARE IS...</strong>&nbsp;is a collection of&nbsp; six player options for Wanderhome.</p>
<p>Each focuses one of&nbsp;the many ways people care, truly, deeply and profoundly, about the people and world around them.</p>
<ul><li><strong>The Almanagist,</strong>&nbsp; researcher for the latest issue of the H√¶th Almanack.
</li><li><strong>The Gravedigger,</strong>&nbsp;stoic and respectful in their treatment of the dead.
</li><li><strong>The Stargazer,</strong>&nbsp;a storyteller who reads from the heavens.
</li><li><strong>The Stemsage,</strong>&nbsp;a herbalist dispensing remedies with shy smile.
</li><li><strong>The Toymaker,&nbsp;</strong>a craftsperson who delights in the joyful whimsy of play.
</li><li><strong>The Trailblazer,&nbsp;</strong>burning with a singular passion for their game.
</li></ul>
<h4>Featuring three full colour illustrations by <a href="https://www.instagram.com/spookymeals/?hl=en" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Ema Acosta!</a></h4>
<h4>50% of the proceeds of Your Care Is are donated to charity and mutual aid networks!  Currently, we are donating to:   Organizaci√≥n Latina de Trans en Texas!</h4>
<h4></h4>
<p><strong>This is a 32-page colour pdf, downloadable as spreads or pages.</strong></p>
<p>Wanderhome is copyright of Possum Creek Games Inc.</p>
<p>Your Care Is... is an independent production by <a href="https://winterymute.itch.io/">Jo Winter</a> and <a href="https://urania-games.itch.io/">Kyle Tam</a>, and is not affiliated with Possum Creek Games Inc. It is published under the Wanderhome Third Party License.</p>
<h5>Your Care Is... is a proud recipient of the <a href="https://possumcreekgames.com/en-gb/pages/the-haeth-grant" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Haeth Grant</a>!</h5>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1OTgzNi83OTY2ODI2LnBuZw==/original/bYL6kR.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1OTgzNi83OTY2ODYxLnBuZw==/original/qJ8zaP.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1OTgzNi83OTY2ODYwLnBuZw==/original/l4Yab0.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM1OTgzNi83OTY2ODI3LnBuZw==/original/v0mGig.png]]






<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgwNzM4OTgucG5n/original/bpisgH.png" loading="lazy">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; is a solo tabletop role playing game about Introspection, Identity, and Heritage. You play as a character who has discovered they are a Changeling, a fae amongst humans, and through the game you will explore&nbsp; changes, challenges, joy, and most importantly what it means to be Yourself. <br></p>
<p>You will go through 5 Acts answering questions and prompts to figure yourself out through your past, your present, and your hopes for future. <br></p>
<p><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgwNzUwMjgucG5n/original/viUwko.png" loading="lazy"><br></p>
<h2>Game Contents</h2>
<ul><li>20 Page pdf</li><li>5 Acts</li><li>4 Sonnets</li><li>14 Prompts per Act</li><li>BW Word only PDF </li><li>txt File </li></ul>
<p>This game was made<em> In Memory of <a href="https://blinkingbirchgames.itch.io/anamnesis">ANAMNESIS<br></a></em></p>
<p><em>Anamnesis </em>copyright <a href="https://twitter.com/GoblinMixtape" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Samantha Leigh</a></p>
<p>Special thanks to <a href="https://twitter.com/momatoes" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Momatoes </a>for their game<em> <a href="https://momatoes.itch.io/the-magus">the MAGUS</a></em> for visual inspiration</p>
<p><em><img src="https://img.itch.zone/aW1nLzgwNzUwNDAucG5n/original/178uZr.png" loading="lazy"></em><br></p>
<h2>Basic Info</h2>
<p>Players: 1</p>
<p>Items Needed: Tarot or French Deck, Recording Method, Optional Dice</p>
<p>Session Time: ~1 hour<br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM4NTk2NS84MDczODU1LnBuZw==/original/iQ1ZLx.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM4NTk2NS84MDczODU2LnBuZw==/original/vzd6Lj.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTM4NTk2NS84MDczODU4LnBuZw==/original/Fr17WX.png]]






<h2>ZURF</h2>
<p>by mv</p>
<p>A hex crawl pamphlet for <a href="https://emielboven.itch.io/durf" target="_blank">DURF</a>. Inspired by classics like Roadside Picnic and Annihilation. <br></p>
<p></p>
<p>Enter the ZURF. A place of unspeakable horror. A place of unimaginable opportunity. Not too many have returned. Even fewer have gained what they have come for - Artefacts as they are commonly known in the town.</p>
<p></p>
<h2>Hex Crawls for DURF</h2>
<p>by <a href="https://twitter.com/yungdumbitch" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Ava Islam</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/TraverseFantasy" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" referrerpolicy="origin">Marcia B</a>, mv</p>
<p></p>
<p>A toolkit for creating and running hex crawls in DURF. While it has a strict procedure, it is intended to be highly flexible and modular. <strong>It is available as a free download. Check the Demo section below!</strong><br></p>
<p></p>
<p>In the spirit of DURF, this pamphlet is made to be hacked, pulled apart and built on top of. It is licensed under Creative Commons (CC-BY 4.0) so you can share and adapt this material for any purpose, as long as you give attribution. <br></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Using <a href="https://vandelarden.itch.io/13-engraved-textures" target="_blank">Engraved Textures by Vendel Arden</a><br></p>

[img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI0NDM3MS83NDU2MzIwLnBuZw==/original/BC9E8z.png]][img width=500 [https://img.itch.zone/aW1hZ2UvMTI0NDM3MS83NDU2MzIxLnBuZw==/original/gikTw4.png]]
